text: bottle. hazy copper color with frothy head. aroma is wheat, slightly banana, clove and light fruits. slightly sweet taste, but balanced. well bodied and lively. perfectly drinkable.

Bottle. Cloudy dark orange beer, large, slowly diminishing, white head. Aroma of spice, clove, wheat, light banana, light citrus. Taste is light sweet, very light tart, biscuit, wheat, clove, spice, with notes of banana and citrus. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Rather thin. Good example of the style.
Hazy amber color, medium white head. Aroma citrus, banana and honey. Taste lemon peel, coriander, spices, banana.
Pszenica jak pszenica, goździki i banany z przewagą tych drugich. Pod koniec trochę męczyło, wydawało się jakby za słodkie. Tak czy inaczej bardzo przyjemne.

Hazy, amber, high carbonation, nice head. Aroma: nice balance between clove and banana, some sweetness. Medium body, medium sweetness, very low bitterness. Taste: more into bananas, very noticeable wheat.

Aroma: loads of ripe banana, clove and some wheat.

Taste: clove, wheat, banana and some spice with some German yeast.

From 50cl bottle. Pours hazy intense brown with white foam. Aroma is caramel and malty, fruity, but also a little piney/herbaceous. Body is average, with good carbonation. Taste is sweet but delicate, with a nice underlying bitterness, again delicate. Finish is pleasant and relatively short.

Bottle.

A- Subtle spice, banana, wheat.

A- Gold color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Banana, bubble gum, spice, cloves.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Fairly light on the spice, and fruity esters. Not quite as good as Paulaner or Weihenstephaner but good enough.

Eingetrübt und bernsteinfarben mit grobporiger, dicker und lang anhaltender Schaumkrone. Fruchtig hefiger und süßer Geruch. Malziger, hefiger und fruchtiger Geschmack mit einer spürbaren Säure. Ziemlich lebhafte Kohlensäure. Gute Balance zwischen Erfrischung und Tiefe eines Weizen.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 Drinked in bottle. Marvellous hazelnut colour. At the nose a strong mature banana flavour and a big sweet yeasty notes. In mouth is medium light bodied. Quite carbonated, some hints of sourness a short after taste with some malty sweetness. Very enjoyable
I didnt know it was a hefe and I dont care for them. But it looked very tempting.

Babboo told me that this was a top 20 Heffeweissen and I immediately thought it would taste like one of those light, wheaty ones that you accidentally drink at a party where its Heffe or Bud Light. Poured a golden brown - much darker than expected- with a pleasant lemony and floral aroma. The taste has some definite mild spice to it, with hints of bubblegum and apple cider. Nice long finish. Good for finishing the end of Barry Lyndon with tummies full of curry and cadbury eggs mashed with peanuts (try it trust me).

0,5l bottle. Very thick hazy mud-like dark copper colour with medium lasting big creamy white head. Aroma: Banana, biscuit, floral tones with honey. Taste: A quite sweet rich malty start with a spreading sour tone that slowly turns into a soft bitter mouthfeel. Has a very creamy texture. Medium bodied with a medium carbonation. Long sour and a bit smokey finish. Very tasty but the festweisse ist krieg.

Világos barna szín, nagy, de nem túl tartós hab. Búzás, banános, korianderes illat, hajszálnyi karamellel. Búzás, banános, nem annyira fűszeres sör, ami még épp hogy nem vizes érzetű, hajszálnyi savanykás és karamelles felhanggal. Könnyed, közepesen szénsavas, alig keserű. Tökéletes nyári frissítő, a célhoz passzoló arányokkal.
Bernsteinfarben dunkelbraun, hefetrüb, zitronig duftend mit gut haltender Schaumkrone. Leichte erfrischende Säure im Antrunk, gute Würze. Bananiger Geschmack mit leichter Hallertauer Hopfennote.
Aroma fruity, banana, cloves. Taste mid-dry, bubblegumy at first then some rather dry hoppy finish. A perfectly balanced weizen. Nothing more and nothing less.

Bottle from Føtex. Amber color with medium white lasting head. Sweet aroma, ryebread, banana, yeast and honey-melon. Taste of ryebread, banana with some spicy character. The body is full, but still a refreshing beer.

Bottle from The Cave, Glasgow. Beer served in 8°C, Duvel Glass. Pours hazy amber, nice head. Aroma is malty, banana, melon, citrus, clove and coriander. Flavor is filled with malty sweetness, biscuit, banana and clove, cumin, root, peppery, spicy character. Full body, but still very refreshing. Great example of true German Hefeweizen.
500 ml bottle served in Weizenbier glass. Medium brown colour, big white head. Rye, sour dough, grain, lemon. Light bitter and light malty. Nicely carbonated, medium body. Similar to Dunkelweizen.
Bardzo dobra pszenica. Biszkopty, banany, goździki. Mętna, zapychająca. Klasyczne podejście do tematu, wzorowy przedstawiciel stylu.

Amber with a small white head and high carbonation. The aroma has clove and spice, with some milder banana, plum, wheat, and toast. The flavor is pretty clean, with yeast flavors and a bit of creamy wheat and toast on the finish. What can you say, its one of the few that are responsible for the style existing.

Thankfully, Schneider-Weisse is unique in that they still ship all their beers as non-pasteurized, bottle conditioned which should be given nothing but applause. The dark amber color, banana and clove flavors coupled with a yeasty caramel sweet-slightly sour finish is perfect for this style. From sip to finish it provides a complex array of flavors without overwhelming the palate. Anyone who rates this below 4 does not appreciate Bavarian weizen beers.

Good cloud, substantial head, very dark though. Sweet banana/bubblegum aroma - apple, grape. Taste is banana, bubblegum, apple, toffee; lightly bitter but rather watery in the finish. Palate seems quite thin. Rather disappointing.

500 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. Thanks, I guess. The pourbisba dirty brown-ish orange with a thick light tan head that lingers with great retention and a light lace. The aroma is all banana and clove. There is a wheatiness about it and a strong clove. I dislike it. The flavor is a little better because there is such a dominant banana. The clove is there and the wheatiness isnt terrible. The banan dominance is the only savior and that is not a good sign. The mouth feel is thicker and a little syrupy with a big soft carbonation and a lingering wheatiness to go where the banana. Ugh.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat, yeast,v bubblegum, eh. Appearance is dark dark goldenrod/brown, off white head, hazy. Taste is bananas, wheat, slight clove, slight sweetness, finishes quickly. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, wheat banana and slightly metallic aftertaste. Overall, middle of the road hefeweizen.

16.9oz bottle. Pours amber-gold with a medium foamy off-white head. Aroma is floral and fruity with bubblegum, grass, banana, bread, clove, light citrus, malt, and yeast. Taste is initially sweet and fruity; citrus, bubblegum, wheat, banana, honey, a bit of caramel, some apple, and yeast. Some spice and a little dried fruit towards the end. Dry finish. Medium body. Average carbonation. Slick, relatively smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2017 Wygląd niezbyt zachęcający - jakiś taki martwy, ciemny bursztyn. W zapachu nuty weizenowe, bez przykrych dodatków. Ogólnie trochę słodkie, ale całkiem porządne piwo. Nic tam nie przeszkadza. Można by na chwilę pomylić z jakimś La Trappe, gdyby dostać szybkiego łyka bez patrzenia.

Pours dark brownish, slightly amber. Pronounced top, off-white colour. Aroma is slightly banana, yeast and malts. Taste is very smooth, fresh and light with following full-bodied feeling. Slightly sour aftertaste. An exquisite beer!
Aroma is licht gefermenteerd, licht rottend fruit. Heelijk. In de smaak: zout, ansjovis, gefermenteerde/rijpe banaan. In de afdronk een licht zuur. Mooi!

Solider Bananaspicearomatiker der guten alten German Hefeweizen Schule. Im Mund dann etwas untercarbonisiert und auffällig schlank. Trotzdem auch säuerlich spritzig und mit getreidiger Alkokante zum Finish. A Good One!!! 0,5/4,20. FASS. PORTICUS Flensburg. Hoppydryness ist ebenfalls vorhanden 😀. Und wenig Süße 👍.

Amber body with a foam off white head. A pleasant wheaty, mildly spicy aroma, suggestive of banana and pineapple is dampened by wet hay, moss, and cheap hops.The flavor is bland, inoffensive, with watered-down hints of honey and wild flowers. The tickle of fizzy carbonation accentuates notes of green apple, clove and dusty wheat, before ending on brief flare of bitter hops and a long malty sweetness that coats the tongue. Having been recently spoiled by a run of delicious German brews, I found Schneiders Original refreshing albeit utterly unmemorable.

Ambrée brune couleur acajou bien troublée surmontée dune énorme mousse blanche à bulles fines dense et persistante... Le nez est bien digne dune Weisse Munichoise. Arômes de malts dorge et de froment, caramel, cannelle, pain viennois, miel, gelée de coin, citron vert, herbes fraiches, aromates (coriandre, basilic, thym...), pomme verte, trèfle, luzerne... Simple, gourmand et efficace à souhait en plus dinviter à la dégustation tout en désaltérant. Bouche soyeuse, texture ronde et douce, carbonatation moyenne, alcool sobre mais élégant, levure agréable et légère comme une plume, amertume faible. Les saveurs de malts sont légères, on retrouve également des pointes dagrumes rafraichissantes. La longueur est moyenne, le final un peu en deçà, trop sage à mon goût. Un breuvage simple, élégant, équilibré et qui aura pour vertu de désaltérer tout en proposant du corps.

Poznan, NaPiwek, kran. Ar: cudowna swiezosc, slodowosc, swietne banany, ziarnistosc, bosko, wzorowe weisse, lekko kwasnie w tej ziarnistosci, dobra intensywnosc, generalnie slodowosc i banany. Wzorcowo. Wyg: bursztynowawe, zamglone, dobra piana, nawet trwala, nie tak obfita jak u innych, drobnoziarnista. Sm: klasyka weizenow, cudowne, wysycenie wysokie ale pasujace, super swiezosc, mega ziarnistosc i banany, dobre cialo, aksamitnie, swietna pijalnosc, mila nuta lekkiego kwasku, wybitny weizen! Pos: ziarnistosc, slodowosc, lekka kwasnosc, super.

zapach średnio intensywny, sporo bananów, goździków, trochę nut kwasowych i karmelowych, ale niestety silna i ostra nuta czosnku. kolor karmelowo pomarańczowy, mocno, równomiernie zmętniony. piana niezbyt obfita, ale trwała, drobna i średnia, w kolorze złamanej bieli. w smaku pełne, lekko mączne, biszkoptowe, lekki, niezbyt palony karmel, przypieczona drożdżówka, mleczna czekolada z bananem, sporo drożdży, trochę goździka, gałki i korzeni. całość lekko kwaskowa. goryczka niewysoka ale nie trzeba jej szukać, ziołowa, korzenna, czysta i bardzo krótka. piwo konkretne i treściwe, ale nie ciężkie. nasycenie wysokie, ale nie bardzo wysokie.
Uklar mørkegylden hvedeøl med duft af banan og gær. Flot luftig skum. Smagen er en anelse mere bitter end andre tyske kvalitets hvedeøl. Den er har mere krop.

Bottle. Pours hazy deep amber with a medium white head. An explosion of spicy and fruity notes in the aroma along with notes of toffee and baguette crust and wood; phenolic and ester content is very belgian-like. Not as sweet as most dunkel weizens. High carbonation, frothy texture. Amazing, aroma is simply superb!

Butelka do 06.04.2017. Wygląd - ciemnobursztynowe, zamglone, z trwałą pianą lecz niezbyt obfitą i kremową jak na weizena. Aromat - słody, goździk dość wyraźny, trochę banana. Smak - klasyka weizenów, przede wszystkim goździk, banany raczej w tle, pewną kwiatowość. Ciało dość pełne, wysycenie średnie, lekko kwaskowate. Klasyczny, dobry pszeniczniak.

Bardzo klasyczna, niemiecka pszenica. Całkowicie mętna, z wysoką pianą. W aromacie banan i goździk - niezbyt intensywnie. W smaku więcej goździka, bardzo lekka kwaśność, ciało słodowe i wysokie nagazowanie. Przyjemne i orzeźwiające.

Aroma: Soft resin/floral notes (fresh but not too special)
Appearance: Pale color witth cloudy liquid and a white rocky head.
Taste: light sour and bitterness.
Palate: Medium body with creamy texture and soft carbonation; long bitter finish
Overall: Wheat beer with full flavour, nice texture and very easy to drink; fresh feeling and tasty even cold.

Poured from a 50cl bottle at home. Cloudy brown-yellow with full white head. Very strong and sweet wheat, banana and yeast aroma. Full body. Oily texture. Low carbonation. Mild but lasting bitterness.

Bottle. Smooth, mildly spicy, lightly fruited, malty wheat beer. Not bitter. Fairly dry. 
(2008)

8. 2. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Shared w/ my dad. My tasting was affected by smoked beer prior to this one, so I'll have to repeat the tasting.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo barwy brunatnej, mocno zmętnione, piana wysoka, biała. W aromacie bardzo klasycznie, goździk wyraźny, potem nutka bananowa. W smaku bardzo przyjemnie, lekko, zwiewnie, trochę słodowo, ale bez przesady, lekko kwaskowate jak na pszenice przystało. Świetne piwo!
Aroma of clove and a slight banana. Pours a swamp-water like brown with a feint head. Tastes fairly sweet with a sour finish. Not half bad.

aroma of clove and some banana 
top quite high initially, white very nice, but reduces fast. color copper / orange
taste a bit spicy with some fruity-sweet background. fresh and pleasant
body light, carbonation medium-high 
nice, fresh, drinkable beer, no adventures inside, quite stylish
Piana drobna, wyraźnie zmętnione. W smaku bananowe, jakby lekko kwiatowe. Orzeźwiające. Całkiem ok.

Sehr dunkle Farbe, Mokka. Wenig Schaumbildung, hält sich nicht lange. Tolles Aroma: Karamell und Banane. Seidig-cremige Textur, angenehme Malznoten. Abgang dezent hopfig. Leckerer, süßlicher Nachgeschmack. Geiles weizen!

Bottle 0.5
Шикарн В послевк& кислинк& немного нетипич& для немецко& вайцена, но все еще далекая от витбира.

50 cl. bottle. Cloudy and even murky deep amber/copper coloured with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel, banana, toffee and some flower notes. Flavour is bready along with citrus and floral hops. Taste is sweet with a bit of sourness. Palate is pleasant. It is medium bodied and oily textured. Carbonation is average, maybe a little bit more than average. Finish is quite long and sour but leaves a slight bitterness, too. I should say that its an interesting German Hefeweizen. Not very traditional but still well-balanced. To give an idea, its much better than Erdinger but not as good as Weihenstephaner.

500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy copper, darker than an average weizen. Pale cream-colored head which initially looks quite impressive but dissipates completely in a matter of few minutes. Aroma of slight clove, yeast. Taste is moderately sweet, very low bitterness; flavors of esters - banana, clove, bread-like flavor, wheat malt. Medium body, smooth texture, high carbonation.

Faint aroma of yeast and some sweet banana notes. Cloudy copper in the glass with minimal head. Taste of wheat maltiness with bready core. Bit of tartness senses the throat. Medium body but bready notes give the sensation of the palate. Ive expected more at all.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Cerveza espectacular. Un aroma espectacular, una apariencia ambarina y oscura acompañado de una capa de espuma blanca. Un sabor de otro nivel y un paladar más que interesante.
Una cerveza de trigo que está a otro nivel. Altamente recomendable.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: W aromacie goździk na pierwszym miejscu, na drugim banan, przyjemny, klasyczny, dosyć intensywny. Barwa ciemnozłota, mętne, piana obfita, dosyć drobna ale opadająca. W smaku pełność słodowa fajnie kontrowana przez lekkość, wysokie wysycenie i kwaskowaty finisz weizena. Bardzo dobre, klasyczne piwo.
Hazy amber with white head. Banana, floral and spicy. Sweet, round and caramel finish. Nice!
Classic german hefeweizen bought in a supermarket in a town near Albacete. Banana aroma, bread ans biscuit. wheat and barley flavour, sweet, delicious.
Mooi donkerblond bier met oranje gloed. Smaken van abrikozen, pruimen en ander steenfruit. Beetje banaan, koriander, hooi, tarwe. Schoolvoorbeeld van een witbier.

Theres probably some old German law that prohibits drinking Schneider Weisse in the winter, but Original was my preferred snow day beer. Pouring an unconventional amber color, this Hefeweizen has attractive lacing and a creamy head that lasts. Spicy, fruity, and yeasty nose. Taste profile includes banana, apple, citrus, clove, nutmeg, and coriander. Thick, full feel and just a hint of bright tartness at the finish.Definitely a lovely example of German Hefeweizen.

Darker than most Hefeweizen with an amber body and large white head. Sweet banana and spice aroma. Taste is sweet with a slight sourness from the wheat, along with banana, clove, and pepper. Moderate to high carbonation.
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat przyjemny, głównie bananowy, słodowy. W smaku podobnie. Wysokie nasycenie.

Bottle. Dark orange. Could easily be mistaken for a Dunkelweizen. Thick fluffy head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, clove and lemons. Taste is bananas, lemons and malt. Slightly sweet and sour. Creamy, light and süffig. A touch of bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Not as heavy and filling as some other Hefeweizen. Balanced and delicious.

Dark anber color. Moderate carbonation. Aroma is sweet, malty, fresh. Taste is bready, yesty, grassy. Fresh, bready, grassy, banana,clove. Aftertaste - sweet and interesting finish, a bit fruity and honey. Super

50cl bottle @Schneider Weisses Brauhaus, Munich. 03-08-2016.
As "Tap 7 Mein original".
Pours very hazy dark orange with nice creamy white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Banana, phenolic nose. Medium body, average carbnation, light crispy texture. Taste is deep wheat character, malty, sweet.

Ar: Fresh grain, medium pepper, clove, and banana; some slight wet dough and herbal hoppiness. Ap: Orange-amber and cloudy; huge white head with great retention, leaving a thick mound of foam in the glass. T: Light banana and toasty malt up front, mid palate is very mild clove, a touch of bubblegum, and tart lemon; finish is a light, clean bitterness with a herbal character, and lingering black pepper and dough. P: Medium-full body with high carbonation that gives the beer an impression of thickness, though the beer finishes crisp and dry. O: Solid and classic example of the style; the flavors are harmonious and well-integrated, with the typical banana, clove, lightly toasty malt, and black pepper flavors melding gracefully, none of them dominating.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Weizen-typisch, leicht säuerlich. Erscheinung: orangebraunes, trübes Bier, cremeweißer, feinporiger Schaum, akzeptable Gardine. Geschmack: süßlich, hefig. Nachgeschmack: leichte Säure kommt im Abgang, schön vollmundig. Gesamt: nettes Weizen, nicht mehr, nicht weniger.
Jolie bière ambrée, belle mousse, banane et muscade. Belle bière allemande.

From bottle. Copper, hazy; white head that does not last as long as many other beers of type. Fruity (but only a little banana), grassy, dry. Malty, somewhat sour with citrus notes. An exellent wheat beer interpretation.
Leuchtend braun, trüb, feiner weißer Schaum, leicht hefig in der Nase, schön voller Körper, leichte süße, leicht fruchtig im Abgang, sehr süffig
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Golden color, little hazy. Little white head. Typical weizen aroma, honey and clover. Banana, honey and clover ina taste, little citrusy. Nice mouthfeel, medium body, spritzy finish. Refreshing light weizen

0.5 l bottle at Old Pharmacy Pub, Zagreb. Pours murky reddish-brown color, small to medium creamy off-white head. Light aroma of citrus, dry fruits, light spicy, light banana. Soft to medium carbonation, medium body, taste is sweet, light texture, finish not spectacular.

Bottle, 0.50l. Pours hazy amber brown color with medium creamy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is yeasty, fruity, spicy and grainy. Taste starts grainy and bready, following is yeasty and refreshing mild fruity, mouthfeel is mild spicy, while finish is light grassy bitter. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Simple and excellent...
caramel, bread, cereal, toast, floral, amber, cloudy, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, fizzy,
In einem Berliner Restaurant, gezapft. Gelb-Orange, trüb. Aroma:Fruchtig, Banane, Hefe. Geschmack sehr fruchtig, Pfirsich, Banane, Hefe

Pours with a hazy amber colour, craggy head, and good lace. Moderate carbonation with an aroma of cloves and soft fruit. The taste is crisp with cloves entering quickly and advancing into the middle with mild banana notes. Some mixed fruit overtones appear in the moderate finish with a suggestion of bitterness at the very end. Mouthfeel is somewhat thin. Something is amiss!

Amarillo dorado ligeramente turbia, abundante cabeza de espuma blanca de buena retención; aromas a plátano, clavo, bollería, grano y flores; en boca entrada suave, ligeramente maltosa, frutal y fresca, cuerpo medio ligero y buena carbonatación, notas a grano y pan, corto retrogusto ligeramente maltoso y dulce, cerveza agradable y fácil de beber.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy light orange-brown with an off-white head. Moderately yeasty aroma, pear, banana, earthy and slightly dark breadish malty notes along with some spices. Light to medium body with soft to average carbonation and a light sweetness. Nice wheat flavor, fruity with pear and orange, cloves, slightly yeasty. Overall well balanced and refreshing.

Pours a very odd cloudy yellowish-brown, I would compare to aged leather. Typical of German beers, it has a full white head that lasts through the drink. The aroma is malt and banana. The taste is bready malt, honey, banana, some yeast spiciness, some grassy hops. It is partly sweet, partly sour with the wheat contributing a very crisp finish. A refreshing, flavourful easy drinker.

0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, banana notes. Hazy golden color, white head. Malty taste, light sour. Medium body, watery texture, average carbonation and malty light sour-bitter finish. Well balanced, easy drinking.

- trüb-braun-orangene Farbe mit guter Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Banane, Hefe, Brot, Nelken, Muskat und grüner Apfel
- angenehm zurückhaltende Carbonisierung für ein Weissbier
- der Antrunk gestaltet sich eher etwas flach, aber mit einem gut ausgestatteten
 Malzbett
- diese Flachheit neigt im Mittelteil leider zu einer leichten Wässrigkeit 
- die oben beschriebenen Aromen bringen sich schlussendlich im Geschmack viel zu wenig zur Geltung
- man wartet irgendwie die ganze Zeit darauf, dass noch etwas Zündendes oder
 Unerwartetes kommt
Fazit: Im Gesamten einfach zu ausdrucksschwach
Dark abmer with low clarity. Beautiful. Banana and well ripe fruit flavor. Very drinkable.

Pours a hazy amber with a small white head, lightly carbonated. Fantastic example of a Weissbier. Banana, clove, spice, bready malt. I get a bit more bitterness with this one compared with others, and as well as a coriander flavour in the finish there is a bit of mint leaf. Really good, very drinkable.

Color ámbar oscuro, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación alta, las burbujitas se pegan al fondo y las paredes del vaso. Aroma a trigo, malta y algo frutal. Sabor a trigo, malta, fruta, algo de plátano. Un poco de amargor final. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación bien medida. Toda una cerveza de trigo. Gran surprise.

Butelka. Piana obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, opada powoli i redukuje się do obwódki, słabo koronkuje. Barwa ciemnego złota, mętne. W aromacie intensywny banan i goździk. Goryczki w zasadzie brak. W smaku intensywniejszy jest goździk, dalej banan i pszenica. Pełnia średnia, nasycenie wysokie. Trudno o bardziej klasycznego przedstawiciela stylu.

Botella en una @Cata. 16/10/16 
Color ambar, sabor malta, trigo, cuerpo medio.

Keg @Salt Horse, Edinburgh [Rating Backlog]. Pours yellow, orange, light brown i could not make up my mind, murky. Nose is spices cloves huge, banana, in general a classic hefe. Taste is similar, banana, clove and oranges are all in abundance.
[backlog] 10-02-15 // at BeerDeLuxe, Melbourne. Pours a clody amber golden beer. Full body, with banana, ripe fruits, some clove spice. Well balanced.

Tasted at the Craft Beer Festival Herbst #3 in Frankfurt aM
Cream-colored head, banana, short finish, Hefeweizen

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Banana, bubblegum, bread. Appearance: Brown base, almost clear, nice dense white head. Taste: Bready, banana, light clove, lightly bitter. Palate: High carbonation, medium-low body, semi-sweet finish.
0,5l bottle. Very drinkable. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Color: dark amber, poor foam. Aroma: clove, gum, some bananas. The taste is fairly empty, a little spicy and mineral. Well carbonated.

I didnt see what all the fuss was about, sure it smelled o.k with hints of banana and slight bubble gum. A nice amber body, with a super thick cap that left good lace. But the mouthfeel was too watery, and after the initial taste of slight banana and clove there wasnt anything except a little yeasty after taste, that was really bland. Overall it was o.k. but i dont intend on getting another one.Originally rated on 10/ 9/2008.

Bottle from the Schneider Weisse Kulturbox. 
Pours dark amber. Nose is bubblegum, banana with notes of citrucy hops. 
Medium carbonation. Hits all my favorite Weizen notes. Well balanced. Comes close to the Aventinus, but it was missing something I cant really put my Finger on. Still really nice.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy, deep caramel pour with a small white head. Aroma is a little like warm apple cider - fruity, some nutmeg and cloves, subtle wheat malt and hints of citrus as well. Taste is caramel, apple, spices, slight citrus and floral notes in the finish. Really tasty, finishes balanced and light, not cloying or lingering at all. Nice, and a little different.
Hazy amber pour. Sweetish banana aroma. Taste is pleasantly sweet banana and spice. Slight tart snap. Medium body, refreshing.

Sharp hops come through on this one with its rich weisse texture coming through. Wonderfully smooth the texture is perfect and like velvet washing around your mouth. Very nice Wiess as good as some of the beer hall ones.
UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 Ambrata, con sottile schiuma biancastra. Aroma lievito e frutta. Bevuta non molto spinta sul dolce, con frutta e banana poco evidenti. Carbonazione media. Birra ok

Bottle @Mittlestation, Arosa, Switzerland.
Medium, creamy head, dark golden/orange colour. Aroma of bananas, clover, also a bit of grain. Lightly sour with sweet aftertaste. Light body, lively.
Very good and refreshing.

Banana nutty clove Belgian yeast aromas and flavors. Balanced well by the malt but still light enough to be easy drinking. Flavorful but still easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,5 l bottle, served in weizen glass. Poured hazy amberish dark brown with a small one finger off white head. Darker looking than most other hefeweizen. Lively carbonation in glass. Aromas of ripe banana, cloves, caramel, brown sugar. Taste: Again the banana and cloves. Then vanilla, caramel, wheat, sugar candy, nuts, spice. Malty ripe banana mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. A light body with a nice sweet malty finish. Some faint bitterness. A very enjoyable hefeweizen.

Lovely stuff, isn't quite on the same level as the stronger Schneider Weiss but still a lot more complex with nicer aftertaste than your normal wheat beer. Dark colour, just 5.4%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A 500 ml bottle from Bottle Jockey in north Burnaby. A murky copper color with moderate pale head and a nose of dried fruits. The nose is confirmed on tasting. Flavors of dried fruits combine with malted grains. A trace of hop in the background. nice. 3.9
Barwa ciemnego złota, wpadająca w bursztyn. Piana z początku średnio obfita, momentalnie znika do zera. W aromacie stylowo, ale nie zbyt intensywnie. W smaku wodniste, puste. Rozczarowanie.
Приятно& и достато& темное пшеничн& пиво, красиво& на вид, хороший аромат, хороший вкус и слабое послевк& TAP7 Mein Original - 500ml Bottle
Murky brown colour, Fine carbonation, medium body. From the probably best producer of Weiss in Germany and the whole world. Almost possible to chew this beer.

Zapach intensywny, banany, goździki, chleb, guma balonowa. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, mętne. Piana obfita, gęsta, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, goździki, karmel, guma balonowa, banany, lekka kwaskowatość. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Легкое, слегка сладкое. Аромат хлеба и сена.
Nice clody brownish color. Airy white head. Medium body. Somewhat sour and yeasty. Dry.
An exceptional beer, but not my estil.En stressed its balance and evolution in the nose. As emu taste somewhat lacking graduation. The remaining perfect. A fantastic beer.

Tap at Schneider weisse brauhaus in Munich. Pours cloudy light brown. Darker than your typical Hefeweizen. Aroma of banana, cloves, cinnamon and malt. Taste is lightly sweet with some minimal bitter and sour. Nice.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2016 Cor caramelo torrado, sabor agradável, aroma agradável garrafa de 0.5l carbonatação média.

Bottle from a random shop in Berlin. Bottled 3 months ago. Pours hazy golden amber with good off-white head. Aroma of ripe banana and white bread dough, damp, wheaty, sweet... Hint of bandaid as its warmed. Tastes wheaty-doughy the most, faint fruitiness, hints of banana and faint hops, but also the thin layer of bandaid. Leafy bitterish hoppy finish. Fine yet active carbonation, medium body, kinda grainy on the palate. I feel like Im overrating it. Dont get the hype. Dont get Hefeweizens for that matter.

Pours a cloudy caramel colour with plenty of carbonation from the second fermentation, 1-2 finger off-white head, tightly knit. Very strong aroma of banana, bubblegum, clover and spice. Palate is medium-bodied but very drinkable and refreshing. The carbonation is excellent in the mouthfeel. Tasting notes are malty, bready, slightly floral with quite an alcoholic aftertaste.

Tap at Zum Schneider, Montauk. Pours sort of toffee caramel color, off white head, creamy. Aroma is clove, lemon, wheat, banana. Standard wheat. Flavor is lemon, clove, some cinnamon or nutmeg, earthy spices, banana. Nice.
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Mislim da o ovom gospodinu ne treba troiti riječi jednostavno treba uivati u njemu, do iduće prilike moj naklon..
Pours toffee caramel brown off white foam, fantastic retention. Nose clove and banana and malt / toffee. Taste is balanced and slight tart. Banana, clove and malty finish. The best German weiss bier.

Draft @ Taphouse CPH.
Pours a dark golden color, which is a mix of brown and yellow, with a good head with some retention. The aroma is mostly malts with some apparent phenolic presence, while the taste is surprisingly (albeit mildly) sour and refreshing, carrying notes of fruits and spices. A favorite.

Pours hazy deep ruby color with rich white head. Smell is fruity, wheat with notes of banana to it.

Medium body with soft, but prickly carbonation. Light texture. Taste is mostly sweet with some sourness and bitterness added. Aroma of wheat, clove, fruit, lots of banana, slight caramel and some hops towards the finish. Very rich and complex, beautifully balanced. 

Overall, delicious.
Bouteille 50 cl - couleur ambrée, fines bulles, mousse beige, arômes boisé, malté, goût sur le malt, les épices, finale longue, alcool très faible
At Home along with Yves hazy dark amber coloured body with a small off white head and a herby floral hop yeast malt aroma a spicy floral sweet yeast hop taste with a dry bitter finish

bottle: pours an orange amber colour with a quickly dissipating off white head.....aroma more banana than clove but that changes a little as it warms.... subtle dried fruit and a smokiness present....not really smokiness but fenugreek,,,I think thats it, it reminds me of a batch of home brew I made with fenugreek.......lightly carbonated.....caramel taste present.....a slight tartness at the back end....at first I wasnt sure but the taste kinda grew on me....

BB 02.10.2016. Poured a hazy medium amber/brown colour (darker than usual for a Hefe) with a three-finger off-white frothy head that retained well (diminished under five minutes) and laced poorly plus with a few yeasty sediments. Carbonation low to moderate with medium bubbles. Aroma of caramel malt, soft sweet banana and subtle cloves; not as fruity as other Hefes. Taste of moderately sweet banana and cloves and a hint of dark fruits/raisins. Light to medium body. Soft, smooth and slightly dry with mild but sweet banana and a hint of cloves on the finish. Good.
On tap @ Weisses Bräuhaus, Starkbierzeit 2016. Üvegesbe jobban ízlett, ez olyan savanykás, kb mint a hordó alja. Színe is iszapos.

Reddish brown and light-bodied. Fruity aroma and light fruity flavour. Mild, somewhat dry taste, with moderate acidity and low bitterness. Overall, a dull experience. I do not appreciate dryness and acidity together, no matter the beer style. I guess weissbiers are not for me.
Murky mud brown lasting decent head vanana sugar cloves great balance to this bottle at the Healey rochdale
A very tasty white beer. Very cloudy amber color and a creamy white head. Some smokey on the nose. Malt and smoked oak taste. A good finish.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Bottle. Chestnut color, hazy liquid, white head. Lower carbonation. Typical hefeweizen with a micro tin of burp vomit aroma and smell. Medium, but pleasant sour, light bitter. Below average.

Bottle at Woodland Creatures. Pours auburn.russet with big bubbly off whote head. Banana, malt loaf, cloves on the nose. Full fruity chewy breakfast mouthfeel. Not too much banana on the taste - lots of dark fruit: raisins, dates, figs. Soft, drinkable dessert of a beer and an excellent beer - all the best of wheat beers and dunkels in one glass. Lovely.

0.5l bottle.

Dark amber color with off white head. Mostly wheat and yeast taste.
Dark amber, brownish with big white head. Aroma is lemon, grass and a little bit wet basement. Taste is fresh sourness and very light. Still medium body and overall a good Weizen.

Tap 7 original, avec malts dorge et de blé, plusieurs houblons, refermenté, non filtré, non pasteurisé. Niveau abv de 5,4 % pour 50 cl. Mon exemplaire était juste à sa date limite.
Couleur ambre caramel, à la clarté nette.
Bulles fines, à montée lente depuis les parois.
Mousse beige clair, nappage soyeux à 1 mm.
Arômes de malt cara, feuilles de chêne, bruyère, amandes, pointe de coing.
1ère bouche structurée à lensemble malté/épicé, avec une touche de candi.
Arrière-bouche assez longue, avec du tabac brun.
2ème au bel ensemble malt/houblon, avec du tabac brun, mais la texture est assez aqueuse.
Arrière-bouche un peu épicée, très originale.
3ème avec un peu de fruits et de châtaigne sur le malt cara.
Arrière-bouche assez longue, souple.
Longueur avec de très beaux moments, malgré une texture trop légère. Des parfums de fût vide,
de foin coupé, touche de noisettes.
Jambes fines, longues.
Levure fine, nuancée, ligne correcte.
Alcool trop faible, il ne peut tenir les saveurs sur la longueur.
Finale assez faible.
CONCLUSION : bière de bonne moyenne, mais à la texture trop ténue. De plus, elle va en saffaiblissant sur la longueur, et la finale est vraiment mince.
Dark amber, big head. Aroma of banana and grain. Taste is lightly sweet, grainy, with some alcohol, banana and sour finish. I hoped it would be better.

Taste: robust, bready, wheat some citrus notes. Lemony and cracked bread aroma.
Brown and unfiltered, with a dark gold creamy head and lattice of lace. Medium body and filling.
Bottle. Okay Weizen! Good taste with an easy, smooth finish and nice aftertaste.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Belle couleur mais pas beaucoup darôme et niveau du gout je suis plutôt déçu... Un peu de banane comme les autre weisse mais pas top...

Dark peanut butter orange. Lighter at the thin spots. The head isnt that big but that might be my fault on the pour. (Although I did it German-style.)

There is a smoky, Rauch-like aroma: it has a peat/wood smoke aroma that is really pleasant. A touch of lemon rind and wheat malt. There is an herbal (minty?) quality to the hop that I cant quite put my finger on. The yeast is doughy as hell. I really enjoy it.

The yeast really comes to the forefront in the flavor. Its a dark, doughy yeast. A touch of that lemony goodness. 

The feel is more slick than expected; its kind of buttery. Boy I really like this beer. I dont know if I like this or TAP5 better.

500ml bottle. Pours a golden cloudy straw color. nice two finger white dense head. nose is ripe banana, banana peel, clove, some light pepper, something fruity underneath it all. beautiful mouthfeel and carbonation. very nice. palate is nice and light and very well balanced with the carbonation and slight effervescence. this is one of the best offerings of this style. always delicious

Draft at Dutchs, served in a pint glass. Pours a super hazy dull orange with a small off-white head that settles into an uneven film and a ring. Notes of banana, clove, caramel, wheat, earth, leaves, apple, nutmeg - its about what youd expect for a traditional take on the style. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, mildly spicy mouthfeel. Very good, but not the world beater Id hoped for.

Pours a cloudy amber topped by a coarse off-white head showing good retention, and leaving small spotted lacing. Carbonation is high with fine bubbles. The nose is fruity with loads of banana bread. Certain doughy and bubblegum elements noted. The taste is sweet, fruity, banana bread, bubblegum, floral hops. Slight mineral presence in the aftertaste. Medium body with sharp and ample lingering finish. Smooth, sweet and satisfying. Cheers!

Bottle (from firma bier as Schneider Weisse Tap 7 Unser Original), bottled 13.01.16. Pours brownish amber with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is intense banana, fruits, soap, citrus. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter, banana, fruits, citrus, caramel, wheat. Finish is wheaty with some acidic and caramel notes. Carbonation is bit high, body feels bit light. Overall: very nice brew.
Flaska. Grumligt brunorange med ett oerhört vackert och långvarigt vitt skum. Dofter av vete, malt, banan och en lätt apelsinton. Samma återkommer i smaken. Medel mot liten kropp, mjuk munkänsla.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy brown with a thin white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, bubblegum, sweet malts. Taste is lightly sweet, tiny sour, loads of wheat, banana, and clove. Medium body, really drinkable, great weissebier.

Robe ambrée et trouble. La mousse tient plutôt bien. Arômes caramel et banane. Goût identique avec des notes épicées. Très douce, texture crémeuse.
Une bonne bière.

Hazy light brown to orange color. Has the typical aromas of hefeweissen bubblegum, banana, and clove. Almost no hop aroma or flavor. Yeasty phenolic flavor, bananas, caramel, and some roasted aroma. Good beer.

Pours muddy brown with small thick white top. Aroma is slightly roasted malts, banana, little bit soap water, fruits, caramel biscuits, apple. Taste is soft, sweet, some sourness, strong wheat, flour, banana, apple pie, some oily caramel. Very long and crispy after. Nice beer, well balanced!
500 ml bottle. Hazy amber colour with huge stable head off. Aroma of wheat,spicy,banana. Taste like weissbier,balanced taste,full body,decent carbonation. I was surprised by colour. Good!
Cerveja de trigo muito encorpada e com otimo aroma. Nao tem gosto residual depois de tomar. Deliciosa.
500ml bottle. Hazy amber pour. Big head quickly dissipates. Bready, yeasty, banana, spice, a good beer.

Copenhagen 22/3 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. Overcrowded label with a picture of the founder, the brewery and a painting of what looks like the sun. pours hazy amber with creamy white head. Settles as thin layer of foam. Strong aroma of wheat beer. Sweet lemonade and banana meeting strong fruity sourness. Prominent notes of yeast as well. Medium carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is sweet and slightly lemonadelike followed by a more sour and fruity - almost acidic - aftertaste. A quite fine weissbeer being not overly sweet.
Pretty interesting, nice flavour, amtls are good. Very light body, easy drinking. Enjoyable overall.

Im sure this is a classic beer. I have been trying to like this Style of beer but I guess its just not my mug of ale. I liked this one better then the last one but the sour, fruity, and yeasty aspects arent for me.

Absolute classic. Pours deep cloudy Amber somewhere between a classic Hefeweizen Helles and a Dunkel. Taste is fantastic: all you want from Hefeweizen: overripe bananas, cloves, sour, and very rich. Head lasts and frothy all the way down.
Bottle at green sheep. Mahagony colour with a small white head. Nose of banana. Taste is also slight banana with some roasted malts. Very nice beer overall.
La receta más antigua de trigo bávaro no decepciona, con mucho más sabor que una weisse y más cercana a una weizenbock. Dulce, pan y fruta, todo ello con mucha intensidad en el paladar.
Bottle from Bradleys. A cloudy deep amber with a decent head. Banana and yeast with a hint of spice. Prefer the complexity of tap 4.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Pours dark bronze into the glass. A small creamy head lingers for much of the duration. Aroma is yeasty, wet wood, and lightly fruity. The expected banana scent that accompanies most Weizen beers is quite subdued. Taste is yeasty, sour, and fruity, light chocolate with some mineral notes in the finish. The palate is marred by a lightly watery character. Decent. Refreshing. But not up to the best of the class.
Rerate: up .1 to 3.1
Balanced sweetness, not to much banana, crisp, some malty aroma, Just really good Balanced.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Hazy amber / Ambar turbio.
T/S: Malt, wheat, fruity / Malta, trigo, afrutado.
Cloudy dark, almost brown, with a thick white foam. The taste is crisp, including subtle notes of banana, citrus and cloves. Good.

500 ml bottle at a restaurant, bottled 15.12.15.
Brown, cloudy body, with a massive, stabel, fluffy, light beige head.
Aroma of bread, bubblegum, ripe banana, dried fruits, spices, some toast.
Tastes of bread, chocolate, spices, banana, orange, bubblegum, dried fruits, some toast, subtle hops.
Medium, slightly oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes quite dry, a bit bitter, spicy, bready, fruity, a bit hoppy.

Very nice. A classic, but also a bit unique style example, inbetween a normal Weizen and a Dunkelweizen. Very well balanced and manifold, with the typical fruits and spices, but also some chocolate and subtle toasty notes. One of my favourite Hefeweizens!
Amber farget tåkete med høyt beige skum. Lukter krydder, gjær og banan. Søt karamell og banan, lett bitter syrlig, noe hvit pepper. Kort
Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is floral, spicy yeasts, fruit, maybe caramel. Taste is a little heavy for a hefe but interesting. Has a slight stewed apple quality.
A nice weizener. Not to sweet, with a nice bitter aftertaste. Good present hoptones, that arent overdone.

brown~orange color, long lasting head
light clove aroma
malty flavor with hint of citrus, fruity
medium body, clear finish

Cloudy dark orange beer, low carbonation with a small white head, nice aromas of banana, and vanilla, nice taste with a better balance malt hops, but as it is expected for an german Hefeweizen the malt flavors prevail and at the end a slight bitterness can be perceived. Sadly in palate the perception is rather watery.
Bottle - schlammig-braunes Bier mit guter Schaumkrone. Aroma eines wunderbares Weizen, leicht bananig, Pfirsisch, Brot, blumig. Etwas zu mineralisch, dünn.
Optisch recht dunkel, schöne Bananennoten in der Nase. Im Trunk nicht zu süß, im Abgang bitter. Insgesamt hier deutlich weniger Banane. Langer Abgang. Lecker!

Aroma:

Malts, caramel, wheat, fruit. Very faint overall.

Appearance:

Turbid amber/brown beer with a slight white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet with malts and wheat.
