Light aroma with wheat and a hint of banana. Brown/amber color with medium light beige head and hazy liquid. Medium taste with sweet wheat, banana, some nuts. Balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium/short aftertaste with wheat and banana. Medium body with medium/high carbonation. Overall almost schoolbook like hefe, though with bit simple taste and watery presence.
Aromas of yeast, malt and fruits inkluding banana. Taste is the same but with a hint of hops as well. Fresh an a low bitterness. A nice Hefe as all the Germans on the Norwegian marked.
Schlammbraun und trüb, in der Nase recht bananig und nussig, der Geschmack ist sehr gut. Banane Pfirsich nussig etwas Gewürz. Sehr angenehm.

E di colore ambrato, quasi marroncino, con un cappello di schiuma fine e bianca. Al naso forti sentori di lievito, molto fruttata. Entra assai carbonata e con unottima freschezza. Al palato qualche nota caramellata sul classico cereale. Finale leggermente amaro. Lacidità è ben presente dallinizio alla fine della bevuta.

Bottle from my Advent calender. The beer is quite dark, pretty much orange, and very cloudy due to being unfiltered. I dont usually like Weizen very much, but Ill make an exception for this one. Its really good! The banana-clove-taste stays more in the background than in other Weizen, instead there are nice grassy hop flavours and especially delicious yeast flavours. The bitterness is soft and the sweetness is not aggressive. All very well combined. The best Weizen I have had so far!
Cloudy orange beer with minimal White head. Aroma of banana,bread and yeast. Sweet und slightly bitter with medium carbonation. I like it.

From tap. Pours murky brownish with an off white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, cloves, spices, sweet. Taste is banana, yeasty, super sweet, caramel, bready. I only drink this because I suck at playing dice...
At home. Banana and gritty hops, stark end, bit sour as well. Nice complex flavour. Backlog from 2015/07/31.
Advent calendar #16. Murky dark gold,.off white head. Banana yeast aroma. Banana and metallic notes in the taste. Medium.body,thin carbonation
Aromas of banana and nutmeg amongst fresh bread. Pours cloudy golden colour with large fluffy head. Smooth taste with medium carbonation, Very enjoyable and one Ive bought since.

Flasche 0,5l: Braun mit leichten Rotstich, kräftige Trübung, feinporiger fester Schaum; Sehr frische Nase, fast floral, blumig, angenehme Hefearomen, Gäraromen, leichte malzige Süße; im Körper sehr frisch, deutliche Hefearomen, würzig, fester Körper; leicht holzig im Nachgang
Flaske. Farven er dybgul. Skumkronen er høj, fast og hvid/gul. Aromaen er som smagen hvilket vil sige maltet, kryddernellike, muskatnød og æble.

Cloudy amber, tall rocky head, thick lacing. Aroma of spicy yeast, sweetish wheat, banana. Light to medium body. Thin to oily texture. The flavour is relatively dry, very spicy, some caramel, even a hint of earth. Minimal bitterness present. Tasty. A very good one.
Aroma a pan de centeno. Apariencia turbia, color miel, toffe. Sabor a cereal, ligeramente picante y persistente.

Didnt care for this beer. Had a strange type of sour taste to it. Perhaps I got a bad bottle. Not sure. Had a sour pineapple after taste as well as a sort of funky aroma while drawing the beer in. Not my favorite beer. Will not drink again anytime soon.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Botella 50 cl de el c. Inglés tomada en noviembre de 2004. (r1994). Fcpref 28..05..2005. Lote 0473. 2634. Sabores maltosos y cereales. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber. Normal.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Barwa jasna, mętne, piana biała, dość szybko opada i ma duże pęcherzyki. W aromacie nuty bananowe goździkowe. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie, mało nagazowane i dość wodniste.
Wheat aroma with a hint of liquorice and smoke. Golden, unclear with a fine white head. Medium sweetness and light bitterness. Well tasting wheat beer. Lively soft carbonation, medium body.
Kurze Review von Untappd: Bananenane, but not to bad, quite tasty. Sicher eins der besseren Weissbiere!
Sample c4. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma yeast, fruity, banan, spice. Taste is very yeasty, undertones if malts, fruit.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 From tap. Excellent! Pours cloudy dark, almost brown, with a thick white foam. The taste is crisp, including subtle notes of banana, citrus and cloves. Probably the best Weißbier Ive tasted.
Light crisp fruity smell, weird brownish cidery appearance, taste isnt as fruity or as sweet as expected...drier....malty, no hop bitterness...slightly watery

A 500ml bottle with a best before date of 28th February 2016 and poured into a Riedel weizen glass. It poured a cloudy bronze copper colour with a slightly less than two finger white head that dissipated slowly without too much lacing. Aromas were sweet, approaching overripe bananas and clove dominating with hints of bubblegum, caramel, toffee and maybe even pear. The toffee becomes even more pronounced as it warms a bit. Taste wise, banana bread is the first thing that comes to mind, but its definitely sweet banana and toffee with hints of clove and caramel while nutty on the finish. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, a very nice hefeweizen that I would definitely buy again.
Bottle 500 ml. Very good foam, yellow-amber color. Aroma and taste: banana, cloves, wheat bread, drinkable, like.
Ideenreiches hefeweizen, fruchtig hefiger Duft, süffiger Geschmack auch hier schöne hefenoten mit getreidig fruchtigem Beigeschmack

Flasche und Fass. Helles kastanienfarbenes Weissbier mit luftigem, feinperligem Schaum. Starker Hefeduft mit Kräuter und Fruchtnoten. Geschmack auch sehr hefig. Brot und Getreidenoten, dann fruchtig. Sehr gut passt dazu Käse!

Sexy veiled pure amber color. Gorgeous beige head with good lacing. Lots of activity.

Sweet aromas and flavors of fruit and wheat. Nutty and slightly spicy.

Extremely flavorful and balanced taste, complex and delicate, but a little too faint.

Slightly too light for my taste, still slick and prickly. Very short finish with good intensity, ending of the bitter side.

Overall an excellent beer, but a little too light compared to others of the same brand. More enjoyed TAP 6.
from draft, deep hazy yellow golden pour with a white fluffy head. nose of wheats, crisp grains, coriander, and ripe banana, granny smith apples, cloves. very nice brew

Wild honey coloured beer with a big, medium-lasting, creme-coloured head. Aromas of light banana, clove, butter, honey, wheat, peach and orange peel . Taste is clovy with some fruity hops, orange peel and some cereals. Light to medium bitter and light sour finish. Light body, soft carbonation, slick texture. Not my favorite Schneider Weisse.

Aroma: banana and cloves.
Appearance: only slightly hazy deep golden color and very good white head.
Taste: cloves, banana, zesty notes, quite dry and drinkable.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, zesty finish.
Overall: Classical beer, really good weizen, drinkable.

Aroma dense, with rich fruity and woody tones, lactic sourness.
The taste is strong enough acidity to suhofruktovymi and berry tones, with her trying unsuccessfully to fight light grain sweetness; bitterness carefully looks at the background.
The finish on time, go ahead yeast tone, the bitterness intensifies and begins to play wood notes, then more rapidly receding, leaving a sour stretch.
This is a plain Weißbier in a house typical style. It is not very interesting but still good craftsmanship and well suited for afterski or a nice moment at the fireplace.
Bottle from craft and dough, sheffield. murky brown, no head. Aroma is banana and clove. Taste is sweet and a bit sour. Mild carb and a bit thin. Ok.

Bottle at home 500ml
It it has a malit aroma would hints of dark chocolate
Is a caramel brown colour
 it has a poor body
One word disappointed

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Amber coloured, dark for a wheat beer, with a large white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, typical spicy fruitiness, and banana which is a bit stronger than in other Hefe, sweet. Fruity wheaty finish as expected.
2015-06-24
Bottle from Meny (Amager), Copenhagen - light brown pour with white head. Sweet malty and wheaty aroma and taste, some doughy yeasts, some grassy hop nuance, banana, into a sweet finish.

Cloudy, light brown to golden with a medium white head. You find aromas of yeast, wheat, fruits and vanilla. It tastes overall sweet with light, subtle bitterness. With fizzy carbonation and full, creamy texture this is a very enjoyable, atypical Hefeweizen.

The classic scent of wheat beer is the first impression you meet when Hefe from Bavaria poured. It has a great light brown in color, have sustained a white foam, as well as a flavoring in addition to wheat also reveals a hoppy and slightly malty sweet duft. Taste is slightly malty, very discreet hoppy and ends in a soft and round final, where wheat beer lens characteristic freshness dominates to end in the aftertastes very soft hop bitterness. The carbonation is very soft and provides an almost creamy mouth feeling.

Bue après 4 mois. Robe jaune très foncée tirant sur lambré. Petit col de mousse dense qui sestompe rapidement. Arômes de bananes, léger sucre, clou de girofle et muscade et cassonade. Nez doux mais un peu fade. En bouche, des saveurs herbacées que je navais pas décelées au nez se présentent rapidement. Cest citronné et malté. Suivent des saveurs de banane verte, eau minérale et dherbes. Les phénols typiques des weizen se pointent en finale. Goût de banane mûres et muscade et toujours cette arrière-goût de citron. Jaurais aimé que les levures se démarquent plus. Le malt est beaucoup trop mis de lavant. Texture très mince, bonne effervescence, corps moyen. Bonne hefeweizen mais il se fait mieux.
50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours cloudy light brown with a big white head. Aromas of yeast, banana, roasted malt and fruits. Taste is sweet and a hint of sourness. Rich and good beer.
Typical Hefeweizen but in a perfect form. Orange colored with a clear white head and aromas of oranges and yeast.

Schaum: gut wie sichs gehört, stabil
Farbe: dunkelorange, trüb
Nase: passt schon.
Geschmack: sprudlig auf der Zunge, Abgang klar Hefeweizen, erdig orange, sehr rund und voll. 
Kein Nachgeschmack.
Richtig gutes Weizen.

Bottle to stange glass
Its 3am and I spent all day Saturday at a company retreat, having to do a presentation and then getting home at 10pm, I worked another 5 hours. Just now, I made a breakthrough in a project, so away went the work and out came a Tap 7.

I poured it carefully into a stange glass and even so, I got a 4-5cm creamy off white head. I let this beer sit for a few minutes and it reduced to a reasonable 1/2 cm, with no lacing. Time to get down to it. Theres some wheat, light orange, and clove on the nose. I feel like Im sitting in a wheat field in Germany.

The taste is a touch of lemon with wheat and some fruity esters. I get just a hint of pepper too. Its light, thin, and dry with light carbonation and it leaves a light chalkiness. Top notch.

On tap, 500 ml. Pours golden light brown. Head is medium tall and white colored. Scents of light malt, fruity and wheat. Body is medium with slightly oily to creamy mouth feel and very light carbonation. Quite smooth. Tastes lightly sweet with mellow bitterness and slight acidity. Flavors of lightly roasted malt, ripe fruit, nutmeg, light spice, wheat, light esters, clove, very mild hoppiness. Smooth and crisp, not heavy, not quite light, gentle, good with food. OK.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 Cloudy nutty brown appearance, with almost no head. Complex tastes of banana, caramel, citrus, some smoked wood and vanilla. Medium body, well carbonated and a good aftertaste of wheat and dried fruits

50cl bottle. Dark orange color, cloudy, spawns a big head that quickly dissolves. Classic weizen aroma, fruity, light spicy with earthy yeast. Taste is very intense, umami. Mid to full body, average carbonation, smooth finish, gentle bitterness. It is smooth, elegant, delicious.

0,5 l. bottle from Beervana as Schneider Weisse Unser Original [Tap 7]. Courtesy of my gorgeous wife. Pours a hazy light brown color with a medium white head that vanishes quickly (not the proper glass, though). Aroma has moderate intensity and shows a traditional yeasty aroma of Schneider Hefes, fresh vanilla and spicy notes with hints of nutmeg, coriander, candy sugar, some banana but less dominant than in other Hefeweizens. Good but less bright and lively than the Hell. Taste is fine, smooth and subtle. Moderately sweet with spicy flavors exploding in all directions. A trace of nutty bitterness is found towards the end. Nice. Light to medium body. Fizzy carbonation (at times I think it needs slightly less). Dry mouthfeel and finish. Long pleasant aftertaste. Refreshing. This one is a really good and well-crafted example of the style but I think the Schneider Weizen Hell is more cohesive and lively.
500 ml bottle. Strong banana smell and some vainilla. Deep golden color with white head. Deep complex sensation, pure heffeweissen, great beer. Ich leibe alles!!!

Aroma: Medium-high banana, clove, Light vanilla. Light toasted banana.
Appearance: Hazy, burnt gold body. Thin, off-white head, low retention
Flavour: Medium banana, clove. Light vanilla, Medium-dry finish with lingering clove. 
Mouthfeel: Light body, High carbonation with carbonic sting. Light mouth-coating.
Overall: Very well balanced. The missing head was strange. The body is also lighter than expected. And the beer is missing that creaminess.
 
500 ml bottle, roused, poured.
15A. Weizen/Weissbier

Poured a very hazy orange/amber colour, with a large foamy head. Good lacing and has a great mouthfeel. Yeast is in the aroma along with wheats, malts, and fruits. Flavours are of the same variety, very yeasty, but hints of banana, orange, apple. A little bit of sourness on the palate, nothing too extreme, and not off-putting. Very good.
Bottle. Pours cloudy/hazy with white head. Aroma of wheat, banana and clove. Taste is sweet, wheat and spices.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Murky brown body with a thick off-white head. Aroma of green tea, orange peel, brown sugar and pot puri. Flavour of apple, yeast, bread and light spices. Medium body with a frothy texture. Very fizzy. Not as nice as I had hoped it would be. A solid German Hefeweizen.
One of my all-time favorites from one of my all-time favorite breweries. A nice hefe with sweet wheat flavor.

It is overall a good beer. The colour is typical of a brauweisse, dark brown. The taste is like prune, "figues". There is just a taste of acidity at the back of the mouth. This beer is perfect with a roast meet.

Bottle from Supervalu, Longford [190815]
Dark amber, hazy, frothy white head, head dissipates fairly quickly
Aroma of soft clove, yeast, more fruity than Tap 1 but less intense nose
Taste of soft clove, yeast, soft esters, dab of fruity malt, no bubble gum
Palate - Medium carb and body, light sweet palate. Finish as main flavour.
Overall - I prefer the Tap 1 to this which was surprising, didnt find this quite as good...but still a decent hefeweizen

I cant believe Ive not ranked this. Nose is banana, bubblegum, yeast, what, slight lemon note, peach, spice. Taste is spicey, cloves, wheat, very fruity, apples, lemon, honey, little vanilla, herbal notes, more cloves. 

Such a lovely beer, which is one of the few I can remember clearly the very first time I drank it and introduced me to wheat beers. Fantastic.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Hazy orange with white minimal head. Malty aroma, fruity, spicy and honey in taste. Lovely.

Hazy gold. 
Medium body, weak flavor, watery mouthfeel, low carbonation and alcohol heat, short palate. 
Refreshing acidity, moderate sweetness, low bitterness. 
Fruity, yeasty, low hops. 
Disapointingly weak in every sense. Substitutes water very well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle at home bought at a random Merkur supermarket in Vienna. Bottled 03.02.2015. BB 03.12.2015. amber hazy color, medium big off-white head. smells of spices, fruity, peach, light yeasty. medium body, bubbly carbonation, full mouthfeel. tastes fruity, peach, light spices, some yeast, some herbs, lightly acidic. finishes with peach and herbs. decent, was expecting a bit more, maybe fresher would be better. overall nice full mouthfeel and good drinkability.
Ingen banan! Fin smag af lyse malte og en god læskende effekt. Om ikke andet er det sjovt at sige navnet.
500ml Flasche. Bernsteinfarben und opalisierend. Kleine Schaumkrone. Leicht malzig. Süsslich und vollmundig.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, Pod Mosteczkiem. na szybko: nie da sie ukryc, ze klasycznie. jest wszystko na swoim miejscu, banany i jakies inne jasne owoce, moze tez pomarancze, jest gozdzik (choc wycofany w aromacie troszke, intensywniejszy w smaku), jest guma balonowa (w tle), jest kwaskowatosc, jest duza piana, jest pelnia w ustach... klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

[2015-07-26] Tummanruskea, samea. Tiheä valkoinen vaahto. Tuoksussa hiivaa ja luumua. Maku on hieman makea ja siitä löytyy kuivattuja hedelmiä, katkeruutta ei ole käytännössä ollenkaan. Runsaasti hiilihappoja, täyteläinen runko.

Bottle at Golgatha in Berlin. Pours a deep almost brown golden color. Its a hefe but thats misleading because its a smooth and full bodied beer, great for beginners through connoisseurs. I know Ive had this before but for some reason never rated it. One of the best.

I had to make sure I poured this from the correct bottle since I thought I had bought a hefeweizen. It doesnt look like a classic hefeweizen or have the taste. It is like a hefeweizen with a dash of doppel bock mixed in, with a mature apple taste on the front end. It is a good beer, just not what I was expecting.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 0.5l bottle. pours a murky orange-amber with a persistent creamy head and a nice lacing. aroma of cloves, banana, but not as dominating as usual. sourish taste, apple juice, nutmeg. dry finish. a rather fruity weizen.

0.5 l bottle at "Zum Treppchen" in Bonn. Murky, brownish orange with a medium large, creamy, almost stable, tan to white head. Yeasty-spicy aroma with lots of clove and banana, some vanilla and honeydew. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy taste again with lots of clove and banana, some vanilla and honeydew, followed by a short, sourish and yeasty finish dominated by clove. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Good weizen, more on the spicy than on the fruity side.
Bottle to glass in Bermuda. Spice and clove with wheatfield and slight graininess. Clear amber! Full ivory to khaki head. Taste is pepper and clove.

Bottle shared by Sjogro. Hazy amber with big white head. Banana, cloves, dough, some spicy rye, bubblegum, fresh baked corn bread, brown bread, light wood, quite some herbs, chalky, grass and soft fresh hops. Light sweet and light to medium bitter finish. Medium bodied with creamy and ready feel. Very good, nice complexity and not just banana.

Tolles Weizen.
Im Aroma Weizen, Banane zudem weiteres Gewürz.
Im Geschmack fruchtig-würzig mit angenehmer Süße. Auch hier Banane und Nelke, außerdem leichte erfrischene Säure.
Lang anhaltender Nachgeschmack. Leicht zu trinken, macht Lust auf mehr.
Wheaty nose, good cream head, cloudy with a burnt orange colour and some fizz in the glass. Good wheaty and lemony flavour, refreshing but a little watery on the finish.

APPEARANCE - turbid and darker than most hefe?s. It?s really dark straw or light brown in color. Great head that?s fed by the continuously bubbling from the beer emanating from the glass to augment the beautiful foam on top.
NOSE - light lager type of scent. Not bright like a lot of other hefewizens are.
FLAVOR ? rich and robust. Slight bit of clove spice at the very end as the beer warms up and a mild hint of bittering hops. Much more body than I am familiar with for most hefe?s.
NOTES - Glad to see a nice variety in hefe-weizen from Germany.

500ml bottle. Appearance: Deep copper to amber color, hazy, with a thick white foam head. 
Aroma: Bready malt undertone, dominated by spicy clove phenols and banana, pear esters. 
Taste: A bready, slightly toasted malt sweetness, some lemony citrus notes, then dominated by banana and pear esters. Finishes with a moderate spicy bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, some creaminess, and moderately high carbonation. There is a bit of slickness left on the tongue. 
Finish: A spicy, moderate bitterness on the swallow, with some bready, pear esters. 
Overall: World class dunkelweizen. Mixes the bready, toasty sky character with wonderful fruity yeast esters and spicy phenols. Proper body for the style, and a citrusy note adds complexity

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, zmętnione. Piana średniej wysokości, drobna. 
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Nuty zbożowe, trochę bananów i goździków. 
SMAK: Goździki, banan, zboża - standard. Goryczka niska, krótka.

Frisse neus. Redelijk typisch voor dit beer. Smaak erg vol/romig, fruit, mout, banaan (moutsuiker) en alweer fris fruit. Heerlijk. Goede tweede na de Aventinus (vergelijkbaar, maar op alle fronten net iets beter/meer uitgesproken)

500ml Bottle - Dark hazy amber with a foamy head. Banana, toffee and sultanas in the aroma. Biscuity and slightly sweet and spicy taste with toffee and banana dominating proceedings along with some dried fruit notes.

Bottle. Slightly darker than your typical weizen. Otherwise the classic exampple. Light sourness, crisp, refreshing, high carbonation, light caramel, clove, banana. Nicely balanced and easily drinkable. Very good.
Bottle. Hazy golden/amber colour. White head. Aroma estery, fruity, banana, yeast. Fruity weizeny taste, some pleasant sourness. Bit empty body, but good one.
Hefeteiges Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, fruchtig, Banane, spritzig, süffig. Hopfen: Hallertauer Tradition, Magnum.

Bottle. Dark amber colour, mighty white head. Nice banana and fruity grass smell. Taste is rounded, sour, medium bitter, light sweet. Pleasuring palate, fresh carbonation, with a thick mouthfeel. Great aftertaste, dominant banana and cloves, but also other spices.
Darker amber color. Sweet wheat aroma with banana and yeast. Smooth clean medium bodied mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Flavor is wheaty, sweet, lightly fruity and very slightly sour.
@ Kallithea Beach, Rhodes 150711. Bottle (500 ml) from Carrefour. Wheaty, fruity and estery with spicy notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet wheaty and estery.

Orange/ brown color with brown quickly dissappearing head. Aroma is banana and spicies. Taste is very pleasant, a mixture of bitter bite at first and then little sweet, and it ends with sourish finish. A good weissbeer indeed!

Very dark beer, for a wheat. But it smells and tastes like a good wheat.Pours murky brown, white and dense head. Wheat, sweet and banana fruity - almost esterish aroma. Prickling mouthfeel.Fresh fruity wheat flavour, mild sweetness and light acidic touch. Light dry wheat and banana fruity finish.

Very beatiful beer in 330ml bottle. Not as supreme as Aventius, but its a still wonderful experience. Schneider makes wheat beer look so dark, dense and with perfect foams. Taste is very soft, for being wheat beer, they have a good body, not so caramel, I feelt it a little bit grassy but creamy. Its wheat! But very soft, yeasty aroma, bit of banana toasted flavour.
Колір янтарни& Аромат невираз& -кислува солодов& В смаку солод, пшеничк& малуват& терпкув& гіркота присутн& в достатн& кількос& Кислинк& ледь замітна

Bottle. Amber hazy color with medium unsteady head. Aroma of banana, yeast, cloves, fruit notes (apple). Taste is initially sweet than goes to light sour notes. Refreshing. Light-bodied. Highly carbonized. Good weizen.
Tap. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma: Fruits, banana, wheat. Taste: Medium sweet, some bitterness. Minimal acidity. Palate: Medium body. Spices in the end. Good.
Aroma of banana and spices. Amber colour with small white head. Taste is surprising because alcohol is noticable, there is also some classic weizen notes, but booze really disturbs. Disappointment.

0,5 l bottle. Murky dark orange in the glass, big white head. Wheat, yeast, citrus and clove on the nose. Taste is intensive fruity, more citrus than banana, yeasty, clove. Little bit dry. Above average carbonation.

This is an excellent weiss and is fairly with complex aromas. This beer has aromas and flavours of a typical Bavarian weiss, such as banana and vanilla but are mild enough to be enjoyed by those that do not usually enjoy the pungent characters of a weiss beer. Once poured the beer has a golden/brown colour, with a hazy appearance, typical of a hefeweiss. The initial taste is slightly sweet followed by a refreshing acidity. Flavours follow on from the aromas with complex yet mild banana, caramel and toast.

Pours hazy, amber color, nice head and lacing. Spicy and yeasty aroma, same in taste. Medium carbonation, nice sourness and a little bitterness on finish. Very drinkable and different than ordinary weizen.

Una hefeweizen diferente. Más oscura, ambar clara. Aromática, más de lo normal incluso. Un aroma muy frutal y agradable. En boca muy bien equilibrada, manteniendo los toques frutales pero de forma mucho menos marcada (banana) que la mayoría. Algo de clavo, y como diferencial el sabor a caramelo tostado. En conjunto muy buena.
A complete full bodied german style wheat beer. Less sweet/banana taste than others, more sour. Good!!!!

Darkish brown color with a brownish foam head. The smell has a little banana and a lot of yeasty wheat smell. The taste is a little heavy and darkish wheaty and yeasty. A little note of banana and hints of licorice. Smooth mouth feeling with a calm aftertaste.

Murky amber with lasting head, nice carbonation. A: predominantly Pilsener malts mixed with apple pulp, apple juice, grains, and a note of apricot. Some faint yeast notes. T: fresh beginning which is swiftly followed by a wheaty apple juice taste. Medium bodied, medium crispiness. Development is slightly sour and sweet from the apple notes, faint hint of almonds. Aftertaste starts a bit dry and a bit sticky, slowly a wheaty apple juice flavor returns. Fruity variation on the Weizen style.
Dark, cloudy amber, not much head. Floral notes. Floral taste and hints of caramel and apple. Slightly tart aftertaste.
500ml bottle. Hazy dark copper color with beige head. Fruity and yeasty aroma, light bready. Sweet and light bitter, fruity and caramel. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Tap. Medium, slightly tanned foamy head. Murky brown. Aroma has berries and wheat malts. Tasty, refreshing and plentyful. Tadte has banana, wheat bread and sour berryness. Lovely!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with white head. Banana, fruity, wheat aroma. Sweet, banana, fruity, wheat, yeast taste. Medium body.
Bottle. Pours hazy, slightly dark amber. Aroma of citric bananas, a bit of caramel. Sweet taste, some hoppy bitterness, but well rounded with the banana flavour. Crisp palate.
Klar gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av banan, frukt og gjær. Smak av banan, frukt og krydder. Søt avslutning av banan. Vinmonopolet.

Aromat wzorowy. Banan i bardzo qyrazny gozdzik. Barwa miedziana bardziej w stylu Dunkela.  Piana srednioobfita jak na styl. W smaku czuc gozdzika, kwaskowosc, jest super orzezwiajace. Goryczka niska ale odpowiednia do stylu. Super pijalne.

L:
-pours a murky brown with a medium fluffy beige head
-high carbonation visible
-S:
-banana,caramel,toffee,white bread,sweet chocolate
T:
-Follows the nose plus a grassy hop note and a certain tartness
F:
medium-full body,medium carbonation
O:
very unique within the style.Pleasant beer

0,35l tap @Pingvinen. Dark amber, offwhithe small head, cloudy. Banana, clove, dough, yeast on the nose. Fruity taste, some caramel sweetness, long aftertaste with distinct clove. Good mouthfeel. Wonderful beer!
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy mahogany. Nose is ripe banana, cloves, spices, wheat. Taste is ripe fruits, banana, spices, yeast.
Bottle in Berlin. Its a nice choise to get a weisse beer taste. But its little bit strong taste..not easy drinkable..
Bottle from Wine Rack in Thirsk. Cloudy amber with a good cream head. The taste is citrus and spice with caramel and wheat. Smooth mouthfeel. A little bit on the watery side. Otherwise pretty tasty.

Amber beer with a white head, medium carbonation.
Tastes likes sweet fruit, wheat, grain and sligthly spicy.
Nice refreshing beer.

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Wheat and spice, very nice
Appearance- Pours a reddish brown with a medium sized fluffy head.
Taste- I noticed it was a little watery, but it had a very nice malt flavor
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation
Overall- A very good hefeweizen, I will drink this again and I recommend everyone should try it.
On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Hazy orange with big white head. Sweet aroma of banana, peach, spices. Taste is sweet, fruity, banana, light spicy with creamy texture.

Golden hazy, cream head
Banana, riped fruit, yeasts
Wheat, banana, a hint or rum

duft lidt krydret lidt bana, lidt karamel
farve ravfarvet lidt uklart. svag skum 
smag. krydret banan frisk lidt korainder. lidt karamel. tør- eftersmag emd smag af banan. fik øl

Tap & Bottle. Dark yellow and cloudy appearance in the glass. Very carbonated with huge persistent head. 

Smell: Banana is the first thing hits your nose with aromas of clove and yeast. 

Aroma: Banana, clove, and citrus. Moreover, biscuity wheat malt also detectable. Good fruity finish. No hop bitterness, but fruity aromas.

Keg at Drygate. Cloudy brown beer with a thin head. Spicy aroma but theres banana in there too. Smells its strength. Flavour has a strong hit of banana too with a touch of toffee over a bready base. Airy banana aftertaste.

Bottle from The Holy Inadequate, Etruria. A hazy amber colour with a thick, fizzy head. Aroma is pleasant of bread, banana, cloves and toffee. Taste of toffee, banana bread, grain and cloves. Light bodied, moderate carbonation but a crisp, smooth texture. A crisp and clean banana bread finish. So easy drinking and smooth for a wheat beer, lovely banana and bready flavours. Not amazing but good for its style.
Nevelig, bruinoranje. Witte volle kraag. Zurig, licht zoet. Tarwe, beetje citrus. Zacht.
Bottle. Very dark golden color thats cloudy. Aroma is clove, banana with hints of pear. Taste is spicy banana, fruity with hints of clove.

Barwa ciemnego bursztynu, piana obfita, drobno-pęcherzykowa, dosyć trwała. W aromacie banany, goździki, cytrusy. W smaku powtórka z aromatu, do tego troszkę kwaskowatości, delikatna goryczka i otrzymujemy piwo bardzo orzeźwiające i lekkie. Wysycenie wysokie. Troszkę nudne, aczkolwiek bardzo poprawne i dobre piwo.
Wow. Linda cor dourada envelhecida. Aromas cítricos intensos equilibrados com banana e cravo já deixam água na boca. Cerveja com corpo, ótimos sabores que seguem as linhas do aroma. Sensacional!

Amargor: 3/5
Dulçor: 4/5
Corpo: 3/5
Uma cerveja muito refrescante, aromatica, não é excessiva e muito intensa.

Smooth banana and clove aroma. Mild brown opaque colored body with the typical full size head that settles to a finger thick. Has the typical smooth banana and bready flavor with a mild orange twist to balance it out. Velvet with a citrus feeling.
With fine aromas of banana and clove, it has a darker color which was the traditional color of the old style wheat beers. Fantastic drinkability!

Hazy orange hue with thick billowy Weissbier head which is retained in the glass for several minutes. Fruity banana and orange esters complement bready mouthfeel and smooth yeast character. Fine-ass weissbier.
Golden reddish colour with creamy head. Aroma of citrus, plums, bananas, similar is flavour. Good quality but still not in the same rang as their weizen bocks.
Dark amber. Quite big, white head. Banana, clove, cilantro, some malt, spice and fruit flavour. Sweet. Some bitterness. Medium body and carbonation.
Poured a dark golden colour with dense white head. Aroma: clove, malt, citrus. Tastes of banana, lemon, spices. Light bitter hop taste. Oily mouthfeel. Pretty good wheat
500cc bottle. Pours light amber and almost clear. Great wheat beer. It has that wheat taste but lots of banana and some citrus and spices. Some yeast also. One of the best wheat beers I have had

Pours a clear dark yellow beer with a big fine white head, low carbonation.
Smells yeasty, spicy, cloves, fine fresh nose, not one negative element.
Tastes gentle bitter, spicy, hint of malt sweetness.
Leaves a gentle sweet palate, mouth feel is medium. carbonation is medium.
Great refreshing beer and a great weisse! I love this style.

Aroma: banana, clove, wheaty, some citrus
Taste: refreshing, spicy, banana, citrus
fizzy carbonation
Pours a hazy dark yellow, white head. The arove is banana, clove. The flavor follows, a mix of sweet, spicy. The finish has a spicy bite. Solid hefe.

Poured from 500ml bottle. 

Hazy/murky, dark amber with a 4-finger off-white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of banana, coriander, hay, apple, lemon-lime, wheat and yeast. 

Taste of coriander, cloves, banana, lime, wheat, tangerine and yeast. 

Light/medium body and medium/high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dunkles trübes Bernstein mit weißem cremigem Schaum. Fruchtige Aromen, Banane, Beeren. Das Weißbier ist würziger als die meisten anderen Vertreter und zeigt sich im Mund nicht ganz so fruchtig. 
Gutes Weißbier!

50 cl bottle. Pours medium cloudy brown with thick, foamy white head, average lacing. Aromas of banana, barnyard and fruits. Taste is medium sweet, little bitterness and somewhat sour. Average carbonation, a bit oily palate. Aftertaste is long and a bit sweet with balanced bitter and fruity finish. A bit boring but well-made wheat.
1-Bellow average head for a Weiß. 2- Cloudy and light brown color. 3- Moderate carbonated 4- Banana and floral/spice notes. 5- Amazing beer! The best Weiß so far.

DWF; Bottle 0, 5L. Pours moderate, hazy gold with a frothy, lasting, lacing white head. Nose is malt, coriander, citrus orange, yeast and sour. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a short to moderate, citric, yeast finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is avarage. White and fruity, bitter mix.
Foamy, such a foamy pour. Murky light brown color with a light tan head. Aroma is bananas, clove and wheat. Taste is wheat. So dry. Slight taste of banana and clove in the finish.
UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 How: Bottle Appearance: deep orange  color, small creamy white head. Aroma: Intense banana, oranges, vanilla, cloves, honey. Palate: Medium body, smooth carbonation.

A darker & clearer hefeweizen than Im used to seeing. Familiar fruity & spicy, ester aromas and taste, with a tangy finish and an almost caramel like quality, or maybe its just the color thats influencing my taste. Overall very easy drinking & slightly different weissbier thats very good and enjoyable.  Its just plain hard to beat a good German Hefeweizen.
Lovely Banana ?? undertone with cloudy appearance and leaves a lovely taste on the palate
Nice beer. A banana taste and aroma, reminds me of the banana sandwiches i got for school lunch. Good times however i couldnt drink this all night one or 2 are ok.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden, nose is banana, lemon, wheat, taste is similar, dry.

Piana puszysta, mocna, towarzyszy do samego ko?ca.
Aromat intensywnie owocowy, banany, brzoskwinie, troch? jakby ziemisty, przywodzi na my?l zapach kurzu w stodole - urocze.
Jest lekko kwaskowy, wyczu? mo?na równie? karmel.
Smak to owoce w?ród których znale?? mo?na banan, brzoskwinie, mirabelki, jest bardzo przyjemnie kwaskowy, nie ?ci?gaj?cy, ani te? nie jest cierpki.
Goryczka niewyczuwalna. Bardzo pyszne, jestem mile zaskoczony, pije si? ?atwo. Jak dla mnie rewelacja. Mo?e to kwestia dnia, ale siad?o idealnie.
Schneider Weisse Tap 7 to piwo po które warto si?gn?? nie raz. Polecam.

Une blanche à la robe ambrée mais au nez classique sur le citron, le froment une pointe de miel et de levure. La bouche est à la fois ample, ronde, fruitée et fraîche, belle finale épicée. Une blanche équilibrée.
(bottle 05/03-2015) medium fading beige head, unclear amber color, wheat aroma, medium co2, slim body, slightly watery taste. BB date 2015.04.20.
Pours a cloudy dark amber color. Aroma and taste are lightly sweet with bananas and wheat.
Сильно газиров& во вкусе оттенки карамел&

Bottle at Fiddler. Pours hazy amber with an off white head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, bready malt, clove, light banana. Flavor is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbobation. Very decent example of the style.

Amber with cream, frothy, medium coarseness, 1cm head that fades at a moderate rate. Aroma is clove, bread, wheat grain, touch of bakers yeast. Slightly chalky too. Reminiscent of hefeweizens of years long gone. Body is watery, lightly oily and gritty. Medium weight. medium-light down blanket of carbonation, light burn. Flavor is slightly tart wheat grain, hint of raspberry, light demerara sugar. Very pleasant and drinkable

Bottle. Off-white frothy Medium head, medium lasting. Hazy amber with orange hues colour. Aroma is wheaten, banana and spicy. In tongue it is citrus, banana, sligthly spicy and clove aftertaste. Medium body and high carbonation. Pretty interesting wheat beer..

Cloudy amber pour with large off white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, citrus and faint fruit. Taste of wheat, yeast, lemon citrus, hay and faint banana and cloves. Medium bodied, higher carbonation, nice and crisp and refreshing, slightly dry finish.

Blonde très foncée, hazy. Bonne mousse blanc cassé persistante.
Bien sûr blé, mais pas tant que ça pour une Hefe. Un poil sucré banane.Très légère acidité perceptible.
En bouche complexe et balancée pour une Hefe. Pas damertume. Légère acidité. Un peu sèche en fin.
Grosse carbonatation.
Une bonne Hefe assez traditionnelle mais complexe, et étonnante par son côté sucré.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch 1621081014. AROMA: predominant wheat aroma with notes of fruits like banana and bubble gum. faint phenolics (clove like). no hop aromas. no DMS and no diacetyl. APPEARANCE: dark gold colour (almost light brown) and hazy. large moussy ivory head with good retention. TASTE: predominant bready flavour from wheat with notes of faint banana, bubble gum and some clove. low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium body but not heavy. high carbonation and always effervescent. OVERALL: a good traditional hefeweizen with characteristic aromas and flavours.

Good beer. If you like white beer this is the one you probably want to start with 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
After living in Germany for over 10 years, 4 in Bayern... this is still my all time favorite. It is the measuring stick for all Hefe Weizens.

Bouteille de 500ml au Bar de la Baie Noire. Robe de bronze voilé sans aucune mousse. Odeur fruitée (pommes?), levure et épices. En bouche, elle picotte un peu les gencives et le devant de la langue. On goûte la levure, les pommes, la banane, sur un fond légèrement épicé. Mince de corps et courte en bouche, elle a une finale sèche et laisse une vague amertume et un relent de levure pour marquer son passage. Bonne bière daccompagnement, elle na pas vraiment sa place dans un bar où on lui préfèrea une bière de soif "moins bourrative au goût", comme disait Boum-Boum Geoffrion.
Bronze pour, small tan head. Nose is spice and yeast. Lightly bitter. Middle is dark roasted grain; faint clove and bubble gum is awash. Finish is dry and appetizing.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2015 Well not my favourite Weiss although it's a classic. The yeasted fruity taste however is delicious. To me it has a marked flavour of banana, apples. with a sour finish.
Cloudy dark colour beer with a huge head. Aroma is fruity, banana, wheat and fresh yeast. Intense. Taste is full. Caramel and banana with a spicy end. Medium body. Right carbonation.. Very good beer

500ml bottle. Pours a murky brown with a big white head that fades down to a crown of foam in less than a minute. Aroma is yeast, banana. Taste is banana, malt, a good balance of sweet and sour. Feels good in the mouth. Another good one from Schneider.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Super dejlig Hefeweizer. Jeg glæder mig til at smage en så dan øl igen. Købt i Føtex

This here is a fairly tasty brew with no real sentient qualities. I have found it pretty rare that a beer smells better than it taste but this is one of those occasions. It is the colour of a newly minted penny, a white fizzy head that buggers off and the wee-est bit o haze. It smells freaking delicious, like a fine Belgian beer decided to bake a spicy apple pie, jump into it, and then roll around in some honey and wheat. Maybe its the low carbonation and dead mouthfeel that does this, but the flavour just isnt there in the same manner. Would I snarf again? Yea! Would it be myself purchasing said snarf? Nay!
From the Germany trip 2010: enjoyed in Bonn in a beer garde with loads of students. Had it many tiemes since. A perfec German Hefeweizen. Fruity, full bodied and refreshing.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 33cl bottle at the Golf Bar in the ITC Hotel, Delhi, India. Poured into a tulip glass. Reddish amber colour with a medium sized head which slowly dissipates. Fruity aroma. Taste of fruit - citrus and banana. Light bitterness in the aftertaste.

Perfect thick white persistent froth, dark amber colour. 
Very spicy, mutgmeg, clove, just a hint of banana. 
On the palate a good balance of sweet, sour and bitter, not too fat. 
Bottle, by the way.

Amber-red, off white head, off white head, lite head retention. Wheat, citrus, Bannana, and caramel. Medium bodied, syrupy, wheat, citrus, Bannana, salt. Decent balance, sour-bitterness, mild sweet, and dry notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy dark amber clour with a huge head.
Aroma is fruity, banana, wheat and fresh yeast. Intense.
Taste is full. Caramel and banana with a spicy end.
Medium body. Right carbonation. Long and tasteful finish.
Very good beer
Very crisp and refreshing. Citrus taste with some bitterness at the end. Leaves a dry feeling on the tounge afterwards that leaves you wanting more. Nice ale to relax with in the summer time.

Poured into a weizen glass in late 2013.

A: Opaque brown. Slight head.

S: Lemon, citrus, wheat.

T: Lemon, wheat, somewhat spicy yeast. Also has a roasty character like a dunkel. Tiny bit of banana too.

M: Has quite a bit of carbonation with bubbles coming up after I sip.

O: This was a confusing hef. Everything seemed to point more towards a dunkelweizen. It was also more subtle in flavor than other hefs.
Uma característica marcante de trigo porém bem equilibrada no amargor, boa densidade da espuma e bem equilibrada no geral.

banana nose, thickening into bubble-gum sweetness, hints of cloves/nutmeg. Nice and mild weizen-taste, with banana/clove/nutmeg esters again, a bit watery in back-palate. Light sourness. A burnt plastic note in its fade out. Was expecting more...

[50cl thanks to ruigo] Orange golden hazy color. Medium head, that quickly vanish to a small and persistent lace. Medium carbonation with medium body. Aroma is banana and very strong to cloves. Taste is banana, bread, cloves, yeast and a bit acidic/bitter. Aftertaste is dry and bitter.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, nice stable off white head.
NOSE: bananas, bubblegum, wheat.
TASTE: sweet, some caramel, wheat, bananas, oké, balanced

Tasted from bottle. Pours a super murky orange amber with thick off white head. Great bubblegum, banana, fruity and wheat aroma. Taste is bubblegum, dark fruits, wheat, yeast, spices. Very tasty. Medium bodied. Definitely a top tier Hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Woodland Creatures. Hazy golden orange. Big fluffy white head. Lightly spiced apple and wheat nose. Wheat and very faint pineapple with ginger. Medium body, clean finish. Decent.
Cerveja clara de coloração alaranjada. Fica marcante o sabor frutado ao ser bebida com um amargor residual na medida certa.

Barwa ciemno pomarańczowa, mętna, piana średnio obfita, nietrwała. Aromat klasyczny pszeniczno-chlebowe nuty współgrają z dojrzałymi bananami i goździkami. W smaku dokładnie to samo plus suszona gruszka i namoczone rodzynki. Ledwo zaznaczona drożdżowa słodycz kontrowana lekką pszeniczną kwaśnością i chmielową goryczką, wszystko w małych proporcjach.
 Piwo jest bardzo poprawne, ułożone i tradycyjne. Nie ma tu za dużo ciała, raczej wodniście. Nagazowanie średnie, lekko szczypiące w język. Pijalność na dość wysokim poziomie. Po prostu pszeniczniak, bez żadnych dodatków i nowofalowego zacięcia. Klasyczny niemiecki Hefeweizen.
Had this at the Weisses Brauhaus in Munich. It was good but not spectacular. But Im not a big fan of helles beer.

Bottle sample. Hazy brownish-yellow with huge white head. Strong aroma of banana, yeasty, wheat, caramel, a bit floral. Sweet flavor, fruity (mostly banana, peach), yeasty, hint of honey and caramel, slightly smoked. Light carbonation, medium to full-bodied. Very nice.
In bottiglia. Aroma di cereale, frumento, speziato, leggera banana. Corpo leggero, al palato sentori di cereale seguti da banana e finale speziato di medi intensità e armonia.

Pours a hazy orange with big off white head. Aroma is of bubblegum, cloves, apples, and wheat. Tastes of light gum, spices, apples, wheat, and ginger. Has very clean feeling spicy finish. Has full body yet is very refreshing with more of sour sweet finish.

Lightly hazed copper pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is brown sugar, clove, and light fruity esters. Flavor is sweet malt start with clove on the front and banana esters come through followed by a flat bitter finish from the wheat. Medium bodied with aggressive carbonation and a touch of slickness.

Bottle. Color is between hefe weizen and dunkel. Hazy. Medium white head for weizens. In aroma banana and dark fruits with some sour. In taste again banana and dark fruits, plums. Some spices and alcohol in finish. Good stuff.

500 ml bottle
Murky dark orange to brown beer with blonde head. Aroma is sweet with ripe banana, vanilla and toffee. Also some bready maltiness. Flavor is yeasty with banana, pear and toffee. Palate is thinner than medium and foamy. Finish has medium bite of bitterness. Aftertaste has slight alcohol, apple juice and dry yeastiness. Decent sweetish weizen, with some Belgian ale characters.
Bottle west riding dewsbury. Murky orange brown ok head. Aroma is fruity banana cloves taste same nice smooth body. Decent.

very clean and well-balanced taste, I think. darker colour than normal Hefe-weissen or weisse style beer. Usually I prefer Paulaners Hefe-Weissen. This should be included in my favorite Weisse style beers. I really enjoyed drinking this beer. Thank you.
Pours much darker and clouded than most hefe-weiss beers. Flavor is strongly banana and challah. Delicious.
Drank as a draught. Very fresh and very nice weizen. Theres nice citrusy flavours. The beer looks really good.

Bottle 0.5l at Majstor za pivo Beer expedition with host Matt the Master :-) Belgrade Serbia.Pour it dark amber color with small white head.Taste and aroma of plum, banana, yeast and little bit sour cherry.Ok good balanced.

Très bonne bière!.Draft de bananes,pain frais,levure(légèrement acidulé),Gros goût de bananes , cest pétillant rafraichissant avec une finale légèrement épicer genre muscade , noix , amandes.Final un tout petit peut sèche. Cest parfait
Bottle. Pours amber/bronze with a huge head. Nose has banana, grains and some yeast. Taste follows the nose with the addition of some spice as well.

Great orange-brown color with proper head for a hefeweizen. Ripe bananas and spicy yeasts in the aroma, maybe a bit of nutmeg. Taste is more intense than most hefeweizen, I would think it is rather a Dunkelweizen. Super good bananas and spices, a bit taste of nuts. Furthermore, there is a slight sourness/tartness to give it a bit more kick. Refreshing feeling, low carbonatio, pleasant finish and aftertaste. Among my favourite Weizen.

Always heard this was a true hefe... But wow it?s a great one too. Pours a murky amber with a frothy white head that leaves nice rings of lacing up the glass. Aroma of banana, Apple, nutmeg and cloves phenols all in a delicate balance but a full assault of your senses. Taste is banana esthers, Apple, cloves, nice spicy bitters in the finish with an almost sourness that rounds it out nicely and delicately... Delicious hefe!

Schöne orange-gelbe und relativ trübe Farbe im Glas. Weißer Schaum. Der Geruch ist toll hefig-süßlich-vanillig  ideales Weizen. Das Bier ist auch ganz frisch  gerade einmal vor 5 Wochen abgefüllt. Der Antrunk ist klasse bananig-hefeig und schön abgewogen süßlich-mild. Sehr mild-süffig. Zum Hauptteil wird das Bier ein bisschentrockener, die milde und angenehm hefig-süßliche Note bleibt aber bestehen. Der Nachgeschmack bleibt fruchtig-frisch, schön hefig-mild und angenehm weich-vollmundig.  → Ein klasse Hefeweizen. Mild-fruchtig-vanillig-süßlich und hefig-mild! Allein die etwas trocken-muffige Note im letzten Teil des Nachgeschmacks ist leicht störend! 14/12/14/13

Bottle. Hazy brown color with thick white head. Banana, yeast, caramel and ripe fruits is aroma. Taste has malty body with a long and a bit sour finish. Flavors of citrus, banana, malt, ripe fruits and hops. Excellent German Hefeweizen.

Świetny "wajzen". Fajny i świeży aromat. Z wyglądu mętne i dość ciemne jak na ten typ. Piana obfita, ale szybko opada. W smaku mała goryczka, fajna kwaskowość i słodycz. Piwo jest niezwykle pijalne. Polecam!

Blond color, minimal head. Aroma of wheat, banana, lemon, bubble-gum. Light body, thin carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet but well balanced, with a nice banana aftertaste. Nice and refreshing.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Pours a hazy brown body, the head is off-white, fluffy and settles to an even layer on the beer. Nose has notes of yeast, ripe bananas and banana bread. Taste is mildly sweet but finishes with a nice, smooth bitterness. Carbonation is lively but smooth and the palate feels medium rich and creamy. A nice, fairly dark wheat. The bottle is close to its BBE date, a fresher one might score better.
dark and cloudy, very thick appearance. aroma of bananas and maybe strawberries. a little sweet up front, but sour, lemony on the back end. decent.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle servem in my beautiful Weihenstephaner Weizen glass.
A: Pours a cloudy dark amber to brown color forming a huge beige bubbled head. Medium retention and many lacings formed and left
S: Complex. Very spicy, fruity and sweet. Flowery hops. Upfront is strong on banana esters. Followed by caramwl, sweet malts, wheat, cloves and yeasts
T: Follows the nose: Mild sweet upfront. Banana esters, cloves, caramel malts, wheat and yeasts. Very light hoppy bitterness in the end
M: Creamy body. Good carbonation. Slightly molasses. Smooth. Very malty and bready aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Very smooth beer. Authentic German beer. Prost!
[ BA Review @ 2/6/2010 ]
Taste of bananas, bubblegum, wheat. Very nice palate, smooth, drier in the end. Has a beautiful hazy brown color. I like it a lot.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma is wheaty, yeasty and fruity. Taste is same, quite nice weisse.
Murky and unusually dark amber-golden color, nice sticky head. Nose of banana, grain, malt, herbs, clove. Lightly sticky carbonation. Taste of banana, yeast, herbs and some metallic notes.
500ml bottle at home. Sweet and fruity aroma. Taste is malt, slight banana, spice, crisp. Nothing aggressive, really enjoyable and well balanced beer :)

0,5 l bottle from an IN.KA Super Market in Chania. "Tap 7 Unser Original". Deep muddy nut golden body with a large dense grey-brown head. Banana, bubble gum and wooden notes on the nose. Refreshingly crisp with a ripe banana sweet malty flavor. Medium bodied and a doughy texture.

"they really nailed the bubble gum-clove banana aspect here. i smelled it upon opening, and while the aroma was the strong point, the flavor did not dissapoint. one of the best\, if not the best straight up hefe out there. awesome aftertaste as well
A great dark and hazy colour when it pours. Not nearly as exciting when it comes to the taste and aroma, which are underwhelming.
Awesome wheat! Looks thick, both colour and body. The aroma is great, with yeast and flowers. The taste is full, spicy and the finish is long.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 Pours cloudy brown and pale amber, with thin head,  aroma of banana and melon, palate of wheat with sour hints
Sweeat aroma of yeast, banana, spices. Taste of wheat malt, sweety and spicy with sour aftertaste.
bread, banana, cinnamon, cloudy, orange color, rocky head, white foam, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium sourness. Boa weiss, podia ser mais densa.

Tap at stanleys. Pint glass. Hazy light orange. Small white head. Banana and slight clove and funk. Yeast and citrus flavor. Kind of Crisp but with warming coated feel. Very representative of the style. Good beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with medium white foamy head. Aroma is malt, wheat bread, banana, melon, yeast, yoghurt, lemon and spice. Taste is initially light sour, then medium sweet and light bitter. Body is watery to creamy with medium carbonation. Finish is long and mostly sweet with notes of malt, sugar, lemon(ade), banana, cinnamon and cardamom

Dark Gold with a thin, off-white head. Nice smell of bread, wheat, yeast, soft citrus and cloves. Medium thin body with medium carbonation. Tastes of banana and clove with a touch of citrus and wheat. Some bitterness but mostly sweet dry malt. Crisp and refreshing with a lingering bitterness. A bit too much yeast for me but still nice.

Pours a rather dark shade of cloudy orange, with a big white head. Aroma is OK, with raisins, clove, banana, dough. Taste isnt very sweet, with bread and some citrus-sourness. A rather unsusual Weizen, but a good one, which I do enjoy from time to time.
Heldere oranjebruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruit, banaan, mout, tikkeltje zoet. Smaakt fris, banaan, tikkeltje fris zuur. Smaakt ook beetje naar snoep.

August 15, 2014. Bottled june 17, 2014. 
Pours hazy amber with a medium sized white head. Aroma is ripe banana, caramel, light cloves and coriander. Taste is medium sweet with a light bitterness. Finish has lingering banana notes and light bitterness, a bit watery in the finish as well. Light/medium bodied.
Hazy orange body with a thin white head. Aroma is strong fruity, strong floral. Taste is sweet with low bitterness. Body is thin.

Pours unclear brown with a tiny white head. Aroma of classic arises banana notes, some bubblegum, sweet malts and some bread. Taste is fresh and ha those same sweet fruit notes along with some hops, caramel malts and some grains. A bit watery but still nice.
Escuta mas Boa de tomar. Forte o sabor. Lembra champanhe. Não dá para tomar muitas. Apenas 2

Dark brown opaque beer with a nice frothy head.
Smell is cloves, banana and malty graininess. Hints of vanilla.
Taste is watery fizzy, lightly sour. Sweet bitterness. Oily.

Bottle from supermarket. Amber brown, cloudy, head vanished almost immediately which seems unusual for a Weizen. Cooked banana aroma with hint of spice, quite restrained though. Highly carbonated. Taste is bread overlayed with bitterness that strengthens towards the end. Fairly dry finish. Carbonation acidity almost dominates over other tastes.

(50 cl bottle from local supermarket poured into a footed pilsener glass from Brøckhouse; BBD: 2015/06/08) Pours a cloudy dark amber with frothy, white head and fizzy carbonation. Aroma is phenolic with notes of grain, dust, clove and nutmeg. Oily texture, medium body and a slightly ascerbic finish. Flavour is relatively harmonic with the dominant impression being the wheaty ascerbic note in the finish. Really not my style.

Bottle thnx to Dennoman 
Pours unclear , muddy orange . Small white head . 
Smell is fishy ( typical to me in German beers ) , funky, bitter . 
Taste is bitter , buttery , flowery . OK ... In the meantime I had German beers I did like, but these kind of beers still remain a mistery to me ( the reason why they are popular, I mean )

Draught at Mother Kellys, Bethnal Green on 30 August. Poured a cloudy orange, with a very thin off white head. Aroma of coriander, cloves, banana and bubblegum. Orange sweetness in the flavour, with some bread and mineral notes. Finish was very light, with some soft fruit, peal and bread.

Aromat słodów pszenicznych, warzywa, cytrusy, korzenne, kolendra. Piana obfita, znika natychmiast, nie zdobi szkło. Kolor brudny, brunatny. W smaku alkohol, alkohol, trochę cytrusów i słodów i znów alkohol, następnie kolendra. Piwo jest kwaskowe. Odczucie w ustach - zbyt wysycone, kwaskowość, wodniste. Ogólnie, blee. Nie polecam...
On tap. Cloudy amber colour, medium beige head. Aroma of wheat and sour cherries, lemons, yeast. Taste has a clear sour tone: lemon juice, wheat, banana

500ml bottle. Pours a rich hazy dark gold. Aroma on this is mainly about the wheat and biscuit malt character, deep and rich malt favours balance nicely with banana, barnyard yeasts and coriander, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation. Classic weisse
Interesting, quite dark, but typical wheat character, strong fruitiness, banana, light citrus, light clove. Mostly sweet with light sourness and bitterness in finish. Decent brew, but nothing special

Aromas of cloves, fruit, nutmeg, yeast, and some herbal notes. A large foamy short lived white head sits atop a dark amber pour producing little lacing. The taste follows the nose with a pleasant touch of sourness in the finish. I like that! Medium body and crisp carbonation. Overall, one of the better Hefewiessens Ive had. Will drink again.

Drink cold (8-10°C)
Eye: Pours brownish-dark copper almost rusty colour, with nice big white head. Good Carbonation.
Nose: spices, wheat, barley, ripe banana.
Mouth: what, bread, honey, caramel-malts, raisins.
Palate: ripe bananas, whole-grain bread. Tastes of caramel but less sweet, prunes.
Overall: very nice Weizen, nod as good as Aventinus but still very drinkable

500 ml. Opaque copper with a lasting disc of creamy bubbles. Surprisingly looks more like a dunkel. Big nose of clove, caramel, resin, sourish apple, banana and a hint of smoke. Tastes of caramel, clove, lightly tart apple, nutty wheat and traces of banana and smoke. Light-medium body is too fizzy, but has a great balance from many angles.
Another one of my all-time favourites. This is why I love beer....................................... ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Mainly note ripe banana in the aroma. Attractive foam but murky in appearance. Appreciate it is the style, but still doesnt make it look any more attractive. Slight savoury note at the beginning of flavour. Main enjoyment factor for me is the refreshing juicy tanginess of this beer.

500ml bottle served in a weissbier glass. Big creamy beige head. Clear copper colored body. Thread-like sediments. Aroma is very pleasant. Banana, bread, pale malt and spice. Very light on the tongue. Mostly sweet with a long lasting bread-like aftertaste. Slightly sour and yeasty. All in all an excellent weissbier, although it might be watery to some.
Duft av humle, malt, eik og frukter. Rødbrun farte. Lite skum, nesten ingenting. Frisk smak av hvete og frukter som sitter.

Dirty brown color , huge head. Aroma of yeast , banana and spices . Taste of wheat malt , spices , yeasts . Medium body and carbonation. Good balance between sweetness , sourness and bitterness. Very good weizen.

A hazy orange brown coloured beer with a frothy off white head. A light aroma, yeasty and bready, mild spice, clove and cinnamon plus a tropical fruit element. A dry mouthfeel. A tart, zesty citrus fruit and sour tropical fruit, green bananas, mango, grapefruit and lime. These flavours are tempered by an underlying sweetish wheaty, yeasty and bready flavour which brings forth the spice element. The finish is zesty and spicy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is one of my favourites. Available on tap at my local drinking hole where they consider this to be a dunkle weissbier on their menu. The head on this beer is so thick that it actually stands up and remains all the way through. The taste is very full and and slightly bitter. A++

On tap @ Mother Kellys, Bethnal Green. Cloudy caramel brown with minimal head. Banoffee pie aroma. Sweet toast, bananas and caramel biscuit spread. Intense heady yeasty nose. Moreish sweet taste with slight sour overtones. Full chewy palette. Maybe a bit too much sweetness in the aftertaste. A blueprint for hefes.

Bottle. Pours a hazy mahogany color with a nice head and bits of lacing. Aroma of malt, caramel with a bit of spice. Taste of malt, some caramel sweetness, spice and light citrus in the background. Nice bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, crisp, quite smooth and nicely balanced. Enjoyable beer

Nice, amber weizen. White head lasting long. Pearly, with fruity aroma. Light bitterness. Like it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A really awesome blondie! Excellent taste and aroma, highly reccommendable for all beer lovers.

"Tap 7". Hazy apricotish body. Deep pearl head. Falling lacings. Aroma; barley and sweet wheat malts, spices, bread. Taste; fruity malts all over, banana, grapes, spices, clove, coriander, ginger, cinnamon, cheese, bread, bun, tomato, lemon, grass, hops are present all the way in the background, and a tiny butterscotch pops up. Fruity finish, modest bitterness, fresh and crispy and fruity feel. Moreish. Excellent beer.
 [50cl. brown btl. 5.4%abv.
