08.2014 (Butelka 0,5 litra) ZAKUP - Warszawa - Szklanka typu pinta - schlodzone
On tap. Dark weisse, aroma isnt too present but the taste is loaded with banana, esters flavor, Mouthfeel is good aswell.

Wellicht nog eens prijzen na avond van bier geweld. Aroma is moeilijk re onderscheiden en smaak kalmpjes. Niets uitgesproken, zelfs weinig herkenbaar. Meer begeleidend bij conversaties. Nieuw te kopen!

On tap at Øltorget, july 29th 2014. Light brown body with a creamy white head. A bit darker than expected. Aroma of pineapple, banana, wheat, cloves and bubblegum in swallow, with a light spicy hefeweissen aftertaste. Refreshing

Butelka0.5 L.

Wygląd: Ciemnobursztynowe, mętne. Piana biała, średnioobfita, niezbyt trwała. Lacingu prawie nie ma.

Aromat: Dojrzałe banany, lekko przyprawowe,goździkowe, drożdżowe, guma balonowa. Typowy hefeweizen. Delikatny alkohol i palony cukier oraz trochę pomarańczy.

Smak: Słodkie, banany na początku. Przyprawowe (głównie goździk) z pomarańczą w rozwinięciu. Na finiszu skórka cytryny, pomarańczy, lekko gorzka.

Odczucie: Nasycenie CO2 wysokie-, ciało średnie, faktura kremowa.

Całość: Orzeźwiający, dobry, typowy hefeweizen.
La perfeccion en una cerveza alemana la numero 2 de todo el pais por algo esta entre las mejores del mundo

Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Pours IPA-ish, amber with a white head. Aroma was sweet fruit, some spice. Taste was more sour fruits, a bit of banana. 12.4 This one finished 4th in the tasting, trailing Paulaner, Weihenstephaner and Franziskaner.

Pours amber with a lush one finger cap pulled from the old mans fridge. Summer time & the living is easy. Especially today with a hot July day. This beer meets the occasion nicely. Goes down silky smooth, with a refreshing ease. Deep banana start on the flavour, with a surprising carbonation & vaguely bitter finish.

Poured from a 500cc bottle. Clear mahogany with off-white head. Aroma is grass, wheat, and light hops. Flavour is sweet malt up front with a crisp clean finish. Nice German wheat beer for a summer patio or a World Cup victory.

Frothy large slowly fading white head. Chestnut-brown yeast-opaque in colour. On the nose aromas of bread, clove and some fruits like apple-banana arise. Light lively, fresh and crisp texture envelops the palate. Some fruity sweetness and acidity develops. Medium bodied with a light slick lasting finish.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 Surprisingly dark for an original weiss. Smell is characteristic sweet banana. Wheaty cereal weiss. Huge banana and wheat malt flavor. Silky palate and obviously refreshing in the middle of July. Summer is here and Schneider Weisse is your friend. Medium body weisse with lots of taste, a classic for sure.

500ml bottle. Cloudy amber body, medium beige head with poor retention. Aroma of wheat and sour cherries, lemons, banana, yeast, spices. Taste has a clear sour tone: lemon juice, wheat, banana, cloves, yeast. Good.

Butelka. Aromat dro?d?y, pszenicy i go?dzika. Piana obfita drobno i ?rednio p?cherzykowata. Ma?o trwa?a, nie oblepia szk?a. Kolor bursztynowy, lekko zm?tniony. W smaku s?ody pszeniczne, go?dzik i nic wi?cej. Mo?e dla tego, ?e jest wysokie nasycenie. Goryczka niska, szybko zanikaj?ca. Finisz na j?zyku wynika z nasycenia.

Bottle 50cl. (Tap7). Cloudy amber color, good frothty off-white head, stays for a while, than reduces to a thin layer; aroma yeasty, wheat, banana, vanilla, citrus; fresh wheaty and yeasty taste, accompanied by light sweet, bitter and sour notes; medium body, creamy texture; bit more bitterness and sourness in finish. Very nice.
Couleur brune ambrée trouble, belle mousse blanche. Nez fruité banane, levures, notes dépices. Gout vieux fruits bananes, levures, fin notes dépices et citron. Bien balancée en bouche.

Big foamy but rapidly disippating head. Dark gold yo auburn. Aroma of honey and wheat. Taste is very sweet and malty for a hefe. Very atypical of a hefeweizen, weak clove fla
vor and no banana.

Bottle 0,50L. Murky, dark copper colour with big, fully lasting, creamy, off-white head. Aroma of bananas, caramel, wheat malts, spices. Taste starts as a combination of light sweet and light bitter with caramel note, while finish is more on the bitter side. Medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation. Really good hefe...
Stabiler Schaum und Mezzo-Mix Farbe, etwas trüb. Geruch nach Banane, Bubblegum. Am Gaumen Banane, etwas alkoholisch, leicht schwach. Mundgefühl zu wässrig und sehr schmal.
Sadly I drank this one with a stuffy nose as it is quite a nice brew and I probably won't see another one of these soon. A very very good dunkel even with a stuffy nose.

Bottle. Cloudy orange. Very nice banana, clove, wheaty hefe nose. Soft medium bodied. After weihenstephan, this is probably the best retail hefe Ive come across. Very nice esters, good body. Just real nice.

Served from a bottle into a Schneider Weisse glass at a pub in NYC. Im not sure if there was something wrong with my bottle, but I was very disappointed by this beer. Both aroma and taste were very subdued, even for a Hefeweizen; the notes characteristic of the style were there, but barely perceptible. Will try again in the future probably, but it will be Weihenstephaner only for this summer at least.
user_location: New York City, New York, USA

text: Bottle, 500mL. Home. A hazy brown earthy beer with orange hues at the bottom of my glass. Huge creamy white foam, great persistence. Fruity aroma (lemon, pear), spices (coriander). Medium refreshing bitter, light sweet spicy. Light body, medium texture, fizzy carbonation, dry bitter finish. Overall, great refreshing spicy fruity beer.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 On tap at Zlý Časy.  Pours a cloudy, dark amber colour with a huge, long lasting, white head. Fruity aroma of ripe banana, caramel and nuts.
Dark in appearance and retains a good head. Taste is complex with some sweetness and some bitterness in the aftertaste. A good beer
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 Bottle bought in Berlin. Dark pour, foamy head aroma is banana, wheat, yeast and marzipan. Taste is banana bread, sweet malts, solid carbonation. Very nice

500ml bottle ($2.95) from Premier in Halifax.

Nice clove and nutmeg aroma. Pours a great looking cloudy amber with frothy head. Has a mild sweet taste. Medium body, with oily texture, lively carbonation. The finish is somewhat abrupt.

Overall a great Heffe.

Aroma: alla prima boccata si percepisce un lieve acidulo e floreale, poi un fruttato un po più leggero. In bocca si percepiscono chiare note calde di banana e pera, con un leggero acidulo che si sposa bene. Alla fine risulta asciutta. Lamaro è molto poco percettibile, e solo sul finale. Cè un accento di mieloso. Una birra molto buona: stupisce perché non assomiglia ad una weizen. Scorrevolissima, con sapori ben equilibrati tra loro

Bottle. Pours cloudy amber with big, white, longlasting head. Aroma of banana, bread, clove, some bubble gum. High carbonation. Medium body. Nice, a bit velvety on palate. Stylish, very good, refreshing hefe-weizen.

bottle 
pours misty amber with white-off small to medium top, light lasing. Aroma is simply wheat malts with wheat ale yeast strains, a bit similar to Belgian ales, green apples on nose. Hints of caramel. Flavor also quite similar and simple - light sour and heavy yeast bitter for hefe-weizen with malt sweetness left behind, way too behind. Medium to light body, watery to compote texture, lively carbonated with light dry, yeasty bitter finish. Even my first brewed German wheat beer sample was more rich flavored. Too nothing to find in this brew for 100 score in category.

Bottle. A strong smell of bananas, sweet, also some yeast, strong aroma of bread. The white fizzy-creamy head is medium large with a normal duration. The body is dark red. A light sweet taste, malty, fizzy on the tongue. The body is light to medium strong, lively and light creamy with a lot of carbonation.

5cl bottle into a large schooner. Faint wheat aroma. Cloudy pale brown with a huge buff colored head. An almost maple light sweetness, medium sourness for a wheat beer, very smooth. Full body, creamy, lively, short finish for a wheat.

500ml bottle from Charter Mall supermarket, Chongqing Lu, Changchun, China. Pours orange brown with a typical weizen head. A little clove and some astringency. I dunno, not really as good as I remember it.

It had a dark bronze color like a Dunkelweizen. The body was hazy and had some visible carbonation. It produced a thick billowy head that was cloudy white in color and had good retention and slick lacing. The aroma had a fruity yeasty character that stood out over hints of wheat malt. It is very smooth and creamy on the palate with soft carbonation and a good solid medium body. The flavor has a big solid malty presence with creamy wheat, sweet bready and lightly toasted caramel notes. Flavor notes of fruity yeast, banana and clove are present and well balanced. Its hop flavor is very mild and it finishes fairly crisp and balanced.

wazig oranje/geel met witte kraag
Aroma van banaan en tarwe, gist, sinaasappel
smaken sinaasappel,banaan, caramel, fris, licht zuurtje, mais
laag co2, medium body, zacht en glad in de mond.
goede weizen
Bottle. Pours deep amber. Aroma of bananas. Srong banana flavour with some grass and bubblegum. A very good beer.

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2015 Donker geel / oranje kleurig troebel bier. Smaak is fris zuur en licht hoppig. Een erg goed weizen. Tap 6 en Tap 7 gedronken, weinig tot geen verschil.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a big head. Aroma of bananas and cloves with of course wheat. In taste wheat malt, slight acidity. Low bitter aftertaste, high carbonation. A typical weizen.
Draft at Abbey Burger. Pours opaque tawny brown with a creamy, fizzy beige head. Tastes like banana, roasted malt, caramel, booze. Light body and low carbonation. Roasted, fruity, banana aroma.

Drinking from a 0,5l bottle.
A nice coffee caramel, tropical fruits aroma.
The unclear, copper beer has a medium off-white head.
A smooth taste with caramel and banana. A sour tone.
Medium carbonated.

Bottle. Cloudy, wood-coloured. Nice, big head. Aroma is surprisingly weak, distinctively weissbier-like, but not as strong as in other beers of this style. Tase is a bit dull, not as full-bodied as advertised, with just hints of banana-bubble gum notes. A disappointment.

Honey, apple, and toasted biscuit aromas. Aside from typical banana and clove flavors familiar to the style, this beer also has a noticeable floral characteristic with just a hint of bitterness. Chewy and thicker than most, and perhaps a bit darker than most, this is probably the best hefeweizen Ive had to date.

Scent of chamomile, orange, wheat malt, and yeast. Cloudy copper colour. Light bitterness with slight sweet fining; flavours of orange, nutmeg, and toffee. Med-light body with mild carbonation. Really tasty; would definitely buy again.

Piwo butelkowe. W aromacie rzuca się bardzo intensywny zapach bananów i słodyczy. W kolorze mętne, słomkowe z przyzwoitą pianą. W smaku bardzo słodkie, słodowe do bólu, smak bananów i kwaśnego jabłka. Wysycenie bliskie zeru.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy, dark amber colour with a huge, long lasting, white head. Sweet aroma has notes of banana, wheat, fruit, nutmeg and clove. Sweet flavour of banana, wheat, caramel malt and citrus with a mildly spicy, dry, bitter finish. Hint of sourness in aftertaste. Medium to full body with a smooth, oily texture and lively carbonation. One of the best.

Appearance was hazy light brown with creamy diminishing off white 1 finger head, no lacing. Aromas are toffee, brown sugars, wheat malt with fruity mineral yeasts. Taste are caramel, toffee, brown sugar with banana, clove yeasts. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 with light-medium body, smooth fruity average length wonderful finish.
Solid German hefeweizen. Wheaty, smooth and with some fruity yeast. German brew art.

0.5 bottle. Surprisingly dark amber for a weizen, obviously cloudy with a small white head. Sweet aroma of bananas, citruses, bubblegum, and obviously wheat. Taste is sweet with evident citric notes but it also brings out some undesirable and simplistic hay. Medium body, creamy texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is less delicate than the rest, medium-long at best, and a touch sourer. Overall the beer is pretty good but seems a bit hackneyed and standardized.
Golden colour with reddish touches. Complex and fruity malt aroma with hints of clove, nutmeg and apple.

Pours a medium brown, cloudy and dirty-looking body with a huge, creamy, egg-white head of decent life-time. Strong spicy and yeasty aroma with citrus in the back, not much banana. Rather strong flavour of spices, a bit unclean and light metallic yeast, citrus and generic fruit and caramel. Light sweet taste with a light to moderate bitter, pretty short and watery finish. Not one of Schneiders best.
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 7 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Ambrée, trouble et avec un col blanc de mousse. Nez de blé, de bananes mûres, dépices et de levure. Goût fruité, de bananes, de clous de girofle et de céréales. Bien équilibrée et délicieuse.
Classic weissebier, one of the best Ive had. Very light with a lemon flavor, perfect for summer.

Appears a mahogany color with 2 finger white head. Smells dominant of bubblegum and banana. Slight clove. Tastes of banana, clove, bubblegum, and slight tart. Nice medium palate. Refreshing, I liked it! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had at the Foamfest in Fayetteville. Pours a hazy yellow with some head. Yeasty and wheaty. Some fruitiness. Nice beer.
Pours hazy amber, with small head. In aroma mostly yeast and cloves. In taste sour and sweet. Medium body, lively carbonation. Decent, but nothing more.

Cloudy brown colour, thin white head. Slightly sour aroma, reminiscent of plum. Soft bitter taste at first, rounds out nicely towards the end. Great carbonation, really soft mouthfeel. Very nice for its style.
This is a delicious ale, sweet to start tart on the finish, well balenced, the carbonation is what sets this flavor off well done great beer

Murky light amber. Medium white head. Aroma of banana and lime. Sweet and bitter on the tongue. Slightly astringent. Bearable., fruity, a bit medicinal, with a mild bitter finish. Medium-full bodied, lively carbonation. Decent but not great.
500ml bottle. Deep cooper color with white head. Banana and clove aroma. Banana taste, but less powerful than other versions. I actually prefer it.

Bottle. Pours darker than regular weizen beer, beautiful slightly hazy amber with a medium head. Aroma of banana, bread, clove and yeast. Sweetish, fruity, a bit medicinal, with a mild bitter finish. Medium-full bodied, lively carbonation. Decent but not great.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Dark brown color / dark golden color, medium white head. Aroma is banana with some bubblegum and yeast. Medium sweetness. Medium to full body, sweet finish. 
(Svijet piva 0,5l bottle)

Darker in colour than most weissbiers, it poured an amber, light brown body with typical tall head. From the first sip you can tell it?s something appart, with taste of bananas, biscuits and slightly sauery. It leaves you with an interesting aftertaste like apples mixed with bread. Quite the sensory experience for a weissbier of it?s kind. Will definitely drink again!
Aroma is tropical fruits, bananas. Taste is bananas, some citrus, sweet malt backbone. Decent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2014 Hazy dark orange to brown color. Aroma: ripe banana, clove, touch of vanilla, bit of alcohol, apfelstrudel, pleasant fruity sourness. Fruity, bit of a fruity sourish (in a good way) taste, some caramel, medium body.
Bundan öncesinde ne içtiğinize göre tadı değişen bir bira.Tap 1 içtikten sonra içerseniz tadı çok kötü ama dandik bir weissen içtikten sonra içerseniz çok iyi.

Pours an dark brown colour, big head, quite untypical colour for a "Weisse". It looks quite a bit like the Aventinus I tasted some time ago.
Nose is mostly banana to me, taste is banana with some citrus-like finish.

Aroma has clove and some banana. Beautiful small bubbles and some creaminess. Quite ok and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2014 500 ml, weiss glass (drinking it right now). UNtypical weisse I would say. Pours medium/large head which dissolves quite rapidly, with an almost amber, dark orange color. Beautiful aroma, quite original for an hefe of its category, smells apples (rather than banana), which gives a more sour than sweet taste. Leaves a sort soury strudel biscuity palate. 
If I was tasting this blindfolded, I would say it tastes more dunkel than weizen, also due to the different color, amber / brownish.The missing link between hefe and dunkel.
Awesome beer !! I would put it among my fisrt preferred weizen
Lovely beer with a copper colour, good head.........................................

Colour between copper and chestnut, with head that quickly fades leaving some residual lace. Moderate body, with fruit flavours offset by a sourness not found in the other Schneider taps. Good, but the stronger taps 5 and 6 offer a lot more and, despite the additional strength, are just as drinkable.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a semi-dark brown body with a two finger foamy lumpy head that quickly dies to a film of a head, some light clingy lacing.
The smell had the "banana"/estery yeast up front with some light wheat, and grass, comes off a bit bready-like
The taste was basically the same.
The palate sat at/about a light to medium, somewhat sessionable, seems like it has the right amount of carbonation and good for me as well.
Overall, well, I say this is good for the style and good for me, I would come back to this and that says a lot since Im not a true fan of this style.

Fľaa. Tmava jantarova farba, Biela pena, ktora drzi velmi dlho. Vona ovocna, bananova, korenista a v pozadi ako cukrova vata. Chuť je sladká, bananova, jemne kiwi. Zaujimave pivo, celkom pitne, aj ked alkohol tam robi svoje.

500ml bottle from Gourmondo.de, hazy dark amber colour, medium frothy mostly vanishing off-white head, good lacing. Heavily malty fruity aroma of ripe banana, caramel, nuts and cloves with light floral hops and some dough. Taste is initially very balanced and turns in to a long mildly bittersweet and slightly sour finish with an acetic feel. Medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation. Somewhat more refreshing and less sweet than weizens usually, still tasty though a bit less aroma intensity than many. Taste was downright mild although pleasant.
Cerveja boa mas não chega perto da clássica erdinger que é o golf standart pra weiss bier
Cloudy-hazy wheat colour. Malt, yeast, fruits, bread. Nice long finish. Good beer.

500 ml bottle, courtesy of Fox and Hound, Aabenraa (as Tap 7 Unser Original). Quite clear amber body with a nice off-white head. Nice fruity aroma with banana, cloves and all the other good stuff I want from a Weizbier. Flavor is also typical wheat flavor with some caramel and it feels really fresh and fruity. Medium body and good, long lasting aftertaste. A true classic.

Bottle. Wiezen glass. Amber, cloudy, dark orange with great big head, medium lacing. Aroma is banana, bread, clove, malts, some basement notes. Taste is medium sweet, banana, slightly sout. Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.

Aroma - caramel, bread, citrus, banana, bubblegum, clove
Appearance - amber, hazy, frothy, white foam
Taste - medium sweetness, lightly bitter
Palate - medium body, sticky, slick feel, lively, astringent, bitter, long finish
On tap at WOB. Pours amber, cloudy orange. Smell of clove and banana. Taste is the same. Smooth, yeasty, light as it warms. Tasty hefe, maybe not my fav style.

Pours a dark gold colour with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Has small white bubbles and an inviting clarity . Notes of wheat malt in the nose with a lack of hop character . Has some floral notes in the nose due to its wheat malt Has a sweet malt character with flavours of licorice and bubblegum in the finish.has a creaminess on the palate and a nice evervecence due to its high level of carbonation. No apparent hop character but a strong wheat malt presence. .overall a sweet, malty beer with some notes of fruity esters that are typical for me of wheat beers. Nice and clear for a hef, this is Avery tasty example.

Shared a 50cl bottle from alldrink (Trier). Pours a cloudy orangish yellow colour with a creamy white head. Aroma is deep banana, clove and yeast. Average carbonation and medium and almost a creamy full body. Taste is very balanced a bit acidic and with a bitter finish. Overall, a very delicious and refreshing weissbier that I will certainly drink again.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is fruity yeast with cloves, banana and some berries. Medium body with average carbonation. Flavour is sweet and with a somewhat strange burned presence, as well as the yeast with all its fruitiness and berries.

From bottle. Absolutely beautiful in glass. Cloudy, dark wheat color. Nice white head. Lightly perfumed, with a malt forward aroma rounded out with small banana notes. Taste is very crisp and refreshing, and slightly sour, making this a highly quaffable hefeweizen. Flavors from sour dough bread, hints of cloves (though much less than expected for style), and a long, subtle banana finish. Very well balanced and nicely carbonated. This is an order by the 2L kind of beer.
Karamellbrun med fint hvitt skum. Aroma av modne bananer, sitron og gjÃ¦r. Frisk, god sÃ¸dme og lengde. God weissbier, ikke for kunstig.

500 ml bottle, compared back to back with 3 other top rated hefes. Pours cloudy dark amber, with large creamy and clumpy, mostly lasting off-white head.
Aroma is malts, yeast, canned corn, musty, basement aroma, different from the other 3 beers, feels old-school and somehow reminds me of my dad.
Taste is similar to the aroma, less sweet, acidic, with a slightly bitter finish. Very creamy and full bodied, with soft carbonation. This one was quite a surprise.
Nice, medium-light, aromatic beer. Has a fruity after-taste but not overpowering.

I was dissapointed with this hefeweizen beer...
too light for my taste.... :(

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2014 500ml bottle. Pours cloudy with bright white head. An aroma of fruit, spice, cloves & banana. Full-flavoured, creamy weisse, clean sweetness, lightly spiced with banana, pear drops and the slightest touch of apple with slight bubblegum on the finish. An absolute classic - awesome stuff.
Slightly hazy dark golden, amber to copper appearance with medium head. Malty, wheat, bread and banana aromas, medium sweetness, light bitterness. Decent body, very enjoyable Hefeweizen style beer.
Very good Weissbier, bottle, pours amber with a white head. Sweat taste with wheat and banana notes.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is yeast, malt, caramel, nuts, hint of clove. Flavor is slightly sour with yeast, wheat, nuts, apples. Refreshing sour aftertaste.

Tap 7, bottle in the hotel @ Davos.
Aroma of orange, light grain, hoppy.
Pours amber blond, orange, hazy. Off white thick head.
Taste is sweet, herbs, orange, a bit bitter.
Finish is fruity, but a bit weak.
Best so far at skiing holiday
Copper to Brown appearance. Good white head. Yeast gives it its many delicious tastes and aromas. Very refreshing though its a darker Hefeweizen. Good carbonation. Yeast still living, nice one :)
Hazy amber with a large white head. Aroma of malt, banana and cloves. Taste of sweet spices, banana and pear. Very sweet, spicy and a little dry. Super.

Color is deep copper, almost brown. Big fluffy head. In the nose it is spicy with cloves. Very nice. Body is medium. Carbonation spot on. 

Flavor follows the nose. Wheaty, Spicy, cloves and bananas. Very tasty and refreshing beer.
bottle. Hazy amber colour, medium white head, good lacing. In aroma wheat malt, banana, cloves. Taste malty, some spices, slightly sour aftertaste, average carbonation. Quite good.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 o,33l fles tijdens de wintersport in gerlos. Amberkleurig met een volle witte schuimkraag. Geur en smaak zijn kruidig, met ook banaan. Redelijk maar wel iets te zoet

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 0,5 cl bottle
Appearance: light cloudy dark amber with a mediumsized white head. Not much lacing.
Aroma: bread, wheat,clove, banana, yeast
Taste: Light sweet, Some banana and wheat, with a hint of caramelised malts, in the finish some bitterness.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Tastefull and a good Heffe Weizen, but I prefer most of the Other Schneider beers over it..
Ottima birra weisse, corposa e decisa, piacevole al palato... Una delle migliori mai assaggiate.

As Tap 7 at Bottega in Yountville. Pours deep bronze gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma of sweet fruits like pears and bananas, some yeast spice, a bit of sugars and florals. Flavor is sweet banana, clove, pears, brown sugar interestingly enough. Nice and light, with lots of bubbly carbonation and a sweet and refreshing lasting finish. These guys know their stuff. Yum.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2015 Looks great, attractive dark amber/copper brown with a tiny off-white head. Fruity aroma of wheat, banana, citrus. Flavour is just a little bit sour. Very nice Hefeweizen, one of the better that Ive had.

On draught at Novare Res, pours cloudy reddish brown with a thicky foamy finger of head. Nose is musty banana bread, spices, cereal, dough, bready. Taste is somewhat creamy bready banana, cereal, spices, cloves, malt, fruit, peppery. Finish is malty cereal, fruity banana, cloves. Enjoyable beer.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours very dark for a hefeweizen. Smell of banana and nutty toast. Taste spicy with a very refreshing citrus input and big wheat yeasty flavours in the backbone. Very drinkable.
0,5l bottle. Hazy copper color. Aroma is banana, wheat and spices. Taste is sweet and spicy with nice banana and wheat notes. Medium body. Its excellent hefeweizen, very tasty and aromatic.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 (Re-rated on 30/5/2015)

Rationale: from previous tasting, I thought the bottle I had from my local German restaurant was faulted and it might have lost much of the taste. So I give it another try with a well-kept bottle from a beer shop to give it one final test to see if this one is really for real, or just a dud! So here goes

500ml bottle bought at Cheers in Yuen Long.
Looks: Cloudy hazy straw brown colour with a thick layer of dark brown yeast sediments; One and a quarter finger head with crumpety white foam which lasted for 3 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing and quite fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Fragment light malt, with fairly strong wheat and tartness, banana, strong vanilla, strong caramel, light toffee, sugar, strong ester, cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, light lemon and thin grass.

Taste: Close to light sweet malt, with ripe banana, strong caramel, strong wheaty tartness, vanilla, cloves, strong spices, strong yeast, lemon, moderate bitter hops, and notable light grass. 

Body: Close to medium body. Thin yet slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: solid maltyness with strong wheaty presence. Tartness is notable but still moderate. Strong caramel and phenol and yeasty as hell, with probably the spiciest taste I ever have from a Weiss, its that strong! Fairly good banana ester to good with strong lemony hops. Spunky!

Hoppiness: Lemon and faint grassy hops in nose, and much stronger and energetic in taste.Bitterness is a lot stronger than most Weiss for a lasting, moderate stringent malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Quite creamy and hoppy to mouth.

Comments: Now this is much much better than the (probably) leaky restaurant bottle I had last year. With a strong smooth malty body, rich estery aroma and very spicy and hoppy taste, I certainly dig this, a close call to Neumarkter Lammsbräu Weisse, through not as sparkling as Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier. Still, Recommended!

-------- />(Original review 1/3/2014)

500 ml bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 7 Unser Original bought at Berliner Restaurant in Olympian City, Tai Kok Tsui.
Cloudy hazy straw brown colour with a thick layer of dark brown yeast sediments; Two finger head with crumpety off-white foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with notable small carbonation; Slightly fragment aroma of light malt, with light banana, light vanilla, sugar, light bubblegum, caramel, light cloves and very light grass; Tart and near zero sweet taste of light malt, with light banana, faint cherry, light caramel, faint alcohol, yeast, light lemon and faint grass; Mid to light body, very thin and slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is close to watery and lack of taste despite the thickish looks. Moderate wheat tartness, banana estery taste is close to minimal. Yeast and phenolic are very light. Boring Hoppiness is faint grass nose, very light lemon and faint grass taste. Background hop notes only, just very light wheaty tart finish; Fairly dry after taste, very easy and to mouth.

Comments: I had a lot of expectation with Schneiders Orginal, and I am really let down by this - strawy muddy looks, very light aroma, watery mouth feel with no crispiness, and taste is close to minimal. Really taste like nothing. Below average and disappointing.

(Original rating: Aroma: 5; Looks: 3; Taste: 3; Palate: 1; Overall: 9. Score 2.1 / 5)

500 mml Bottle tasted at home on 27/02/2014. Amber-brown colour with small head that dissapears instantly. Smell of some fruits, with banana predominance and clave. Some bubble gum and licorice on the mouth. Deefinetly is a nice beer. Next one please!

Poured into a Weizen glass

Appearance: A nice golden brown. A little more deep than most. Thick head that dissipates after a few minutes but lingers on the glass.

Smell: Aside from the normal banana/wheat, a hint of spice and fruit.

Taste: Pretty spot on. Definitely one of my favorites of its kind.

Mouthfeel: Very smooth and the taste lingers. (I dont know if that should be in this section)

Overall: A very good beer. Definitely a recommendation in my book!

Pours thick amber with big bubbly white head. Awesome mildly sweet aroma of orange, coriander clove and spices with the hint of nutmeg and vanilla. Orangey, woody flavour, very well rounded with a delicious spice finish. Big bubbles break down into a silky thin layer. Surprisingly fantastic.

Darker than expected colour with a typical hefe head that stays for awhile. Not a big hefe smell but still present. The flavour appears much bigger at first but kind of fades away. A bit fruity with a touch of spice mixed in.This would be a perfect intro for someone who as not tried this style. Kind of a sweet finish that goes away rather fast. A lot of the little bubbles that you would expect from a hefe.

Dark orange golden pour with a medium white head that quickly disappears. Weak phenolic aroma with hay, caramel, grass and everything you could combine with a barnyard. Not very strong or pleasant. Taste is medium to heavy sour, and in the middle scales in both bitterness and sweetness.
Muito refrescante. Cravo, banana, pão e coentro. Espuma bastante permanente no copo. Melhor quando a 7 graus.

Dark amber appearance, which is the best side of this beer. Tick foam medium lasting. Aroma of yeast and some lemon. Low body very drinkable but not my beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 29, 2015 Vazy deep amber color, big white creamy head. Medium to full body, lively carbonation. Aroma is banana, wheat, bubblegum. Sweet taste with short bitter finish. Very nice.

Pour is a dark copper brow, hazy, with an off white tight head. Nose has a hint of roast, a fair bit of yeast, lightly dusty and lemon notes. Taste is similar, dark malt, lots of yeast, dust is faint, a good bit of lemon and candied sugar. Body is light, moderate carbonation and flavor thins a bit in the finish.
Bottle 500 ml. Pours hazy orange brown color with fruity wheat aroma. Citrus, banana and wheat flavor. Nice hefeweizen.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought from Malting Pot, Brussels. Lovely dark flavourful wheat beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into weizen glass from 1 pint .9 oz bottle. A cooper amber, with small head that was only at glass edge in seconds. Really light lace. A slightly cloudy beer. Aroma was a yeasty wheat. Taste was yeast, banana and clove. Mouth feel was thin. A little sour in both the aroma and taste. Finish was short and yeasty. Clean and simple and for that I like it.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, leicht würzig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig bananig mit minimaler Bitterkeit.
Lots of yeast aroma and taste, with a sour tang. Light brown color with average head and body.

50 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Hogerdijk, Culemborg. Hazy amber with a white head. Malty aroma with banana and cloves. Slightly thin taste however where most weizen have a full creamy mouthfeel. Maybe I had a wrong bottle so I will taste and rate again. Not blown away by this one.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat and banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long banana finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Cloudy orange-brown with minimal head. May be past its prime. Nose is fruity with some clove. Light-plus body, average carbonation, and a light orange peel bitter finish. Not a top German hefe example.
0,5l Flasche. Dunkelgoldenes Weissbier. Typischer Geschmack nach Banane, sehr ausgewogen und rund. Gutes Bier!

Bottled. Many thanks to Netty and Tomas! Overall I expected more from this hyped original Schneider Weisse. It is not bad, but in this category I prefer a Weihestephaner or Schöfferhofer. The color is brown, but I prefer the golden/orange colored weissbiers. The taste is bitter orange and dry, nothing more. I am definitely NOT blown away by the weissbier.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2014 The best widely available wheat beer I?ve tasted. You get a rich hit of orange and cloves before the sharpness finishes off the swig and leaves you savouring the last taste and excited for the next. Beautifully dark and the head lasts well.
Tåget, ravgul med kompakt, stabilt skum. Aroma: gær og banan. Blød fornemmelse, lav carb. Smag som aroma, plus lidt sødme og korn.

A great weissbier. Typical of the style. Good aroma, taste and after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy straw color with a slight but lingering white head. Aroma is bready malt and banana. Taste is banana, clove and wheat. Medium body with a lingering banana and wheat finish. Very good German hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A very nice and easy going wheat beer. It does have a pleasant sour apple note. Nothing great going on here, but certainly worth a the price of a 16oz bottle.

Pours cloudy, actually pretty dark amber with a thick white head. Smell is very breaded with lots of wheat. A little leather-yeasty bitterness. The taste is a bit more fruity, but still pretty dry. A slight bitter and sour finish. Decent balance, but not that exciting. Could actually carry some more alcohol.
A very nice hefeweizen. Pours a dark golden with white head. Nice and fizzy. Great aromas of banana and spice. Nice apple too. Sweet grain flavors.. Very nice stuff.
This is an unusual example of the style. Amber colored and filtered. I found it to be somewhat bland with a lingering sourness on the palate.

From bottle. APP: Pours hazy copper-mahagony brown liquid. Medium white frothy head. AR: wheat malt, strong banana, citrus, clove, sweet.Very well. T: Light sweet, light bitterness on the end/ in the aftertaste, light to medium sour. Banana and clove, perhaps a bit of caramel or toffee? Very good typical German Hefeweizen. P: Medium to full body, creamy texture, lively to fizzy carbonation, light bitter finish. O: A very good typical Hefe Weizen. Bit better ten Maissels Weisse Original from yeterday.

Quite good. Hints of banana and clove. Reminds me of weihenstephaaner hefeweizen 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500ml bottle. hazy golden color, medium head that diminishes quick. sweet aroma with fruity notes. taste is similar with a light dry and fruity finish.

I got this at Randall's. Pours amber with a off white head. Taste banana, fruity, sweet. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16.9 oz bottle. Amber in color with a good sized off-white head. Aroma is of clove, banana, yeast, light lemon tartness, and wheat. Taste is of citrus, wheat, banana, caramel, booze, and clove.
Bottle. The smell is lemon, yeast, banana, clove, wheat chex, and fruits. The look is slightly cloudy, off white head, and amber in color. The taste is wheat, fruits, banana, yeast, tang, and clove

Bière brune pâle orangée, bien voilée, extrêmement effervescente, et surmontée dune copieuse mousse blanche, dense, compacte et rocailleuse, qui se réduit tranquillement. Arômes de pain frais, de blé, et léger de levure, avec un peu de houblon floral, et certains effluves fruités (banane, pêche, agrumes) et épicés (clou de girofle et coriandre). Nez très agréable et complexe, mais qui pourrait tout de même être un peu plus intense. En bouche, ce nest pas tellement pétillant, plutôt mousseux, et lonctuosité au palais est intéressante. Au goût, cest frais et bon, pain frais, blé et autres céréales, paille fraîche, léger caramel ou sucre dorge, un peu de levure acide, du fruité (plus agrumes et moins bananes quau nez), et les épices sont plutôt très subtils, mais perceptible. Le houblon floral est agréablement présent en bouche, et lamertume est légère, mais bien sentie. Cette bière est succulente, complexe et intense au goût. Léquilibre des saveurs sucrées, acides et amères est extraordinaire. Cette bière est LA Hefeweizen original, elle est la référence est la matière, et elle est excellente!

Pours caramel amber and yeasty-cloudy with a full and foamy off-white head that settles nicely at two fingers. Nice wet lacing abounds. Aroma is wheat bread, banana, clove. Taste is wheat and banana bubblegum with a slight lemon sourness. A touch of dry bitterness at the finish. Mild carbonation and easy to drink. Aftertaste is bubblegum and clove. Not quite in the same league as Weihenstephaner or Ayinger, a good, classic hefe. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkel, starke, jedoch kurz anhaltende Schaumbildung. Hefearomen, Banane. Geschmacklich sehr dominante Kohlensäure, leicht hopfig, sauer. Im Abgang stärkere Säure. Geschmackssache.
Bottle. Pours cloudy copper with a beige head. Aroma is banana, yeast, caramel, metallic and floral. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied.

Bottled , Prague , CZ , Wheat,yeast,fruit and spices aroma , Hazy amber color with bigger creamy lacing head , Sweeter taste with some sour notes and longer finish , Medium body , Soft carbon , Superb amber hefe.
Classic Weisse... reddish-amber in color, nice white head and plenty of estery fruitiness... I love the muted, but distinctive fruit and spice nose on this beer...

La représentation parfaite de ce que je me fais dune bière allemande : le goût de banane généré par la levure prédomine. Le corps est très, très agréable! Il est bien pétillant mais rond en même temps. Une excellente bière, très raffraichissante!
Sweet at the beggining. Fruit and caramel taste. Dark collor and light body.

Bottle 0.5. Semi-dark wheat beer. Color - amber, caramel, but muddy. Foam is good, bar, fine-grained, pure white. Fragrance - the usual wheat - light banana, apple, nutmeg and cloves. Taste - too sweet. Im disappointed. Taste is not full, a bit empty, not even like a little wheat, not to mention the caramel flavor.

Bottle from Rhythm and Booze. Hazy, amber colour. Thin, tight, white head. Aroma is fusty grain, white bread, clove. Some red fruit. Hint of caramel. Taste is clacky sweet, with some sour apple. Full bodied, and a bit sticky. Sweet, and lightly soured finish.

From 50 cl bottle. 
Aroma of wheat and yeast. 
Pours reddish amber with lasting head. A little sour in taste. Sweet too. 
Feels good in the mouth.

Bought in Germany in 0.5L bottle. Have had the original a few times in the U.S. and actually remember it differently. It pours darker than I thought - a cloudy light brown. Aroma is a little weird on this one - might have to revisit this with a fresher bottle. On past experience, though, this is of course one of the classic weiss brands, but I prefer Ayinger and Weihenstephaner.

Bottle at home , thx Frederik. 
Nice Hefe nose, banana, dry. 
Dark orange color, Three finger thick white head. 
Medium body, small sharp bubbles, banana, dusty, dry and round aftertaste. 


:)
Bolton Brew.

Pours a beautiful dark wood colour, with a very clear profile. The head is nonexistent (from a bottle). Aroma of burning sugars, almost like the kitchen aroma when making caramel. You might love the aroma or be left wanting a bit more. I was quite happy.

I like the wheat profile from the first few sips. A classic weisse with a maltiness that provides for an excellent sweetness.

Surprisingly well carbonated, perhaps a dash too well. The lingering sweetness a minute or two after a sip, tends to lend to a certain flatness, or should I say a lack of well roundedness, to the finish. 

Surprisingly refreshing, however every sip demanding a bit more from this beer. A bit of balance at the finish would be nice, but still a great sipper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours hazy-amber with long lasting, white head. Aroma is of cloves, banana, yeast and wheat malt. Body is medium and slightly crisp. Taste is of wheat malt, brown sugar, yeast cloves, banana and hint of hops. Some acidity. Finish is long and spicy. Nice, complex Hefe.
Weisse beer of the highest order. Banana, clove, ace mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Top banana

500ml bottle. Gushed when opened, poured with about 8cm white head over cloudy, opaque, brown liquid. Head reduced to thin light brown layer wihin a few minutes with no lacing. Spicy aroma with cloves dominating. Taste again of cloves and possibly nutmeg, but no evidence of the apple mentioned in the description, slightly sour and refreshing. Somewhat carbonated as befits the style. Dry, spicy and sightly bitter finish. Would make a good brew to enjoy while sitting in the marktplatz people watching.
Excellent heffe weiss beer, just love it. One of my favourites. Great taste, really enjoyed it. Cheers!

I love hefe weisse and for me this is one of the best in the style. the dark amber color is unusual for this style but the flavor is not. Subtle fruit, wheat and yeast flavors with some bitter and sour notes.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Amber coloured beer with white foam head. Smell is fruit-like. Taste banana and wheat malt.
Nice amber appearance with thick stable head. Much darker than other helles weizen. Good weizen but not the best one a have had.
Banana cake, roasted nuts aroma. Nice crispy honey cereals, decent fruitiness, clean finish. One of the most solid German weissen for sure.
bottle. Deep amber with three finger head. Lightly tart. Quite a bit of banana but virtually no clove. Its tasty, but nowhere near the best hefes Ive had (Franziskaner and Weihenstephaner).

50cl bottle. Hazy orange/brown with medium head. 
NOSE : strong banana with spices, tart, strong yeast, dough. 
SIP : medium body with good carbonation. Creamy texture. Sweet with aromas of banana and spices in the background. Sweet grains play the main role till the end. Banana and yeast notes make the surface further on. Bitter and little sour notes are delicate. Finish is mostly mild with dominating notes of spices and yeast. 
OVERALL : Its easy to drink and it makes a great example of this style. Good mouth feel.
Cloudy dark chestnut brown - considerably darker than most wheat beers; thick white lasting head; fairly neutral aroma of malt, wheat; taste is classic banana / clove; the textbook wheat beer.
bottle--amber pour, hazy golden, thick white head. fruity aroma, fruit, bread, yeast taste, highly carbonated, dry slight bitter finish. Excellent brew!!

(Bottle): Pours a murky dark amber with a big white head. Aroma of yeast, bananas, clove, fruity notes. Sweet and sour balance in the taste with yeast, banana, clove, malt, fruit aromas along with some spice notes. Lovely hefeweizen.

Pours amber-brown with small head. Not very notable aroma, but still some yeast, wheat, bread and fresh fruit as expected. Pleasant, unsurprisingly bananas, sweet malt, yeast tasting. Mild bitterness and citrus. Lively, high level of carbonation. Refreshing and enjoyable.
Ok brew. A good weizen for a mass produced export. Aroma is weak but delicious and flavor is wheat and yeast.
Like liquid golden bread, drinking it is like being in a bakery, fresh aroma to yeast and flour, flavour like muesli. An authentic gem.

Bottle. Big thick head. Cloudy brown. Nice round and smooth mouthfeel. Hint of banana and raisins. Some mild lingering malty sourness. Mild bitterness. Thoroughly enjoyable.

500ml bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 7 at Pot Still, Glasgow - hazy golden amber, thin white head, yeasty, cloves, fruity aroma, no lacing, high carbonation, fruity, yeasty, moderate dry bitter finish

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2013 Frisk och härlig weiss i doft. Härligt. Läskande weiss. Vill dock minnas att tap 4 är snäppet bättre. På SBWF 2013------- Härlig weiss. Både jag och Wallén gissar att det är en Schneider i glaset. Känns bra

Aroma: very distinct aroma a bit roasty
Appearance: Pale brown&opaque in colour
Taste: A bit sour and fruity
500ml bottle. Cloudy medium brown. A little too much cloves for my liking, but great malts. Crisp body. Overall, Loved the malt, but a little too much spice.
Bottle. Hazy medium brown color with a thin off-white head. Aroma of ripe banana with some roastiness. Medium bitter taste. Lively carbonation.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Draught at the World Craft Beer Tasting 2013 in Osaka. Sharp, tangy wheaty aroma. Cloudy and soupy, with a huge fluffy head. Good solid banana, sweet, turns to bubblegum in mid, along with some sharp citrus notes, and then to a layer of powdered sugar in the finish.

Bottle
Aroma-yeast, 
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, thick feel, lively carbonation,
Overall- very good

Very disappointing. When I read another review saying it poured out like river water I thought that was a joke. Sadly not. It reminds me of home brew that has not got it right and it has nearly a year left according to the bottle's date. Disappointing, a bit like poor English beer from the 70s.

Keg at brewdog Birmingham. Pours like Thames river water! Muddy brown, thin head. Aroma is very nice though, banana, clove, lemon. Taste is on the sweeter side, with the spice turning to a black pepper note. Medium bodied with a nice long finish. Lovely beer.

Pours oddly dark for a hefe; cloudy brown leather in color. Wonderful aroma of peach, cherry and some spice; hint of cloves and cinnamon. Dry champagne like on the palate with a spicy fruitcake aftertaste. Overall... deeeelish! Thanks to Dandman629 for the bottle direct from Germany.
50 cl bottle 5.4% Light brown murdy color, huge head. Taste is somewhat sour with with cloves and spices. Nicely balanced. A decent hefeweissen.

Bottle. The colour is hazy amber with a light beige, medium head on top. Fruity and rich aroma with banana, sweet berries, yeast, spices and some wood. The flavour follows up with more spices, lemon and some berry sourness in the background. Slick and smooth mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A rich and tasteful hefeweizen. Delicious.
UPDATED: SEP 21, 2013 Delicious! Cloudy appearance, not much of an aroma, but smoothe and almost creamy for a wheat beer. A bit pricey but worth it for a special occasion.

Bottle from National Brewery Centre, Burton. Hazy amber beer with a lively head that reduces to a thin head. Aroma of cloves and banana. Taste is cloves and other spices, yeast and a little dry bitterness. Quite light on the palate. Ok beer, but I was expecting more from one of my favourite breweries.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: SEP 23, 2013 (bottle) hazy cloudy orange brown colour with a small tan head; aromas of cloves, fruit, cereal; creamy palate; clean flavour with a hint of sourness

Description has it right with the amber-mahogany color. Large foamy off white head. Good looking beer. Strong cloves in the aroma as well as yeast and mild banana. Tastes just like it smells pretty much. Mild sweetness in the flavor. Full body, and easily drinkable. Very smooth, minimal bitterness. Yeast flavor is strong in this one and it lingers on. Good beer. This beer or the Paulaner could be my go to beer for drinkability.

Appearance: Brassy color, great head. Aroma: Banana, bread, taffy, yeast, lemon pith, grass, clove, apples. Taste/palate: Crisp, moderate body, bread, esters, pepper, taffy, grain, yeast, apple, spicy clove, bit of alcohol warmth. Dry finish. Impressions: Darker than most hefeweizens, this is a bold brew that manages to be approachable. Definitely a classic, at that.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 From a bottle at Atlantas 2013 German Bierfest. 

Hazy medium brown. Smallish but durable off-white head. 
Lighter aroma than flavor but both feature some yeast and banana. 
Unusual hint of smoke in the taste. 

Good if very light mouthfeel.

nuts, toast, amber, hazy, frothy, medium bitterness, medium body, thick feel, fizzy, bitter. The commercial description is, naturally, right on the nose. It has a little more body than most weisse beers but its not too filling. Nice head. Darker color than most weisse beers (more amber than gold). It has a little bit of a punch of bitterness at then end. Just enough to make it stand out from other weisse beers; but nothing like an IPA. All in all a well constructed, balanced beer.
Tap. Hazy dark brown color. Medium size, white head, stays. Banana, sweet, grainy aroma. Banana, sweet, grassy, mild paper in flavor. Crisp mouthfeel. Sweet and sugary aftertaste.

Quite simply, glorious. Whats especially striking is how it has such a full body yet is not heavy. The taste is endless variations of mostly sweet, yet shades of sourness, in some ways mimicking a complex apple cider. Enjoyed from a bottle.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2015 Amber color (quite dark for a Weissbier) with big and dense head.
Aroma of clove, banana and bread.
On the palate, it is acid and a bit bitter.
A very good Weissbier!

Kaatuu lasiin samean ruskeana vaahdon ollessa 2,5 sormea...tyypillistä vehnää väriä lukuun ottamatta. Hajussa on vahvaa banaania ja hedelmäkarkkia. Löytyy siitä myös neilikkaista mausteisuutta ja vehnäistä viljaisuutta. Maku on hyvin banaaninen, nyt menee jo hieman ylikypsän puolelle. Mausteisuutta löytyy ja viljaista hiivaisuutta, Hieman hedelmätoffeetakin löytyy. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen, pirkahteleva ja keskitäyteläinen. Melko maistuva perusvehnä, joka on jopa tavallista hiilihappoisempi. Raikasta tavaraa.
Hazy brown, tiny head. Good yeasty aroma. Banana in the nose and the taste, caramel, a little sweet, yeast. Flavors finish quick but the yeast lingers.
Molseralp. Hazy brown with a foamy off white head. Rich yeast and malt flavours over the traditional banana and wheat. Has a tricky sour apple taste in the finish. Quite a bit of carbonation.

Bottle. Brown-golden with a large, frothy, mostly lasting white head. Aroma is moderate malty, spicy, cloves, hints of lemon. Flavor is moderate sweet and mild bitter. Finish is spicy and sweet. Average Hefe.

Aroma: intensive clove and banana. You can also taste wheat and citrus. Amber colour - not very elegant, medium white head, mostly lasting, but virtually none lacing. Light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Medium body, creamy texture, fizzy carbonation. Refreshing, well-balanced, classy weizen.

Bottle 0,5. Cloudy amber with floaties inside, murky-white soft head. Wheat malts, yeast-phenolic spicy, clove and some caramel in the nose. Wheat crispy flavor, a bit tropical and light sweetness. Lively carbonation, medium bodied (cant say its full like official site tells us..). Refreshing and awaking, very special beer!
Dark golden-amber body, large white head, spotty lacing. Wheat, clove, and semi-sweet fruity malt. Medium bodied with mellow carbonation and a lingering semi-sweet finish.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Me siento intimidado por el 100 que tiene en su estilo, si no, diría que es una cerveza ácida de coj***s. Quizás sea mi botella. O quizás no sea mi botella.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Color: nice clear amber beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: caramel, cereals, wheat. Taste: nice amazing taste of wheat and white bread. Good equilibrium. Aftertaste: nice bitterness and small sugar presence.

Ambrée foncée assez trouble, forte pétillance de visu, plutôt légère au palais, col crémeux persistant. Aussi onctueuse que sa mousse, elle dévoile de bons malts de caramel léger avec des notes de bananes et de fruits blets, sans oublier une légère amertume sur la fin. Surprenant, dautant que je mattendais à tout autre chose et surtout moins bien!

Bottle. Lots of light brown foam which dissipates quickly. Cloudy brown color. Aroma has banana, apricot, yeast and wood. 

Taste is crisp and fresh. Nut, apricot, banana. A bit watery. Some cardboard on the aftertaste. Alcohol also pusjes through a bit. Characteristic wheat beer but somewhat off here and there.

Bottle. Moderate malt and hop aromas of grain and flowers, moderate to heavy dough for the yeast, with notes of banana, juicy fruit gum, dried apple and a hint of clove. Head is large, frothy, white with some slippery lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is, oddly enough, sparkling clear copper. Flavor starts moderately acidic, then finishes faintly sweet and moderately acidic. Palate is medium, watery with a lively carbonation. Classic mix of spicy and fruity aromas in this very true to style German Hefeweizen.

Bottle from Total Wine, Sacramento. Pours dark golden with a huge foamy white head and a fruity nutmeg aroma. Once I got through the lasting head, I discovered a hearty malted wheat flavor with a modestly bitter clove finish. Well-balanced without the usual banana ester taste.

Appearance: a brown almost amber color, hazy and has some particles floating around in it, pours with a massive white head that settles into a large very dense head

Aroma: banana, bread, lemon, alcohol, smells good

Taste: banana, clove, hint of sourness, does have some subtle hops on the finish, 

Palate: average carbonation, leaves mouth dry, some bitter aftertaste 

Overall: interesting 'hefe' that has some sour notes in it as well as hops, a good beer I'd like to try again, easy drinking

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy dark orange with a large off-white head. Aroma of banana, some caramel and yeast. Taste also has banana, caramel, slight sourish touch and a soft to medium bitter finish. Medium body and medium to high carbo. Decent weizen.

Extremelly taste... Good flavours..Nice appearence. Affordable..easy to find

Bottle nice amber color lasting white head this is a real classic On. Of the best weizen in the world like this very much.
Fantastic beer no matter how you look at it, and surprisingly affordable. It is darker with more molasses than a typical wheat beer, but still appropriate for summer.
