Half liter at Wurst und Bier on 7/19/13. Hazy amber pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of banana, clove, caramel and malt. Banana and pepper flavor with clove and malt accents before a semi-sweet, thin finish.
With so high temperatures, a weisse beer is needed. And this one here is one of the best in the market. Super flavor of banana, nice yeasty aftertaste.
UPDATED: JUL 27, 2013 Suprisingly hazy darkorange/brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is great,
På fat. Brungrumlig med vit mellan stort skum och lite kolsyra inte så mycket smak och lite konstigt weissbier. Ok

Pours hazy amber. Lots of head initially, quickly dissipates. Aroma is malty with a hint of slate. Palette is slightly sticky.  I get some spice/cloves in the flavor, and maybe a bit of banana. Pretty good on a hot day, but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Enjoyed in a Berlinese bar. 50cl bottle, served in Weizen. Pours dark golden-orange with white creamy froth on top. Wheat and hints of spice regarding the smell. The flavour is mostly banana (not strong), lightly yeasty and hoppy. The mouthfeel is medium, carbonation just perfect. Easy to drink and refreshing as usual in a Hefeweizen, but not among my favorite ones.

BOTTLE.

Head: light beige, medium, creamy, avg. retention. Colour: dirty dark amber, cloudy.

Aroma: quite weak, clove, banana or caramel?

Tatste: Co2 traces, moderate acidity, vanilla, clove.

A hefeweizen on the sweeter side of the spectrum.

50cl. Nice earthy-hazy orange color with a huge, creamy, mostly lasting head, good lacing. Aroma is sweet, fruity especially tropical fruits, bananas, (flowers?). Flavor is good, fruity, banana, a bit yeasty, no bitterness. Great in hot summer day
Pours hazy brown. Aroma is mild fruits, mild spice, earth, sweet malt, and just a hi t of funky Belgian spice. flavor is fruity, grainy, sweet and creamy texture. Good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Golden chestnut collour, medium white foamy sticky head, sweet fruity banana hints, soft malty smell, soft a bit flat low bitter, medium carbonation banana hints dry after taste and a bit hay in the end some sour notes
Hazy coppery gold with a foamy off-white head. Full and punchy with hints of citrus and spice. Hops kick in at the end with a bit of sourness. Very nice.

The beer is good and pleasant, but if I rate it to the style, it looks and tastes less like a Hefeweizen than some of its German competitors. Too coppery translucid, too much cloves and warm spices on the flavour, much heavier than others, coming across more like a mix of a Weizenbier and a Doppelbock.

0,5 l, 5,4 %, købt i SuperBest, 11. juli 2013.
Flot rav/brun hvedeøl med 6 cm fint hvidt skum (ophældt i hvedølaglas).
Minimal aroma, nærmest ingen. Dejlig frisk ølsmag og god fornemmelse i munden. Lettere syrlig eftersmag.
God hvedeøl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A bit of a disappointment. Feels a bit watered down and vague in the flavors. There are much sharper hefeweizen than this.

Bottle from Biershop Bayern. Old fashioned dark amber weissbier. The usual suspects when it comes to taste, but with a lot more of everything. Also a bit sweeter than most weizen. Perhaps the perfect example of the style, which should set the standards for all others...

Bottle from LCBO. Pours cloudy amber - darker than an average heffy - with a thick quickly dissipating head. Aroma: the usual suspects - banana, vanilla, spice. Taste: solid hefeweizen taste. Good, but Weihenstephaner is better (both are regularly available at the LCBO).

Amber orange color with a thick head with good retention, which got light murky brown after a poured the residual yeast.
Predominant aroma of bananas, honey, bread and some pine.
Very flavorful and perfectly balanced on the citrus versus yeast. Taste of oranges, cloves, light on bananas, medium spicy yeast, and a hint of toasted malts which is good for a change. Dry aftertaste.
Medium body with perfect carbonation, controlled acidity and sweetness.
Beautiful wheat beer that is not tiring, and still flavorful and refreshing. One of the most balanced Weiss I had ever had, with its own character. A must try for who digs the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2013 Dark gold color. Aroma: yeast, banana. Light bitterness. High carbonation. Very refreshing beer.

0,5l bottle
Surprisingly dark color, amber brown, with a long lasting white head. Aroma wheat/citrus/fruity. Highly carbonated with a slight bitter finish.

Pours hazy brown with a foamy off white head. Big bready yeast aroma with granola, peach and caramel. Crisp carbonation with medium to light body. Fairly sweet grains and fruit that turn surprisingly dry in the finish with some sour apple. Fantastic.

Very smooth malt background, 
rich yeast flavors, spicy, with fruity banana tones,
reminiscent of clove, very balanced wheat beer. 
Washes down easy and lasting tasting notes.
Nice carbonation and dark colour and a medium bodied beer.

Tasted from a bottle and tap, both are just as good. personally prefer the bottle cos you can control the pour / head and more importantly the goodness thats left at the bottom.

non pasteurized, bottle conditioned.
Test, hooi, noten, noten, bloemig, deeg, leer, deeg, boerenerf, deeg, gras, deeg, hars
aroma of bananas, and flowers,  appear clear with a thin head.   taste slight sweet and sour.    i really think this is a standard weisse

500 ml bottle, at home, poured into a small weizen glass. ABV 5.4%
Deep amber brown colour on the body, with a tall and thick white head on top. Good retention.Lots of activity going on in the glass.
Aroma of wheat, clove, apples.
Great taste, unlike any other hefeweizen I had before. Little wheat, a bit of caramel, very very fruity and refreshing. Mildly sweet.
Medium thin body, good carbonation. Fairly dry on the palate.
Pours a hazy caramel with white, creamy head. Smells of ripe fruits. Tastes crisp with hints of apple, banana, and spices. Finishes slightly bitter. Nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Bottle at home. #21of my advendkalender. Dark orange beer, small head. Aroma is wheat, malt. Taste is weizen. Bittersweet. Nice

Original rating: 
0.5 L bottle, surprising dark orange beer with a lasting white head. taste was good, This beer is really refreshing on a hot day, another great  Weizen.

Surprisingly dark beige color, with a big, long lasting head. Banana, lemon aroma, with mild malt sweetness. Sweet, bread/bread crust, and nice lingering caramel flavors, with lemon, banana, clove. Good balance between yeast and malt flavors.

Pours dark golden. Strong wheat and banana aroma. A little sweet tasting, with banana, fruits, and a little citrus. Lingering banana flavor and slight bitterness come later. Full bodied and highly carbonated, very refreshing. Not your standard American hefe, seems lighter and more flavorful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its ok, it has a caramel note but I also though there was pepper in it, also probably more a summer than a winter beer. That said if I was having a party Id get this for people to try and enjoy, the caramel not and the sour tang make for a really nice drink.  I didnt get the banana thing. But then sometimes I dont get many things. Also you could rightly describe this is a dry beer. Its taken me a while to get that .

Bottle bought from Munchen @ very warm home balcony. Murky brown / orange beer, quickly almost completely dissapearing white head. Aroma is sourish and quite original for the style. Yeast, fruits, banana, malts. Tastes pretty much the same. Dry and sourish.. Medium body and lively carbonation. As the name says quite original for a classic German hefe.

500 ml bottle pours a cloudy dark orange.brown color with medium head and good lacing.  Aroma is full of bananas, other fruits, yeast, wheat, and some light spices.  Body is light to medium with very lively carbonation. If someone had given me this with no label I wouldnt have guessed it was a German Hefeweizen.  Still, it is unmistkenly German in character, flavorful, and another  delight from a brewery which has never disappointed me.

surprisingly dark, almost fully brown colour, great off-white head; aroma of yeast, banana, hay, minimal citrus and some disturbing sourish  thing; taste of banana, malty sweetness, yeast and citrussy notes. great beer...would be much better without that slight disturbing (maybe sour cabbage?) thi ng in the nose...
Poured from a 500mL bottle. Cloudy orange-ish brown with off-white head. Yeast and wheat on the nose with a slightly sweet yeast flavour.
Very good "standard" German hefeweizen, refreshing and pure. Exellent drink for summer day.

Very cloudy, orange-brown color white enormous rocky head. The best Ive ever seen! Aroma of clove and yeast, but not intensive. Taste of banana and clove with apple notes on background. Unfortunately, its too watery. There appears some light sourness on the finish. Very high carbonation. Very good weizen, but not perfect. However, it?s worth to taste.

Pours a super cloudy orangish brown with an enormous tan head. The smell is spice, clove, wheat, apple. Taste is wheat, clove and some fruitiness - quite spicy. Ends spicy and fruity with  dry crispness. Body is light/medium with average level of crisp carbonation. Obviously a very nice darker weißen.
darker than most weiss beers - amber copper colour. sustained foamy head. great tasting - lots of natural cirus zest

500ml bottle from the state store 
Appearance: Cloudy amber with a big off-white head and spotty lacing 
Aroma: Banana and fruity 
Taste: Banana, yeast and wheat 
Nice and mellow

Ambrée/jaune nuageux avec une petite mousse blanche. Larôme de blé, levure et malt. Il est aussi légèrement épicée avec des clous de girofle. Un goût de blé et levure. Très plaisante et rafraîchissante.

small ivory-white head with some lacing. yellow turbid colour. smell of ester-like fruitness, slightly spicy and banana. refreshing fruity taste, slight note like coriander. rather short dry aftertaste, wheat and fruit. nice soft mouthfeel and soft carbonation. nice weisse.  draft @ baden baden

On tap. Hazy orange body, with a low white head that diminishes quickly, leaving a fair lace. Yeast dominates the aroma. NIce bitterness that I havent come across in other hefes. Medium carbonated, texture is watery, very thin bodied. Strong point of this beer is taste, but its prettty watery and over-carbonated.

Orange mahogany colour, striking for a hefe, with a persistant and massive fluffy off white head.  In the nose, banana and bubblegum, and a hint of lemon.  Very smooth palate, moderate carbonation, the wheat malt is up front, followed by some sweet raisin, lemon and banana flavours with a very subtle hop bitterness in the finish.  Excellent hefe and a great way to reopen my rooftop patio after a winter of discontent.

Bought a 500ml bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Aroma of flowers, bananas and caramel. Orange/brown color and a large cream colored head, highly carbonated. Taste of citrus fruits, banana and some herbs. Taste is light sour and creamy and has a light bitter aftertaste. A good weizen but there are better ones from Germany.

Aroma: Yeast, banana, notes of mollasses/brown sugar and malt, coriander spice. Palate: Very light, yet creamy mouthfeel and dryness combine to make for an interesting palate. Flavor: Banana, brown sugar, grainy malt. Lingering spice (coriander-like) on the finish.
Great look from bottle. Persistent head. Good weizen. banana flavors which are quite typical but not overwhelming. Smoooooth

500ml bottle @ The Knife & Fork Atlantic City. Pours a hazy light copper color with two finger white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, coriander, slight cinnamon, and green apple. Taste is banana, cloves, coriander, with a touch of lemon and grass.
Tasting at Red White and Bleu.  Amber with frothy white head.  Loads of wheat and yeast, with some citrus notes.  Benchmark for the style.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur ambrée foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées légèrement acides (bananes, léger dagrumes) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle, notes de poivre), de blé,  léger de gomme balloune avec des petites traces de caramel. Moyenne-mince en bouche et assez pétillante avec une texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées légèrement acides(bananes, agrumes, notes de pommes) et épicées (clou de girofle, notes de poivre, traces de cannelle) suivi dun goût malté de blé, lége de pain aux bananes avec quelques traces de caramel très doux puis en finale, lon retrouve des notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen, légèrement acide aux petites notes sûres de blé et de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes et pelures de bananes) avec des notes épicées (poivre doux) et quelques traces de houblon herbeux. (2006)

A decent reddish brown color in the pour with a good foamy head. This beer has undertones of fruit (I had some citrusy flavors) and a pretty clean fresh finish. Does have a bit of a sour aftertaste after a while.....so beware

Pours very hazy light amber almost opaque with present off-white medium carb head. Aroma of yeast and wheat with citrus and banana touches. Taste yeast tang, body not very present, then banana and clove finish with yeast tang. Not very complex. Too light a weisse for my taste.
Pours a hazy yellow.  Citrus aroma, thin head that lingers.  Sweet fruity taste, very drinkable.  Very smooth:)

Poured from a 500 ml bottle thanks to robloc303. Thanks! Pours a hazy copper with a white head of foam. Good retention. Bananas and clove come through in the aroma. Fairly bready throughout and a little sweet. I do like how the bread comes through in this.

500ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Hazy medium amber body, initially huge, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is moderately malty, slightly yeasty, with notes of banana, orange, and clove. Flavour is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, with the spiciness of the nose coming through in the taste. Nice finish, kind of bittersweet, with the fizz tickling your tongue just enough. Give it a roll on your tongue and it gives a delightful mouthfeel. Quite nice indeed.
Bottle a hazy yellow orange colored beer with a white head aroma wheat banana spicy yeast and hops flavor malts banana yeast fruit citrus and hops

500ml bottle. Hazy dark amber colour with huge, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, white head. Slightly spicy yeasty and wheaty aroma. Taste is wheaty and yeasty with a citrus touch, later with cautious hints of tangerine. Absolutely average Weizen.

Delicious German beer, dark golden color with a foamy white head a finger tall. Poured out of bottle so perhaps my fault. Palate was very smooth and consistent but perhaps a bit watery. 

Flavor is of wheat and cloves.
May 2012 - Had from bottle recenlty - some interesting flavours, strong aftertaste of spice and alcohol (almost like saki), slightly sour.  Not bad, not worth buying again.

Bottle @ Home. pours hazy brnt orange with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, banana, little sourness. Flavor is wheat, yeast, bubbegum, banana, light lemon, little sour. Medium body, abit to high carbonation. Very refreshing and lovely beer, even with a snowstorm outside160313

Bottle 50cl. Very thin white layer. Hazy amber brown color. Aroma has yeast, citrus, wheat and rottening fruit. Flavour is acidic and like old fruit on fresh bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

keg in Vienna
Pours dark hazy amber with striong banana esters on the nose and fluffy white head. Spicy wheat, thick body, medium carbonation, touch of clove phenols, more banana.My kind of wheat beer!

Cloudy amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, bananas, & spice; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, clove, citrus, and spice; Nicely balanced; Underrated - really good hefeweizen!
bottle.  Poured clear bronze with a small white head. Tart hoppy aroma. Medium body with a crisp mouthfeel, fairly dry finish. Wheat beer with banana and clove flavour.
Great hefe weissen!
Bottle. Pours cloudy amber with airy but stable white head. Grainy and hoppy aroma. Well balanced flavour of malty sweetness and grainy acidity. Nice, dry aftertaste. Very good.
Heerlijk zacht van smaak, echt een super weisse bier. Mooi troebelige roodachtig kleur
One of the best Hefeweizen around. Rather strong. Medium dark amber, though it counts as a "Helles Hefeweizen". Just nice!
Birra molto buona e molto fresca. Fruttata, gusto tipico di frumento. Note poco amare, "bevibilissima".

Pours muddy amber with an ok head.
Aroma is mild, classic wheat tones, banana, spices, grass and green apples.
Taste compliments aroma, with some notes of tart berries, cider, moderately sweet in the end.
Aftertaste is yeasty and spicy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Caveau, Marburg... Perfect Weizen... Amazing aroma and perfect mild faste with weak banana flavor... I love it...

Weiss molto particolare, al naso banana e mela al gusto molto fruttata e molto beverina. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

500 mL from Central Market. Very bready and leaves a thick coating on the back of my throat. Aftertaste is not the most pleasant but does not stick around long. Smells appropriate for a hefe but looks beautiful. Though not translucent, certainly much less opaques than I would have expected.
Keg at BrewDog Birmingham; mahogany pour with foam off white head, apple and clove aroma, taste is quite sweet almost pear drop, clove is present OK

Bottle. On the pour, the head is just magical. Superbly thick and large, the bubbles very minuscule. The head stays and stays and stays. The liquid is a dirty brownish orange and opaque. Aroma is loads of banana on the first whiff. Later its semisweet clove, some sour wheat, light caramel. Taste is semisweet, but also lightly sour. Banana and cloves in the beginning. The banana disappears later, but the cloves stay and are joined by wheat and light caramel. Aftertaste is quite spicy, clove but others as well. Palate is light and somewhat carbonated.
Small head fizzes away within a minute.  Aroma is minimal, but fresh floral hops come through.  Pleasant taste, almost yeasty(?), hard to pin down.  Very smooth in mouth.

Aroma: Strong banana accents with notes of vanilla, dried fruits and a bit of orange. Nose is sticking out good but a very strong banana dominant to the detriment of all other ones.
Visual: Very hazy and muddy amber. Quantity of head is average but texture is delicate and creamy. Lasting is average.
Taste: Banana flavors are coming back with a good acidity. Sparkling is very efficient. We can also find notes of orange zest bringing a certain bitterness and also lemon sub-notes for acidity. Texture is watery and sparkling giving it a very refreshing mouth feel. Body is light to medium. Acidity is somehow quite dominant. Notice to those repelled by acid beers.

From Bottle.  Aroma: Yeast, banana, notes of mollasses/brown sugar and malt, coriander spice.
Palate:  Very light, yet creamy mouthfeel and dryness combine to make for an interesting palate.
Flavor:  Banana, brown sugar, grainy malt.  Lingering spice (coriander-like) on the finish.
This beer has a slight banana smell and a sour "citrusy" taste to it. It has a nice cloudy look and the head fizzles up and dies rather quickly.. I wouldnt mind having another one of these...

Pours dark amber-brown with a huge, quick, off=white head.
Scent is yeasty....clove and wheat.
Taste is bright, apple-cinnamon cream of wheat....
Very tasty and soft.

2013/02/11 - Pours a hazy amber color with a large, foamy, off white head. Aroma is yeast, cloves, sweet malts and banana. Taste is similar to smell. Starts sweet and finishes slightly dry. Good carbonation, but mouthfeel is a little thin. Not a bad German wheat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was very surprised that it was very pleasant in the bottle. Unlike other beers such as Erdinger which I really like on tap but cant stand in the bottle, this is one that I would actually buy at the store.

Ruddy copper color.  I was surprised by the lack of any decent or lasting head.  The typical gamut of banana, some cloves perhaps, and a fairly decent splash of malts.  Overall, a fairly decent weisse and very well made.
A very enjoyable wheat beer that leaves you intrigued and satisfied.  Clean aftertaste with a slightly sweet fruit flavour.  This is a real classic weisse by all definitions.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 Hazy light brown colour, with creamy head. Aroma is banana, candi sugar and roasted malt. Taste banana, and its not too sweet. Very good weiss, different than usual, but very good.

500ml bottle from Beernavigator
BBE 09.01.13 - Pours clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of yeasty fruits, hints of malts and tart banana notes. Taste is malty with some slight yeasty and ripe fruity notes. Finish is smooth and slightly tart. Okay, quite well balanced hefeweizen.
Amber-brown hazy color with white persistent head. Banana aroma that come back at taste with frizzy carbonation and light sweetness.
This was "ok." Nothing really special. There are certainly better Germans out there, even within the brands own line.

Has a murky, almost lees like brown/beige colour. Banana, clove and kitchen spice aroma are met with a slight hint of lemon or something equally fruity. the palate is filled with banana and vanilla like flavours and the brew has a slight tartness about it. Very well done and classic styled brew, just wish it had a bit more on the abv front to give it body.

Une excellente bière de blé, où lon hume des arômes de bananes, de sucre cuit et dabricots ; le nez fruité est suivi dun goût légèrement tropical, avec des notes de céréales et une effervescence qui souligne joyeusement ses saveurs puissantes mais bien balancées. Un délice.

Bottle. Greyish-brown, muddy colour. Yeasty and fruity aroma, banana, vanilla, subtle clove. Crisp, tart, fruity and light taste with hints of carmel and pear in the finish. A bit too dry for my liking and the carbonation is too biting.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Amber goodness. Very delicate beer and well-balanced. Clean taste and lovely hazy color. Very drinkable.

On tap in Munich brewpub half liter. This is dark golden brown color and opaque large off white head that sits on top of the beer nicely. Nose is soft fruit and banana, some grape maybe. Taste is very refreshing and clear with a sweet start and slightly dry finish. This is what every weissbier should aspire to be. Really great.
Bouteille de 500ml, robe blonde opaque, arôme de levure allemande, goût fruité de banane et de pomme.

Bouncing bananas and estrogenous esters,
Lacing that hugs the glass like your warmest blanket,
Lacking translucense, cloudy but no pollution,
Perfectly palatable

Hazy brown colour, dark for a weissbier. Nice creamy head with good lacing. Classic hefe aroma of banana and cloves sits atop the malt sweetness. Creamy thin body. Taste is relatively uninteresting. Mild sweetness and a tiny bittering with a touch of spice in between. Finish is smooth but not remarkable. This starts of great, but finishes somewhat mediocre. A good hefe, but not the best.

Pours a slightly cloudy copper with a huge white head of foam. Aroma is bread and yeast with some spice. Very creamy on the palate, the taste is wheat, bread, light spices and some fruit notes. Nice finish with only a suggestion of hops. Very refreshing. Try it with sardines on matzo crackers.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 A truley great beer really loved this one nothing I can complain about just a fantastic beer will be getting more

#36
Dieses Aroma ist dem Paulaner Weissbier ebenbürtig. Hefe-Nelke bis zum abwinken...Danach wird es leider etwas wässrig im Antrunk. Die Dupplizität der Ereignisse: Im Abgang nelkenartige Würze. Ein tolles Weissbier, das in Sachen Würze noch einen Gang zulegen sollte, aber sonst...Lecker!
	
Test vom 21.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 14,15,13,13,9,13 - 13,20

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 On tap at Kopta. A very solid cloudy hefeweizen with a reddish gold color. Sweet and spicy a good example of the style. I just had this from a bottle and I think I preferred it like that. It is copper colored, decent head and your classic weizen fruity & spicy aroma which is matched by an easy drinking beer. Very nice.

The beer appears autumnal orange with a thick , lasting, light tan head. An odd color for a hefeweizen, but still a good appearance. Moving on...The aroma offers bananas, clove, malt, booze...slightly sweet. The flavor is smooth and balanced, with banana character gaining strength in the finish. Additional flavors aside from the norm include a pronounced malt flavor with some candy sweetness. Less bold than some of my favorite examples of the style. That said, this beer has some character and pizzaz. Medium bodied with appropriate carbonation. Overall, this is solid, but I would never choose it over Weihenstephaner.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-03-2012

Bottle from my bro under the alias Tap 7 Unser Original (thats the beer, not my bro).  Cant fault the looks - very nice cloudy amber with a thick, steady, creamy head.   Has that spiced, orange, Bavarian smell.  Sweet flavoured, perhaps lacking depth and watered down.  I want to like it more than I do - its just very good.

Tap at BrewDog Camden. It pours cloudy light brown with a medium white head. The nose is wheat, light spice, subtle smoke, over-ripe banana, caramel and banoffie pie. The taste is wheat, banana, spice, dough, bread, caramel and citrus peel with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Inoffensive, easy-drinking Hefeweizen.

Bière brune de 5.4 % dalcool. Très opaque. Elle possède un long col mousseux au versement. Il y a un odorat dorange mélangé à une épice ( ?). Elle a aussi un odorat de froment. Elle possède un goût sucré, et vraiment dépice, sans nécessairement savoir laquelle. Petite amertume, mais on ne goûte pas beaucoup le froment. Correcte.
Schneider Weisse is an own beer style. There is nothing comparable to this brew which  is truly  caracterised in its commercial description.
From a bottle at home. Pours a cloud dark honey cold with a thick white head. Aroma of fresh baked orange rolls. Light spice and lemon zest notes. Smooth finish.

Aroma de laranja com algo de banana. Sabor característico das cervejas de trigo sem aquele retrogosto de laranja fermentada, possui notas de cravo. Cor turva, bela, com espuma densa e saborosa. É uma cerveja refrescante e balanceada.

Probably the first hefe wisse I evere taste. In Berlin (Cafe Adler at Checkpoint Charlie) maaany years ago. Like a first love, because it is a natural choice even today. Lovely hazy amber colour with a white head. Wheat, banana and vanilla aroma. Flavour are about the same lovely stuff. Medium pluss body and a fine balanced sweetness.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden]

bottle from derrys german market was the tap 7 unser original bottle  which comes under this same one. darker amber colour. to be fair I had this after a hooegarden which is a lot different then this original but overall it was an average hefe I felt.

Bottle at at a train ride from Basel to Zurich, November 2012. Cloudy, darkish amber with a frothy white head. Bubblegum, banana and clove as well as some untypical graininess. Banana-ish sweetness, almost without soourness. Sun dried banana and watermelon seeds finish, full body. Great.

bread, grass, banana, clove, amber, orange, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, light body, thin feel, lively, astringent, bitter
Nice amber pour that gradually clouds over. Tall white head. Big banana aroma with spicy clove and some grass. An initial sourness along with doughy bread but a mild bitterness replaces it and lingers for a short time. Mouthfeel is quite thin and carbonation surges in the mouth.  Overall a very nice wheat beer.

This beer has a beautiful head. It has an almost fruity banana bread like taste. It has a clean finish and is full of flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
One of the best from a brewery that only does weizens.Dark for a hefeweizen, but full bodied. Flavor is like a nice farmers loaf of dark bread. This ones a real treat.
Sailed back from work today, quite enjoyed it. Got to put the bins out later though and Im not looking forward to that. Prefer 6 I think, but this is good. Its very wet.

From half-liter bottle to glass.  Brown-amber cloudy tone with foamy head.  Strong banana aroma with spices and a yeasty note.  Medium sweet taste with slight bitterness in the end and a bit of a booze sting(or a sting from something). Bubbly carbonation (burp).  Overall, pretty good.

Pours a hazy brown colour - which is a bit unusual - topped by a floppy white head. Scents of banana and yeast on the nose. Taste is a nice blend of cloves, banana, citrus and a floral note. Big flavours are complemented by a velvety palate and a fresh finish. Very good.
Bottle. Clove, orange/banana aroma. Clear amber with a large off-white head, poor retention. Strong clove, orange/banana, wheat malt flavor. Light to medium body, lively carbonation.

si

que bueenaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!!! debe ser la cerveza
Bottle.  Hazy dark amber color, fizzy white head.  Aroma of clove > banana.  Taste is clove, caramel, bubblegum.  Tasty.
Dark golden, almost light brown colour with minimal head. Aroma of wheat, hay and some fruits. Like in a stable. :) Taste of wheat, hay, dry grass, some bread. Sweet but balanced weissbier.

Cloudy brown liquid topped by a creamy white head. Aroma is restrained, with only a few spicy esters tickling the nose, mostly cloves. Taste is bananas and cloves, with a bit of green grass. Palate is one of this beers best features. It rolls on the tongue like it was silk, incredibly quaffable. I didnt  notice the slight sourness until I read the brewers description but it is certainly there and helps enhance the quenching impression.

bottle. Cloudy brown amber colour, pillowy head. Great aroma; spices, banana, clove, citrus. Lively, well-carbonated. Taste is fresh and rich, sweet, mirrors the aroma. This was great with a spicy meal.
Nice beer, pours a browny orange body, quite a baked and bready aroma, tastes quite clean and light spicey/bready aroma. Pretty enjoyable beer!
500 ml bottle. This beer tastes really good. Its spicy and not too heavy.
Huge white head, cloudy brown colour. Mild yeast aroma. Fruity and full taste, spicy palate. Very good one.

Hazelnut color with off white head. Aroma of bread,  clove, some nuts. Taste is well balanced, sweet, bananas, citrus peel. I would beer this beer again, enjoyed it a lot. Schneider Weisse brew one of my favorite weissebeers, for me the best is Tap 5

Grainy aroma with undertones of banana, bread, spices, and clove. Smooth taste with similar notes, resulting in little bitterness or sweetness.  Easy mouthfeel, plenty carbonated. Enjoyable for a 30-minute midday break, but rather unexciting.

Thx to tirstybird ! 
Head: off white, and away very fast ! 
Colour: Copper / Dark amber 
Smell: irony, wheats, malts, some sweetness, dry bitter 
Taste: banana, malts, some wheats, irony, slight sticky sweetness, oily texture, good but a bit weird in a certain way ...

Subtle banana aroma. Copper colour with small sustained head throughout. Sour apples with banana bread finish. A weird and wonderful mix of typical wheaty hefeweizen with sour darker beer characteristics.
Well balance of clove & banana. Perhaps a bit dry for a weisse.is not my cup of tea

Bottle in Bern.  Cloudy brown pour with a big white frothy head.  Big fruit and wheat aroma with a slight sourness in the taste.  What can I say. This beer was not overflowing with flavour thats for sure.  I drank it with five other friends and they were not complimentary either.  It was fine to drink once, but I wont go out of my way to find it again.  I find its relatively high rating quite surprising.
If you want to drink the best, this is it. Hefe weizen doesnt get better then this. The original and the best.

Tried this on tap at the Flying Saucer in Houston. Fruity notes with clove, nutmeg and apple with a bitter/sour finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a light amber color in the glass with a nice head. The aroma has some citrus with a little bit of yeast. Taste has some citrus and a touch of caramel. Good finish.

Bottle - Tap 7. Poured a hazy amber with an off-white head that had a thin layer lasting. Aroma of wheat and citrus. The flavor found wheat with a backing of citrus and clove. Light body and enjoyable.
Fra fat på Den tatoverede enke: en skikkelig god weissbier med mye kropp og ganske så intens smak av bananer og krydder, og med et delikat anstrøk av pepper. Kan trygt prøves igjen!
Pours a cloudy yellow with a light head. A citrus sourness, a little honey, not bitter and a nice clean finish.
Picked one up due to reviews I read for it when I should have been working. Pours a "dead" brown and has a sweet but soapy aroma. Tastes surprisingly good and a good representation of classic Hefe.

Bottle. Dark golden, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty  wheaty and sweetish aroma, light fruitiness and faint banana. Body is medium, malty  wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint fruitiness and faint hoppyness. Finish is average malty  some wheat and dryish, faint fruitiness and faint hoppyness. Dryish hefeweizen - OK, but nothing special.

Bottle, 50 cl. Cloudy dark golden with a dense, bubly, but quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is sweet banana and light acidic fruitiness, very frsh and wheaty. Falvor is sweet fruity, wheaty with a light bitter finish.

found this to be very different from most other hefeweizens... deep amber pour, soft white head... fruit both on the nose tongue.. even some slight caramel and spice maybe?  these seemed to subdue the normal clove and yeast you?d normally pick up... very enjoyable
Hefeweizen with a strong individual character. This one stands out from other hefeweizens. Amber colour, almost brownish. Banana and clove. Not as fruity as others, but more spicy. Nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2012 Bottled, from the backlog
Deep orange, big white head. Smells of citrus, clove, banana; on the complex side of the hefe-scale. Nice wheat flavors, yeast, some citrus acids in the back. A very solid hefe, one of the better
Its an ok beer. Nothing really special. Your standard banana, clove and a little bubble gum with something oddly sour. Not bad, just nothing to write home about.

Tap at the Weisses Brauhaus, Munchen - 16/07/12.
Obscured brown amber with a thick dollop of white head.
Malty yeasty nose with a pinch of banana and clove, though not as dominant as in other beers of this style.
Flavours match the nose with a little spice on the finish.
Medium bodied with a rich creamy feel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 16.9 oz bottle into an Aventinus glass. Pours hazy amber (was expecting the usual gold or yellow) with a medium dirty white head that collapses into a skiff of foam after a few minutes. Aroma consists of banana, bubblegum, apples, caramel--not as clean and clovey as the best examples of the style. Taste is sweet and meaty with a slightly tart finish. Mouthfeel is a bit too bubbly for my tastes. Nice enough, but I was expecting so much more.
It was good. There wasnt much aroma. It didnt have much strong fruit notes. But still a good hefeweisen beer.

500ml bottle
Aroma: it has a nice floral bouquet with notes of citrus and hints of yeast.
Appearance: a nice robe, cloudy and white as you would expect.
Taste: a bit sweet, not overpowered.
Palate: feels light bodied, with a think texture, fairly lively and feels astringent on the finish. Very refreshing in summer.
Overall: Excellent hefeweizen. Thumbs up.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2014 500ml bottle from the liquor store in Huntsville
pours a dark hazy amber with small head
Smells sweet bubble gum and bannana
A nice refreshing wheatEarlier Rating: 10/28/2008 Total Score: 3.6500ml bottle from the LCBO
I like this wheat beer a lot cant seem to get enough of these German wheats mmmm
Pours very murky and cloudy, large white head. Aroma of cloves and malt. Flavour of spices and banana bread. Quite sticky, lingering aftertaste of bubblegum and bananas.

A - Cloudy dark orange. Much darker than I would have expected. This beer had a mattress of a head that stuck around long enough to sleep on all night.

S - Citrus, fresh picked apples and yeast. Not as aromatic
as other hefes.

T - nice balance between the soft sweet malt, crisp citrus and faint hop presence. A bit of the citrus lingers and makes the mouth water at the back end.

M&D - soft and well carbonated. Crisp and clean on the tongue. great anytime , and all the time.

This beer has a definite cardamom note and a spice to it up front and on the palate.  Not a light heffe but more of an amber.  We found this at palmers in Lagrange, IL.  Nice fall beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. A lot of carbonation, creamy head. Sour taste, banana finish. Not quaffable at all.

0,5 l bottle shared with Mcapps. Too much carbo, too sour and at least the biggest disappointment of a whole evening. A bit better than the weizen from a discounter but at the end an absolute tasteless and overcarbonated one. Aroma ? Maybe sour milk.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Hazy, milkybrown colour. Good foam that stays.Banana and spice on the aroma. Refreshing ;)

Bel colore ambrato con schiuma bianca pannosa e persistente.
Aromi intensi e complessi con chiodi di garofano, banana, spezie e un lieve agrumato.
Secca, corpo scarso, abbastanza acida......non male.....

0,5l bottle as Schneider Weisse Tap 7 Unser Original. A brown weiss with orange highlights. It looks like dunkelweizen. The head is white. The aroma has notes of fruits, wheat and spices. The taste is sweet and very refreshing. Wheat finish.
50cl bottle as TAP 7. This is more like a dunkelweizen or vienna style beer. Color is brown, amber color. Head is thin. Carbonation is high. Aroma is roasted, caramel, malty.

0.5L bottle.  I was surprised this wasnt classified as a dunkelweizen, it pours a brown-copperish color, not yellow, with a healthy head and light lacing.  Agree with description about the taste.  Really full body, impressively complex taste, pleasant aftertaste and aroma.  An interestingly decent weizen.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy amber orange color. Huge rocky white head. Fragrant wheat malt nose with a strong prescence of clove, yeast and vanilla. Light sweet biscuit wheat malt flavor with a twinge of  citrusy, tart yeastiness. Light body. creamy mouthfeel and a soft lingering bitter finish.

After having their "Tap X Mein Nelson Sauvin" last night, I noticed I had not had this one before (and had lots of rating). Well, the LCBO had some waiting for me, so I grabbed one. Loaded with carbonation, the brew came out of the bottle before I could pour it. Hazy golden-amber colour with a big frothey off-white head, good retention and thick lacing. Spicy wheat nose with notes of banana bread, hints of vanilla and witbier yeast. Smooth, almost creamy mouthfeel. Again, crazy carbonated. The taste is nicely balanced between the wheat, spices, apples and mild sugars. Quite a nice brew that reminds me of a milder Unibroue Maudite (even though they are not the same style, many resemblance). Easier to drink for sessions.
Drank slightly chilled straight from the bottle. Good aroma, strong yeasty/fruity flavour, not bitter in the mouth but a slight bit afterwards. One of my favorites so far.

Strong aroma of banana, sweet bread and indistinct tannins. Pours a dark hazy orange. Excellent sweet, spicy banana-wheat bread taste. Crisp to the point of being crunchy. Schneiders products are the best wheat beers around, and this is no exception.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, dark orange-red pour with white head, aroma brought banana, clove, biscuit and bready notes, some yeast character, touch of grainy grass and pine.  Slight vanilla as well.  Taste is sweet cracker and biscuit, some slight banana, clove and spices mixing into a hint of caramel, touch of earth, finishing fairly sweet.
nice aroma. its a little darker than hefes usually are, a light amber in color with a decent head. good hefe taste, yeasty and a slight spice flavor

I got a big amount of bubbly head. It looked darker then other hefens & I couldnt see any carbination. Smell was light & soft & spices. Taste was a light sweetness with bubably spices & mabye some bannana bread like taste.
cereal, banana, citrus, herbs, orange, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,

Hefiger und runder Hefebeginn, vollmundig, beginnend dunkle Malznoten. Das Weizen bleibt frisch, die Malznoten werden dunkler, die Hefe angenehm bananig ohne süß zu sein. Trockene Herbe im Hintergrund, hefig, vergoren bananig, leichte Süße. Referezweizen! 10/12/13/13/12/12
bottle- It is very lively, with a complex, fruity flavours, maltiness, almondy nuttiness, and clove.
Had this as the Tap 7. A real german weizen, not my favorite but very palatable on hot summer nights. Bought at the De Schans store in Uithoorn.

A decent hefe.  Maybe I was drinking one that was a bit old, but it was sort of sour and smelled like feet.  Light golden, decent head.  Some citrus but mostly stale wheat. Tried at the Cunigans tasting party in 2012.
Bottle> Hazy yellow color. Thick head. Smells of slight lemon and wheat. Not as flavorful and interesting asi expected. Not one of my favorites. Kind of Bland IMO

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy orange/brown with good white head. 
Aroma is banana, yeast, malts, citrus. 
Taste is bitter, some sweet, bit sour. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Awesome weissen!

Color tea. Aroma hay, malt. Taste metal, little sour, watery. Palate fresh, small body. Overall good nice weizen.
Hazy harvest orange sun colour with a large frothy white head. Banana aroma. Crisp beer . Banana and clove. Quite sweet with a hint of dishwater like qualities.

Has some strong banana clove scents like usual. Taste is not that bad the clove definitely takes over the banana and a little bit of other spices. Not bad for a hefeweizen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Pours an opaque cloudy orange/brown with lots of light tan head...not the colour I was expecting at all. Lots of clove and banana yeast on the nose with something I want to call smoke but isnt. Taste is heavy on the clove as well with some bananas and a little grain.
On tap @ Sormanufaktura. Hazy deep orange body, off-white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and hops. Taste reflect the aroma: yeasty, hoppy, fruity. A really good weizen.

Pours golden brown, kind of an iced tea presentation, with a large head.  The aroma is crisp and fruity, lots of bananas and a little citrus.  The taste is bright and clean, with more of those fruit tones and a little hoppy bite at the end.  Pretty good.
Eines der besten deutschen Weizenbiere das ich bisher getrunken habe. Nicht zu herb mit vollem Geschmack.
500 ml bottle. Pours a dark orange/brown with light persistent head. Spicy floral aroma with cereal backdrop. Crisp. Wheat, cloves, and hops with a bit of vanilla/banana.
Bottle pours a dark golden with a white top. Scent is banana and wheat. Taste is wheat and spice.

500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy rosy amber colour, with a large off-white head of fine bubbles.  Darker than usual for hefeweizen.  Aromas of spice, clove, dough, citrus.  The taste is malt, with a noticable undertone of metallic hop all hidden in the usual banana, earthy pepper notes, yeast, clove, bubblegum, with a finish a little more bitter than usual for a hefeweizen.  Good stuff.

Bière blonde-ambrée, légèrement voilée, coiffée dune énorme mousse compacte et persistante. Au nez, une belle odeur fruitée, de purée de bananes et épicée, notamment par le clou de girofle comble loutil olfactif. En ce qui me concerne, jai souvent une mince déception lorsque je déguste une bière de ce type, parce quil me semble que le goût nest pas à la hauteur par rapport au fumet. C,est moins prononcé, mais très agréable quand même. Le blé se prononce plus un coup rendu en bouche et il est accompagné dune touche acidulée. Aucunement déçu. (261-100612)
Licht bruine weizener. Kruidnagel en banaan aroma. Vol mondgevoel. Kruidig met mild bittere afdronk. Tarwe. Verfrissend.

Tap. Pours cloudy, dark gold with thin, creamy white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is banana, orange, cloves, floral hops, candy sugar, bread and cookie malt, and light spice. Flavor is sweet malt with good supporting fruit esters and faint hops; sweet, banana finish. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

When I first poured this I thought there was something wrong with it; apparently Im just an idiot and didnt realize the hefeweizens could be this dark. I like to drink drink drink cloves and bananas... I like to drunk drunk drunk...

Bottle. One of the darker Hefeweizens Ive got thus far. Darker orange colour with a nice, creamy white head on top. Wheaty, soft aroma with hints of banana and lemon. Flavour is sweetish, quite ok and easy drinkable. Just your typical hefe, just a tad better. This one is very nice!
Poured a cloudy amber gold color, aromas of bananas, clove, light yeast.  Flavors follow suit with a kiss of citrus, a solid German Hefeweizen, great and refreshing outside.

500ml bottle pours a hazy pale amber color with a 2 finger white head that settles slowly to reveal some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is banana and cloves with some nutmeg and light fruits and mild hops.  Taste is very well balanced with a fruity and malty sweetness and spices and a light hop bitterness.  One of the best hefes that I have tasted to date.
Bottle - big foamy head, medium copper color, well balanced hefe, smooth malty flavor with ver mild cloves - not a hefe fan, but this is very good

My favourite beer...and with good reason! The taste is sublime, just the right hint of sweetness in there and this, combined with the lovely aroma and beguiling appearance typical to wheat beers, makes it pretty special. It will take some beer to knock this off the top of my list.
Banana and yeasty aroma.  Huge head with a creamy mouth.  Light taste overall.  This one isnt overly wheaty.  Easy drinking with a hint of sour.

Backlog feb 2010, on tap outside Karlsruhe.
Golden, close to orange, good foam.
Fruity and refreshing- good taste intensity.
Enjoyable
My first Wheat beer ive tasted about 18 years ago. Still one of my favorites. Highly aromatic for the style yet still refreshing as a thirst quencher.

Im Glas hat es ein Schönes Aussehen, einen Naturtrüber Körper und eine gut aussehende und haltende Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist Durchgehend schön fruchtig, etwas hefig und leicht hopfig. Im Nachgeschmack ist es weiterhin sehr fruchtig. Lecker!! Fazit: Gutes Bier!
	
Test vom 28.12.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,13,12,11,11,12 - 11,95
Cloudy, brownish orange colour. Light nose, slight anise essence. Taste is very nicely balanced. Not overly complex. Little banana, little caramel taste.  Great summer beer

from bottle. hazy orange brown colour with a frothy white head, looks absolutely amazing! aroma is really fruity, ripe bananas, some apple and pear, slight toffee notes as well. light to medium body with average carbonation, nice balance between sweetness andsourness. flavours of banana and green apples, only marginal hints of malts. could be a bit more complex but it is a really good weizen. cheers!
Initial heavy taste with a nice finish. Before I even got the glass to my nose I got a heavy red wine flavor. It has a nice clove start with a sweat caramel and raisen finish.

Schneider Weisse Original has a very thick, light beige head and an initially clear, amber appearance, which clouds up once the bottom bit is swished and poured in. Then, little gray chucks float about. This beer is very bubbly, like Champagne. There is a small bit of lacing left behind. The aroma is of clean water, grain husks, and some sweetness. Taste is of white wheat bread, sourness, sweetness, a touch of mild hop bitterness, yeast, and a ghost of coriander. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Schneider Weisse finishes dry and quite refreshing. Overall, this is a very good beer. RJT

Poured from bottle.  Aroma of burnt French toast.  Sketchy looking dirty mahogany with a bit of a head.  I taste caramel, molasses, dry wheat, cinnamon.  A bit flat and a vinegar aftertaste makes me think this is old.  Would like to retry someday.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: .5l bottle as Tap 7 from Kuca Piva in Zagreb. Bubbly bottle, emptied in to a wine glass that leaves a mahogany and oily wood. Appearance is darker for a hefe, everything pushed toward the caramelized (malts, fruit, smoke) side of things. Fruit and candy body, sweet bites. but finishes dark and caramelizes all of the other flavors..  Very nice, could drink this any time

50cl bottle, Weissbräu at Pavilion. Pours dark golden with a large off-white head. Fruity aroma with wheat, light citrus, some fruits, hints of yeast and spices. Sweet, but refreshing with a nice light bitterness in the finish. Excellent beer in the heat. (2012-05-04)

500 mL bottle. Pours an orangey amber color, darkly clouded with a thick white head. Lots of lacing. Deep cereal and butterscotch notes, cloves, banana, apple and fresh dairy. Slightly sweet, a little bitter hops and a citrus finish, floral. Light bodied, and good fizz. A nice weisse.
Pours a cloudy, dull brown.  Picking up some cloves, maybe a bit of banana.  Pretty smooth.  Pretty standard for a Hefeweizen.

500 ml bottle. Poured into my preferred weizen glass. Approximately 5ºC. This is actually one of my favourites beers of them all. Its a very special hefe-weizen, darker, of amber colour, more "spicy" than others, stronger... Apart from this, quite similar to a normal Hefe-Weizen, particularly cloudy and orange, clove and banana flavours. Long finish. Beautiful long-lasting white thick head. Perfect balance, sweet and lively carbonation. Overall an incredible beer. Prost!
From the bottle, pours a hazy golden hue with a nice soft creamy head.  Aromas offer banana, vanilla, grass.  Very bright on the palate with a nice sweetness.  Great for the summer.

hazy wheatfield-gold with a beige, foamy head. Aroma is primarily banana and clove, with some bready notes. The taste is bright and fairly sweet- more banana and some spices. Smooth, citrusy finish with a small amount of bitterness - totally appropriate. This is special.

500 ml bottle from Morrisons, served cold in a weizen. Familiar spicy bannana bread aroma. Murky brown body, much darker than Ive seen in previous Hefeweizens Ive had. HUGE frothy off white head, despite a gentle pour,which persists in a pinkie finger thickness down the glass.Flavour is more "grown up", if you like; more spicy apple than the usual banana/clove/bubblegum. Remember "Soor apple" sweets that dried your mouth up and made you sweat under the eyes? Medium bodied, lively carbonation, some dry sourness in the finish. I really enjoyed this beer.
Not much aroma to speak of but wonderful bouquet of banana and clove flavors you would expect from a hefeweizen.

Sept 2006 from BA: Drank this beer years ago in the old brew house in Munich, it was draught and its taste has stayed with me since then. 

This review however is from a 500ml bottle. 

Poured into the correct glass, this darker than most hefe weizen beers, amber, more than blonde. The head is large, deep and full. 

Powerful aroma of vanilla and bannana, almost a shock, if you are not expecting it. 

Great, wiezen flavours, if you have never tried this style before, this is the one to start with, like this and you are hooked, dislike it, well dont bother again, because this is a classic hefe weizen. Tart, yet with soft tones also, a very complexed beer in every sense.

Bottle 0,5 l - jollybeers.net
Appearance: Cloudy brown color with a large,good lacing, mostly lasting tan head. 
Aroma: -moderate to high (but less intense than TAP 5 or 4)- malt, bananas, flowers,yeasty(dough), cloves, nutmeg, citrus. 
Taste: moderate sweet almost absent bitterness, just a touch of sour
Palate: medium body, average carbonation, watery to oily texture
Bottle. Great stuff! The sourness in the background forces the smoothening wheat to really get to work. Some mild spices are there to keep them company.
500 ml. bottle.  Pours copper brown with a nice off-white head.  Aroma of malt, bananas, and spices.  Taste is malt, yeast, banana, grain, and spices.  Smooth and delicious!

Really a bottle of Tap 4, but that beer is "aliased" and therefore cant be rated. Nice foam, cloudy, reddish appearance. Taste is somewhat bitter, not as weissbier should be. Aftertaste also bitter and a bit of alcohol lingers. Not a favourite, but Way better than störtebeker...

On tap. Nice, hazy (almost totally opaque) sort of darker yellow orange color. A nice foamy off-white head, leaving lace. Nice hefe aroma, vanilla and light clove is there. Nice light sweet and light sour taste. Good light soft carbonation, dry texture. Good hefeweizen.
Hazy dark orange colour with a thick white head. Banana aroma and flavour, along with some some caramel.
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 Hazy amberish brown colour with medium head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, banana. Flavour is wheat, citrus, sour.

Poured into pint weizen glass, three finger head

An amber weissbier isnt something Ive seen.  The intriguing color opens many doors for a beer lover.  I smelled cloves, bananas, and some bubblegum. The taste was all of the above, but scarcer. With a nice gentle mouthfeel it was worth consuming. I am going to buy some more of this superb beer very soon.  Try this beer.
Very cool cloudness when poured. Fruity type flavour...clove..nutmeg ....touch of sweet. Really nice finish. Very good beer.

In bottle. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of bananas, nutmeg, wheat and cloves. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a great chewy mouth-feel. A classic German hefeweizen.

Smells like puffed wheat. Great variety of favors, some citrus and banana. Dry after taste but a watery and full taste down the gullet. 

22

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy amber yellow with a bright head and ok lace. Aromas of banana and clove-like spiciness with generous wheat notes and a reminder of the yeast. Flavor follows, highlighted by the wheat malt and citrus. Light body, lots of carbonation, and a clean, crisp finish.

500ml bottle. Arome is floral, citrus. Appearance is dark amber, orange and cloudy with a 4 finger head. Taste is medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Has a medium creamy body with average carbonation and a solid finish. Overall a very good Weissbier.
Bottle, Toffee brown with a creamy head. Aroma of fruit toffee, some spice. Flavour is light smoky, caramel, banana and spice. Finish is dry wheat

Bottle; cloudy yellow-brown with large off-white head; aroma-banana, yeast, green apple, clove; taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation. Decent.

500 ml bottle. Pours an opaque, orange amber with a resilient white head. Smells like wheat, fruits, bananas. Tastes like bananas and citrus. Very little taste in a finish, besides some acidity. Body is average, mouthfeel is creamy. Very good wheat beer.

Head diminishes quicker than I remember. Nice clove/ apple nose going on and hint of allspice and smoke. Touch of Juicy Fruit (the bubblegum) taste-wise, but not as much as with some other wheats Ive had. Spiciness kind of lingers nicely and theres a good balanced sweetness to it. Good, standard Weissebier.

50cl, Mi orge, mi houblon. Cloudy chestnut brown, big fluffy white head. Nose is thin maltiness, yeast, wheat, banana, stagnant water and caramel. Mouth is big fruity, candy, big bubblegum, banana, yeast, some dried fruit peel, sweet, suppressed, dullened flavour. Sweetish aftertaste, not very clean, malty banana, long, hazy yeasty end. Alright, pretty heavy for a hefe.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 Tap in Lady Godiva, Geneva. The darkest standard hefeweizen ive seen, with an almost toffee brown colour. A very complex beer, with yeastiness, toffee like malt, spicy clove apple, and just enough bitterness to cut through. Not as clean as some of the lighter hefes, but still very drinkable and one of my favourites.

Maybe its past its prime, but I was just not impressed with this one in the world of hefes.  I appreciate its attempt at complexity, but it just didnt come together well.  Pours an amber brown orange with thick off-white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, spices, and yeast.  Not much more to the flavor.  Its decent, but not memorable.

5.4% cloudy brown colour (dark for a wheat beer, almost the colour of a dunkel weisse) with a thin head, nice banana aroma, taste is slightly bitter with some banana, it is good but a bit lacking in body.

Good amount of character & complexity for a wheat beer. Deep amber body with a thin persistent white head. No lacing. Aroma of banana, honey, and a hint of clove. Somewhat chewy wheat toast flavor, slightly nutty, a touch sweet. Nice sparkle. Has a mild tangy finish that lingers.
This is darker than I expected for a hefeweizen, but still light. Nice citrus flavors come through, and pours with a moderate head.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 Drank this at Italian restaurant in Switzerland - why not all Swiss one could ask. Good weizen, nice aroma and fesh taste.

500ml bottle at Come Back Inn.  Pours a rather deep brown-orange.  Mellow banana clove aroma.  Sweet, but very centered in its malt foundation.  medium bodied, somewhat watery.  Somewhat dulled and sublime, Ale fruitness with some mellowed lager tones as well.  Straightforward, quality example, but maybe not as yeasty as youd like for the style.  A good beer.

Bottle 500 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours dark hazy orange with a big orange-white head. Aroma: Cereal, citrus, fruits. Taste: Banana, cereal, sweet spices, clove. Banana aftertaste. A bit watery. Overall: Refreshing wheat beer.

Pours a hazy, pale copper with copious white head.  Faint yeast esters, light banana, citrus and a little vanilla.  Fairly watery hegemony flavor of light yeast, and citrus with some carbonic acidity.  Lightly dry and with little residual flavor.

Pours with a nice foamy head and a slightly hazy ochre/copper hue with great tiny rising bubbles.  Aromas of clove wheat bread and a hint of bubblegum.  The taste is always moving starts full and wheaty but rides the banana clove on the finish. Its enjoyable on a couple levels... first you get the very full mouthfeel of flavors but it finishes a bit off dry with a pleasant lingering clove type finish ! Great Spring Beer
Muddy amber brown, foamy off white head lingers. Yeasty wit aroma and taste, some clove, banana, caramel and citrus. Lively carbonation. Sours as it finishes. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Bottle. A solid hefe. Banana, cloves and  bubblegum etc. Doesnt stand out from its peers.
Smells like banana with some slight astringency, bitterness.  Theres a little citrus in here and a heavy wheat smell.  Murky blond color, soft carbonation and easy to drink.  Full palate. Bottle
NIce crisp beer with banana, clove and bubble gum flavors.  There is no apparent bitterness and a smooth, semisweet finish.  Nice beer...one I could have many of at once
A light brown with a crisp head that has champagne bubbles to give off aromas of yeast and lightly toasted malts.  The crispness of the finish lingers with a clean aftertaste.

bottle poured into wheat glass

a: hazy pale straw yellow color. Nice thick head with excellent retention

s: yeast esters

t: wheat, clove

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, bottled 4/26/2011.  Pours hazy golden orange color with a nice 2-3 finger fairly dense off white head with great retention that reduces to a thic cap that lingers.  Some decent lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up.  Aromas of big banana, clove, citrus, pepper, bubblegum, bready wheat, and yeast spices.  Nice and well balanced aromas, with good complexity.  Taste of big banana, clove, pepper, citrus, bubblegum, wheat, and yeast spices.  Lingering notes of citrus, banana, pepper, and clove on the finish for a bit.  Nice balance of flavors.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a fairly creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  Very smooth and drinkable, with no alcohol presence noticed at all as expected.  Overall this is an excellent and drinkable hefeweizen.  Nice complexity and great balance.

Pours cloudy gold with a big head of larger bubbles. Aroma is floral/grassy hops which I was not at all expecting from this style along with the classic banana. Mouth feel is lively with a lot of carbonation. The flavor is unique with a mango like presence along with more hops than is normal for a Weizen Bock. Somehow it seems to work pretty well. Thou I dont think Ill be making this a regular, Im glad to have tried it. Be sure to mix the yeast well, it makes all the difference in the world.

Fantastic. The nose is bread and clove. The appearance is a hazy copper with a white disappearing head.  The taste is bread, clove, and a touch of bitter to round out the dense maltiness.  The palate is clean and refreshing. Tasty.
I drank this beer a while ago. Ill update this ratin if I have the chance to drink it again.

Bottle from Fristo Getränke-Markt, Stuttgart. Dark mahogany color with huge white head. Aroma of banana, apple, clove. Taste, banana, orange, orange zest, clove, light bitterness in background. Bittersweet finish. Good.
BOTTLE. Malt, clove, banana, wheat. Well balanced. Very drinkable.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and its not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!

Die Farbe des Weizens erinnert doch sehr an ein Colabier...Die Blume ist mittelporig und zerfällt sehr schnell. Geschmacklich hauts mich jetzt nicht unbedingt vom Hocker. Sehr hoher CO2-Gehalt, sehr bitteres Aroma. Zum Mittelteil wirds zwar angenehmener, aber dieses zitronenartige is einfach nicht meins...

Very nice large head and a foggy-gold body. Soft aroma of detergent, hops, fruity esters. Flavour is a solid mix of hops and citrus notes with a medium finish. Far less cloying than most hefeweizens, and thats a good thing.

0,5l bottle from Sörspecialista, Budapest. Beautiful cloudy dark brownish orange color with huge white pillowy head. Classic but very intensive weissbier aroma with citrus, fruits. Fresh wheat malty and a bit yeasty aroma. Light dry taste with biting carbonation. Light body with creamy texture. Long citrus yeasty finish with a little banana. This is one of the best weissbier Ive ever tasted. Very delicious, more intensive and more pleasent than other weissbiers. Very refereshing and light, though it makes a great impression.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, one of the greatest weisse beers, nice fruity aromas, good finsh on palate and leave pleasure just behind..

coffee, caramel, resin, citrus, basement aromas, earthy, cooked vegetables, vanilla, cough drop, amber, sparkling, brown foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, full body, slick feel, flat, long finish, bitter,
Bottle. Solid Hefeweizen. Medium body and carbonation. Good mix of hefe flavors with a bit of a sour finish. Smooth and tasty.

Schneider Weisse TAP7 from bottle.Pours unfiltered really cloudy yeasty dark orange impenetrable with big chunks of yeast at the bottom. Well developed creamy head. Aroma vivid banana, vanilla fruity yogurt smell with papery yeast. Taste is mouthful with over medium carbonation and texture. Further taste yeasty, wheat and malt sweetness well balanced with citrus sourness. It is fine wheat beer, with well balanced nuances. It looks like more dunkel Weisse , because of really cloudy yeasty substrate in the beer.

Bottle. Pours bright amber with a big off-white head, some retention/little lace. Aroma of banana, apple, clove, fruity esters, floral hops. Taste is lightly grassy/floral, banana, clove, apple. Palate is soft, clean, light-medium body, fruity finish.

Pours a slightly cloudy dark golden, amber, brownish color.  Aroma is of yeast, clove, some banana, floral, and a little nutmeg.  Flavor is of yeast, earthiness, clove, malts, and a little citrus.  Nice round flavor.  Leaves a clovey and yeast finish.  Im usually not a fan of this style, but this is really good stuff!
From bottle. Cloudy with big white head. Banana and cloves etc. Hefeschteifens, youve had one, youve had them all

Hard to believe I havent yet rated these classic German Hefeweizens.  This one was unusual looking for the style, very dark orange/amber.  A slight haze, a thick head.    Floral notes along with cloves and other spiciness.  Spicy palate, a bit light, very little banana, a bit of caramel.  Nice and different but still excellent in the German way.

Bottle. Cloudy orange amber color with a white head. The nose is sweet, some clove, some banana, light malts. The taste is moderately sweet, clean, malt-driven. The palate is medium, the carbonation lively. Overall, a nice hefe.
Bottle. Cloudy brown yellow with white head. Banana and clove et. Hefe. A good one.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

A: Hazy dark caramel color with a very lively pour. Be careful because this foams up. The foam is easily 2 fingers which slowly dissipates to a 1/2 finger foamy head.

S: Banana bread smell with clove hints. 

T: Sweet banana foretaste that is very pleasing that leads to a nice clean wheat taste and leaves a banana bread aftertaste.

M: Medium carbonated almost full bodied beer, very pleasant going down.

O: Im enjoying this very much, very bold in flavors and easy to go down. Well worth every penny.
Bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale brown with a thick white head.  Aroma of candi sugar and clove.  Sweet vanilla and clove taste with some banana notes on the finish.  Bready.

50cl bottle. Pours a cloudy toffee brown with steady carbonation and a huge head. The nose has creamy banana and some vanilla. The taste is vanilla cream and bananas. The palate is medium boded, a nice thick creamy texture and a eefreshing finish. Overall, a terrific example of a creamy weizen,
Bière de blé intéressante à couleur attrayante et bonne effervescente.  Cest une bière moyenne dans tous ses aspects et qui à mon goût manque de corps.  Cest quand même léger comme produit.

50cl bottle 2 weeks over the best before date.
Decent creamy white head.  Hazy amber pour.  refreshing.

Amber/brown and hazy with a nice head. nice aroma of bananas and yeast. tastes also like banana/yeast and a bit clove too. full body and lively carbonization. a decent bitterness and some citrus in there too. nice.
Bottle.  Dark amber pour.  Aroma of banana, apple, and nutmeg.  Taste of sweet bubble gum and some green apple that leads to a sour finish.  Medium carbonation. Medium body.

Otra weisse muuy buena,color ambar oscuro tiene el tipico olor de una weizen,al paladar es bien carbonica y aromatica. Suave y muy agradable,banana y ligeros citricos la hacen sumamente agradable al paladar,muy recomendada
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
Awesome beer - all banana and a huge nose which goes through to the mouthfeel. Gear stuff

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2015 50 cl bottle @ home as ?Schneider Weisse TAP7 Unser Original?, BBE 16.01.2012
Rather dark colour for a hefeweizen. Aroma is surprisingly light with some banana esthers. Flavour has some ripe banana, some wheat and hints of spices and yeast. Palate is too high on CO2. Should be more rich, maybe the bottle was just too old?

Draught @ Sivukirjasto
Fresh and better, finish is slightly vichy-like though. Harsh score estimate: 3.6.

50 cl bottle. Bottled 16.05.2011. BBE 16.01.2012.
Pours hazy copper colour with small head. Aroma of apricot, wheat, yeast, light caramel, nuts and light citrus. Flavour of citrus, apricot, wheat, toffee and spices. Medium carbonation, somewhat stuffy.
4324

500 ml bottle as "Tap 7 Unser Original". BBE 16.01.2012.
Pours a deep amber colour with a small white head. Aroma of wheat, light hops and some fruitiness. Flavour of sweetish malts, wheat, light fruits, caramel and some floral notes. Medium bodied, quite foamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes sweet with malts and some fruits. Well balanced and I really like the floral notes here. A Hefeweizen done well.

lightly hazy golden amber white head, not much retention, no lacing... malty banana wheaty yeasty, modest carbonation medium body, a little heavier body but the yeast is less noticeable than in many hefes... big flavor the darker malt provides a depth of flavor, medium spice deftly balanced... a top notch hefe...
Poured darker than expected with a decent head.  Aroma of yest, nutmegn and clove.  Tasted about the same with a nice yeast and clove finish.  Better than expected Hefe.

30-SEP-2011, bottle @Ulkløbben @Morten. Tasted blind.
Brown with lasting off-white head.
Malty, yeasty, spicey.
Taste is the same with a citric sensation. A bit on the thin side, but wiht an OK carbonation.

Poured a amber color, medium full head.  Aroma of banana and spice.  Medium-light sweetness.  Med-light body, slick and slightly creamy texture.  Softer carbonation.  A milder tasting hefe.  Some lemon in taste as sell as banana tones and yeast.  Smooth going down.  Wish it had a smidge more flovor.  But good overall.

Draught:
Medium white head that disappears quick on top of a hazy dark orange to light brown colored beer.
Smell malts, corn, sweet, fruit, yeast, grains.
Taste is sweet of fruit, banana, tangerine, orange, malts, hint of caramel, yeast, hops and a nice low to medium bitterness.
Nice fruity medium bitter aftertaste.
Low carbo, medium body, soft almost silky mouthfeel and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: (Flasche in Weißbierglas  gefüllt) Es hat eine orange-braune Färbung, eine starke Hefetrübung und eine schöne weiße Schaumkrone.  Das Aroma ist leicht mazig und zudem stark hefig-würzig. Der prickelnde und leicht vollmundige Geschmack ist stark hefig mit einer hopfig würzigen Note im Hintergrund. Zusammenfassend ein leckeres Weißbier, mehr fürs Essen oder einen Abend denn für einen heißen Tag.

On tap serve in three times in a 50cl glass. Murky golden/ambar colour with white foam persistent and abundant. Smells to malt bread and butter with some hints of fruits. Wheat taste with sweet touches. On palate results a beer with medium carbonation citrics and buttery are present.From my point of view one of the best weisse Ive ever drink.

Pours a murky amber color with tall white head.  Aroma of dark fruit, spice and clove.  Taste - first impression was that it is much drier than I was expecting...judging by the appearance, I was expecting it to be richer and maltier.  This has a rather light mouthfeel with notes of wheat, dark cherry and clove.  Prickly carbonation.  This reminds me of a lighter dunkel.  Unique and highly drinkable.  I like it.

On tap at Milltown, Carrboro. Another one Ive enjoyed many times but havent yet scribbled down. Fairly dark pour for the basic style, but handsome and earthy looking in the long-stem. Nice head crackles along for the duration, and the nose is ripe and inviting. Fruity, dry, and bitter at the outset, the beer transforms considerably as you get into it, first into a mellow bready poster child for the Reinheitsgebot, then into a strange amalgam of tealike bitters and an almost ESB vibe. Pretty damn good overall, multiple personalities and all.

50cl bottle. Deep reddish-brown pour with a short, white head. Aroma is bready and malty with a tart nose at the end. The taste is quite light but hoppy... perhaps a bit of rye here? The finish is full... that surprises me after the initial light taste. Great tangy bite at the back of the mouth

500 mL bottle at home into a pint glass.  Dark brown with creamy head.  Roasted and wheaty aroma.  Nice roasted malt/sugar taste with a bit of wheat.  Very nice on the palate.  Just a hint of sourness at the end of a sip.

Vorab: die hohen Erwartungen wurden erfüllt. 
Ein sehr dunkles HW mit kräftiger Schaumentwicklung. 
Der Geruch gibt sich fruchtig mit Nuancen von Kiefernharz. 
Fruchtiger Geschmack, leicht rauchig. Herbe und Süffigkeit in der richtigen Dosierung runden dieses HW gelungen ab. 
Schneider Weisse Original ist eine Bereicherung der Bierlandschaft und sollte man probiert haben.Test vom 26.12.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Pours darker than a typical hefe-weizen.  Sweet nose with banana, clove, and maybe a little bubblegum.  Flavor is sweet but balance with some aggressive carbonation and a dry finish.  Another great beer from Schneider.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2012 Hazy amber color with a fine head. Sweet malty  and banana taste and arom. Delicious..
50cl bottle as Tap7. Dark orange/amber color, with a lasting tall head. Fruity aroma with hints of olive (?!). Full bodied, a bit oily, dry and sour aftertaste.

Profondément trouble, couleur sirop dérable foncé. Clou de girofle et pomme verte en arôme, la levure est assez présente. Au goût, même chose avec une finale sûr. Bonne corpulence. Pour une petite bière (5.4%), ne se boit pas si facilement.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy amber color with a thick, dense, white head.  Great head retention.  The nose is has a thick note of wheat, yeast, and some clove.  This flavorful brew has a lot to offer.  The flavor mirrors the nose with lots of yeast, wheat, and touch of spice including clove.  There is a bit of sweetness on the front, but a great dryness on the back.  Smooth from start to finish.  Light to medium body with softer carbonation and a short to medium, slightly fruity and spicy finish.  A gold standard thats a must try.

One of my first experiences of this type of beer, the sourness is evident, maybe too much so, my Dad thought it was off! Very clean though, full bodied and drinkable. Fruity with the aroma of apple, a nice beer.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from The French Cellar.  Not sure how old the bottle was.  I didnt care for the aroma.  There was some cardboard, yeast, and apple.  Appearance is cloudy and brown with a thin off white head.  Fine bubbles make up the carbonation.  After getting by the aroma though, this was a pretty  light and refreshing beer.  The beginning is a bit spicy and there is a bit of an apple/pear flavor with a crisp finish.

0,5 l.  bottle. Cloudy, dark amber colour with a dense, medium sized head, that slowly fades. Powerfull aroma of banana, yeasts, clove and apples. Lightly bitter taste with a pleasent sour-lemon, long lasting finish. Medium body with a slick body, soft carbonation. Very refreshing hefeweisen!

Pours dark cloudy amber.  Aroma is spice and some fruity and bready yeast.  Taste is bready malt with clove and some banana.  A nice fruity sourness sneaks in on the finish.   Mouthfeel is a bit chewy yet dry and refreshing.  Very tasty and enjoyable.
Hazy orange with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana, yeasty and cloves. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Sweet and light acidic finish. Soft and smooth. 210210
Bottle in Germany. An excellent hefeweizen. One of my absolute favourites in this style.
Very balanced between the wheat and the bananas.  A very good hefe, well-made.
Not the worst weizen Ive ever had (thank God for that) but still not very good. Average I would say.

Bottle into Chimay glass. 

Aroma: Malts, banana, cloves, green apples, some sweetness and some sourness too. Some complexity but a little weak...you really have to sniff. 

Appearance: Cloudy bronze color, small slight off white head. Hefeweizens typically dont look that appetizing to me, but thats probably because Im using the wrong glass. 

Taste: Wheat, slight apple and banana, a little sourness and very faint vegetal notes.

Palate: Quite carbonated, very crisp, light and like the blurb here says, fresh and clean. Light bodied, kinda thin, balanced, and the alcohol is not detectable. Fuckin A. 

Overall: A beer I drink every once in a while because its tasty, very refreshing and priced fairly...funny how I hadnt rated it until now. Finding it on sale for next to nothing was even better!
Great weizen with a soft taste. This is probably the first time a great weizen feels like a disappointment. It may have something to do that Aventinus was in the back of my head when tasting this.

dark amber, unfiltered very murky. nose full of ripe banana. full body. something citrusy, good aroma. slightly dry finish with a delicate bitterness. whole would not fine enough. 

ambrata scura, non filtrata molto torbida. naso pieno di banana matura. corpo pieno. qualcosa di agrumoso, buona aromaticità. leggermente secca con finale delicato di amaro. nellinsieme non abbastanza fine.

Pours a cloudy and unusually dark amber colour with a fine although short lived head. Aroma is quite wheaty with notes of bananas cloves and spices. Taste is also wheaty with some citrus and bananas. Full bodied. Quite a nice Hefeweizen and I love the dark colour.

It pours a dark golden body with a very small, off-white head. The nose is perhaps banana, some citrus and wheat. Quite thin body. The flavor has a little citrus note, some wheat and a weak bitterness. Short slightly bitter finish.
Fruity aroma with hints of citrus and yeast. Taste i the same, fruity, citrus and yeast. Slightly sweet aftertaste with som yeast bitterness. A good beer!

12/07/2011 50cl bottle @ home - bottled: 10/1/11, BB: 10/09/11 (2011-321) 
Very cloudy dark amber to murky brown beer, creamy light beige head, pretty stable and adhesive. Aroma: lots of banana, sweet malts, lots of spices, bit of caramel and toffee. MF: a lot of carbon, but ok. Full body but light finish. Taste: banana peel first, then malts, grassy, bread and fruity. Caramel with a citrus touch in the end. Aftertaste: citrus and a bit of hops. Very refreshing.

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Meglepően sötét árnyalatú narancs színe van, piszkosfehér habja igen tömör, hatalmas és baromi kitartó. Illatában van egy kis extra mézes édesség, narancshéj, banán és élesztő. Igazán telt íze van, banán, citrusfélék, élesztő és fűszerek pikáns kombinációja érződik némi keserű komlóval egyetemben. Száraz, közepesen testes és élénken szénsavas. Igazi frissítő nyalánkság.

Tap 7 bottle at, bizarrely, Vienna Zoo! Deep brown copper pour with a good amount of white head. Nose is light banana and clove, subtle but definitely a hefe. Palate is very refreshing - slightly sour, ester, slight banana, strong pepper note too. Finish is fizzy, yeasty, crisp and smooth. Very nice. 7 4 6 4 17
