UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 50 cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Moeder Lambic: hazy amber/brown with a white fluffy head & some lacing, smell is wheat & spice + slightly sour, body & taste is very creamy with lots of wheat plus some yeast, light aftertaste of spices and an all around presence of baked bananas, malt-like character & very slightly tart, nice /// Tried an aged one of these, about 1.5 years old, interesting, heavy wheat, oddly evolved, banana is gone,... Rating is obviously for the fresh draft one. /////////////////////// 0.5 littre darft @ Chez Moeder Lambiek Fontainas. Super heavy banana, bubblegum is light, balanced creamy wheat. 3.7 -> 4.2. Very easy to drink.

50cl bottle. Poured hazy mahogany color with a frothy, lacing white head. Aroma is wheat and clove. Flavor is wheat, banana and some spicy notes. Maybe slightly sour towards the end. Enjoyable hefeweizen.
I do love the mouthfeel of this beer. I do not like this style (always a bit too candy-sweet in smell and taste). This one is no different. But the mouthfeel is very nice.
One of the better wheat beers, fresh and full bodied its amber mahogany colour looks amazing in the glass.

Aroma of clove/ banana/ gum/ brown sugar and some nutmeg. Appearance is copper gold with thin white head. Flavor starts out with sweet clove/banana/gum with brown sugar sweetness and a slight herbal finish. Palate is quite bubbly and frothy. Great stuff.

Pours much darker than expected. Fairly dark reddish-amber with no head. Very fruity and yeasty aroma of clove, bubblegum, banana, plums, and some sour citrus and cider smells. Taste is less fruity, lots of yeasty and wheat flavors, slightly sweet and with a small hint of alcohol and a minute finishing hop presence. Medium bodied and leaning toward flat, though it isnt so. Its a bit weak overall for what I was expecting, but still a solid hefe.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Partially hazy dark yellow with a generous off-white head. Banana, yeast, grains, hint of citrus, Nice carbonation, bit of maltiness, nice balance between sweet and bitter although not much of a finish. Very good heffe and very drinkable.

Pours a little darker than expected, an auburn / brown color with gray fizzy head which soon disappears. Aroma of banana, wheat, yeast, clove. Sweet carbonated bite of good wheat, lightly spiced, which sours a bit, to notes of lemon on the finish. This is very simple, but a remarkable rendition of the style, all the simple flavors done perfectly.

Was very much looking forward to this. Pours much darker than a normal wheat beer - muddy brown. Aroma is sweet grain and yeast. Flavor is sweet fruit and yeast. Very complex for the style. I really like it.

Brown yellow hazy colour, firm fluffy white head. Aroma is very light, bit of malts, some yeast, somewhat sour, the characteristic banana is there only in the faintest of backgrounds. Flavour is mostly malty. Some yeast tones, sweetish and some light hops bitterness. More pronounced banana but still much more in the background than with other Hefeweizen. Slightly tart and very refreshing, albeit a bit thin in flavour.
(From 0,5cL bottle)
Bottle at home. Fruity aroma with banana. Cloudy dark amber with little yeast floaties. Nice thick head. Average carbonation. Taste is malty with medium body.
This beer is extremely attractive. Its a perfect balance of smooth drinkability with malty complexity. The clove and bananas you normal see in german beer is there. Just soooo smooth. I love it!

500mL bottle - Pours hazy apple cider with a small fluffy off-white head. The nose is really fruity, with apple and banana taking center state, along with a bit of honey and some baking spice. Light skunked smell. Taste is less fruity up front--more mineral, alcohol bite, and a bit of sweetness. Yeasty finish with either a sharp hop bite or more alcohol. Weird--this is only 5.4%. Wasnt as impressed with this as I thought Id be.

An unusually dark-hued Hefeweizen, at least for my experiences.  Is very typical for the style, dark banana meat (pulp?) with clove, the spice is a little more powerful.  Lacks some of the wheat sweetness I like in the style, but overall very tasty.

Again, I really like unfiltered beer so this does it for me. Cloudy caramel in colour. This is a beer for a hot summers day. Lower alcohol does make it refreshing. Medium sweet and lively carbo creates a nice mouthfeel. A really good Bavarian beer. Ill drink it again.

Macarthurs, Beverages, DC 500ml ($4): Pours a light brown (very dark for a hefe), with a large quickly dissipating head; also there is sediment at the bottom. Aroma of cloves, banana, yeast, and some other fruit. Slightly sour. Good body, as a result of the good malt backbone. Somewhat sweet. Hop notes are present in there as well. This bottle might be a little bit old, but I still think  that it is an excellent hefeweizen, and makes me wonder why I usually steer clear of the style.
Tap at Kafe België, Utrecht: Hazy dark amber coloured brew with an malty taste and hints of banana.
Orange coloured, head should some longer. Yeast, wheats, fruity, caramel. Nice carbonated, pretty sweet. Pretty good one.
A bit sour and fruity green apple, which is not always apparent in the style.  Classic hefe.
Pours lehigh brown with a big fluffy head that rapidly disappears. Big aroma fuel of estery yeasty clove and fruit smells. Taste is a bit dry with a hint if banana. Finishes clean and crisp.

Pour copper to amber brown beige head great lace. Aroma clove, pepper, bubble gum, banana. Taste clove, pepper, spicy yeast, banana, bubble gum, MF medium body solid carb. Quite tasty very easy to drink.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2012 Bottle @ home. Fairly hazy orange appearance with an off white head. Bready, banana, clove, light yeast, wheat nose. Slightly spicy, big banana, clove, yeasty, sweet wheat malty flavor. Yeasty finish. Unique compared to other Munich Weizenbiers but not one of my lesser favorites though still very good. Update: tap @ Schneider Kelheim. Very nice, a bit floral, banana, lightly toasty aroma. Slightly chewy, bubblegum, rich banana flavor. So much better than the old bottles I get in Colorado. A really fantastic weissbier.
Aroma of nutmeg and sour apple.  Appears opaque and sepia in color with a big fluffy head.  Tastes of apple, sourdough with a hint of bleach.  Great aftertaste and a great weisse.
Amber colour with a huge white head. Aroma is roasted malt and some banana. Flavor is roasted malt, banana and caramel. Heavy sweet palate. This hefeweizen is awesome.

Bottle. Cloudy amber body, thick dissipating to medium off-white head. Nose of banana and clove with dusty, earthy yeast and tangy, grassy wheat. Bitter, tangy body with biting esters (clove and banana) and grassy, grainy wheat. Lots of chewy, spicy, bubblegummy goodness follows the initial acidity. Nice.

Bottle picked up at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a weizen glass.

Pours yellow-golden to bronze in color with a huge white eggshell head. Incredible retention on the super-thick head. The nose has a good yeast presence plus a bit of backing malt. The taste lays off quite a bit and there is mild yeastiness with some spice and a bit of banana. The malt simply takes over too much. There is a slight sweetness there as well. Body is medium with moderate carbonation. The clove comes through more in the finish. Pretty good and certainly easy drinking.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-08-2011

Bottle (500ml): Your usual German wheat beer smell here with a nice coriander & clove smell with a hint of citrus on the nose. Not as strong as some hefeweizens but quiet pleasant. A cloudy light amber colour that almost borders on an orange colour.Like most good hefeweizens it has a large, fluffy white head that has excellent retention. It looks excellent. Very smooth and medium bodied, going down rather well as expected. The only slight down side is that the carbonation is perhaps a little high. Very nice overall although there is definitely much nice, cheaper hefeweizens out there to be had. I enjoyed this one but not overly & probably wouldnt buy it again, simply because I prefer other beers in this style a little more. - - - abarwithnoname,wordpress.com

Copper brown hazy body with big off-white head. Surprising! Heavy yeasty aroma with hazelnuts, dark bread and toasty, maybe leather. Full on fatty taste with lots of flavour thanks to a well balanced bitterness. Although it isnt as fresh or citrussy as a lot of German hefeweizen I certainly like it. Texture is spot on. Well brewed wheat beer for sure. (2,95 EUR?, 50cl bottle)

Bottle. Pours  a tawny gold colour witj a good white head. The aroma is banana bread, cloves, coriander and some other spice notes. The taste is  banana, cloves, and some ginger, with a good dry finish.

Bottle. Fruity aroma with banana and some over ripe apple scents. Cloudy dark amber with little yeast floaties. Nice thick head. Very soft carbonation. Taste is fruity with light/medium body. Very good for the style.
Pours a hazy amber.  A little citrus aroma.  Great spicy wheat flavor, finishes very clean leaving you wanting more.  A very refreshing hefeweizen.

Appearance:  dark amber and mahogany, almost a dunkelweizen color, nice creamy head.   Aroma:  typical HW--wheat and citrus and clove, hint of bubblegum.   Taste:  midway between a traditional HW and a dunkel; slightly toasted, very creamy.   Finish:  short, wheaty and crisp.    Notes:   Solid HW.  Seemed to be a little darker and fuller-bodied than your typical example, but was nonetheless extremely refreshing.
Had with Hungarian barbecue (rich, fatty pork) and it was the perfect beer for it.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2012 Beautiful cloudy dark orange body with a big white head. Great aroma of wheat, banana and chocolate. Taste is a bit sweet, with wheat and fruity. (9/5/8/5/18)
Dark copper body with a white head. Great aroma with wheat, banana and lots of vanilla, with a hint of chocolate as well. Great yeasty flavour with wheat, banana and fruits.
Hazey amber with a soft white head.  Clove-spice aroma.  Lighter wheat beer with apple and clove notes.
slightly hazy amber with a big off white long lasting foam head. reminds me of an ale but with the acidic citrusy flavour.

500mL bottle.  Poured hazy, deeper golden with a tall, fluffy whitish head.  The aroma picked up sweet, yet toasty bananas, vanilla, and a touch of cloves over a soft bread and wheaty backing.. really pleasant stuff.  The flavor found banana and vanilla again, this time picking up nutmeg to go along with the cloves.. wheat and lemon tartness surrounded and carried through the finish.. well-balanced and very tasty.  Light-medium bodied and very well carbonated on the palate.. a bit too sweet, but certainly drinkable and enjoyable.
Al naso è sopratutto grano e lievito, poca banana. Al palato è molto secca, poco dolce con note di pane e floreali. Discreta.

Cloudy brown amber with a big and lasting white head. Aroma dominated by clove and other spicy phenols, with some banana and bread crust too. Sweet spicy and fruity flavour with a hint of raw cereal. High carbonation
weisse aroma,golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

A: Poured from a half liter bottle, the beer is strangely colored for a hefeweizen. Almost copper in color with a finger of soapy white head.

S: Rather heavy on the spice notes, mostly clove, with a bit of bubblegum to it. The banana is not super strong, but it is there and is sweet. A moderate breadiness, but not all that malty.

T: Sweet, but moderate in strength, banana flavors are present up front. Clove provides plenty of spice and is the bulk of the flavor here. Some decent bread and wheat, but, like the nose, not super heavy on the malt.

M: Medium in body with a moderate level of carbonation.

D: A good hefeweizen, but not one of my favorites. Easy enough to drink, of course.
Heavy taste and smell of bananas, pours slightly darker than other weiss biers and has the colour of urinary tract infection piss, but if you can get over that the taste is certainly above average

(Bottle 0,5l)
Banana, light vanila, light sweet, typical wheat aroma. Cloudy goden color (dark for weizen beer). All time creamy white head. Light sweet, light sour. Fizzy. Sticky, creamy texture. Medium body. Light astringent finish.

Its my favorite beer. Can drink so easy, tasty, (sometimes many :-D) as I want - never felt bad the next day. Not a headache beer! I dont know what makes the special taste of the Schneider Original - but if you like Weißbier you will love Schneider Weiße!!
Bottle. Pours medium head that slowly fades. Aroma of banana much stronger than the taste. I would like to grab a few more bottles of this.
Decent offering, pretty light, but the crispy flavours from the wheat, roll off the tongue as you drink this one, I would have it again
very well done a wheat beer. it had a sparkling apple finish that left almost a sour/tarte taste in your mouth. would love to get more of this.
Darker than most, it is murky brown, nice lemon, clove, tangy. Jsut a solid natural Hefeweizen.

Schneider Weisse is relatively common in the U.S. as they have been exporting since the early 1990s. Because so many people were introduced to weissbier with one of the blonde versions they often mistakenly refer to Schneider as a "Dunkelweiss," when it is actually an "Original" weissbier. This style is rather common among the smaller, traditional weissbier breweries in Bavaria, all of which are based loosely on Schneiders version.

It pours deep amber or light brown in color, with a bouquet full of expected banana and clove aromas. The initial sip is sweet and full, with a rounded and soft body, containing hints of earthy fruitiness. The finish is relatively clean. The head is creamy, but with larger bubbles than some versions and it does not hold as well as it does when fresh. I find that it takes a few sips of weissbier to truly get the palate adjusted. Once you get the idea, however, it leaves the tongue asking for more.

Original is a very consistent brew and holds up relatively well as an import (as opposed to many lighter weissbiers, which can become sour and tangy if incorrectly stored) and would never be a bad choice in my book. Im happy to give it a very solid score and only a slight lack of complexity relative to some of its micro-cousins prevents this from earning top numbers over the board.

Serving type: bottle

Maybe a little age on this 1 pint 9 oz. bottle. After gently rolling, it poured a hazed, deep orange/amber to my Czech-pils glass. Displayed a good deal of rising, bubbly effervescence, abundant, mousse-like, off white head foam, and clingy ribbons, dots & dashes of lacing. The aroma was light yeast and some grain, a little tartness, light banana, but more, almost overly ripe apple and spice, and a bit of sweetness. The flavor added just a touch of hop bitterness, lively carbonation, and a spritzy crispness, in a medium body. Still held on for some flavorful sessionability.
Bière de blé trouble, de couleur noisette, laissant un dépôt de levure au verre.  Col mousseux, dun blanc cassé.  Arôme de feuilles et de fleurs.  Très peu acide pour une bière de blé.
Very nice color.  Aromas are strong and breadish. Deep body and strong but not overpowering flavor.  Very complex for this style beautiful weisse beir.

Per me la miglior weisse al mondo, eccezionale, ottima, fresca e gustosa. 
La Schneider non sbaglia un colpo, a parte per la kristal che personalmente odio come genere.

500ml bottle, Innisfil, Ontario. 
Dark, hazy pour - not what I was expecting. Very murky, brown-yellow. Big head. Great aroma - Banana, orange, a little caramel. Proto German in a good way - smooth. Bananas, refined cloves, maybe even some bubblegum. Sweet, sweet, sweet through to the finish! A really nice hefe, but not my all-time favorite. Certainly
Pours a hazy Orange color with a longlasting white head. Has a wheat malty banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty banana flavor. Has a nive refreshing wheat malty finish.
Ruskea, samea olut ja runsaasti vaahtoa. Tuoksussa on banaania, vehnää ja hieman mausteita. Maultaan samaa. Aika perusalueella liikutaan tämän oluen osalta.

22/01 At Glockl Brau, Graz, I wrote in my notes draught, but obviously they just pour it from the 0.33 l bottle. Anyhow, it had very hazy dark yellow, almost brown body with big head. Banana, orange and some caramel in aroma. Very nice flavor, typical german wheat - banana, bubblegum, cloves. Bit sweet, less sour, balanced and pleasant. Full and cloying body with long sweetish fruity and banana finish. A great Hefeweizen indeed, although not even nearly the best I had.

pours an amber/orange...almost the color of a dunkel weisse...with a huge, foamy white head...lively looking!  decent lacing and retention.    aroma has nice clove, a hint of bubblegum, and a touch of fruitiness...like cider.  flavor is yeasty...spicy with more than average wheatiness and a tangy, spicy finish that lingers nicely.  mouthfeel is very lively.  great example of the style.

A - full and shining gold color. Lighter on the bottom of the bottle and darker on the top - exceptional.
S - refreshing smell - most of bananas, maybe fried bananas or candied and a little bit of cinnamon. 
T - starts with nice banana, followed by clove and ends again with bananas
M - medium body with medium carbonation
D - very much drinkable! dangerous! :)

Surprised that I had not rated this one before.  It was offered on tap at Docks Oyster House in Atlantic City, NJ when I visited there this weekend.  It was by far the best option on their menu, so it was an easy choice to order this one.  The keg kicked halfway through my first pour, which meant that I had to drink mine from a freshly tapped keg :).  And, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they offered the same beer in 20 oz. bottles at Steve & Cookies by the shore in Margate, when we had dinner there on Saturday night.  I always love it when you experience a great beer for the first time and it is accompanied by a great time.  Anyway, the beer itself - heavy banana and sweet bread aromas.  Pour is a cloudy caramel color with a tan head.  Taste of banana and sweet malt with a full but very enjoyable mouthfeel.  This is one of those beers that I am already looking forward to enjoying again.

From bottle at Glöckl Bräu, Graz, where you dont get to see the bottle itself, but hey, Im sure they have good reasons for that. Opaque dark amber body with a thick white head that went away slowly. Orange rind and spices in the nose, quite nice. The taste holds the level more or les, slightly acidic and drinkable. Notes of banana, some light chewed up bubblegum, sweetish and balanced. All in all, a damn tasty wheat!

500ml bottle sample purchased at the LCBO. Pours a dark cider like colour, with a large white head that recedes to a small ring. no real lacing to speak of. Aroma is of sweet hops. Taste is hoppy, banana, bread, sweet and slightly bitter on the aftertaste. Very interesting and complex brew.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2011 Cloudy brown orange beer with nice creamy head.Sweat wheat malt smell,clove, yeast.Taste wheat malt,cloves,honey,light bitter,some banana,light acided,bread,a very light coffee thing.Nice and refreshing.
On tap @Schneider Weisse in Munich, Germany. Gold color, persistent froth, with a malt and fruity aroma. A little bit bitter. Very refreshing and spicy.

This poured an almost amber color, strange for a hefe, with a large white head. Aroma was of banana light clove and yeast. Flavor was a strong banana and light citrus, not nearly as much spice as the nose. OK.

500 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy, deep amber with hefty beige head - awesome!.  Fruits on the nose with a bit of spice.  The taste is classic, very well balanced and flavorful hefe-weizen.  Smooth at the finish.  Thick lacing throughout.  Once again, an awesome offering of the style from Schneider and Sohn - Prost!

Aroma of crisp fall apples and faint banana.  Quite dark for a hefeweizen - almost brown in color.  Cloudy haze from the suspended yeast.  Tastes like a German Hefeweizen should - banana, cloves, faint citrus, bread.  Very smooth and refreshing.  More character comes out as it warms.  Good beer.

Pours darker than other hefes Ive had. Aroma is of clove and yeasty. Tasted somewhat sour, which I wasnt expecting - but according to the description, is to be expected.

Not my favorite German hefe.
Light amber/orange, massive pillowy head, banana, clove, spice  and sweet wheaty yeast. Fairly full bodied and lots of character.
27th June 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Draft at Dusseldorf Airport! Dark wheat beer. Complex array of malty chocolate and banana. Sweet dry finish.
Colore dorato torbo classico dello stile con abbondante schiuma persistente. Aroma fruttato. In bocca però è decisamente meglio di altre weizen.
18.10.2004. 0,5l Bottle in Zurich. Yellow hazy colour with white head. Wheatmalty aroma with nice bitterness.

12 oz. bottle.  Dark amber pour, darker than the hefeweizens Ive had before.  More of a malty flavor as well.  Still has the great citrus and clove aroma and flavor.  Very well balanced.  Excellent beer.

Bottle. Poured a murkey red brown orange with a nice thick lasting white head. Nicely balanced and mellow aroma of banana, vanilla, toffee, and whats that...a slight memory of solvent abuse and thinners creeping in. Sounds bad but just lends it a touch of magic. Very easy to drink. A real winner in my eyes, glad I can get this every time in my local (ish) offy.
Pours a cloudy amber.  Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat and yeast.  Taste is very similar with some pineapple coming through oninitial taste.  Sweet with a a crisp finish.

Pours a foggy golden yellow with billowing white head, nose is standard hef esters, banana, clove, hint of honey. Taste is great, fairly dry for style, hint of lemon zest, bread, honey, clove, very drinkable.
An excellent brew.  Great balance, clean finish, as fine a weisse as there is.
pretty standard example of the style, though its no Paulaner. a little bland and watery, but still pretty good.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2010 Bottle from Peckhams. Spicy, yeasty, banana & bread aroma. Slightly hazy amber brown colour. Big flavour -  spices, banana, yeast. Well balanced. Good wheat beer.
Bottle. Thin banana aroma. Bread, wheat, banana, sugar with moderate carbonation. Aftertaste lingers a while. Nice weisse.

Bottle 0.5 L.
Hazy amber body, with a large, creamy, white head, mostly lasting with a good lacing.
Moderate-to-strong malty (cereals, grains) and yeasty (bread) aroma with an intense banana note and a bit fainter notes of orange and apple.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour.
Medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation, very light astringency in the finish.
Very satisfactory. Definitively one of my favorite weizens.

500ml bottle. Coppery teak colour with a distictive deep beige foam that forms a rocky head and quickly fades. Banana, clove and a faint hint of vanilla greet the nose while a smooth sweet flavour greets the tastebuds. Well balanced flavours allow you to ist and enjoy this and go back for more.

Draft @ Bishops Arms Gustav, Malmö. Pours a hazy Orange color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity wheat malty banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy finish.
Pours dark brown and has the aroma of bananas and floral.  Taste is also of bananas and citrus.  Has a unique taste from most Hefeweizens.  Great beer.

500ml bottle from the LCBO, poured into an Erdinger world cup weizenglass (from their gift set ;)).

Pours a very dark, opaque mahogany color with a foamy cream colored head.  Smells minimal:  bananas and wheat..  Tastes a little like acidic fruit, banana, and as others said and I agree with, it has a sour finish.  Medium to heavy mouthfeel, and many carbonation bubbles when you look into the glass.  

I have always enjoyed this weissbeer and tend to choose it over some of the others in the LCBO.  I like to switch it up, but this is always a solid choice in my books.

The earthy brown pour suggests that this is a bit different from your average hefeweizen. Instead of the usual banana esters you have apple and ginger, followed by bread and spices. Dark malts give it a bready dunkelweizen character. Nice balance. Not all that refreshing, but a good hefe for the winter months.

Bottle 50 cl from Mitra van Bergen. Label Tap 7.
Hazy dark golden to amber color, with a offwhite head. 
Aroma yeast, wheat, some lemon. 
Medium body. 
Taste lemon, yeast, and bit hopsbitter finish.
Light brown pour, white head.  For such a highly rated hefe, this one seems to be lacking in the flavor department.  Very, very mild hops, and herbal content.  Almost could call this a "light" hefe.
Orange brown pour with a white head. Weak aroma of grass and citrus. Flavor is dry with a bitter finish.
Lots of frothy foam that quickly recedes. Beautiful. Fruity aroma. The carbonation is a little less than desirable.

Bottle.  Pours hazy amber with a large, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), light hops (spicy), average esters (banana) with notes of wheat and ginger.  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), light hops (spicy), and average esters (banana) with notes of wheat and clove.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry finish.

500 ml. Bottle. Put into a Weizen glass. Pours dark amber with a fizzy white head that quickly diminishes to surface cover. Aroma is of banana, molasses, clove and caramel. Flavor is very similar but is a little more grainy, with the sweet fruitiness more subdued. Medium body with much carbonation and a long dry, bitter finish. A little lacing as I drank. Very nice, and almost perfectly balanced;  this one is very enjoyable. Worth every penny at $3.99 a bottle. Would buy this again.
Bottle tap 7. Hazy amber body with a large creme white head. Aroma is wheat, fruit banana. Flavor iswheat, fruit, orange and banana. Quite boring.

Recommended to try by Harrisoni (hey, that rhymes). Smells of bacon fat. Tastes of almonds, orange juice, sharp red fruit and hints of alcoholic wheat. Brown colour, soft mouth feel, quite fizzy. Tart red fruit short lived finish.

Great hefe.  I like the color mixed in the glass, cloudy redish,brown-gold.    Its got a slight fruity taste, a bit of honey, orange, bready, maltiness.  The trail on the palate is pleasing, not overwhelming.  Overall its a real treat, try it sometime.  I had to go to Munich to find this one, and I did only get one at a gas station, but I will run across it again. I liked it alot.
500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is yeasty, nuts and some lemon.  Some dull lemon followed with a lemon, yeasty finish.

Pours a dark amber with a small white head.  Aroma is a little stale, slightly roasted malt, caramel and a hint of coffee.  Taste is a slightly resiny malt backbone, not a whole lot of wheat taste.  Tastes more like a lager than a Hefe.  Good malted beer that I would drink more of but as a Hefe, it doesnt do it for me.
Grass and bananas. Dry palate. Earthy and yeasty. Not a fan of weissbiers, but this one is a classic.

A bit different from other hefeweizens but truly enjoyable.  Pours a cloudy dark orange with billowing head.  Aromas of banana, raisin, clove.  Theres more sweetness in this than in many of the style but its not cloying or sugary sweetness and its balanced with a spicy and funky yeastiness.  Drinkable.  Yum.

Bottle, pours a cloudy rich hazelnut brown towards the darker end of wheat.  Several fingers of light, stable foam.  Mixed sediment adds to a creamy foam that barely leaves the bottle.  Bright banana and clove and nut flavors lightened by effervescent body.  Light raisin and clove aromas.  Drinks very quickly.

Bottle.  Bottle. Deep amber-orange-brown..  murky, cloudy.. tastey. Lots of tropical fruit (banana, plantain). The body is fairly thin considering how dark the brew is and how deep the flavors are. This goes down very well indeed.

This bottle is labeled:" Schneider Weisse Tap 7 Unser Original". Poured into a mid-sized water glass impeding the ability to get a good head and see the yeast tailings. The head I did get disappeared right away after the first pouring and had no lace. Second pouring had better head, still no lace and settled out quick. Aroma is yeast, malt, a bit of spice, and citrus. Flavors like aroma with some nice sweet almost tart and a bit of bitter. Body is good but carbonations seem a bit low. Finish is like flavor and has a citrus character that  lasts a while. This bottle was cool only, maybe cellar temp. Believe it or not, the Schneider Origianal that I have at home is better than this! Much better.

Yellow-brown beer with medium and blond head. Aroma is pleasant, sourness and wheatish, yeast and some toffeeish sweetness. Flavour is slightly sour, wheat, some spicyness and hint of roastiness. Nice and smooth to drink even carbonation is high. Not most refreshning hefe, but tastefull, interesting and personal beer.

Bottle 50cl. A cloudy copper-orange beer with a very nice head and good lacing. Smell is very perfumes, smooth and banana like. Very creamy hefeweizen well balanced, with hints of lemon and cereal like. Good but less interesting than other products of the same brewery.

500ml Bottle. 5.4%. Pours a hazy, golden orange colour with a frothy, white head that fades fairly quickly to a foamy ring. Aroma is yeast, banana bread, and a floral whiff. Taste is very much a bready, banana flavour with a spicy/herbal note lingering into a smooth finish. Medium carbonation. Mouthfeel is clean and superb. Excellent.
Quite dark for a hefe-weizen.  Good head.  Lots of bubblegum along with lots of malt.  Really nice malt finish too.  A good one.

This was another of those "I cant believe I havent rated this" beers. Iced tea colored, which was pretty surprising. Tart, lemony aroma, with some wheaty notes, too. Flavor was citrusy, wheaty, and a little bit toasty. Not bad at all...

Bottle:  Pours an amber color, with a nice hefe style head. Flavors are citrus, clove, banana, yeast as one would expect. Mouthfeel is more full-bodied than Ive come to expect from a hefeweizen, though this isnt a bad thing. No, it is simply a little different. I enjoyed this brew overall.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 This was called "Tap 7" at the brewpub, not sure that its the same beer as this.  Either way, nice unfiltered, cloudy hefeweizen in a fun, boisterous atmosphere on a Sunday morning.  Very cloudy dark orange / brown.  Tons of spices, banana, and that nice yeast coming seeping through.  No bitterness to speak of, and quite dry.  liked a lot!

Had this in the US from a bottle.  More caramel and apple than I remember. Probably not a fresh as the sample I had in Germany, and definitely not quite as good.  Not bumping the rating down though.

Bottle - what stands out right away from all other traditional German hefes is the cloudy amber tint to the normal golden hue of the type. Mouthfeel seemed more substantial than other similar beers. carbonation present but not overpowering. Flavors of banana, citrus and yeasty earthiness are present. Quite different from other hefes but very smooth and easy to drink. Great character and overall a great hefe.

Dry clove aroma, some faint banana.  Spice forward.  Dark muddled brown, foggy with the swirled yeast poured in.  Toasty bread crust, cinnamon, herbal.  Overall seems mechanical.  Bubble gum sweetness.

Pours cloudy light brown, more like a dunkel. Good large head.
Nose shows nice bready wheat, soft cloves and definite banana. Pretty much spot on for the style, but somewhat faint.
Similar flavours, just a subtle. Nothing to say about the finish, it just fades away to nothing.
Watery body, but nice high carbonation.

Bottle, home. Really excellent head lacing, graet bubbly froffing white head, pretty poor golden orange colour, huge toffee and banana nose, taste banana; toffee, sweet malts, tough doughy yeast, some bubblegum and a nutty palate. A good wiessbier but bet this has been poorly kept. Will need to have this again.

Bottle. Pours a murky swamp like amber color, with a frothy off white head. Aroma is of bready malts, banana, wheat, spice and a slight caramelish aroma. Flavor is of over ripe banana, clove, doughy yeast and bready malts, apple along with a slightly tart/sour note. The body is medium, with a slightly dry mouthfeel, and a very heavy carbonation. Overall my favorite of the authentic German Hefe Weizens!

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 Rerate on 5/14/2013 - much better than I remember it. I must have been in a shitty mood that day too. Banana and clove flavors. Sweet and tangy finish. Spicy and yeasty. Color is cloudy amber. 

bottle in weisen glass - doh! Haste makes waste - I bought the wrong beer, but Ill rate it anyway.  Pours light amber in color with little head.  Smells of wheat - go figure!  Really light in flavor - to my surprise - and goes down light.  Sort of a skunky aftertaste.  Definitely makes me wish I had gotten the beer I meant (Schneider-Brooklyner weissen one).  bummer and I have another one.4/3/5/2/9 or 2.3 on 8/3/10

Pours a hazy amber with thick creamy beige head and foamy lacing.  Notes of wheat, citrus, and corriander as befitting the style.  Taste reflects aroma with a well balanced brew.  Smooth and sessionable.

Pours a cloudy brown color with a quickly diminishing head.  The aroma is nice with spices and earth.  There is a strong citrusy lemon in the aroma as well.  Lot of clove in the flavor wih a soft subtle flavor of citrus.  A bit of earthiness to it as well.  The finish is rather long and tart.

dough, dry malts and citrus on the nose, the color is dark amber/red, the feel is broad with a medium carb (really well-balanced) and the taste is ripe fruit, sweets, and a little alcohol. the bitterness in this brew is extremely late
Had in German beer garden in Wahlberg, TX.  Excellent atmosphere to enjoy this classic German hefe.  Nice even notes of mild citrus; even; beautiful looking pour and head.

Bottle at Bermuda Brau, Vienna. Pours unclear orange with a big frothy white head. Aroma has lots of citrus and banana, some weak clove. Taste is fresh and crisp, with a dominating banana, also a nice citrusy feel. Medium bodied. Very good hefe.

~light caramel and wheaty scent with maple syrup.
~Pours cloudy dark golden color with creamy lasting off white head.
~yeasty wheaty taste with light caramel notes and banana.
~med body, med CO2, sweet wheaty finish.
~Great wheat beer. Really like the caramel and syrupy notes.

On tap at the Lions pride. Pours a very cloudy amber/brown with pale head. Aroma is the classic wheat, banana and cloves. I prefer the taste even if there is a lot of similarities. I like the nice tangy banana/apple/citrus twist with bready malts.  Ive had the bottle a few times and the biggest improvement is on the palate. Full bodied, crisp and appropriate carbonation. A very decent wheat beer.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2010 Poured with a hazy, brown color and an off-white head. Syrupy, fruity aroma, a real dessert beer. Yeast, wheat, maple syrup, banana, clove dominate this delicious beer. Medium body with the right matching carbonation. Sweet, smooth, a delight on the palate, I really enjoyed this one.
Clear amber pour white head .... aroma of bready malts and yeast --banana and clove .... taste of bready malts and banana, clove with some bitter hops very well balanced and clean flavor

Tap at The Standard. Definitely one of the classic Hefes. Pours cloudy yellow with a bold, fluffy white head. Pleasant aroma of bread, with notes of wheat and yeast. Flavor has moderate sweetness with some banana, clove and more bread. Light to medium in body with lively carbonation and a smooth texture. Crisp and refreshing, the beer finishes with light sweetness and yeast. Delicious.

Une tête blanche savonneuse repose sur un liquide ambré brun.  Les arômes qui se dégagent sont typiques : on parle ici de blé, de banane et de citron, avec une levure qui respire le clou de girofle et le poivre.  Le goût est similaire mais davantage orienté vers les épices.  À lil et dans la bouche, le liquide produit des bulles qui sont notables et laisse une impression fraîcheur.  On peut facilement dire que le liquide est de densité moyenne à faible et quil offre une finale de notes surettes qui sont sans doute attribuables à son empreinte acidulée.

Bottle. Pours with a blooming white frothy head on a darker orange copper hazy body.  Loads of banana and citrus in front, very faint clove in the aroma.  Bananas continue to dominate, but a very nice citric sourness quickly cuts through that.  Medium body, with nice bubbly, but not oppressive carbonation.  This is what a hefe should be, and a world class brew.  Luckily the distribution is quite wide.

Bottled in a Franziskaner pint glass. Appearance is a beautiful hazy burnt orange with a long lasting off white head. The flavour is a strong clove with a hint of banana. This beer is nicely carbonated that helps lift the flavour off the tongue. A very nice beer.
Color is a dark hazy honey, aroma of molasses, smoke and sweet spices.  Flavor is nutty with cinnamon and coriander, smooth finish with pecan and smoky flavors. Refreshing and flavorful.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2011 Hazy amber, bubbley white heald, medium-body, high co2.

Aroma: bright green banana, hint of minerality.

Taste: toasted caramel malt sweetness, tart wheat, co2 burn, strong notes of green banana and clove.

Great aromatic flavors, but high co2 is harsh.

-----


Aroma is dry cider and white wine, with hints of minerality and subtle oak.
Appearance is hazy copper.
Taste is cider, alcohol esters, minerality, tart musty wheat, and a bit of caramel.
Body is medium.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Had at Schneider Weisses Brauhaus.  Quite yummy and quite a bit darker orange than I expected. All the things a weizen should be.  Serving: Tap
50 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON, Canada via Lakeville. Hazy copper colour, creamy looking head. Banana aroma, tight carbonation with a velvety texture.
On tap at SD Brewing Co.  Dark orange with a tiny head.  Nose Belgian yeasty and pepper.  Tobacco.  Taste is pepper and citrus.  Cinammin and other spice as well.

On tap at Weisses Bräuhaus, München 02.07.2009.
Hazy brown with a creamy head. Aroma consists of banana and hints of yeast, its soft and delicious. Easy to drink.

bottle by dady, golden to amber colour, clear, rocky head, frothy, white foam, nice aroma light sweetness, lightly bitter, very good weizen taste, medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish, very good
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2010 Una delle migliori hefeweizen in commercio. Bevuta alla spina al Fondo di Chiavari, è una weizen atipica, più scura, con un lieve color mogano molto particolare, ma che non rinuncia ai tipici sentori di banana e chiodi di garofano sprigionati dal lievito.
Buonissima, anche in bottiglia.
Excellent heffe weiss bier.

Much darker than I anticipated. Good carbonation but I didnt get much head retention with it. Good clove/spice flavor that is not overpowering along with a huge malt load. It gets much sweeter as it warms up. Very drinkable I prefer different style hefeweizens.
Very Nice auburn brown color to it. It has a very mild haze to it. Very good fruity aroma. And a great sweet wheat taste.

Appearance: 4/5

Dark hazy orange brown liquid with a big dirty white head that left chunks of foam on the side of the glass.
Smell: 7/10

Foam banana, fresh banana,
Taste: 7/10

Foam banana, yeast, hint of smoke and toast,
Mouthfeel: 4/5

Smooth mouthfeel, thin-medium body
Comment:

A nice and easy to drink wheat beer. It doesnt quite reach the same level as Weihenstephaner or Franziskaner but its trails behind like  close third. There are some noticable differences between the three beers. This one is allot darker in colour and has a flavour difference that Im a bit curious about, the smoke and toast. Feels like the two are connected, most likely to the choice of malt.

For me a good hefe-weizen is great on a hot summers day, its thirst quenching and easy to drink. This beer stands out a bit though as I feel it is more suitable for a pub then the sun. Even though I think it would work in both environments, it just doesnt feel like the perfect partner on a hot day.

500ml. bottle. Pours opaque brown with a thick white head that is not as long lasting as many hefes. The aroma consists of caramel, bread, dough, and raisins. The taste is fairly sweet and a little sour with very minimal bitterness. Lively mouthfeel and crisp finish makes this beer very refreshing and drinkable.

Bottle. Slightly cloudy and quite lively upon opening. Poured with a small head and had a gentle wheaty flavour that lingered for some time. Not as overpowering as some wheat beers and definitely one worth trying.

500ml bottle - $3.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Clouded, murky-looking, medium-toned brown body with a tall head stand comprised of Mother of Pearl-colored foam that soon dissipates into a few disorganized strands of fizz.

Smell: Punchy nose of darkened wheat malt with notably vibrant yeast-derived phenolic spice accents and ample whiffs of bananas as well as subtler notes of bread and caramel.

Taste: Initial malted wheat tastes of sliced wheat bread brushed with sweet dark caramel, but this is soon knocked away by the crackling carbonation and ever accumulating clove flavor. Lesser hints of banana and citrus lurking within. Very restrained bitterness, with that strong, pesky clove character doing most of the balancing. Modest acidity ushers in the dry, clove-packed finish with a vague remembrance of the upfront bready maltiness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Moderate carbonation. Both giving a brisk, fairly lively mouthfeel.

Drinkability: This is all well and fine, but, personally, Id rather have a Weihenstephaner. Maybe Im speaking out of town, but thats just me. Paired well with the track "Gay Human Bones" by the relatively new band Harlem.

50cl bottle.   Hazy amber, bordering on brown.   Head is medium and fizzy, with quick dissipation.   Definitely in the bernsteinfarbenes hefe; splitting hell and dunkel down the middle.   The aroma is richly bready and has a spicy banana bread thing going on with some chocolate in it.   A bit floral and sweet as well.   Definitely leaning more heavily on spice than outright banana or other fruity esters, which melds nicely with the malt aromas.   The flavor has the same rich bready character, medium sweetness, and a spicy, lightly bitter finish.   More clove than banana again, but not super spicy.   Just a tinge of acidity in the finish.   Mouthfeel approaching full, but still very drinkable and highly carbonated, which helps cut the malt.   Distinctive and tasty.
One of my favorite wheat beers. Very nice dark golden pour. Nose is citrus, lemons, banana and plenty of wheat. Taste is the same. Rated 6/29/02
500 ml bottle from the LCBO.  Great!  Pours dirty, muddy, hazy, murky amber in colour, with big white head.  Aroma and taste are mild banana and lots of wheat.  Cant get enough...
Starts with a huge creamy head and a distinct scent of bananas. Very light and fizzy body with a sweet beginning and a barely noticable bitter finish.
Pours hazy brown with nice white head. Spicy, sweet malty hefe aroma. Crisp fruity and malty flavor, mmm... Round and lean on palate and finish is crispy fruity with tones of hops.
Amber with nice head. Aroma yeast, apple. Taste soursweet yeast, apple, banana. Body medium/full, text thick. Finish sourbitter.
Bottle form the Fort Worth Gingerman via Cavie.  Orange pour with a white head.  Aroma is yeast, grain, fruit, and banana.  Taste is lemon, banana, wheat, and tart.  Nice lemon finish.

500 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a Weizen glass. Pours cloudy orange-amber with a 1 cm white head. Head remains, leaving a touch of lace as it glides down the glass. Aroma is a combination of fruit and spice: apple, clove and nutmeg, along with yeast and a hint of malt. Very fresh. Flavour is moderately sweet up front, becoming a little sour towards the finish. Finish is moderate and malty. Medium-full in body with a smooth, creamy texture. Carbonation is lively, but with tiny bubbles that are almost imperceptible on the palate. Overall, a very nice example. A little darker than some other hefeweizens but still very smooth and refreshing. Head is not quite as tall as Id expected, but good retention. 2010-04-20

Bottle from Gman FW. Pours a heavy rust orange color with a cresting white head. Lots of carbonation. Yeasty aroma with some banana. Flavors of fruity yeast mixed with a metallic grain. Wheat flavorings with a sharp yeast finish. Lacking the complex elements of the other Schneider offerings.

Bottle at home. Beautiful deep orange amber glowing color with a thick creme colored creamy head. Aroma of banana, wheat, fruits and some peaty smoke. Quite full fruity sweet to bitter flavor with hints of citrus in the finish. A hint of smoke is present and it has a creamy texture and lively carbonation. Great beer.

Bottle. Pours murky dull amber with an off-white head. Medium bead. Smells mainly bready with some cloves, bananas and citric dank. Tastes thickly sweet but with nice balancing sour funk and a mildly bitter finish.  Although well within date, Im guessing this is a shadow of what left the brewery. Still pretty good, though.

500 ml. bottle.  Pours a little darker than expected, an auburn / brown color with gray fizzy head which soon disappears.  Aroma of banana, wheat, yeast, clove.  Sweet carbonated bite of good wheat, lightly spiced, which sours a bit, to notes of lemon on the finish.  This is very simple, but a remarkable rendition of the style, all the simple flavors done perfectly.

Ive encountered many different wheat beers and while I would say Im a fan of the style, its rare for a hefeweizen to impress me as much as Schneider Weisse Original did. This is a beer that is not only delicious, but easily drinkable. If the majority of beer drinkers knew of this winning combination this beer would rival any American macro lager in sales.POUR, COLOR AND AROMADepending on who you ask, the proper way to pour an unfiltered wheat beer varies. According to the brewers website, Schneider Weisse should be poured fairly conservatively into a titled glass until about ¼ of the liquid remains in the bottle. At which point you should vigorously roll the bottle to stir up the yeast which has settled to the bottom and pour the remaining beer into your glass. This is exactly how I poured my bomber and the result was a perfect glass of beer.This is by far the darkest hefeweizen I have ever seen. With a body of pure brown which is also extremely hazy, Schneiders appearance might actually be unattractive to some. I didnt see any sediment floating in the glass but plenty of carbonation was definitely noticeable. The head was white, thick and fluffy and almost creamy like whipped marshmallow (I wish I had a spoon for it alone!). It did not leave much lacing on the glass, though.The aroma was a strong bouquet of malts with notes of spices such as nutmeg, clove, and possibly vanilla. It was very sweet-smelling, but with a bit of a kick.TASTEAuthentic German wheat beers are often very spicy and Schneider Weisse Original is certainly no exception. Upon my first taste I noticed a great combination of nutmeg and clove. What differentiates this beer from others is the strong sweet component it utilizes. I noticed a distinct flavor of vanilla and what I would call a banana bread taste (many hefes have a banana flavor, but this tastes more like banana bread  honestly!)Whats so interesting about this beer is the palate is evenly-divided and well-balanced between its sweet and spicy components. The initial mouthfeel is sweet and delectable with a juicy-like richness of flavor (especially vanilla and caramel). As it finishes, the spices are released en masse giving the beer a bit of a kick. Clove, nutmeg, banana and possibly cinnamon make themselves known in the finish.And yet there is still an unmistakable light and watery composition to the body so as to make the overall palate surprisingly mild. The flavor here is quite a work of art.FINISHThe mouthfeel is soft, thick, and a bit watery making this beer very drinker-friendly. It finishes smooth and clean with next to no aftertaste at all. BODYWhen Im reviewing beer I usually wait until Ive finished my first bottle before I decide if and how soon Id like to move on to another one. In the case of Schneider Weisse Original I really wanted a second when I was only halfway done with my first. Not only is it tasty and smooth, but at 5.4% ABV its a perfectly average body that lends itself to sessioning. FINAL THOUGHTSHonestly, its difficult to list any flaws for Schneider Weisse Original, although Im not sure I would go so far as to call it a perfect beer. Its delicious, smooth and fairly light in body, which all adds up to a high ranking. I wouldnt put it on my personal favorites list, but I can honestly say this is an outstanding beer and highly recommend it.NOTE: Watch the video version of this review here:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Mkl7syUXdc
Aroma is sweet and yeasty, body is light but that isnt a bad thing. My go-to weisse for showing newbies what a wheat beer is supposed to taste like. Plus, at 2 bucks a bottle its pretty impressive.

One of the few Hefes I enjoy. Goldne/amber colored brew with a frothy, small white head. Smells of spice, cloves, pine, and bananas. The taste follows the nose with the flavor of bananas nicely worked in. Tastes a bit spicy, in a pleasant way, at the end. Smooth and refreshing beer. Will be getting this one again.

This nails it for me. The sour aspect is awesome. Most Hefeweizen beers have way to much clove and banana flavor this one its perfect. One of the best beers I have had.  With its amber-mahogany coloring and streaked with fine top-fermented yeast, this beer has a fine, persistent head that adheres well to the glass. It is pleasantly fruity with a typical top-fermented smell, an aroma of clove and nutmeg apple tantalizes the nose. On the tongue it is fresh, clean, full-bodied, harmonious and well-balanced. It finishes with a light, delicate taste of bitters leaving behind a sour impression.
Bottle 500ml.Dark hazy orange/brown color with big lasting head. Aroma banana, orange, wheat. Taste caramel, banana, orange. Great beer.

Pours a rather dark, hazy, translucent orange with a an initially large white head that diminishes but doesnt go away completely.  Aroma is fresh, citrusy, floral and has even a hint of smoke to it.  Body is medium, flavor is unimposing but pleasant.  Notes of lemon and orange as well as banana, bubblegum and yeast.  Finish is mildly bitter and dissapointingly short.  A nice hefe but I dare say a bit overrated in my opinion.
Draught at ØLbaren. Cloudy golden - white head. Banana, high banana, wheaty, yeasty, fruity, orange, cardboard, zesty. Not my style !!!

Bottle.

A very nice and classic German wheat beer. Hazy brownish with a large white head. Spices, yeast, wheat, banana. Very drinkable with a pleasant palate.

Bottle. Pours a murky copper brown with large, fast-vanishing off-white head. Smell is bread and caramel with some clove notes. This is a rather dark weissbier, almost bordering on a dunkel weizen. Tastes of mellow toffee and wheat, a very nice blend. Smooth palate with just enought bubbles. A very pleasant brew indeed.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2017 Bottle, 330ml. Pours a murky, copper/brown colour with a medium off-white head. Aroma is of wheat, banana, vanilla, and some nice spices. The taste is wonderful, deliciously smooth with lots of wheat and earthy notes, easy to drink, not much bitterness, yet with character and complexity. Fantastic.
Bottle from Morrisons. Hazy dark golden colour, large foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana. Flavour of sweet wheat, banana, some spices. Well drinkable.

Bottle. Pours deep amber colour with natural cloudiness.  Aromas of hops with fruity yeast undertones.  Taste is of bitter hops with slight accents of fruit (orange, apple?) and spices.  Overall strong hoppy flavour is good but not a favourite of mine.

Caramel-apple with a fine off white head looks luscious is a weizen glass. Smells of sweet sourdough bread, banana, nutmeg and cloves. Wraps the tongue with apple esters, barnyard yeast, finishing spicy and smooth. Mouthfeel is velvety and finely effervescent. This is an excellent weizen, a standard upon which others should be compared.

Poured a hazy brown with a foamy white head.  Aroma of banana, malt, and yeast.  Banana taste with some sweetness in the aftertaste.  Some spices including cinnamon and nutmeg?  Less yeast in the taste than in the aroma.  Overall very good.

Provdatum: 2009-06-04 
Prov temp: 12 grader (kanske lite i varmaste laget)
UTS: Urin färgad (socker sjuk) molnig alt äppel mos molning fin försvinnade krona, härligt tappetserade gardiner.
D: Aprikos marmelad, jäst, ljunghonung
S: Aprikos, chilli (WOW, den bet till), metallisk mineral, apelsin med kryddnejlika (är detta en juldryck?), bra beska
ES: Apelsin med kryddnejlika hänger kvar och pulserar
Lite för mycket kryddnejlika gör ser mer påtaglig ju mer man dricker, Annars har man gjort ett bra jobb att kamouflera alkoholen 8,2%.
Multiple tastings. Getting caught up on my life beer list ... Drank alot of these while traveling through Europe.  Pretty decent hefe and probably a good benchmark for the style.

16oz Bottle. [09.127 - May 07, 2009] Pours a pale, yeast-speckled amber, with a clean white rim. Aroma is more restrained than I expect, but gives off a genteel, clean cinnamon, spice and generic fruit. Very sophisticated and collected in some ways, as compared to the brash, abrasive hefes Americans seem to be prone to creating. Flavor thickens up and curls its hand around the aroma, squeezing sweet lustrious wheat sugars into balance with a tiny nip of hops and the elegant yeast profile. Delicious and classic.

Purchased via mail @ TheBeerBox . Really nice aroma of this brew doesnt have that Euro-skunk smell, some clove and nice palate sweet, almost too much,  balance  of flavors like clove and Apple,beside the Unfiltered Weisse ,very pleasant palate . A bit heavy on the tongue but very nice with some charbroilled cow intestines and Hot American Style-Wursts
Enjoyed on draft, light bitterness, definitely a wheat beer, with some clove and banana flavors in the mix.

Bottle. Pours a unclear brown beer with a dense white head. The aroma is sweet, wheat, banana and fruit. The flavor is wheat, malt, some hops, fruit and banana. The palate is dry and fruity. Overall a good beer.
Bottle,  Rehills, Ncl. Banana and pineapple cubes add to the fresh, yeasty and clove aroma to provide another classic German hefe. Medium brown appearance, spft and foaming on the palate.

One of the best of the style Ive had. Nice dark amber with a decent lasting head. Aroma is of fruit and spice, nutmeg, clove, some banana. Flavor is sweet to start with a bit of the banana and spices but finishes with a pleasant sourness that really makes it nice. Long lasting aftertaste.

Appearance: Cloudy orange color with muddy-brown sediments. Huge, creamy, slightly off-white head on it. Thick and cohesive head texture.
Aroma: Fresh citrusy on the nose. Balanced banana and bublegum notes. Moderate to low spiciness. 
Flavor: Active citrusy tartness all through. Moderate banana estery level with decent bubblegum notes. Pleasant, almost peppery yeasty(?) spiciness. 
Mouthfeel: Lively, but moderate carbonation. Almost sticky yeasty texture. Light to medium bodied. 
Overall Impression: Authentic, fresh, quenching, Bavarian Hefeweizen.

Aroma for a hefeweizen the aroma is really small, but the usual culprits are here - the banana, clove, and malts.  The appearance is a bit of the norm of hefeweizens with a darker clouded brownish color.  The head is originally huge, and then settles down to a wispy white head about a 1/4" inch thick.  Flavor is really clean, with an amount of the complimentary aromas.  A little too clean, somewhat sweeter than smooth or tart.

Egészen sötét narancssárga színe van ennek sejtelmesen ködös búzasörnek aminek a tetején vastag,kemény és sűrű piszkosfehér hab csücsül,ami nem igazán akar elillanni.Illata enyhén mézes,fűszeres és élesztős.Íze hozza az illat miatt elvártakat,banánosan,szegfűszegesen és enyhén fanyarul és édeskésen.Sűrű teste van és tele van apró csípős buborékokkal.Utóízében feltűnik a komló kellemes kesernyéssége is és hosszan tart.Nagyszerű klasszikus német búza!
Hazy orange, big creamy white head lasts. Aroma of banana, orange peel, clove, dough, yeast. Taste is bready and spice medium sweetness and a slight earthy bitterness and tart. Tingley carbonation.

Pours a cloudy golden with thick white head.  Aroma of citrus, banana, clove, yeast, malts, great balance and full aroma for the abv. Similar taste, very crisp and enjoyable.  A good hefe is hard to find, it this one found me tonight!
Nice pillowy white head and pretty thick. Very dark gold in color. Deep and dark for a hefe. Notes of wheat, banana, and apple. Pretty good, but hefes still arent my thing.

Pours a slightly hazy amber body with an off-white head.  Aromas of yeast, clove, hint of zest.  Flavors of yeast, some banana, clove, little tart.  Finish has clove, tart, dry.  A long time after the swallow, flavor of bran flakes.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2010 Strong clove, fruity aroma. Two finger head, good carbonation. Head dies down but carbonation stays through entire beer. Cloudy dark apricot color. Strong clove flavor thoughout, different fruits, slight banana finish that lingers, some lemon. Medium body or a bit more. 

Overall a very good beer, nothing fancy. Great example of the style.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2011 [3/2/2010 - On tap at Oakford Social Club, Reading] Cloudy deep gold with a negligible head and a slight but prickly fizz.  From the off, cloves are the dominant flavour.  Some foam banana sweets and fake lemon come through, but the sweetness of these is balanced out by the bitterness of the cloves.  More cloves in the finish.  Its a little one dimensional, but it feels good in the mouth and goes down very nicely.  Overall its a decent enough beer as long as you like cloves, which fortunately I do!  [Re-rate 14/4/11, 500ml bottle that Dad shared with me - cheers!] A murky deep amber.  Tastes of grass and lemon and straw and pepper.  Deserves its decent reputation, my only criticism would be that its a little sweet and could do with more dryness. Differen in both appearance and taste to the keg version, but still gets a similar mark.

Typical hefeweizen color, smells of bananas, cloves, and also a bit of wood/tobacco...has the hefe taste with the same tobacco note and also some alcohol.  Aftertaste is pure hefeweizen.

EDIT: Aquires far more traditional hefe characteristics as it warms up...the tobacco taste disappears after some time out of the fridge
Bottle thanks to Bman1113vr. Hazy orange brown pour with a foamy off white head. Aroma is esters, bananas, wheat. Flavor is faded wheat, clove, and generally old.

Surprisingly expensive bottle. Pours with a deep hazy golden brown body and a large white head. Aroma of hay, must, banana, vanilla, tart lemon, raw grain and phenols. Taste is fruity, rotten citrus, banana clove, and some chalky tartness that I am not liking at all. Fizzy and dry. Tartness on this is not enjoyable. Not sure how fresh (or really, more to the point, how old this is...)

( 500ml bottle) Pours a huge 3 finger head that recedes quite slowly, but doesnt last. This beer pours the darkest of all "hefeweizens" I have ever seen, and it is quite murky in appearance. Nose of dried dark fruits (figs, plums) pears, alcohol and bready yeast. Taste is sour fruits, and a great aftertaste. Very creamy, and perfectly carbonated.
Pours a cloudy amber with a large off-white head. Aroma is light wheat, banana, clove and light smoke. Flavour is wheat, light banana, light smoke, light clove. Dry aftertaste.

This was a disappointing brew.  It did foam nicely when poured into a glass and it did have a nice color and aroma - but the taste didnt keep up.  If the label hadnt said the beer was brewed in Germany, I would have thought I was drinking some typical boring mass-produced American beer.
Not my style of Hefe-Weizen, but a solid beer.  It was well balanced between the floral flavors and bitterness.  It was a bit darker and heavier than my preference, but still very enjoyable.

bottle- yummy- darker than style guidelines suggest appropriate- almost a reddish hue, clove is there, but banana is as well, and all is somewhat balanced by a nice sweetness at the front- a classic that I finally sought out.
Sweet aroma of banana, sugar, yeast and vanilla.  Taste is sweet...a bit cloying.  A bit simple...not much yeast complexity.  But the biggest problem  is the sweetness.

Assaggiata in bottiglia da 50 cl.
Bel colore biondo, leggermente più ambrato di quello che ci si aspetterebbe da una weiss, con una bella schiuma alta e fine, anche se non molto persistente. Laroma è molto fruttato e cè una predominanza di banana. Al gusto risulta corposa e piacevole, forse un poco troppo frizzante, ma di ottima bevibilità.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2013 Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a amber/light brown color; darker than most hefeweizens.  Taste is caramel malt, bread, some clove, hint of molasses, and a hint of ripe banana.  This beer has some breadyness present in many weizenbocks, but few hefeweizens.

bottle - pours orangey - amber color with a smallish off-white head. The aroma was a lot fainter than i expected and was mainly comprised of apple and spice with a bit of bubblegum, I could only detect  the faintest trace of banana. The taste was very malty and spicy, almost had a cider feel to it, I really couldnt detect any citrus and there was a faint alcoholic hint in the finish. I expected more from Herr Schneider on this one......

50cl bottle: Copper orange colour with a thick, white head. In the aroma, this manages to combine qualities of a classic Hefeweizen and a Dunkel - the fruity, perfumey and clovey esters are tamed by a sweet, dark caramel maltiness. Subtle butterscotch and clean alcohol as well. Very yeasty flavour, christmas spices with a rich malt sweetness. Drinkability would benefit from a less creamy/sticky palate.
what a great brew. poured with a good size white cap, that stuck around for a while. a nice copper tone graces the glass. smells of bananas and citrus. taste is quite smooth and citrus-y.

Bottle. Pours clear, dark amber with a fizzy white head that quickly diminishes to surface cover. Aroma is of banana, molasses, clove and honey. Flavour is very similar but is a little more grainy, with the sweet fruitiness more subdued. Medium body with lots of prickly carbonation and a long dry, bitter finish. Very nice, and almost perfectly balanced; even though hefeweizens arent my favourite style this one is very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2010 In bottle; solid sweet, citrus (orange) aroma. Poured a dark golden brown/honey color. Taste, orange and spcie notes, light bodied. Almost a lager meets a weisse beer/would be good for those they dont like weisse beers alot

[2621-20091203] 500mL bottle. Sweet heavy banana malt aroma. Hazy, dark brown amber body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Banana flavour is sweet with tasty fruit malt. Medium body. Not bad, a nice surprise!
(From LCBO-Summerhill, Toronto, ON; w/ jerc)

500 ml bottle. Pours a surprisingly dark golden brown with a huge thick pillowy off white head. Aroma is very clove, sweet and bready, banana, yeast, spicy, pretty light and perfumey. Flavor is fairly basic. Some spice, clove etc but not really enough of it. Stays sweet, a bit gummy and banana candy but mostly sweet and sugary. Medium body and a sharp fizzy carbonation. Really basic and boring in the flavor, not awful just bland.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellowish-reddish brown, with a decent foamy head. Interesting look for a hefe... Citrusy aroma, with some ginger and spiciness. Nice banana, orange, and citrus hit in the taste. Mild chewiness, mild bready malt. This ones got some character, something I really like to see in hefeweizens, nice one!

16 oz. bottle- Pours darker than a golden Hefe but lighter than a dark Hefe, with a nice thick head and perfect lacing. The aroma is wheat and citrus, and the flavor is not as good as the Weihenstephaner Hefe, but is still good, overall the Weihenstephaner was superior in almost every way, which is interesting because its the Scheneider Weisse that is the Original Bavarian Hefe.

500 ml bottle. Pours a pale, but cloudy light brown color with a medium white head. Aroma is touches of sweet honey, with spices, and a touch of fruit (banana). Touches of yeast and bubblegum sweetness. A quality go-to beer when Im feeling a decent German Hefeweizen.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2009 0.5 l bottle.
Pretty pale-brown and hazy color, but the head runs down quickly (Maybe my glass fault or whatever).
Smelling is yeasty, little bit watery, fruity.
The taste is mild, flavour is fruity and sweet.
Finish is light-bitter and dry.
Refreshes!

500 ML bottle in Germany. Murky brown. Honey maltiness and clove and banana aroma. Medium body and well balanced sweetnes vs spicyness. One of the best classical weissbier there is to be had. A superior beer!!!!!!
Tap. Very unclear yellow brown body. Nice white head. Yeasty fresh quite heavy aroma. Much banana. Flavour of yeast and bubblegum. Nice, not too sweet finish. (Brown Cow, Zermatt, 29.09.09)

500ml bottle poured into a Weizen glass. Poured a cloudy orange-copper colour with a puffy 1.5" head. Darker then most other wheat beers but it still looks quite appealing. Aroma of sweet bread dough, bananas, some fruity sourness and some spices. A bit like a combination of sweet buns and banana bread. Smells delicious. Tastes similar to the Aroma. Lots of sweetness up front like honey and caramel. Theres also a bit of toasted grains and roasted nuts in the flavour. Nice fruity tang in the middle with a bit of spiciness in the finish. Pleasant lemon and orange sour aftertaste. Great full bodied feel. Great carbonation. Nice sticky fruity tangy sweetness covers the inside of the mouth. Very drinkable. Best enjoyed slow. Similar to other Hefeweizens but it has its own uniqueness to make it stand out.
Kind of ugly yellow-brown, tight white foam, dry, musty, yeasty aroma.  Light citrus.  Taste is more oranges, wheat, yeasty must.

Spicy bread bouquet and lack of he common banana aroma. Appearance is as the description says "amber-mahogany" and not the dulled golden youd expect from a Hefeweizen. Flavour also is more spicy and bready than the fruity. This is such a hefeweizen in every way but different in every way from all the others. Very interesting and very, very good.
500ml Bottle: Pours clean with a nice head of foam. Strong scent of caramel. Yeast taste but smooth and very tasty. I would buy this again.

Smells very fresh, malt and banana. Dark, very dark for a hefeweizen, not too much head. Tastes exactly as it smells, about medium malt darkness in the flavour and some banana and a slight cirtusy bit of flavour. Very, very smooth, a bit of residue the aftertaste but not at all unpleasant. Quite nice, I have to rate the Hacker Schoor just a bit nicer though.

Brown coloured beer with large white head and lots of carbonation. Hoppy sweet aroma. Full creamy palate. Finish is sweet yeasty ending dry fruity (bit like bannas). An excellent beer to drink with the cheese "Brie".

Pours a dark cloudy amber with a slight off white fizzy head. Aromas of banana, nut meg, coriander, and some yeast. Many aromas carry to the flavor with a sort of banana upbringing, then some spice like coriander and slight nut meg, with a little yeasty undertone. Every swig leaves you ready for that next one with a slight sour/dry finish. Slightly sweet. Pretty good hefe.
500mL bottle - pours an opaque dark golden with a thin off-white head. Aroma is bananas. Flavour is bananas, yeast and heavy citrus. Very good wheat beer.
Cloudy, dark orange colour. Dense head. Quite a malty flavour for a Hefe. Finish is a bit sweet but remains crisp and refreshing.

On tap at SPTR served in a pint glass.  Pours with a couple fingers of head, I cant remember about the lacing.  Smell is of over ripe bananas.  Taste is of over ripe bananas (thats a good thing!), yeast and some heavy citrus.  Mouthfeel is light but creamy, exactly as a good weisse should be.  Overall an excellent weisse, as good as Ive tried.  Lots of complex and powerful flavors.  If youve got a friend who only likes dark beers and scoffs at anything lighter than amber, give this to him.

Bottle at home:  Appealing aroma with some amount of banana and maybe indistinct fruits, but all in all the aroma isnt obvious enough. On the other hand, this hefe looks beautiful in the glass. It is both unclearer and darker than I expected, but the head isnt lasting long enough. The flavor is another thing. The banana is obvious and still there is some other fruits that I can not define, but I can define that this beer is delicious! It is a very "heavy" beer for a hefeweizen, and should really be drank in the same way than a brown ale or something like that. Though I usually think of weissbiers as summerbeers, this could easily satisfy me on a winter evening. The palate is very thick and creamy for a weissenbier too, and all in all this beer is impressing weissenbrew. I the back of my head, and on the back of my tongue I am just missing something undefineable... something that makes the beer boring in spite of its advances, and forces me too not giving more points.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity not wall adhesive white foam collar which was fine and evenly of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. 

The beer has a thick brown color and a light hoppy bitter taste. The after tast of the beer is light hoppy bitter with a fruity touch. This beer smells fruity.

Poured golden-brown/copper, darker than I expected. Creamy white head with decent retention and minimal lacing. Yeast at the bottom cascaded nicely when poured in. Spicy aroma, with subdued alcohol undertones. I thought I detected a coppery off-taste at first, but this disappeared with subsequent tastings. Subtle clove/banana taste--a little too subdued for my liking. Decent mouth feel, although carbonation seemed a bit light for this style. Nice slightly sour finish.

Love it.  What can I really say.

Lovely in apperance; deep reddish amber.

Lovely in smell; fruit, spice, and everything nice..

Goes down great, and feels light to me regardless of its appearance and content.  

A great beer.  Highly reccomended; will be buying again and again.

Wish I discovered the hefe-weisses earlier on!  So underrated or unknown, its shocking.

Draught. Hazy brown with good head. Estery aroma. Medium body with light carbonation. Malt, caramel and some lemon with a hint of complexity. Interesting things going on but didnt quite seem to work.

A very fruity Hefe. Looks beautiful in its glass. Tate is tropical fruits and slightly floral . Very nice drinking, with a heavy body for the style. Perhaps a bit cloying towards the finish, which is the only fault I can pick.
Nice amber, cloudy colour with an ok white head. Aroma was fruity and spicy. Flavor was also fruity and pretty malty with some noticeable spices and bubblegum flavor. Not bad and easily available.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2010 nice color, spicy aroma

Flavor has some fruit and spices with a slightly sour finish and carbonation.

VERY easy to drink!  08/10 re-rate slight bump

500 ml bottle. Pours a rich amber colour wit a nice, thick head that lingers till the end. Smell is banana, clove and apples. Taste is the same with a slightly sour finish. Beautiful beer, the best of the hefes Ive tried.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2011 r8:  The darkest Hefeweizen ive witnessed in its own glass ..glamorous deep baked bean vibez .  Nose is cool.  Bready malt, with brown bread accent. Stocky banana esters . Perfume , spicy clove type texture ..subtle chocolate .   Robust banana quality in the mouth, almost sugary , but quicky a dry tart  movement is given, with apple , spice and light subtle dark malt .  A  complex and distinct beer,

330ml bottle in Japan. Not the best way to rate, but I had one and figured I finally should. Rich wheat malt aroma of banana and clove. Lovely amber color. Perfect mouth feel. Rich, thick, chewy malt. Manages to be amazingly rich, sweet, and flavorful while never cloying. The standard in weissbier. Wonderful.
Very light, not bitter at all. Very nice after taste. This is a wonderful hefeweizen.
Sweet and grainy, lots of bread and meatiness, doesnt taste like most other hefes, bottle from Whole Foods, Miami Beach

Dark bronze in colour with huge creamy white head. Big corriander aroma.
Was thin and watery, not what I remeber it to be like. Still a classic hefeweizen.

One of my best hefe-weizens. Nice hazy dark amber color. Nice thick head. Mostly malty smell with hints of fruits, banana, spicies. Taste medium sweet. Full body, pleasant palate ... This is my firtst choice over than 6-7 years now.
Pours deep brown with a tall beige head. Excellent citrus banana aroma. The flavour is very complex. Notes of citrus spices cloves, banana. Very refreshing. \this is by far my favorite weisse.
Nice German Hefeweizen with a nice head and a dark orange colour, darker than most  hefeweizen hell. Tasted better (more fruity) in Germany as a draught beer than in Greece as a bottle beer.
One of my favorite beers. I have had a lot of weissbeers and this is my favorite one. Two thumbs up ;)

500 ml bottle. Nice head and beautiful dark amber colour which is not usual for a german weissbier. Fully matured taste with a slight bitterness at the end. Thick and white foam also. A very good option when you re looking for a nice weissbier to drink. Satisfying and enjoyable.

500 mL bottle. Pours a light amber-orange with a big billowing beige head. Aroma is pretty potent with equal parts banana and bubblegum, with some nice clove as well. A bit of tropical fruit and an acidic character too. Flavor is tart and citric with lesser banana and vanilla notes. Not as creamy as a hefe ought to be. Doesnt really all come together quite right. Still decent.

Appearance: A nutty brown in colour, cloudy, and very carbonic. Pours with a large head. Smell: Distinctive citrus smell, with a mild hoppiness. Taste: A refreshingly light citrus flavour was the first thing to strike me. Overall the taste is built up from what seems like complex fruity flavours. Mouthfeel: Light but still very lively in the mouth. The heavy carbonic qualities are obvious. Drinkability: This wheat beer is very drinkable, it is a refreshing thirst quencher. The light fruit citrus flavours make it an ideal drink for a hot summers day. This beer seems to have been popping up more recently around the UK, even in some of the chain supermarkets. Considering the quality of the beer, this is great!

I always try to have a good beer for Milestone numbers and #600, was very pleasing. Tasted of a traditional German Heffe, but i tasted bannanas instead of nutmeg/apple. Also had the beer at a cool bar, Little Miss Whiskeys Golden Dollar on H Street. Great little joint!
Tall bottle into my favorite wheat glass.  This is great stuff and one of the definitive German hefes out there - if you want to know the right characteristics, grab one of these, baby!
Bottle 50 cl. Apperance; Amber, clear with a medium head. Aroma; Wheat, sweet, some sence of flowers. Flavor; soft wheaty flavor, bitter on the tongue. Im not fan of wheatbeer, but this was ok.
everything I would expect from a hefe and I enjoyed the ample character it exhibited. Enjoyed from a bottle but alas someday hopefully on tap.

Hazy golden brown color with a big creamy head. Not really any lacing which was suprising. First smell was clove and spices. Then I got orange peel, lemon, and wheat. Taste was the same with a nice bitter finish and a soft creamy mouthfeel with light carbonation. Really good hefe!

Bottle poured into a glass rich amber color with off white head.  Well crafted hefeweizen that balance wheat with malt tart with sweet.  Notes of citrus chilled with a dash of clove and finished with refreshment.

Aroma of dark cooked bananas, a lot darker beer than i expected for a weizen. Nice palate, a pretty boring beer. tasted along side paulaner, weistephan, schofferhoffer, schneider organic. came in last.

Do I win anything for being the 1000th rater of this beer? :)  Pours a murky orangish-brown (dark for the style) with a moderate white head with good retention and lacing.  Solid aroma of clove, banana and some wheat.  Flavor has those, plus some orange and lemon citrus, yeast and a hint of caramel sweetness.  Moderate mouthfeel with slightly dry finish.  Darker and spicier than a traditional hef, but a solid, easy-drinking beer.

500mL bottle. Beautiful pour, medium brown colour, very cloudy, almost opaque. Head is small but dense. Very wheaty and spicy aroma. Boring mouthfeel. Spiced flavour with cloves, refreshing. Pretty good overall. Could use a longer aftertaste, lightly bitter on the tongue in the finish.
Pours a thick and cloudy orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of wheat, bananas and orange peel.  Flavor follows, with full flavors and a good mouthfeel.  Very good weissen.

Bottled at Köln airport. Very nice hazy nutbrown color with a thick, long-lasting head, with layered lacing. Perfect so far. Aroma is sweet weize with some soft malts. Flavour is the same, with some more hops. Very characteristic Hefeweizen!
A good pour with a decent amount of head. Nice flavor very wheaty. some clove aroma. very crisp clean finish. As good as any wheat I have yet to try.
Hazy dark golden colour. Aroma of wheat, clove and banana. Flavour of wheat, clove and banana. Medium body and good carbonisation. An excellent beer.
Darker than Id expected for a weisse, it poured a hazy dark gold with a substantial foamy white head.  Aroma was mild and "wheaty", and the taste was very pleasing.  Smooth and refreshing.
We are in a beer tasting club, several of us get together in honolulu and rate 8 beers every week.  We have our own scales as well as the scale used on this website to record our fun weeks!
the germans can brew some damn good beer, at bar1 at the roadhouse bar in boston, this and hopfen weisse

Ah, the champaign of Hefes - this beer rules!
Poured with ease into my Schneider Weisse glass and I still got an enormous light tan cap that took a long time to settle down.
