In fact, I turned my glass on an obvious angle and the head did not bend with the liquid. Nice colour before the sediment dump, now its just metamusil. The aroma is perfect: wheat, clove, sweetness mixed in with not-sweet bananas and I always seem to find a slight chocolate dusting in Hefes, weak orange and possibly vanilla - all in perfect balance. The flavour is fresh and crisp with lots of excellent wheat, a good balance of clove and banana, orange and a decent yeast punch. Medium bodied, very smooth on the mouth, slight tangy taste, solid yeast/wheat/clove finish.

Bottled.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Flavor of wheat, lots of yeasty banana and spices

Bottle from a friend of mine, thanks James.  Pours a hazy, golden-orange color with a nice white head.  Aroma is sweet malted wheat with notes of citrus, clove, and banana.  On the pallet, it feels refreshing and light.  The taste is sweet wheat and it really brings out a bit of citrus.  A great hefeweizen.

Bottle from Midtown. Pours a hazy orange amber with a huge white head, which is the typical appearance of a hefe. Aroma of citrus and wheat malts. Lighter side of medium bodied with a nice refreshing mountfee, lighter than Ayinger Brau Weissl. Flavor of pale wheat malts, citrus, vanilla, and clove, countered by a very subtle spiciness. Finish tastes like there is some slight autolysis. This is probably and old bottle, so I will revisit.

Pours a dark golden hazy color, with a magnitude of white head and decent lacing.  Aroma is nice, smelling of banana and cloves.  Excellent flavor consisting of banana, clove and slight lemon aftertaste.  This is a great medium bodied hefeweizen.

A classic German Hefe which I love in the summer!  The aroma is very typical yeast and clove and the color is surprisingly clear amber, much different than the cloudy hefes that Im used to.  A very refreshing beer with flavors of banana and clove and it finishes with some crispness.

From the start I was impressed by this session. From a bigger brown bottle. Quite uncivilized looking beer. Foaming hazy light iced tea brown. First impression is mouth watering fine natural feeling,  could this be so?  Tingling taste evolution is strongish at first but then mellows into a fine brew. Plenty of wheat character. Even tart at times, welcomely tart. As I write this I wish I had a bottle to drink right now. Smooth hefe experience, quite smooth. Very good; taste went from a 4 to a 7 within  seconds! That dont happen often enough. Enjoyable sesion for a big brown bottle.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 500ml btl @ a restaurant in Shenzhen, China. Was quite surprised to see this there. Aroma is banana and some woody spice. Really well balanced flavor of the wheat, banana undertons and slightly spicy citrus. Outstanding.

Bottle thanks to a friend. Bananas and clove are apparent, as in any weissbier. White head, with little sustain. Clean and crisp taste. Nothing to write home about, but a pretty good weissbier nonetheless.

Bottle.  Hazy brown pour, some carbonation pour with great aroma of spices and banana.  Creamy mouthfeel, lots of light banana flavor, and a little orange and spice on the finish.  Good for a humid summer night.

50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy copper with a ton of creamy off-white head.  Aroma is bananas, citrus, apples, bread, spice(maybe cinnamon).  Flavor is the same.  Palate is a bit more watery than the typical weizen.  Light carbonation.  Finish is tart.  The particular color of this beer portrayed the light just right to put on an especially lively show of the cascading yeast after the pour.  Nice brew.

Pours an orange with a nice head of off white bubbles. Aroma soft banana. Clean malty slight-citrus flavor hits the tongue with a perfect amount of carbonation before giving way to banana, and apricot. World Class!

it is as described by the brewer and quite appealing indeed. well balanced appropriately flavored and spiced it is moderate in body frothy and foamy yet still substantial. highly satisfying and cloudy the beer is sweet and simply the status quo of its style.
Bottle. Enjoyed this brew, there is nothing special about this hefeweizen, however its still a good beer.

500 mL bottle from Total Wine.  Golden brown pour with a tall off-white head.  Aroma of banana, bubblegum, and yeast.  Flavor of bubblegum and banana.  Near the top of its class as far as hefeweizens are concerned.  An excellent beer.

Light brown color with tan head. Big aromas of over ripe bananas, cloves, tart wheat. Very smooth medium body. Great flavor is lightly sweet banana bread with clove and other sweet spices. Has a bready tart wheat taste to finish. Great Hefe brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: This brew pours a leathery brown color with a big bubble off white head the didnt last all that long, but it left some nice lacing behind. The aroma had tons of sweet bananas and fresh baked bread, but there was also a sour note Im not sure where that was coming from. Both the taste and mouth feel of this beer are phenomenal, the taste is very clean, good wheat malts along with banana and citrusy notes make this beers taste fantastic. The mouth feel is soft and thick kind of like cream but some how a touch chalky. This is the way a hefe is suppose to taste.

Bottled. Pours hazy, amber with a large head. Fruity nose with yeast, wheat  and banana.
Crisp wheat flavour with fruty notes. Slightly bitter inish. An exellent wheat beer.
An old favorite. Pretty, spicy, and as comfortable to me as an old shoe. Not the best hefe-weisse out there, but it has a certain je ne sais quoi that I have never been able to pin down.
Colore ambrato,schiuma discretamente durevole,aroma deliziosamente speziato e fruttato così come il sapore,questultimo anche lievemente tostato.Finale acidula.Ottima e rinfrescante weizen!!
50 cl bottle. A hazy cloudy brown, not what you would except from a Hefeweizen. Notes of dark fruits. There are many better Hefeweizen out there.

Have enjoyed this both on draft at Zum Schneider in NYC and in the bottle.

This is a shining example of a balanced wheat beer.

Pours an atypical brown color with tan head.  Normally these weissbiers are more golden in color, so it is hard to not subtract for this - but the head is weak too.

Nose and palate offer a clean, wheat-forward ale with the usual banana-clove interplay and a soft brownbread toasty finish.  Easty to drink.

Pours a cloudy brown sugar orange with thick cream-colored foam. Aroma is nutty pine hops with spicey notes. Flavor is creamy hazelnut vanilla with mild hops. Body is light yet creamy with high carbonation.

Beautiful color: Deep cloud hazy amber brown.  Aroma is suprising.  Strong clove and nutmeg, spicy.  Bananas and vanilla in there too.  Flavor is a tad more fruity, but it still carries the spiced notes.  It finishes a bit sour like they say, but it is quite bubbly and carbonated.  Spices definetely come through on the flavor.  Wonderfully drinkable, easily complex.  All around just a great beer, enjoyable.

Chocolatey and almost murky.  A little gross looking once the noble head disappears.

Big banana from the yeast with something a little tingly along the lines of eucaltyptus but very mild.  Slightly vine-tomato-like.  

On the tongue it is again nicely herbal. Something lightly spicy too.  Caramel is very apparent with a nice clovey nasal hit in the finish.

Very smooth and slick. Tiny hints at carbonation. Sweet all round but lightly ofset by the bready wholesome flavour.

A great Hefe. Moreish and interesting.

Tap @ OTH.
Pours clear brown, thick off white head.
Aroma is yeasty, thick grainy.
Taste, notes of dark fruits, yeasty, grains, light bitter spicy finish, light notes of malts with a delicious Hefe mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle purchased at Royal Liquors in Kansas City. Pour is hazy, cloudy orange copper with a big thick white head. Head is really lasting. Aroma of fresh banana, clove, wheat graininess and a soft sweetness. Straight forward, fresh Hefe nose. Taste is the banana, wheat, clove and yeasty spiciness all really smoothly balanced together. Palate is creamy, carbonated, smooth - highly drinkable. Pleasant lingering slight sweet aftertaste. Nice Hefe.

Bottle.  Pours a very hazy almond brown with a large dense white head and a lot of little black floaties.  Citrus, a bit of malt and grain, and a little bit of toast. Light, a bit thin, and a touch sweet with some very faint plum flavors, a touch of banana.  Finishes with more yeasty banana and
pours a clear dark yellowish colour with a off white head. a nice smooth taste malty with a light banana

Overall, not as good as the Aventinus, but a great Hefeweizen none the less. Aroma is malty and very fruity. Banana, citrus, apricot are all prevalent. Pour is hazy brownish orange colour. Taste is wheaty and very fruity. Slightly bitter aftertaste but not too bad. Nice.

Bottle @ Mulheim a/d Ruhr. A hazy yellow/brown colored beer, with a thich foamy white head. The aroma is malty with a lot a fruits, like citrus and bananas. It has a strong malty taste with fruits like bananas with orange and citrus. In the back are hops. The aftertaste is nice fruity with some bitter.

Pours deep, dark golden/orange. Big filmy off white head. Orange peel, banana and a slight herb on the nose. Flavour is dominated by fruity orange peel and some banana. Coriander shows but its quite subtle, adds another dimension. There is a medium bitterness which enhances the orange peel character. I got a lot more banana in the finish, which lasted for a fair while.

Bottle, pours a lovely firm, lacey head. rich wheat hoppy,fruity aromas ,. freshness wheat  flavour explodes in mouth finishes with a delicate bitter aftertaste. ....
excellent beer.

tap at ølbaren
clody brown, large thick offwhite hed.
aroma is peachy, fruity, faint banana.
flavor is the same.
quite agressive carbonation

500ml bottle 
5.4% ABV 
I tried this beer on August 24, 2008 after purchasing at one of my local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a dark cloudy brown with a thin tan coloured head.  The aroma was malted wheat, some sweetness, some cloves.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied, and mildly carbonated.  The flavour was less sweet than a lot of Hefeweizens, and was very drinkable.

16.9 oz bottle 4/17/09-Pours a cloudy amber with a nice big white head. Aroma of wheat, coriander, clove, and banana. Taste the same with the yeast and banana really coming through. This medium bodied brew is darn tasty. A great Hefe.

Bottle, Forest City.  Pours light red/orange with a nice creamy head.  Not as carbonated as I expected.  Aroma of clove, banana, esters, and some wheat.  Flavor is really tasty, with crisp carbonation.  Pronounced fruit flavors  not too sweet  come through, along with some red apple and banana.  Wheat and yeast throughout.  Excellent.

Bottle. Amber brown color that starts off very hazy but fades to mostly clear over time. Medium sized soft white head. Aroma and flavors of banana, spice, and alcohol. Theres more hop bite to the finish than on many hefes, though still mostly a fruity, smooth finish. Nice, crisp beer.

500 ml bottle. From Germany.
Deep copper colour with medium off-white head. Fruity (banana), wheaty with hints of alcohol. Slightly wheaty, malty and some alcohol in flavour too.
Pours light brown with a big off white head.  Aroma is fruity, with notes of banana bread and spice.  Taste is banana bread with a little bit of spice and malted wheat flavor.  Pretty good.

Im just not seeing the 3 and 4 ratings on this one. The sour overwhelms anything that could be good about it. I can kind of pick up a little banana and I can almost smell some clove but it really pails to the sour.
Heavy hoppy aroma. Average, frothy, white head. God lacing and fully lasting longevity. Cloudy, red brown body. Moderate bitter flavor. Medium palate.
Darker than expected with no head. Very nice aroma - sweet and spicy with notes of bannana, vanilla, and cinnamon. Taste is more bitter than expected too. Good beer, drinkable.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark ! yellow colour. Light malty and heavy yeasty aorma.lots of esters especially mango and banana. Light bitter messy flavor. Average llight bitter finish. Oily palate. Not the best hefe, but very nice aroma.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2011 tap.  sweet breads.  doughy honey spice.  spicy banana bread. wheat.  slight apple twang.   nice body.   like.

Served on draft at Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy orange-brown color with a medium creamy head. Decent head retention and good lacing. Aroma of yeast, bread, citrus and spice. Taste is toastiness, stone fruits, apple, clove, nutmeg and a tart finish. Medium bodied,

Pours thick two finger, rocky head, body is orange-brown.  Nice clove-banana balance on nose with some bready caramel malt notes coming through.  Subtle in malt flavour, some fruity esters, finishes a little watery and tart with some slight hints of grassy hops.
500ml Bottle. Pours cloudy as a true hefeweizen should, flavor is phenomenal one of the better hefes out there.

Pours clear amber color with white head. Aromas of citrus, clove , wheat and banana. Similar flavors with some yeast and a slightly sour finiash. Medium body with average carbonation. An excelent hefe.
A melhor custo beneficio que eu ja comprei, ja tomei muitas de trigo, essa se sobrepoe a grande maioria das weisses.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2009 500ml bottle. From notes. Poured cloudy orange-yellow. Nice head. Aroma is wheat, bread. Nice freshness. The bottle rated was fresh but I had 2 older bottles and they were not good at all. Rating #63

With its amber-mahogany coloring and streaked with fine top-fermented yeast, this beer has a fine, persistent head that adheres well to the glass. It is pleasantly fruity with a typical top-fermented smell, an aroma of clove and nutmeg apple tantalizes the nose. On the tongue it is fresh, clean, full-bodied, harmonious and well-balanced. It finishes with a light, delicate taste of bitters leaving behind a sour impression.

Bottle from BevMo.  Great example of the style.  Orangish-brown color, a little darker than expected.  Aroma of fruity esters, banana, and wheat.  Flavor is wheat malt, banana, clove, and yeast.  Nice smooth palate.  A winner.

500ml bottle (BeerAngel.de)
Hazy red, healthy tight head. Sharp, almost sour, fruity bananaey aroma. Lively carbonation, crisp refreshing palate. Plenty of retronasal fruity ester aromas. Quite bready taste, a touch yeasty and bananaey. Hops subtle in the taste, but do hang around a bit in the finish. Finish is light fruits, and a touch of caramel. Plenty of flavour, but also comes over as a tad watery at times.
500ml bottle.really fresh and pleasant to the tongue.a little bit bitter on the end but delicately.strong flavour of grains.excellent aroma very fruity with presence ofd flowers

500 mL Bottle. On the label it specifically states "Original Bottle Fermentation", meaning it is not filtered and pasteurized. Pours a clear amber (provided the sediment at the bottom has not been disturbed) with a 1-finger bubbly white head that immediately settles to a bubbly film leaving some lace on the sides. This beer has a very delightful and sweet aroma; sweet grain/malt with a touch of bubblegum and bananas and a faint innuendo of lemon rind. And flavor aplenty! As Nebulor describes, toasted-roasted grains and there is an accent of lime that makes that bit of astringency in the taste. Buttery finish with floral and bitter notes, and with a hint of grapefruit ending in a clean finish, the palate in contradiction to its relatively light body. Ill add this one to my Beer Altar.

Banana, bubblegum and grain malt smell with florals on the background.
A hazy nutmeg and toasted/ roasted wheat/barley grain appearance with a decent white head and too difficult to see the action.
Toasted/roasted wheat/barley grain taste and lime flavor with other bitter florals. 
Light bodied, buttery and resinous feel, mild astringency, with lively crisp carbonation.
As Ive probably stated before while reviewing a Hefewiezen that there is a wide range for this style. This one is a session beer with a different taste.

500ml. bottle from Trinity Liquors in Spring Hill, FL. Pours a cloudy orange-amber with a medium white head that dissipates completely. Aroma is very nice. Tons of citrus, flowers, and yeast. Best aroma of any Hefe that Ive come across. Flavor is mostly citrus and yeast. Bad, sticky mouthfeel...Alot of carbonation. Kind of metallic. Best hefeweizen Ive had...Its pretty damn good...I would consider buying this again.

Banana, clove and a nice grainy aroma added to this beers appeal as it poured with a massive head over a dark gold body with russet highlights. Malty and grainy upfront, followed by a fruity banana bread taste. Finishes with cloves and a peppery sensation. Clean on the palate, but the carbonation is a little low for my liking.
Pours a merky golden brown "sewage water" with a thick creamy tan head. Aroma of citrus, clove and yeast. Taste has a hint of clove, wheaty. A little watery.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours cloudy translucent brown, with tangerine tones. Citrus and yeast on the nose, and similar with banana on the palate. Medium mouthfeel, with carbonation a little on the low side. Decent Hefe Weizen.

This is perfection in a bottle... even better on tap.  If you are a German weizen fan, try this.  Its clove-yeast aroma takes me back to Germany.  It has a refreshing taste with moderate carbination.  It is my favorite in the world!

(Bottle on 2009-02-09) Orange and cloudy. Long lasting white head. Banana and fruitines in aroma. Medium bodied palate with medium carbonation. Banana, frutiness, hint of sweetness, bitterness and hint of saltiness in taste. Banana and bitterness in aftertaste.

500 ml bottle from the Utah State Store. Pours a deep brown-red color with a large thick white head. A rich spicy and nose. some banana and malts also. The flavor is very smooth; light bananas, clove, other spices, and not much in terms of citrus. Very spicy and drinkable. Quite nice.
Has a smokey aroma mixed with hops.Murky brown but thats because I didnt pour it properly and disturbed the sediment. Some lacing on the glass. Also has a smokey flavour.
very wheaty, a little dry and too carbonated compared to other common weisses but pretty good
Aroma de fermentos e frutas cítricas. Coloração caramelo, escura, encorpada. Espuma densa, cremosa e duradoura. Paladar que lembra limão, com discreto gosto torrado no final. Excelente carbonatação.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, light brown with a dark orange tint. The head is initially decent in size, though it soon disappears to fine layer of carbonation. Crisp aromas with a light estery fruitiness amidst notes of clove and a wheaty character. Fresh, light and crisp flavours: banana, wheat and berry and a sharp yet stuccato banana bitterness. Crisp, tart and dry mouthfeel.

Large bottle into weizen glass.  Bottle is probably past fresh, but Ill give it a shot anyway.  I was not expecting it to look like this!  Its way darker than I was expecting.  It does not look like any Hefe Ive seen.  Almost like sewage water in color and consistency (brown and cloudy). Big, thick, white, creamy head. Aroma is spicy, maybe a tad skunky due to age of bottle.  However, I am picking up on cloves and banana.  Spicey.  Banana and clove in the mouth.  High carbonation sensation.  Watery.  Not as bad as I was expecting due to the color, it was pretty good.  However, Im sure the quality was diminished due to age.  Ill need to try this one fresh somewhere soon!

[50ml bottle from Morrisons.] Murky amber in colour with a thick billowing cream head; sour wheat and yeast aroma; creamy mouthfeel; banana, cinnamon and candy flavours with lots of sweet chewy malts; banana and cream for afters. Very drinkable.

Slightly cloudy, dark yellow hue. 
Malty aroma with citrus and banana, some bubblegum and floral notes. Wheat and yeast are apparent. Beautiful! 
Flavours are sweet, and are of caramelised banana, some toffee malt.
Wheat is present in the flavours, with some caramel and clove. Excellent!

THis is my first hefe weizen.  It pours a pale hazey yellow color.   I can taste apple yeast hops.  Smooth.  I had a slice of old cheddar cheese with this and I found taste was very enhanced, very enjoyable.

One of the best hefeweizens Ive ever had.

Pours a dark cloudy brown with a frothy cream-coloured head. Nice lacing.

Aroma is cloves, coriander and spices. Wheat is upfront in the nose and a lot of sweet malt in the background.

The taste is a lot of coriander and clove and is a very well balanced hefeweizen. Not overly sweet with a pleasant herbal hop profile that isnt overpowering. Yeast comes through in the taste also.

Mouthfeel is pretty thin with a medium to high carbonation which makes this beer very refreshing.

The best hefeweizen that Ive had so far. This beer alone made me love the style. Goes great with pea soup.
Pours cloudy yellow with a decent amount of head. Aroma is subdued with some fruit and yeast.  Flavor is similar.  Clean finish, but not a lot going on. Not bad, but not a lot to talk about.

0.5L bottle, hazy brown to copper colour with some yellow taints. Vanila aroma with hints of barnyard spice and some vinous notes. Flavours of bubblegum and vanila over a strong but not overpowering bitter backbone with some sourness leading to a plaeasant spicey aftertaste, body is medium to full. Smooth, full of character weizen.
Wheatey, with aromas of sweet malt and caramel, and tastes of spices and citrus.  Also an apply finish.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2009 Bottle: quite yeasty, wheat banana and lemon notes, faint cooked apple and black current notes in the finish, quite fresh and clean taste, medium to light bodied,  not your typical wheat beer, pretty nice overall but nothing special really.

Pours a cloudy, dark brown color with yellowish edges; off-white head with great retention and lacing. Generous aroma, showing wheat and bananas and belgian sugars.  Flavour of crisp hop flavor and then dry orange flavor in the finish.  A decent, yet refreshing Hefe.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle thanks to my friend Chad.  Pours a hazy dark yellowish brown beer with a white head.  aroma is sweet spice and fruit, maybee bananas.  Medium body with a great filling taste.  good beer, would try again.
Bottled. This beer is darker than I expected. It smells of straw and cloves. The flavour is full and dry with wheat and spice with noticeable alcohol for the ABV.

500ml bottle.  Darker color than I expected.  Amber stained White Oak color, tall white foamy head.  Aroma of ripened bananas, some wheat and little clove.  Sweet malted wheat flavor.  A nice lemon character.  Balanced with a perfect addition of hops.  Very well balanced.  Full flavor of sweetness and citrus zest.  Super Hefe.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Very nice.  Much darker pour than Im used to with this style, but no worries.  Aroma and flavor match in awesomeness.  No competition to New Glarus incredible hefes.  Id definitely drink this one again.

A good hefeweizen that does not quite make the top tier. For me, this beer might suffer most from comparisons within the Schneider und Sohn family of beers than from comparisons to its actual style competition. Aventinus is a wonderful beer that makes the brewery really shine. This beer has a similar but toned down spicy wheat flavor. It is still far better than the vast majority of wheat beers. Schneider has an extremely special wheat flavor, and Aventinus expresses this flavor best. This beer mutes the flavor somewhat for a drier, less fruity experience. The flavor is still very good, full of spice and fruit, banana, esters. It is a very drinkable beer, even amongst other hefeweizens. The feel is a touch watery but otherwise very nice. The appearance is great. A column of dusky amber liquid glows beneath a frothy head. Little lacing remains as the head fades away, but the color makes up for it.

Poured slightly darker than I thought it would - close to a dunkel I poured yesterday.  Cloudy haze with white head.  Head did not last.  Crisp in the glass.  Aroma of bananas and some spice, sourness and vanilla.  Flavor had a sour start - sour fruit.  Smoothed into a sweetness.  Highly carbonated so danced on the tongue with a clean finish.

Very light brown body over an off white head. Nice smell of yeast, clove and other spices. Tasted of banana and clove with a slight bitterness. Watery palate, clean and quick to finish. Refreshing, but I like my weisse a bit sweeter.

500 mL into weizen glass. Pours a clear amber with a decent off-white head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, and orange peel. Taste is a little like apple cider with some sweet bread, corn, and metallic notes in the finish. Creamy mouthfeel. A disappointment.

500ml bottle into weizen glass. Murky orangey brown beer with a dense foamy lasting white head. Vigorous nose of spicy yeasts caramel wheat and lemon rind. Thick creamy palate with flavours of bananas cloves oranges and lemons. Maybe a hint of liquorice to finish. Very well integrated. It is considered a classic of the genre for very good reason IMHO.
Poured a golden color with a big white head. Toasted wheat aroma and grainy flavor.  A little straw and citrus flavors.  Decent german drink.
Draft. Pours a hazy yellow color. Nose is banana and some wheat. Taste is fresh with lots of wheat and banana. Bit high carbonation. Wierd rough mouthfeel.

Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium sized white head. Nose is banana clove, wheat and some corn. Taste is the same but the mouthfeel is kind of awkward and feels rough. Also some corn on the back end.
Bottle. Pours a dark, cloudy brown. Generous head that stays until the end. Citrus and a tad of banana, but not to my liking. Tastes metallic. The Weihenstephaner Hefe Weisse is far superior!

A good quality beer, but not completely to my liking.  A bit of banana, a bit of cirtrus and a little tangy.  For some reason there’s almost a numbing component for the palate. If you drink it you’ll probably be able to know what I mean.   There’s pretty full carbonation when you take a swig and it leaves a watery after effect.
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2009 Blue bottle, nice aroma of clove and banana, orange banana flavour with some clove, too cirusy and not sweet enough.
bottle - brown beer with white head. Typical yeasty banana aroma. The same for the flavour.

500ml bottle, pours a cloudy dark honey and brown, has a good size white head, there is a good amount of effervescence, aroma of banana, wheat, malt and some sweetness, flavor of wheat, malt bread and bread sweetness, has some citrus and pepper on the tongue at the finish, medium or so bitterness at the finish, has a nice creamy mouth feel, a good Hefe.

16oz bottle. Really lovely pour of dark amber, unusual for a hefe with an outstanding long lasting head. Nose is some clove and banana but a heavy wheat aroma that tickles the nose. Flavor has perfect carbonation, a much deeper more intense flavorful hefe than most with an awesome yeasty middle and a lovely banana finish with lots of laid back clove notes throughout and a bit of nutmeg and coriander. There is a reason why this is considered the original. If its not better than Ayinger, than its damn close.
500 mL bottle at Flat Rock Saloon.  Poured hazy orange with typical thick Hefe head.  Yeasty with bananas and citrus dominating the flavor.  Very thin.

Shared w/ SkyCop32.  Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt.  Pours a hazy golden orange.  Aromas of bread/bananas/ and some fruit.  Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice.  Not as clove/banana as most Hefs I’ve tried.  I would actually seek this one out.
This pours very dark with a good fruity aroma.  There is not a lot of cloves in this beer compared to some others but has all the other tastes that a complex wheat beer does.

Pours a cloudy iced-tea colour out of the bottle with a white head that dissapates to the edge of my glass fairly quickly. Aroma is of apples, cloves and a touch of citrus. Tastes of cloves and oranges, has a touch of bitterness and then finishes slightly sour.

Pours hazy peach with lively carbonation and rambunctious white head. Aroma is orange peel, lemon grass, and grapefruit along with a gamut of other citrus delicacies. Clove and allspice abound. Flavor is delicate and sweet with decent malt character for the style. Palate is caressing and smooth, although a tad on the thinner side. An excellent representation of the style- would make a great summer sipper!
Bottle. Pours a hazy copper/orange colour with head head. Aroma and taste is fruits, bread, yeast, hops, wheat.
Bottle.  Slightly cloudy copper pour with a nice white head.  Aroma of bread, bananas and yeast.  Taste of yeast, faint spices, caramel and some tangy citrus.  A little thin on the palate.

Bottle, 500ml. A cloudy bronze colour with a good head. A good aroma of wheat, banana and yeast. Taste has plenty of wheat and malt with clove, banana and citrus. Moderate carbonation. An enjoyable hefe.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml or 1 pint .9oz bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: It had a dark bronze color like a Dunkelweizen. The body was hazy and had some visible carbonation. It produced a thick billowy head that was cloudy white in color and had good retention and slick lacing.

Smell: The aroma had a fruity yeasty character that stood out over hints of wheat malt.

Taste/Mouth feel: It is very smooth and creamy on the palate with soft carbonation and a good solid medium body. The flavor has a big solid malty presence with creamy wheat, sweet bready and lightly toasted caramel notes. Flavor notes of fruity yeast, banana and clove are present and well balanced. Its hop flavor is very mild and it finishes fairly crisp and balanced.

Notes: Overall I enjoyed its wonderful deep malty flavor and drinkability.

Bottle. Enjoyable, easy drinking hefe with plenty of complexity in aroma and flavor. The body is hazy, medium amber in color with a big, frothy, off-white head that sticks around. The aroma is filled with banana, orange and spice with notes of caramel and grain (toasted bread) and a few hints of overripe fruit, particularly pear and plum. The flavor is moderately sweet, but the finish turns lightly bitter. Still some light sweetness sticks around the whole sip. Medium body with a watery texture. Lively carbonation, but one the smooths out the mouthfeel. Nicely done.
Half liter bottle.  Flavors of toasted wheat, caramel yeastiness, with some nuttiness and banana notes.  Poured light brown with foamy head.  Some nuttiness and toastiness to the aroma.
Bottle 500 ml. R$ 8.00 (US$ 4.16) in The Dubliners Irish Pub, Salvador, Brazil. Dark orange color with a thin head. Citrus aroma and taste.
Bottle.  Pours a light cloudy orange body with a white top.  Bananas spices orange loads of wheat.  Malt, eyasty, apple and some spices.  Good beer.
Bottle.  Cloudy amber pour with a nice sized mostly white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, spices and bread.  Flavor is malty, yeasty, bready, fruity and overall a nice beer.

Bottle, poured into a weissen glass.  Light amber color with a nice tall white head.  Smell is slightly malty and yeasty.  Flavor is very malty and wheaty with a nice creamy mouthfeel.  Very light bitterness but it works nicely letting light grain flavor through.  Very nice

50cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy dark amber color with a two finger off-white head that settles slowly and still laces the glass. Aroma is much like most hefeweizens with notes of grain, hay, grass, bread, yeast, banana, clove, and other spices. Flavor is spicy with notes of malt, yeast, bread, some ripe fruit, and maybe hints of banana and clove. Generally light body with a crisp finish. Nice hefe.

Draught into Weizen glass. Pours a cloudy golden brown with a big, fluffy, long lasting white head. Nose is banana and cloves, crisp wheat. Taste matches nose - banana and clove underpin the crisp, light wheat body of the beer, with a slightly dry, clean finish with a hint of hop bitterness that doesn’t linger on the palate at all. Fruity banana is less prominent than, say, Weihenstephaner. Emminently drinkable, delicious and classic.
Bottle, thanks ekstedt. Greyish brown with white head. Light, pleasant aroma with lots of hops. Light, dry, pleasant taste. Soft mouthfeel.

Pours a cloudy rich brown color with a nice light beige head atop.  Smell is rich wheatiness, banana, and light spicing.  Richer and darker smelling than most hefeweizens.  Taste is rich semi-dark malted wheat with some fruity banana flavor.  Light yeast spice flavor, and I can see the nutmeg apple descriptions from the bottle in the beer as well.  Medium bodied and soft carbonation.  Pretty good hefeweizen and darker in flavor than most.

pours a hazy brown with a solid frothy head. aroma of plum, raisin, yeast, and some malt. Flavor is quite nice, with similarities to the aroma and definite darker notes than typical of the style. Palate is ok, a solid beer.

very dark color for a hefeweizen.  lots of interesting flavor, including some spice - maybe clove and some grapefruit finishing with some banana essence.  palate is quite refreshing, it says champagne like on the bottle and while it’s weak to copy the bottle, i have to agree.  i’m not sure how it stacks up against its style, but i liked it pretty well.
Muddy amberbwith medium beige head. Sweet yeasty aroma wth wheat and banana notes. Flavour likewise with a sweet finish.

Bottle. Aroma has a bit of plum and maybe a little alcohol toward the end. Flavor is what you would expect in a very good German wheat like Hacker-Pschorr or Franziskaner, but I find the malts here a bit darker and that some substantial effervescence plays a significant role in framing the malt. Just an alright hefe.
Pint on tap.  Hazy amber with a mellow smooth flavor and a spicy nose.  Someone else mentioned banana and grapefruit notes... we agree.  Went very well with the bratwurst plate we were having.
Pours a kind of unappetizing color of clear motor oil.  Pleasant, banana baby food and coriander spice aroma.  Easy drinking, bright flavor to match.  A bit watery, but refreshing.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2010 (bottle) murky golden-brown colour, firm white head. aroma has pronounced banana esters, cloves, a subtle hop spiciness and light hints of roast and coffee. flavour has a strong wheat base, cloves, hazelnut, hop spices, roasted coffee. pleasantly modest carbonation, well-rounded medium body, not too sweet.

From a 500 ml bottle that cost $4.05 from the North Coast Coop in Arcata, CA this poured a cloudy yellow with a very large white head and great lacing. Nose is of ripe fruit, mostly banana.  Smooth silky mouthfeel.  Flavor is lively and of banana and some yeast.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Malty yeasty nose, hint of clove, smells like Bavaria.  Yellow/brown amberish color with a massive head, some cloudiness.  Anisette sweetness, slight bitterness, the spiciness is what balances it.  Huge carbonation, smooth licoricey finish.  This is a fantastic and rich Hefeweizen, seems it would hold up well with just about any dish.

Schneider & Sohn were one of my first and best introductions to the deep potential of lagers and German beers.  It comes as no surprise, then that their Weisse Hefeweizen is lovely brew.  From the two inch thick foamy white head comes a seductive toffee aroma, sweet and sticky, with an added touch of banana nut bread.  Always welcome in a good hefe-weizen.  I also catch a whiff of dark fruit, likely a plum, but it’s more of an afterthought to the aromatic core of banana nut bread and toffee.  By this point I’m salivating pretty frantically, so I move for a sip, and am rewarded with another soft dose of banana, which then arcs over onto a separate cluster of light fruits, almonds and walnuts, and finishes slightly dry but with a maintained and perfectly pitched ester sweetness.  I’ve never found, nor do I expect to find, a Hefeweizen with a complexity to match a good ale, but as far as simple and refreshing drinking go, Schneider & Sohn have brewed another tastament to the potential beauty of the lager style.

Schneider Weisse Original is a very nice German Hefeweizen. Solid flavors and aromas are present with no mistake of clove and bananna. The beer is hazy amber in color with a sistaining off-white head. I enjoyed this with a meal!

Sampled at Cellar’s Wine & Spirits Wednesday evening beer tasting. Pours a hazy golden blonde Hefe-style brew with a thick and lumpy white head that has some nice retention. Aroma of typical hefe/banana esters, cloves, bubblegum, sweet pears and a touch of water mellon. Taste is medium to full bodied, light carbonation with flavors of banana esters, yeast, cloves and some alcohol presence. Finish has a lingering yeast/banana aftertaste that is quite refreshing.

Great beer with full body and creamy texture, adequate balance with bitterness and malt taste. brown color and those frotty head that is only possible with fine process of top fermentation. bit alcohol in the aroma.

Medium brown pour with a light offwhite dissipating head.  Banana wheat aromas and some light fruitiness.  Mouthfeel is light,  but  pleasant.  sweet ipe Banana, spicy taste, a little fizzy though.  overall decent weizen.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 Re-rate 5/20/14: Bottle. Cloudy dark amber-brown color with an off-white head. Lovely aroma with lots banana, bubblegum, some caramel and a mild spicy hint.Sweetish flavor, fruity, slightly tart, with some caramel and a slightly spicy finish. Rounded mouthfeel. Very good. 8/3/7/4/14=3.6

(6/19/08) Bottle at Aufsturz in Berlin. Cloudy brown with a huge stable beige head - BEAUTIFUL! Aroma of wheat, some spiciness, fruits and bubblegum notes as well as hints of caramelly malt. Sweetish fruity wheaty flavor with some banana, nice spiciness and great light tartness that appears a big later. Medium-bodied. A really great Weizen! 7/5/8/4/15=3.9
Bottle @ de Ponteneur. Hazy amber coloured, big off-white head. Aroma of banana, caramel, yeast. Taste is refreshing, caramel, yeast, wheat, some citrus. A bit of a dry finish.

...bottle from Cloudwine.  On the nose, hints of carmalized sugar, cloves and  roasted malts, with some fruity apple.  The color was darker than the typical hef, a cloudy amber.  Lively tight carbonation, with an off-whitish head that diminished rather quickly with not much lacing.  Mouthfeel was full bodied, with great clove notes, slightly roasted malts, yeast and a dry, slightly sweet finish witha slight hint of alcohol.  Overall, a great hef, and I’m glad I tried it, I will have it again.
Pours somewhat darker than a typical hefeweizen. The beer has a good body and a banana-yeast flavor. Not as biting as some Hefeweizens.

Hazy deep amber beer with no head.  Aroma is spicy, banana, and wheat.  Aroma carries over into the flavor, with an added bit of bitterness.  Mouthfeel is smooth and fizzy. Finish is clean, slightly sweet, with a touch of clove.

No 415
Rated: 21.05.2008
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours mahogany - amber body colour, hazy to cloudy in texture with visible yeasty sediments floating in the body texture, body colour is amazing for a plain Hefeweizen, it looks more like a Dunkel Weizen and the same with head, it is white but initially medium and quite quickly decreasing to very small what is again typical of German Dunkelweizen, at least according to my own personal experience. There is no head lacing and head is frothy in its structure. Carbonation of the body is very lively what creates a fantastic effects.
Aroma: Typical of German Hefeweizen, banana, clove, yeasts, all strenghtened by the lively carbonation, very well balanced aroma, not as sweet and alcoholic as the previously tasted ’Wieninger hefeweissbier’. There is additional hint of slightly toasted malts, burned sugar (caramelly like) and refreshing, gentle fruity aroma, apple like.
Flavour: Very well balanced and wheat flavour, for me much better from those Weizens I’ve tasted so far apart from ’Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier’, very complex and compound taste on the other hand. Banana, clove, a hint of blackberry or bramble, yeasts not overwhelming the whole taste but on the other hand no impression of being wattery. Some gentle notes of toasted malted barley and wheat grains, mature, pronounced, perfectly balanced, a real mastercraft. Slightly spicy and positive alcoholic warmth on palate. Finish duration is long.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is rather creamy with a mineral and tangy accents, carbonation on palate is rather soft, finish feel is mineral, salty, slightly accidic, creamy with accompaining floral hoppy nose, gently alcoholic in the end. Really a mastercraft.
50cl bottle.  Medium coloured body, amber.  Definitely dark for a hefeweizen.  Very apparent taste of bananas.  Pleasant citrus notes.

Bottled. Mahogany coloured, dark for a hefeweizen, with a short-lived yet decent, foamy head. Sweet caramel aroma with plenty of yeast and some cloves. Full flavoured with some bananas, spice and grain before a decent bitter finish, that was unusual for this type of beer. tried alongside the Weihenstephaner hefe and held its own - good stuff.
0,3 l tap at The Wharf, Aalborg. Slightly hazy amber color, nice white head. Aroma is citric with bananas, wheat and some spices. Flavor is the same, with a mild acidic finish. Fine carbonation.

bottle bought at oddies- pours hazy light brown, golden orange red. very beautiful. head disperses quite fast. nose is bubble gum. dampened earth. mud. and some berries. fizzy sparkling mouthfeel, with fruit berries through out. and cola flavours. a lot lighter than the hopfen weisse but still quite enjoyable. 3.6 definite 3.6.

Pours a really hazy and deep amber with a nice fluffy head, that settles down a bit, but pretty decent lacing. Lots of the expected hefeweizen scents - banana, clove, spice, citrus...nice. Taste is not too carbonated, but spicy and a bit alcoholic, even though it’s just 5.4%. Perhaps the first weizen I ever tried (years ago), but still the one the rest are compared to. One of my favourites...although admittedly a bit heavy.
darker than any Hefe I’ve ever had, had a pleasant weizen nose, fruity and a little spicy. Smooth with the classical acidity. Nevertheless not the beer for me.

0.5l at a terrace in Tilburg. I recommend you this place called t Buitenbeentje, 2,80 for 0.5l, very cheap. Im not very experienced with German Hefeweizens, but based on this one I can say: I like it. Smooth taste with less banana than the other ones I had. Nice beer!

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2008 Appearance: Light brown, cloudy. Not much head.
Aroma: Wheat (obviously).
Taste: Very wheaty. Hint of banana. Not my thing.
Info: 500ml bottle, 8/10-2005, 37/300, 22/500
Am I the only one not liking this one? I am not big on wheat beers, and did not like this one at all.

Murky brownish amber with a thin off-white head.  Aroma of yeast, sweet malt, clove and nutmeg.  Taste of more of the same with some citrus on the back end.  Decent hefe  smooth and possess a lively caronation feel.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a Weizen glass. JN17/08.
App.:  Cloudy brown-amber with a decent off-white head.
  
Aroma:  Spicey  clove and cinnamon, yeasty with less of the typical banana esters, fruity  raisins, apricots and cherries.
  
Palate:  Medium body, moderate effervescence with some sharp bubbles, slightly astringent.
  
Flav.:  Slightly nutty, lots of cloves and cinnamon, banana esters, some raisins and other fruits; fairly dry with a light clove finish.

Seems to me I used to enjoy this more...maybe its a older bottle?  Maybe my tastes have changed?  Better drink more to find out!

500ML Bottle: Muddy red in color, good one finger head. Smells like nutmeg. Flavor is a combonation of mild amount of bitterness and sourness. Nutmeg, fruity and spices alll thrown in. Lots of carbonation. Good brew, but I wouldnt but it again.

Hefeweizen tasting at Three Cellars Milwaukee.
A nice basic Hefeweizen. I found nothing out of this world here.

Pours a light orange/yellow with a foamy head. The head was gone very quickly. It was a nice smooth beer but - and this is my fault - after having a triple the body just didnt hold up. I need to go back and rereview this. It was fruity and smooth but it felt a little watery and not fully developed.

Pours dark hazy amber with a light tan head.  It is significantly darker than most hefes.  The aroma has lots of spicy spritziness, rich banana, clove and nutmeg.  It is very full rich and enticing.  Medium body with lots of carbonation.  The taste has the aroma traits, but is on the watery side and has the spices WAY out front.  The finish is peppery and lightly citric.  The aroma is better than the taste.

500ml  bottle served in shaker glass at BB Rovers on 6-19-08:  Poured a smoke filled room hazy copper tan color, nice fluffy off white head one finger thick stayed around long enough to have it introduce itself to friends and the old lady and laced slowly away after each sip, zesty aroma of lemon, clove, bananas, wheat, yeast, and magical German goodness.  Hits the mouth with a medium body, all aromas convert to taste beyond what is to be expected, middle has a slight sweet tang, finish is smooth that leaves you wanting to have some more.  Excellent example of the style- immediate notice send to my frig for incoming brew!

In my opinion, this is a beautiful hefe-weizen, and the way all hefe-weizens should be. It pours a cloudy orange colour with a large fluffy, sticky white head with excellent retention. Very sweet yet not overpowering aromas of tropical fruit. Bannanas, papaya and orange. creamy on the palate, super subtle hop flavor with a round mouthfeel. Wicked tastey, cant wait to get this again. :)

Surpringly dark hazy amber pour with substantial white head. Aroma is of sour fruit with a little spice. Nice taste; crisp with mild banana, grass, and clove. Finish has just the right amount of sour bitterness. Palate is slightly disappointing, retreating right at the end. I noticed this effect seemed to be much less with smaller sips! Nice beer overall.
Bottle-Pours a dark copper color, almost brown with a large head.  Taste and smell of wheat and banana.  Produce Place.

Bottle 0.5 l. Bought Irma Hilleroed. Unclear light brown colour with beige head. aroma yeast and malt. Taste malty slightly bittersweet with a note of smoke. Rich carbonation. I had expected something else.

The commercial description describes the drinking experience fairly well. This beer is reasonably full-bodied and does a good job of adding some extra elements to the traditional, highly-carbonated wheat experience. Purchased several times since my first taste.

Thanks to Nick for this brew.  Pour is cloudy golden with a full white head.  Aroma is very floral with spice and orange.  Taste is even more floral with light coriander, nutmeg, and light bitter orange.  Real good brew.  Nicely balanced.  Highly carbonated.  Would buy again.

Bottle.  The commercial description nails it pretty well so I wont add much.  What impresses me about this beer is its relative subtlety.  Nothing too overwhelming; great balance.  Some wonderful tea-like notes underlying all the banana, clove, yeast, lemon, etc. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2008 On-tap at Bishop´s Arms, Västra Hamngatan, Gothenburg. Amber color with a fluffy white head. Spicy and yeasty aroma with notes of cloves, nutmeg, banana and wheat. Taste of spices, yeast, banana, some other light frutiness, white bread, sourish notes, and some hop bitterness. Not that great on-tap.

Bottle. Cloudy brown amber with medium head with long lasting lacing. Aroma of banana and wheat, nice. Taste much wheat and weak banana notes. Good carbonation. Long lasting aftertaste. A nice and fullbodied beer.
a overall good wheat beer. long lasting taste  destinstive taste of fruit and a hint of yeast.

bottle. Cloudy amber colour, large and long-lasting head. Full-bodied, velvety and creamy mouthfeel. Fruity with hints of banana and a touch of lemon. Slightly hoppy. Very well balanced, a superb example of the style.

Poured from bottle at Opal Devines in Austin.  Deep brown/amber color.  Smells of citrus.  Taste is of a usual hefeweizen, but I love the darker malty hints and spices.  No real aftertaste.  A clean beer.  Fresh and fun.

Bottle pours a delicious looking cloudy mohagany color with a very dense foamy white head.  Very nice spiced wheat aroma with hints of banana and clove.  Flavor is more of the same with a fresh and clean aftertaste.  The slight bitterness in the finish was a nice treat.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2009 Sweet, wheaty flavor with a smooth finish.  Had it served ice cold in a bottle but as it cooled the flavor came out more and it has plenty of it.  Delicious aroma with an almost citrusy tone.  Overall impressed and should be for what I paid for it.
From tap. The color is a lot like your average lager, but its much more opaque. The aroma and flavor confirm the visual clue: its wheaty, and in a good way.

Bottled. An amber beer with a huge white head. Aroma is very wheaty and fruity, notes of spices and some roasted malt. Taste is also wheaty and quite spicy. Some caramel. Some bitternes in the end and a strong body for a weisse. Very good beer

Poured from bottle an amber caramel color with a large white head and lots of carbonation.  Aromas of clove, banana, and caramel.  Flavor is mildly sweet with caramel, banana, clove, and a lightly tart yeastiness to the finish.  The smell and flavors are great, I just wish it had a bit more acidity in the body.  None the less, Ill be having more.
botella 500 Ml. tipica cerveza de trigo. esta es de las mejores del tipo.

Pleasantly fresh fruits - without the overt banana or clove - spicy like all-spice or nutmeg.
Flavor: Starts with a nice malty note which yields to a light hop flavor and then nice fruity notes
Medium-light body with a spritzy and long tangy finish with some lingering fruity (banana) notes 
I have to admit to myself - these classics are no where near their best after shipping here. They come across wanting - Having tried the same beer in Germany I remember being floored by the meld of all the characters that are in this beer
Really nice hefeweizen with orange and banana in the flavour and lovely clove notes.

This is automatically my go to for this style.  I dont think it gets much better than this.  A solid malt backbone, with a richer texture on the palate than most, with a lot of banana and clove notes, very clean and refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2009 Pours a darker color than expected; a hazy amber color. Nice big fluffy white head. Aroma is of cloves, yeast, some spice and banana. This beer is very refreshing, clean and fresh with some yeast and spices to go along with a citrus banana flavor. The flavors are very soft, gentle and buttery. Definitely a good choice on a hot day. Re-rate 4/25/09. Pours a copper color with a huge fluffy head that does settle down a bit. Fresh aroma consisting of bananas, cloves, flowers. Flavor adds a touch of spice. This is soft, creamy, and extremely well-rounded. Tasty beer. Ratings get bumped. Ill probably be drinking this one on a regular basis this summer.
ambrata buona schiuma peristente speziata fruttata leggermnete tostata rinfrescante piacevolmente acidula
bottle, big hefe head that leaves a little lacing on the glass, muddy orange brown color, nice banana and spice flavor with good but slightly off finish

#300: Bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a medium white head that fades away pretty fast. The aroma is dominated by banana, pear and yeast. The taste starts out a bit sour and then gets a banana-like sweetness but still those sour notes in the back. A nice hefeweizen, but not as good as Weihenstephaner

Pours hazy dark orange.  Sweet nose of banas, grass, cirtus and spice.    Flavor is crisp and clean, but not as rounded as I like my hefeweizen.  Some pilsener-like spice on the finish. Hardly any banana in the taste.  This bottle may not be entirely fresh.  Ive had it before with a more pronounced wheat flavor.  Certainly not a bad beer by any means, but a little disappointing from the brewer of my favorite beer.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle; hazy, dark golden appearance of dull bronze.  Spritzy pear, mint, and doughy banana nose.  Vanilla wafting in the middle.  Flavor is soft, crispy, and highly refreshing; bits of golden fruits, light spice, minerals and pine on plenty of hearty yeasts.  Clean, tart, quenching palate; finishing fairly dry with some residual airy sweetness.  Completely as it should be.
[bottle] Pours fairly dark and hazy with a large tan head. Aroma of banana and cloves. Slightly tart, but sweet mouthfeel. Good stuff.

The original hefeweizen from the worlds greatest brewery...at least thats my opinion. I love virtually every beer Schneider und Sohn puts out and this is no exception. I love the dark amber color and its sweet fruity finish similar to that of the greatest beer on planet earth, Aventinus.

500mL bottle. Ridiculous amount of head. Make sure it is chilled, or you are going to be waiting 30 minutes to actually taste it. Banana and some kind of spice aroma (clove?). Lots of carbonization. Hefe isnt my favorite type of beer, but this was pretty okay.

From a 500mL bottle purchased locally. Aroma has banana with a little clove. A cloudy amber with a big rocky off white head. Darker than most weisse beers. Flavor is a little tart and a little oxidized. Some of the banana and clove flavors come through. Highly carbonated, light mouthfeel that finishes clean. This would be a better beer if it was fresher. The shelf has not been good to this bottle.

Bonificare la piana del Fucino (imperatore Claudio) ? Bonificare la palude pontina (presidente Mussolini) ? e chi bonificherà mai la Schneider Weisse??!?!?! Nemmeno Topo Gigio ci proverebbe, per fortuna. Sensazionale.

This beer is seriously alive - really lively pour, with a huge, frothy head - turbid, dark, apple cider-looking beer - strong clove and nutmeg in the aroma, with some nuttiness, light earthy wheat, and strong yeasty character - a wee bit thin on the palate - its actually quite dry, with a nearly sour tartness that compliments the musty, earthy qualities of the wheat - this quality is amplified in the finish - in between it is fairly clean and one-dimensional - some grain and clove - the bitter character is what sets it apart, and keeps it from being boring - Ill take a Weihenstephaner over this any day.

Pours a cloudy amber color with a small white head.  Smells of light banana, somefruity citrus, and mild wheat characters.  More fruity and darker in color than I was expecting.  The flavor had a lot of sweet wheat characters, some banana and subtle clove as well.  Nice full mouthfeel, with a fruity sweet finish.  Very nice hefe, I like the Edel Weisse better, but this is very solid.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Fresh Fruity Banana. pours fresh cloudy with great aroma. Makes you think of a warm summers day

This is a nice hefe.  .5L bottle poured into a wheat beer glass.  It poured brownish-amber right up to the line.  There are distinct clove, banana, apple, and yeast notes.  The taste is of the same with cloves and bananas omni-present.  It is a bit heavy on the mouthfeel for a hefe.  The finish combines the banana and some sour notes.  It is good, but I agree with some other raters-not may favorite hefe-weizen.

0.5L bottle in a wheat beer glass - Pours a cloudy light amber color with fairly large fluffy white head. Aroma is full of cloves, light caramel, touch of bananna, bit of lemon. Flavor is fairly malty, yeasty, definite bananna, light caramel. Finish is balanced. Fairly highly carbonated. Very nice overall, though a bit dark it seems to me for the style.

Aroma is a little sour; yeast yields spice, clove, and some sweaty characteristics. The aroma kinda of reminds me of eating capers. Flavor: Its kinda watered down, a characteristic which Ive found to be all too common in Hefes. Flavor has a lot of clove sitting around in the background. A bit acidic leaving a nice dry finish thats almost tart.

Pours a deep amber color with an awesome soapy white head. The aroma is full of apple, cloves, and general wheaty spice. The flavor I must admit is a little bit disappointing - the apple comes through nicely, fading into a very pleasant yet bitter green apple/sourdough bread finish. While this is all good, the flavor is pretty straightforward and one dimensional; not quite as lively as a great hefe should be. The mouthfeel is similarly lacking - while the beer is relatively full bodied and very drinkable, the carbonation is a bit lacking. This beer doesnt have the lively combination of spice/carbonation that I really enjoy in a hefeweizen. This is a good beer (I especially like the unique apple flavor), but not my favorite example of the style.

Probably not the kind of beer you would prefer to enjoy with a nice home-cooked meal of chicken parmesean (not that it wasnt quite delectable) but either way, a tasty, tasty brew. When your nose is pressed less than an inch from the head, once poured, it gives off aromas that are of wheat and bananas, and slightly of vinegar alcohol making me squint after a good sniff.  Once tasted, a soft carbonation complements the flavors of the drink which are first slightly of apple, then of banana and a hint of honey, with a bitter finish. Not bad at all, not on the level of Schneider Weisses Aventinus...
user_location: Los Angeles/New York, New York, USA

text: Pours a cloudy amber with a fine head. Aroma is of banana esters, wheat and malt. Medium body with sweet citrus and banana flavours through to the tart finish. A little too light for my liking.

Nice light bouquet of cloves and banana with a slight hint of fermenting vinegar alcohol. Wasnt impressed with the quick dissipating head not even a lace on the glass. Large bubble size would sum that up. Cloudy rust in color. What I like to do is before the bottle is empty I leave just a little of the elixir and swirl the contents to get the wheat that settled off the bottom. Taste was a little to light for me. And even though Hefeweizen is my fav. This one has a nice wet mouthy feel but a little to wet for my likes. Not a real true hefe in my opinion. Could be more considered a light hefe. Im just taking taste, but it does pack the punch of hefe. Putting all things aside I like it but it would be last resort if I can get better.

0.5l bottle. Pours a cream golden brown, with a smallish head. Little visible carbonation. The strong aroma is wonderful. Banana, citrus, wheat, yeast and some nuts.   Palette slightly sour and bitter at the same time, yet smooth, and leaves the tongue tingling, but is a little oily. Taste is fantastic. Elements of banana, nuts, yeast, cloves. Absolutely fantastic.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with huge head. Sweet aroma of banana, wheat and citrus. The flavours is banana, candy store, citric fruits and some spices. Good mouthfeel. I love it.

Dark orange and misty brew, head gone,good carbonation.Aroma sweet,wheat,sugar,malt.Flavour a plesant wheat sweetness,banana,grapes,a fun little beer full of flavour typical of Schneider & Sons.Clove finish good herb flavour and mild orange.

Muddy pale brown with a huge head. Aroma of banana, wheat, spice pebber and mint. The flavours has some spice identical to Aventinus, but in weak form -it is sweet to begin with (peach), then it goes acid and ends a bit metallic with a medium carbonated feeling.

Bottle. Standard hefe aroma: banana, clove, yeast,  wheat. Pleasant. pours a surprising bright copper.  Dry on the palate. Crisp  with plenty of yeasty earthiness. Lighter tropical fruit notes towards  the finish.  Medium bodied and quite creamy. Unspectacular but  inoffensive.

16.9 oz bottle.  Poured a cloudy light amber color with a nice 3 finger fluffy white head that lingered.  Aroma was mild, but favorable.  Mostly of doughy yeast and a hint of clove.  Taste was good. Light and refreshing with the characteristic Hefeweizen yeasty/banana taste.  Wheat flavor also comes through in the finish.  A slight metallic taste in the finish and also detectable in the aroma (odd, but not too bad) Palate was good not great.  Light body and pretty limited carbonation.  All in all a good german Hef.  Light and refreshing, perfect for a spring/summer day.

Schneider Weisse Original Hefe-Weizen
ABV: 5.4%
IBU: ?
Calories: 200
Volume: 16.9 fl oz
Glass: Ococim Weizen
Purchased at: Shop Rite Liquors, Hamilton, NJ
Consumed on/at: Monday, March 10th, 2008

sensory first impression: Smells great, but looks rather murky. Head is bright white and well formed, but thins before too long. Lacing is strong and holds well. A very fruity and welcome first taste. Apples, nectarine, and banana are well balanced and very tasty. Thins out after a moment to a slightly watery finish. Carbonation shows itself through the murky depths. Visually, it reminds me of a mixture of apple juice, orange juice, seltzer, and just enough milk to really make it weird. Except for the milk, this is really its taste profile. But it tastes pretty good. Hops are quiet. Malt is nice, subtle, and warming.

Aroma/Olfactory:
Malt flavor is: nuts, toast, fruit juice.
Hop flavor is: grassy, light, citrus.
Yeast flavor is: moldy, muddy, mushroom
Other flavors include: banana, watermelon, raisin, vanilla, clean.

Visuals/Appearance:
Color is: tan, translucent brown, dusty, smoky. Sandstorm.
Liquid is: cloudy, and slightly chunky with sediment.
Head and lace are: thick then bumpy, then flat, then wispy. Disappointed by the lace, after a wonderful start.

Taste/Flavor:
Maltiness or Sweetness level is: light to medium.
Hoppiness or Bitterness level is: none to light.
Sour level is: very light.

Palate/Tactile:
Body or Mouthfeel is: light to medium.
Texture is: creamy, with a crisp finish.
Carbonation is: average or less.
Finish is: sweet, short, and a bit watery.

Overall experience: Not bad, by any means, but not a great beer. For a great rich experience with fruit infusion, Ive been enjoying Victory Golden Monkey. For a more reasonable alcohol level than the Monkey, Ive really grown fond of Flying Fish Abbel Dubbel. Both of these do great things with bananas. Schneider is more like a fruit spritzer, and much less pretty than either Victory of Flying Fish, but not bad.
Tasted 2008-03-09. Pours very unclear, cola brown with beige head. Aroma: wheat, banana, citrus. Flavour: Ditto. Medium to light body. OK beer. Not impressing.

[bottle] Nice dark brown color. Very hazy, with a serious dense white head. Bready yeast and slightly tart wheat aroma. Flavors spicy wheat, banana esters and some clove. Very well rounded. Strong, prickly carbonation.

Lately Ive been getting burned by Weissbeier in Des Moines. If its not on tap, generally its skunky. I can tell upon opening this bottle that this one is not going to disappoint. Smells delicious, yeasty ad doughy, with sweet malt & clove. And I swear that upon opening this bottle I could detect a light smoky aroma, to the point that I had to check to make sure that this was not a Rauch. I might just be insane though. Pours a pretty deep amber, very cloudy with a great fluffy white head that of course sticks around. The taste is beautiful, in my years of drinking Weisse, I am surprised that I hadnt gotten around to this one yet. Very good sweet banana & clove flavors, but there is more going on here than with youre typical Weisse. A little bit of fresh fruity hoppiness midmouth, avd a great dry sour flavor at the back of the tongue. The palate is soft at first then very sharp. Overall just what I needed to re-kindle my love of Weisseier.

Pours a translucent amber that changes a lot with the light. Off white head.  Aroma of cereal and berries.  Palate is thin, yet blends well with the apple and oat flavor.  Somewhat bitter finish that leaves a dry tongue ready for more.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2008 Pours cloudy amber. 40% foam, a good weissebier pour. The 2" head insists on staying around for the duration which is just totlly fucking awsome, you know I love that. Smells malty like dark wheat, and banana, with a hint of citrus. It truly is remarkable how the head on this beer stays around for the whole duration of the beer for your pure texas pleasure. Tastes like medium/dark wheat with a kiss of hops. Pretty sweet, maybe theres some dark sugar in there. Theres obvoiusly more wheat malt than barley malt, though both are present. Tastes more like a dunkel. Medium bodied. Boring.

Bottle: Hazy brown/Red colour, with a nice creamy head. Aroma of citrus,malty, and a bit caramel in the end.
Flöavor is dominated of malts,and caramel,some citric is there to,smouth mouth feeling,thin body. Medium smouth finish.
Brown, unclear. Off white head. Banana aroma with notes of toffee. More banana in the flavour. Malty. Wheat. Yeast. Good carnonation. Excellent.

Bottle...Pours a hazy burnt orange...w a good frothy off-white head. Aromas of grass, some dough and a touch of earth. The taste was very different from the smell; I got some hints of sweet yeast, bananas, and apples. Very watery on the palate w/ a soft finish. Im surprised it is rated this high.
Beautiful head and color, but the bitter aftertaste detracted a bit from the experience for me.

From tap at Ølbaren. Pours murky brown, white and dense head. Wheat, sweet and banana fruity - almost esterish aroma. Prickling mouthfeel.Fresh fruity wheat flavour, mild sweetness and light acidic touch. Light dry wheat and banana fruity finish.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2009 Cloudy orange-brown with a thick light head. The aroma is mostly bready, yeasty wheat smell. Some spicy, clove I guess. Fruity, too, some banana and lemon. The fruit is there in the taste as well, but more spiciness, a little tart too. Its pretty full-bodied for a wheat.
Bottle 50cl. Long lasting head, brown body, nose cloves and muscate. A true classic, overwhelming impression.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2008 Pours dark and muddy, soapy head at dissipates.  Yeasty nose, smooth bodied.  Well balanced. Very drinkable.  I was expecting a lot from this brewery, having Aventinus before, and they met my expectations.

Bottle at home.
Hazy, orange with a large white head. Aroma moderate malty (orange, clove), light hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet, light acidic.
Thick white head; darker than usual color for a hefe; cloves, bread, bananas in the taste; very sweet, refreshing, and drinkable though the aftertaste is a little bitter/sour.

Medium white head. Hazy opaque brown body. Chalky, yeasty, banana aroma with citric notes and hints of herbal licorice. Chalky yeasty banana taste with, again, citric herbal notes. Typical, soft wheaty mouthfeel with a kind of chalky feel to it. Dry, herbal, lemony aftertaste. Nice, but not terribly special. (0.5l bottle at Cardinal.)
Dark colour and large head. Bitter taste at first but eases a little as beer settles. Definately better than Paulaner. You will not be disappointed.

Amber-mahogany with big, foamy white head / Banana and spice nose / Medium body, a touch watery, with fine and lively carbonation and light but decent finish / Restrained flavors of banana, orange, apple, nutmeg, and coriander / Fine but unremarkable.
Schneider Weisse Original is a very good German Hefeweizen. I really enjoyed the unique and full-bodied taste.

Beer poured dark color for a hefe.  Aroma of cloves.  Flavor at pour was wheaty base, banana and cloves.  More bitter than other top hefes.  As it warmed a sweet bubblegum flavor also emerged and the bitterness subsided somewhat, but a sour tartness was present throughout.  Very good, but Im not sure Id give up my Weihenstephaner or Paulaner for this....
Amber/hazy straw in appearance with fluffy white head.  Nice and refreshing with lemon peel, clove, grain, bread, light fruit, and citrus.  An above average hefe.
defintently what a Hefe should be. darker than normal. It has a tangy taste in addition to the malty, banana flavor. do try

Gorgeous color, fruity hoppy aroma. Flavor is distinct for a weiß, mellow and low key and much less citrusy than most. Very bready and rich tasting with just a slight bitter finish. Definitely excellent.

On tap on a riverboat from Kelheim to Weltenburg 21 Jun 07. Strong aroma of citrus and banana. A good-looking white head. Unclear. Rich fruity flavor with a long fruity aftertaste and a sweet bitter finish. One of the best wheat beers.
My favourite wheat beer without a doubt, bubblegum and bananas on the nose with a spicy clove dryness on the palate. A lovely refreshing quenching beer.

Great color, like a wild-honey from the forest... A medium head with a freaky nose. In the flavour is some roasted malt, and however, the citrus and phenolic thing. Light carbonation, a little creamy feeling. I expected more, but good.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2008 Garrafa, em janeiro de 2008. Âmbar escura, turva, creme bege fino. Fermento, banana, cravo, frutada, porém tudo muito fraco, quase imperceptível. Agüada. Falta sabor. Leve amargor no paladar. Carbonatação média/baixa.

A pretty nice, somewhat citrusy weizen, with a lightly spiced (phenolic) nose. Banana comes out more in the flavor. Pretty fresh, spritely, with an easy finish. Well balanced between the wheatiness, esters and carbonation.
Aroma of light grains and bananas. Very cloudy light brown color with a large white head. Taste is initially bananas fading in the finish and becoming more bitter.
The bottle looks simple, but good. The beer in the glass the same. It tastes very fruity-spicy, very good. Thats the way, a weizen has to taste. Very good beer.
great beer bought for me for christmas.  Purchased in Jersey.  Smooth beer with a somewhat complex taste.

bouteille brune de 500ml.

bière de blé de belle couleur ambrée foncée (on dirait un dunkel) belle mousse épaisse et durable. nez très agréable de blé et de caramel, bouche épicée, très longue et persistante, gôut de blé avec une touche de caramel,  vraiment un classique. jadore.
From the tap poured a hazy straw color with lots of head.  Nice smooth hef flavor with a quick finish.

Great beer. Pours a hazy amber color with a good head. Very pleasant aroma of bannana and clove. This nice deep wheat malt flavor as well. Maybe I was not well that day, but allthough it tasted nice, I felt that the bannana and clove taste was weak, but nice....

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée chez LCBO (Ottawa, ONT). Arôme: Odeur de pain et dépices. Apparence: La couleur est brune pâle voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Gout de banane et dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture crémeuse. Forte effervescence en bouche. Présence dépice en arrière goût. (Rating #1381)
Bottle. POured a ruby orange. Aroma is of orange and wheat. Taste is malty and fruity.
de coloração âmbar, essa weissbier tem aroma pronunciado de maçã, mas é bem menos complexa em termos de sabor em relação às weiss mais respeitadas, como a Paulaner, um ícone alemão
Pours a hazy brown color with a white head.  Aroma is lots of banana with a hint of clove.  Flavor is wheat, clove, and a long banana finish.

Pours a clody golden amber with a huge forthy white head.  Citrus aroma with hints of orange, lemon, clove and yeast.  Excellent Hefe-Weizen.  Sweet malty taste with hints of clove, banana, lemon and orange peel, yeast and spice

500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark amber colour. Surprisingly dark. Very tall white coarse and fluffy head that falls down rather quickly. Phenolic aroma with a strong clove background. Quite a bit of banana there as well. Rounded malt sweetness. Strong wheat flavours. Mellow texture with a light oilyness that is being cut through by the high carbonation level. Lots of character. Perhaps a little too much on the sweetside for my taste, but otherwise an excellent weissbier.

A nice amber colored Hefe Weizen. I tasted honey and caramel. This German Wheat Ale is sweeter than most. A nice head which didnt last too long. I got this beer in a 500ml bottle, and paid $2.99, which I thought was expensive.

Medium amber to dark gold, quite dark for style, very murky.  Aroma lots of clove and some banana.  Flavor clove, banana, some grainy wheat.  A bit of bubblegum.  Bit overcarbonated for my tastes.  Not bad.  Faint tartness as well.
Pretty nice German style hefe with banana and spice aroma, yeasty notes.   A step above most I have  had/
Nice weisse with a lot of haze and medium sized head.  Had flavors of most weisse with banana and spice flavorings.  Overall a very enjoyable beer.

this is the original,so lets see what i think of that.looks like murky/rusty sink water with a small head.aroma is heavy malts,some hay,and cinnamon.flavor is cinnamon,all spice,muddy water,and earth.yup,thats it.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dep reddish/brown with an average size slightly foamy white head. Aroma of sour apples, wheat, grass, citrus fruit, and slght toffee malt blending it all togehter in a wierd meltig pot. Thin to medium bodied with light carbonation. Flavor of sour apples, grapes, wheat and citrus fruit. Not smooth, not good, but hey its still beer!!!

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2008 Cerveja de trigo. Muito boa. Cheiro de cereal - trigo. Coloração marron - o que diferencia das demais de trigo. Espuma de boa formação e densa. Sabor suavemente adocicado - caramelo. Leve e refrescante, boa para o calor. Retrogosto um pouco amargo. Boa cerveja.

Another beer I brought back from my trip to Germany. Pours out a dark cloudy tea color with a 2 finger off white head. Smells of coriander, wheat, banana, and a little clove. Initial taste is Banana, coriander, stale wheat bread, a strange hoppiness that throws me off, and lemon at the end. After taste of wheat and light citrus. A medium to full palate thats a little bit high on carbonation. A good weissbier, but I got some funky tastes in there. Much darker appearance than I am used to.
Great beer. Ours a hazy amber color with a nice froathy white head, smells very sweet and tastes almost like bubble gum, great interesting brew.

Bottle.  Poured a somewhat dark orange brown in the center with obvious yeast.  Light golden around the edges.  A small off-white head.  A yeasty alive aroma with signature blends of sweet and spicy.  A bit tart with a sweet overtone of banana.  Medium body with a tough of effervescent feel.

Pours to a murky yeast filled darker amber-brown body with a mostly lasting 1 cm frothy white head.  The aroma is very yeasty.  Wheat bread, bananas, esters.  The flavor is wheat bread, yeasty, carbonated mineral water, bananas, and cloves.  Very nicely balanced.  The palate is medium-light bodied, significantly carbonated, and nicely textured.  A little drying as my mouth is left watering.  Something in the aroma is really enticing.  Almost like it has a dash of nutty tobacco.  Very good.  Sampled side-by-side with Schneider Brooklyner.
Excellent color and sticky head. A little bitter than Im used to on the Hefes. Sticky sour finish.
user_location: Heart of the Rockies, Colorado, USA

text: Golden-bronze pour, with a lovely head. Rich aroma. A pleasant banana and clove flavour, with very subtle citrus tones. Nice thickness. Goes well with a meal, or dessert.

Bottle. Nice white foamy and turve color, Fruity aroma with a notes of banana and cereal.  Flavor is soft and good. Mouthfeel is sweety.Português: Cerveja de coloração turva com boa espuma. Aroma frutado com notas de banana e cereais. Sabor leve e bom. sensação na boca é doce.

As hefe as they come, murky brown beer - on tap at Düsseldorf airport. This is the real thing, a very aromatic beer. Banana, citrus, cereals. This is not a trendy beer, I suppose this is made just like a century ago. At the same time ti is drinkable for everyone. Every airport should have a decent beer like this.
Fad. Superlækker hvede. Mørk uklar med et udemærket hoved. Klassiske noter af banan og kløver i munden, med et fint bid. Superlækker.

Dark golden / amber pour, some bubbles and a medium white head.   Odd color for a hefe.  Sweet banana wheat aroma.  Flavor is very mellow,  light.   Like a bananas foster... ok but since the flavors are so mellow eventually all you have is a sugary taste overwhelming everything else.   Alcohol finish...

A nice twist on the traditional German style Hefeweizen.  Its slightly darkened to a medium brown color, with very nice attributes; good head formation, retention, and lacing.  The aromas of banana, clove, and wheat is good.  The taste also carries a nice little note of burnt toast on the finish.  Would be much, much better if it were slightly thicker, viscous, and more full bodied.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2008 This is a fairly dark, full-bodied hefewiezen that I reall like for its richer interpretation of the style, making it closer to the darker ales that I prefer.  It is a dark, cloudy amber with a thick, long-lasting off-white head with some lacing.  The aroma is fruity.  The flavour is sweetish yet crisp, with a distinct taste of wheat bread, some fruitiness, and a finish that is very bready mixed with spices.  It is smooth and tasty, with a pleasant tingly, yet full, feel.

Bottle. Very high and long lasting off-white creamy head. Hazy amber body with a good deal of yeast sediments. Distinct banana aroma. Sweet and relatively thin flavor with low carbonation and long aftertaste-.

Pours a semi-cloudy brown with an abundant pale head. This is a little darker than typical hefe weizens. The aroma is very citrusy. Oranges, bananas, and cloves seem to be pretty dominating with bread notes hiding behind. The flavour, when colder, seems to be more bread-like. As it warms, the oranges and lemon become more dominant. Bananas and cloves burst in the finish. This is pretty good.
Bottle: pour starts nice with big bubbles and a stark white big head. Bannana, clove and bubble gum flavors and smells.  Just a tad dark for a Hef but a nice beer all around.

16 oz in a .5 L weizen glass.  Darker than the other hefes Ive been drinking.  Nice and cloudy, big frothy white head that settles down to a thin line.  A lot more carbonated than, say, a Paulaner.  Fizzy.  Nice.  Not so sweet and banana (in my estimation) more malty than fruity.  A rich, tasty beer.  I prefer the more banana and sweet smelling hefes like a Fransizkaner, but this one is nice, and Ill buy (and drink) more.

Pours orangey amber, with a great steamed milk head. Attractive effervescence. Aroma is strongly of bananas with a little yeast and nutmeg. Flavour is also strong on bananas and yeast. Well balanced spices and clove round out the flavour.
