UPDATED: JUL 15, 2009 One of the better-looking hefeweizens, the head is exceptional. Muddy-colored, opaque from ample yeast sediments. Fruity and spicy aroma, imparted by the creamy head. Initial taste is heavy on the citrus: with orange, lemon and also fennel detectable. Nice beer: dont serve it too cold!Draft at Weissbrauhaus, munich. Dark hazy orange-brown with white head. Is really good. Smooth carbonation. The tap version of this is great! The banana is more apparent than in the helles weizen. The body is big with a great palate. World class gold standard. 4-6-5-8-16

cloudy amber gold with large frothy head. very traditional wheat flavors and aromas. fruit is more pronounced than cloves, and apple is a little more than in most wheats. traditional and a great example of the style
Amber pour with a steady head.  Aroma is of typical bananas.  Flavor is the same with some nice bready maltiness.  Very easy to drink.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2007 Bottle conditioned and courtesy of the LCBO. Burnished copper appearance, with a frothy white head. Wheat and banana in the aroma. Lovely fresh wheat taste in a flavour accented with spices and yeastiness. Crisp finish and refreshing.
UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 50cL bottle.  Pours a dark, hazy amber color, darker than most hefes. Still has some citrus and banana in the aroma and flavor.  Well done.

Orange/coper colored, clearer and darker than most hefes with GREAT, lasting head.  Wheaty, vanilla, banana yeasty apple scents appear and are overshadowing a subtle spice aroma.  NIce and soft to taste  with a balanced, banana wheat body featuring a apple souring crispness towards the finish.  While this beer doesnt look like most Hefeweizens I have had, it fits the style well and presents a drinkable and balanced example of the style.
A gorgeous, hazy orange with a fairly big, fruity-yeasty nose. Just a little sweet, with cereal and bubble gum aspects. Chewy but refreshing and tasty.
a darker hefe then most almost a bock nose of banana, flavor is similar some bready flavor somewhat yeasty, good foam too

My new favourite Wheat Beer. Amber with a large white head. Smells of cloves, fruits and hops. Tastes of cloves, nutmeg, citrus and bananas. Lightly carbonated, but surprisingly smooth and well balanced. Recommended!

Aroma is moderately strong cloves and sweet cream. Muddy ochre color, extremely thick white head. Very good balance of sweet and tart banana, slightly meaty at mid palate. Weak finish. Good, but I expected more.

Amazing wheat beer. Thicky and creamy. Gorgeous aroma of flowers (elderberry?), vanilla, wheat and honey.  Medium body; very smooth. Reminds me of a Paulaner Heffe. What wheat beers should aspire to be.
[Sampled in 2004.] Should be a hefe of high quality, but thisone had too much carbonation, then it got some bad notes. But it deserves a rerating later.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 Poured from bottle into Weizen glass. Thick head, inviting clove aroma. The full mouthfeel of the wheat and the carbonation with my salad was quite refreshing and quenching. After having this a few times over the months, this beer does have a darker and "dirtier" feel than a Weihenstephaner and has a hint more of a diluted flavor. I prefer the Weihenstephaner Hefeweisen. But this is still a very good weissbier.
Breathtakingly good wheat beer.  Nice head of small longlasting bubbles.  Lots of cloves and spicinessa the end.  This is as good as a what beer gets I think.  Recommended.

500 ml bottle. Huge mostly diminishing frothy near-white head. Cloudy orange to light brown colored body. Very aromatic; wheat along with  a  suger-sweet fruitiness (banana and a ripe citrus)  Wheat , more ripe bananas, sweet berries, dark fruits and  candysugar in the flavors.  Good body. Nice, and powerful, but lacks the required freshness.
A beautiful beer.  Beautiful deep amber color, malty aroma, chocolate flavor.

9/12/07 From the bottle.  Aroma is fruity banana esters forward with light clovey phenols, slightly tart, with a faint bubblegum character.  Appearance is hazy tan with a medium off-white head.  Flavor is a banana/bubblegum flavor forward, followed by a light peppery note infused with some hop character; a bit sweet.  Mouthfeel is medium/light bodied with moderate creaminess and a low carb feel.  Overall, this is very good, easy drinking, but with low carb feel and spritziness for the style.

Amber color, very nice head.
Aroma: Malt , bread, bananas, cloves.
Palate: Malt, toffee, caramel, a little bitter.
Very good beer.
Probably my favorite Weiss.  Pours a red/brown color, head dissipates quick.  As it warms towards room temperature becomes very smooth.  Aroma consists of alcohol, some yeast, and cloves.

Poured a chocolate brown color with a big fluffy head. The nose is of bananas and cloves and coriander. The taste begins simular to the aroma. Big on cloves, with banana bread and toffee. The finish had slight floral hoppiness. This is a great old style wheat beer

Schneider Weisse is gaining popularity (and becoming available) all over the world as a model German style Hefeweizen.
This brew has a sweet creamy fruityness (bananas, pears) coupled with a complex touch of almonds and cloves. Drinking is best in summer as a great thirst quencher (if you do not have to drive, with 5.5% ABV it is rather strong) or to accompany some coarse meal.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2008 500 ML Bottle-Amber/Mahogany color w/a white foamy head. Light fruit aroma. A lot darker than your standard Hefe, more of a dark fruit, plum, malt flavor, but not enough malt to be a Weizen Bock. Beer seemed to kind of wander, kind of lost. No real definite style, like they couldnt decide what they wanted to brew so they just threw a bunch of stuff @ it & saw what stuck. Not much did. Didnt really jump out @ me like their their Edel-Weisse. Average @ best Id call it a disappointment.

Had this again recently & enjoyed it a lot more, Dark fruit flavor w/a nice sweet malt finish. Maybe the first one I had was just a bad sample, or maybe Ive &quotgrown&quot as a beer drinker. Id recomend this.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2011 
Name: Schneider Weiss
Date: June 12, 2003
Mode: Bottle
Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta
Appearance: dark hazy orange, thin white head
Aroma: light banana aroma
Flavor: lots of banana flavor with a touch of chocolate, hint of clove in the finish

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3/5.0Score: **+ /4

Name: Schneider Weisse Unser Original
Date: October 06, 2011
Mode: Bottle Conditioned
Source: Ale Atlanta
Appearance: cloudy orange, fine off white head, drippy lace
Aroma: hugh sweet banana aroma, nice touch of clove
Body: creamy body
Flavor: well balanced flavor, sweet banana from the aroma is cut by a robust clove, light earthyness
Overall: normally I dont like this much clove but it works very well in this beer

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 15/20
Rating: 3.7/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4
bottle.  rather flat light amber pour.  diminishing head.  spicy malt nose.  nice light full bodied beer.
Bottle, golden brown with a hint of haze, a sweet aroma with a grass/hay hint. This has a fruity-fresh taste with a definite wheat flavor. Very enjoyable

500ml bottle...picture perfect brownish-orange (yeah, its Cleveland f-ball season soon!) with a head that thickly sits and dissipates evenly...clove is evident and pleasant, and I have (as seemingly always with weizens) a hint of banana?....the mouthfeel may be among the softest Ive sampled...the refeshing aspect of this beer is difficult to quantify...a brilliantly drinkable beer, more than at home in the humid August evenings...
Hazy brown of color with a off white head. An Aroma of banana, spice and wheat. A flavor of wheat, spice an notes of banana.
Bottle.  Classic german hefe aroma, taste very much to style.  A good Dunkelweizen, cant go wrong with this one.

500 ml bottle. pours amber/brown with a big white head. aromas of bananas and spices. aromas come alive as it warms. flavours are sweet and spicy. complex with noticeable wheat, malt, hops and spice. very drinkable and an awesome example of the style.

Purs out quite a dark brown-amber with a medium, loose head.  Slight hefeweizen banana fermentation characteristics with some spice, wheat malt, and caramel.  Flavor is very similar though a bit amped up with some additional fruit.  Quite light and somewhat thin despite all thats going on here--though it does still manage to maintain good balance.  This is a good beer: subtle, reserved, and somewhat austere for the style--not a bad thing.

This is my 200th rating!  This beer pours a cloudy amber/deep brown with a large off white head leaving no lacing down the sides.  There is a light aroma  of cloves, bananas, and coriander.  The taste is emulates this too!  Although, like the previous poster said, the flavors do fall off very quickly which I didnt like.  But all in all this is a very good beer.  Cheers!

Muddy amber color that lightens towards the bottom of the glass.  Fluffy white head that has pretty decent staying power.  Aroma is of yeast and cloves.  Mouthfeel is relatively soft meaning little lasting carbonation.  The taste is disappointing.  It tastes like a Paulaner Light (if something like that existed).

Bottle. Aroma of banana, clove and yeast. Hazy amber color with an off-white head that is multifingered. Full bodied; creamy carbonation. Flavors of banana, clove, coriander, and maybe some light citrus or apple. The finish is relatively dry, and the banana and clove are right there, but it ends a with a little sour. Very refreshing.

Bottle into wiezen glass.  Pours a murky brownish/ orange with a full sized well carbonated head that lingers for a short while.  Aroma is orange, coriander, bubble gum, and some well rounded wheat textures.  Actually smells really refreshing on this hot summer day.  Taste falls short.  You get the cloves, carbonation, orange in the first couple seconds of the sip, but it all falls flat and all you feel in the aftertaste is a slight twinge of orange and light bubble on the back of your tongue.  Overall, Looks and smells great, Taste is clean crisp but very short lived, Palate lightly carbonated.  Its an Ok Dunkelweizen nothing to get really amped up about.
Draught in matching Weizen Hazy amber pour with massive white head. Great lacing. Aroma of banana, cloves, yeast. Flavor is dominated by banana. Smooth. Good brew.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a large long lasting dense off-white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of yeast, wheat, clove, apple, and light nutmeg. Taste is wheat, yeast, clove, apple, and light nutmeg with a slightly sour finish. Medium creamy mouthfeel that finishes slightly spicy. The commercial description is dead on. Very good.
Deep cloudy orange amberish colour. Nice milky white head. This yeast they use produces a beautiful banana flavor and aroma. Creamy beautiful beer.

Hard to believe I havent rated this before since it was my go-to beer for summer in Vancouver.  500 ml bottle.  Deep orange-amber beer topped by a thick fluffy lasting white head.  Sweet banana/peach aroma with a soft toasted maltiness in the back.  Lots of wheaty character throughout with loads of banana and spice.  Creamy palate with a great balance of toasted wheat and fruity yeast character.  Full-bodied yet thirst-quenchingly tart on the back.  A classic.
yeasty apricot  murky orange hued light brown (swamp water) Palate is light, sweet lightly sour finish
muddy and brown. yeasty aroma with a bit o sweetness. flavor is of yeasty apricot bread and apple pie spices.

Dark color for a weisee.  Ample foam covering the deep tawny body.  Moderately aromatic with the usual Weisse descriptors.  Flavor is fairly good, could be richer and more complex.  Its no Weihenstephaner, but its a fine, high quality brew.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2008 Pours an amberish colour with a huge beige head. The aroma is yeasty, and a tiny bit of malts. The flavour is a very yeasty, quite tasty, with minor hints of some spices, and nutmeg/cinnamon. This is the only darker coloured Hefe Ive ever had, so its a tad different to me, but it still seems good. Not as much banana and clove as I would like, but still enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2007 Looks pretty much as muddy horrible as dunkelweizens often do, yet somehow appealing. Esters, but theres also very nice crispy bitterness. Not as fruity as I remembed and what the nose gives away. Goodie.

Pour is a muddy looking brown with a large white head.  Aroma is clove and spice.  flavor is somewhat lacking the needed kick.  Some clove and banana show up but nothing coming out to assert its self.  Still this is just an ok beer.  Maybe my bottle was old and wil have to revist.

Pours murky orange hued light brown with a large foamy tan head. Aromas of earthy wheat, light fruity banana, a bit of apple vinegar, and just a faint undertone of hops. Toasty grains upfront, with just a hint of banana, a light nutmeg undertone throughout, and a faint sour note in the finish. Palate is light, almost sharply effervescent, with a bit of semi-sweet/sour fruit, and lingering spice. Definitely a good intro for me to a Dunkelweizen (at least I think this is the first Dunkel Ive had). Flavorful, balanced, and steered pretty clear of most of what I dont usually enjoy in wheat brews.

Courtesy of Wild Oats. Poured 1 inch of fizzy white head that dissipated quickly. Displayed an ultra-murky tan hue. Strong nose of wheat. Tastes of wheat, earth, dried toast, and malt. Very high carbonation and thin body with a fickle mouth-feel. Nice.
25 oz. bottle.  Belgian Tumbler glass, (heehee).  Rich dark color.  Nice aroma of wheat, fruit, and spice.  Banana malt and faint hops.  Sweet, sour, and spicy with thinnish but soft palate.
Has a very hazy orange-brown body. The head is creamy white. Aroma is citrus and pineapple. Flavor brings fruits, banana, sweet malt and the mouthfeel is big.
Fleeting head.  Lots of clove, orange, banana aromas.  More citrus on the taste with a touch of lemon and a verbena vegetal flavor.  Finish is a little minerally.
pours a brownish color with lots of carbonation, sweet taste of raisins and fruit, nice mouthfeel lots of bubbles, above adverage beer for sure.
bottle . . pours cloudy brown witha  creamy white head . . aroma is caramel, cream, bananas, dried fruit . . taste is sweet, raisins, bananas, caramel, ginger . . VERY NICE beer . .

I always considered this to be darkish hefeweizen but I not a dunkel. I suppose it makes sense since it is pretty dark. Anyway its a golden orangey darkness. It pours with a huge head and ooks beautiful served in a weizen. It also tastes beautiful. The banana esters arent as prominent as some weizens but still exists. It has lots of spiciness and it is difficult to imagine how they got so much flavour diversity using so few ingredients. Id consider it to be something of a classic of its style.

Bottle, kmweaver-exclusive non-RBSG pity-party tasting 2007.  Pours a cloudy, dark brown color with yellowish edges; off-white head with great retention and lacing.  Generous aroma, showing wheat and bananas and belgian sugars.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: chewy display of complex esters and brown sugar, with lively citrus and wheaty notes; beautifully integrated, satisfying wheat beer.  Medium, estery and brown sugar finish, with a hint of clove.  Wonderful stuff.
Definitely one of the benchmark Hefeweissens available.  Spicy and refreshing.  None of that irritating banana flavour found in most hefes.

This is the best hefeweisse Ive had in recent memory, and possibly ever.  This beer offers a significant amount of clove and spice, but is not overpouring and is extremely drinkable.

Appearance is darker than I wouldve expected, and the head is billowy and plentiful (reminiscent of a Belgian strong ale).  Aroma is clovey with some other spices.  Flavor is extremely smooth and of more clove, balanced well with wheat and malt.  Mouthfeel, due to secondary fermentation, is extremely smooth.  I foundt his beer to be extremely drinkable, and went well with my meal at Cafe Brucke.

I would like to add that this bottle was extremely fresh, as is always the case with Cafe Bruckes selection of imports.  The bottle I had looked like it just came off the bottling line.

Bottle in weizen glass.  Pours cludy medium brown with lasting light tan hed and some lacing.  Faint aroma of banana, tartness, bready yeast.  Very light flavor of tangy wheat and light roasted malt.  Excellent mouthfeel of medium body and medium carbonation.  Very refreshing but somewhat restrained in flavor.   A quality beer but not a favorite.

Head is a down pillow with aroma of clove and nutmeg, banana, pear and perhaps faint apple or peach. Mild mineral aspect. Finish is sour but not in an annoying way. Fairly light body. Lots of carbonation.

Muddy amber with off white head. BB 06/07. 
Yeast, banana, wheat, caramel - malt. Malty bready taste with some wheat & banana around it. Fresh mouthfeel - little watery though. Spicy - not coriander, but perhaps clove or cinnamon. Highly enjoyable (and finally within my reach)! Very good!

Happy birthday to me. crystal clear amber with a lasting white head. aroma smoked banana caramel and clove. sweet banana bubble gum bitter caramel with some spiced bread notes all backed up with an underlying smoke flavor. spicy (clove) smoked meaty caramel finish. medium body. lively carbonation. very interesting wheat. so smokey. if given blind i would say that it would certainly have some smoked malt.....does it?
Banana bread aroma.  Rich yeasty flavor, but the palate is a bit thin.  Nice, though.

Pours a dark, cloudy, amber-brown with a few yeast floaties and a huge, rocky, white head. Ive never seen a beer this dark with a white head before. The aroma is classic dunkelweizen: yeasty banana and cloves, wheat and dark malts with light citrus and just a hint of bubblegum in the background. The mouthfeel is light, slick and soft; very clean and refreshing. The flavor follows the nose with a fresh, sweet, yeasty front followed by a wheaty and slightly sour finish. This is a great example of the style and one not to be missed by wheat fans.

Cloudy dark orange, large white bubbles.  Heavy sweet wheat aroma--tons of bananas and cloves, some citrus.  Flavor is ripe bananas and delicious spiced fruity-ness, with some caramel and yeastyness.  Still has a clean finish.  Excellent.
I love this sweet smelling beer. Tastes like apricots and peaches. Cloudy gold colored (almost light amber)  on tap at j-betskis

Bottle. Cloudy orange/golen color, very nice lasting offwhite head. Banana aroma, with quite alot of whipped cream, citrus notes, some grapes and notes of wheat. Some yeast and bubblegum. Fruity, spicy flavor, banana, citrus, apple notes. Some pear and grapes. Wheat notes and a pleasant finish. Definately one of my favourite wheat beer, bnut it could have been bringing a lil more body.

Rated 11/9/06:  Definately one of my favorite hefes. Awesome dark golden orange color deeper than any Ive seen. Gigantic pillowy head with subtle lacing. Very cloudy, it just looks inviting. Prominant well balanced aroma of banana and citrus with spicy cloves. Flavor follows the delicious aroma with a thick malt content. Smooth to the palate but I get a watery thinness at the end, not too detrimental but it holds back the overall feel. Wonderful wheat costs about a buck more than my other favorite but well worth it.

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors.  Pours a cloudy orange with a white head.  Wheaty aroma citrus, orange, and bananna.  Creamy flavors from the wheat.  Strong bananna and citrus notes but an all around yeasty wheaty flavor that holds it together.  Maybe it has something to do with me going to Munich soon, but my appreciation for the German and especially wheat beers is really growing.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2008 Dark golden amber colour with a fine thin head that has decent retention. The aroma starts off strong but settles down, it is a very fruity smell with some notes of spices and yeast. Flavours of banana, with some spicey notes and a light warm wheaty finish. A pretty decent beer.
only problem with this was it was extremely gassy. had a strong flavour as well.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2009 Pretty dark for a weisse. Fine head. Fruit aromas mostly banana , wheat and banana flavour.A decent weisse.
Bottle. Dull, straw color. Bubblegum aroma. Soft, wheat and yeast flavor. Decent weizen beer.

Beautiful in the glass, with a nice murky blur that really makes me believe there is a lot going on.  The smell is typical for this style and is ever so inviting.  The taste is a little thin, but wickedly refreshing and easy going down.  The finish is just ho-hum, but the after-taste is is pleasant.  A super, fantastic session beer that is fun to pound all night and, because of the purity laws in Germany, not to difficult to recover from the next day.  One of my favorite German beers.  Cheers

Wow...really enjoyed this one.  Maple syrup color with medium carbonation.  Pours with a medium head that layers the beer for a while.  Another great session beer.  Clean taste, refreshing.  Picturing myself downing a few as I cook some dogs and burgers on the grill on a hot Saturday afternoon.
full flavour, nice banana and spices, looks great, smells great. refreshing. classy weizen, will buy again.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy mahogany with a nice white head that dissipates slowly. Nice banana/ clove aroma, not as sweet as some, but very pleasant. Lively, fizzy mouthfeel which works well with the spiced, estery banana flavors. Very refreshing, tasteful beer. It would be nice to be a little more full bodied, but it does work great on warm days like these.

Has an unclear amber/golden look. Aroma is quite spicy, like gunpowder. Little sweet with notes of alchohol.
Flavor is quite sour with a traditional sweet weisse yeast, thick finish.
My favorite beer. It is essential to let sit for five minutes while it lets off some carbonation.
A spicy roasty clovey aroma. Unfiltered and dark amber in color. Flavor is roasty wheat, bannana, and clove with a slight citrus tartness. Smooth and somewhat crisp on the palate. Easy to drink.

This is the best weizenbier that I have sampled.  Has the yeast residue at the bottom of the bottle just like a good weizenbier should have.  A little darker than a standard weizenbier, but no quite a dark weizenbier.  Usually available at the better beer/wine stores, and almost always available at Austrian ski resorts.

Bottle. Pours cloudy deep orange with a nice size white head that dissapates.  Big clove, banana, and wheat aroma and taste.  Lots of carbonation which I didnt care for.  Let it sit and the carbonation got better, but there is just a bite that doesnt work to make this a really good one.

On tap at Munich brewery restaurant.
Nice and dark, with beautiful clovey phenolic aroma.  Best weisse bier Ive ever had, and having it fresh at the brewery outlet in Munich was a special treat.  Phenomenal bier.
Clowdy dark orange, lots of fizz, typical wheat  cloves and spices with hints of banana on wheatness.
A cloudy white beer with a nice fruity finish. An excellent Spring and Summer beer. Lovely with a lemmon wedge and a lawn chair in the shade on a hot summer day.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2008 Pours a light brown beer, very dark for its style though. Sweet, wheaty, banana, citrussy nose with a strong malt presence. Wheat flavour. Quite malty, some toffee, caramel. Full bodied beer with a bitter, wheaty finish. Nicely balanced and highly enjoyable Dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2008 This is a good weizen, pours much darker than most with a big frothy head that disappeared quickly.  The taste and aroma was pretty pure wheat and, contrary to what many raters found, with no discernible fruity or citrus notes.  A solid weizenbier, not the best.   The best is Hopf.

500ml bottle. very good weizen, smells like bananas and clove. taste is sweet and spicy with a hint of orange in the finish. best weizen ive had so far, definatelly gonna pick up a few more of these soon

Best weizen, period.  Originally had it on tap in Munich and it literally changed my life.  I never drank a Miller Lite again.  Recently had in bottle in Chicago-- not quite as good, but my memory could have rose-colored glasses.  Have had many other weizen but none match the full banana/clove wheat flavor of a Schneider.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2007 500 mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy brown with a thick white head.  Aroma is quite sweet, can smell a moderate amount of banana, with a bit of vanilla and a peanut aroma as well.  Taste is quite sweet as well, mild fruitiness at first taste, which subsides to a bit of a nutty finish.  Overall, a nice, enjoyable, refreshing beer.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass, amber with a thick white head. Aroma was pronounced with notes of clove, banana and yeast. The flavor was more subtle, with hints of banana and wheat bread. Very smooth and drinkable.

Nice banana and clove on the nose, some caramlization.  Pours a light brown/dark amber with a big white head that seems like its here to stay.  A little dryer than i remember?  Some nice banana and citrus up front, with some spices, nutmeg, cinamon.  Crisp hop flavor and then dry orange flavor in the finish.  I still prefer the Edel Weisse, but this is a classic!

Tap at Cerveceria Oldemburg, march 07. Cloudy yellow color with a nice, medium, bubbly white head. HUGE phenollic aroma, some cloves, spicy. Heavy clove flavor, with a phenollic tang, beatifull, almost as the real thing, banana ending. Medium MF, drinkable and solid. Non compromising true Heffe Weizen.

.5 liter bottle.  Pours darker than most hefes- deep muddy, hazy deep coppery with a massive fluffy head and great lacing.  Aroma is skewed more on the phenolic side with lots of clove but only a bit of vanilla- banana is almost non-existant- lots of wheat breadiness and some light herbla hop notes.  Nice bready doughy wheat flavor with the clove and some vanilla, and a clean very light tart finish.  Smooth as hell and great spring and summer drinking beer.  One of my favorite Hefeweizens.

I was talking to my sales rep and told him that I wanted the Hefe-weizen that tasted like bananas.  Without hestation he said Schneider.  Took it home and WOW.  The aromas are all about bananas.  The flavor is banana cream pie with vanilla wafers.  Finishs clean and crisp. My favorite Hefe-weizen to date.

Bouteille. Nez de levures et de blé. Belle couleur brune-ambrée opaque et voilée. Belle mousse compact. Goût de levure, dépices, de blé, damertume légère et arrère-goût sur. Corps bien rempli, effervescence parfaite.
Bottle at home. Hoppy Dunkel with plenty, too muchfoam. Citrusy, grassy and slightly watery taste. Also sweet, with marsepijn flavavour. A great, creamy orangy finish.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2007 Bottle.Cloudy,dark amber.nice aroma,apples,spice.flavor of cloves,pear,apple.Light and smooth.Refreshing.Very nice.

500ml bottle.  Accidentally poured a bit too aggressively leaving the biggest white head Ive ever seen that took ages to die down.  Eventually revealed a cloudy, orange liquid underneath.  Aroma is splendid.  Cloves, yeast, light fruit - banana.  Very refreshing smelling.  The taste is smooth and refreshing but a bit watery.  Id like this to be a bit more flavorful.  Still good though.
Bottle: Hazy gold in color with a medium white head. Aroma, lemon, some spice, wheat and yeasty notes. Flavor, light bready malts, some tart lemon notes, spices, wheat, and some clove. Good stuff.
.5L bottle.  Pours with a large, determined head ad is a dirty yellow/orange/amber.  Smell is fruity, taste is sweet , sour and smooth.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2007 First rating(50 cl bottle from Systembolaget - ordering section) Shady amber brown look, huge tan head. Estery banana and some metal plus spice scent. Nice spicy and banana taste. Medium and smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness.7/4/7/4/15=3.7Second rating(Draught at Weisses Brauhaus in München)Shady dark orange color, fluffy lasting tan head. Distinct estery banana scent. Fruity estery banana scent. Fruity estery banana taste with a banana aftertaste. Wuite refreshing. Spritzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.7/4/7/3/14=3.5

When you pour that bottle of Schneider Weiss into your glass you just know that this beer is special. Its a wheat beer but is quite dark in appearance. Very pleasant to look at. Also very pleasant to smell since it has a really pungent yeasty-citrus aroma that translates well into how the beer tastes. Very easy to drink and quite tasty.
This is meatier than most hefes but I still feel it its on of the best. page 417 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide and only 256 of is 500 Classic Brews to go.
remember it tasting pretty rate good and i like the label, actually i like all german beers

Draught, a cloudy light gold with a foamy white head. A wheat and citrus fruit aroma. A surprisingly creamy palate behind a sour tartness, quite flavourless though apart from a little bit of citrus. Expect I would rate it higher from the bottle.

One of the best weizens i have had. Aroma is nice, with a very light hops smell. Appearance is dark brown which is rare for a hefe. Mouthfeel is smooth and has a little after taste and a bit of acidic values. Flavor is packed with hefe-goodness.
As soon as you pour it, you know its going to be an excellent beer. Dark amber colour with very nice creamy head. Sweet sensations of spices and fruits.

(500mL bottle): Pous a huge, creamy off-white heap, decent lacing, lasting.  Brown color, very cloudy.  Floral wheaty aroma, some alcohol.  Light, malty flavor, watery. .Some of that wheat in the taste, some grapefruit.  Watery, not too compex a flavor.  A light session beer.
Very dark for a hefe with the large foamy head typical of the style. Nice wheat flavours; banana and a strong trace of cloves. A very good hefe.

Large long-lasting head & a copper hazy body. Some phenols in the aroma, bubblegum, cloves, the usual suspects. The wheat is nicely balanced with the (quite strong) malt backing. Very citric & refreshing. Definitely on the dry side. Medium mouthfeel, medium/light carbonation. A good weisse!

Bottle. Hazy Dark amber with a nice big rocky creamy head. Fruity aroma with banana, wheaty, sweet, slight spiciness. Flavour is fresh, wheaty and bit yeasty, good fruitiness with banana, spices,  slight sourness. Some hoppy bitterness in the finish.

Pours a light plum color with a big off white head. Not to much lacing on my weizen glass. Aromas of bananas and cloves. Taste of  yeast  and some citrus fruits. Slightly thin in the mouth. Nice crisp and refeshing beer. Overall a great beer.
one of my favorite weisses. big bold aromas of banana, yeast, and cloves. flavour is very yeasty, and full! this is great stuff

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2010 Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Pours a wonderfully cloudy amber colour with a fluffy off-white head. Very silk and smooth moutfeel, perhaps little too carbonated. Fruity malt aroma with notes of red apple and the typical hefeweizen hints of banana and clove. Flavour adds a refreshing sourness, and leaves a mild bitterness in the aftertaste which makes you want to have another one immediately.
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2007 This is best bottled german weisse Ive ever tasted.  If you like this type of beer youll be happy you chose this.

This is a classic German beer and I would dare say one of the top brews.  I loved the flavors of yeats and hops....quite distinct!

Do this one!
Bottle; Nose of banana, cloves, and citrus; copper colored with a big beige head; flavor has some tartness with the banana, caramel malt, and cloves. Tingly mouthfeel!  Good dunkel!
Bought from Høker shop Ravnsborggade.Really good German hefe with a big fluffy head who last long.Fresh tast of banana and herbs.quality beer.

Looking for a classic Bavarian weisse? Go right past this one. Dont let the inviting appearance fool you, cause this beer is all show and no substance. The flavors all seem to be wanting to do different things rather then coming together as a harmonious whole as they do with the Weihenstephaner or Franziskaner Weiss biers. It lacks the fine balance and smoothness that to me are standout characteristics of a quality Weiss bier. I also remember having a metal like after taste; hard water anyone.

NorCal tasting Jan 07 - a fantastic example of a German Hefe. A nice fresh fruity aroma with some bubblegum and bananna characters. Appearance was really dark for a hefe (quite suprising). Flavors carried the same notes as the aroma. Refreshing, clean and tasty. This beer would be excellent with anything.

Bottle. Pours nice and murky (being a Coopers Ale fan - and from Adelaide where our tap water can resemble this colour - I have no problem with the concept of a beer like this) Decent head and for a wheat beer very flavoursome. Much prefered over other wheat beers ie Hoegaarden, Schofferhoffer, Redback etc) . Could drink this all the time.

Bottle. Tasting 12-01-2007 (Søren, Peter, Carsten). Large and fizzy white head that mostly lasted. Spare lazing. Body was murky with an amber-orange color. Aroma was herbs, citrus, leather, banana, clove, coriander and other spices. Body was light to medium with a soft carbonation. Moderated sweet with some very light notes of acidic. Finish was short and sweet.

Pours a very dark brown with a half inch head that quickly settles to a solid cap and thick ring that leaves a nice webbing of lace. This has to be the darkest Hefe Weizen Ive seen so far, it looks more like a Dunkel Weizen.

Smell; strong wheat and yeast aromas right away, with a little bit of bananas and hints of some citric fruits.

Taste; as with the smell the wheat and yeast tastes are on the forefront, and then the bananas, cloves and a little bit of a lemony zing show up. Theres also a really good sweet maltiness thats balanced with a touch of a spicy hop bitterness that im really liking. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a nice lively carbonation. As for drinkability, I would have no problem having a few of these in one night.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: Pours a dark amber-brown color with a medium head.  It has a smell of spices with malt, and tastes similarly.  I personally dont like it as much as the edel-weisse but it is a quality dunkelweizen

Murky light-orange/dark yellow slightly murky body with about an inch of white head.  Smells like citrus, banana, smoke, and spice. Tastes sweet, spicey, and fruity - with some banana and hints of citrus and smoke.  Complex in flavor.  O the lighter side of medium bodied.  A nice complex Weiss-bier.  Not my favorite, but an extremely decent beer, very drinkable.

Bottle to glass... pours a fluffy white head....cloudy light brown...clove and yeast on the nose....a very clean taste...very refreshing with a zingy body..nice balanced clove taste...two thumbs up for this wheat

Nice head and a beautiful, hazy, dark amber color. The aroma is crystal clear - this is a wheat. The flavour is nice and straightforward - just like a good weissbier should be with notes of wheat, banana, other fruits, spice and hints of citrus. Its a quenching and uncomplicated weiss, and a nice one indeed!

The color is a golden/orange.  The head was off-white, fluffy, and thick.  The yeast is very prominant in the aroma.  There was a citris smell as well.  The palate was carbonated and thin.  The finish was warm.

Pours a hazy copper amber. The head is thick, creamy, and egg shell white. The aroma was sour, had some spice (coriander, clove), alcohol, citrus. The flavor had coriander, clove, alcohol, and some citrus. The palate is mild and thin with a warm finish.

Pint Bottle... honey toned with a big fluffy head. Great malty, yeasty and earthy aroma. It had a mild tart apple flavor that went great with the hint of clove and malt and yeast flavors.  This beer is good anytime of the year, cold, warm, wet, dry... its never a disappointment.

500 mL bottle. Pours lovely hazy amber with some yeasties that quickly settle out. Big fluffy, fuzzy off white head that lives and lives and lives. Spritzy citrusy aroma with wiffs of banana and spice. Tart, crisp, refreshing flavor with a little underlying sweetness. Happy-friendly sour aftertaste, in a good way. Very fizzy with loads of carbonation, tickles the tongue in such a sensual way:)
Marvelous. Simply marvelous.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2010 Bottle, A cloudy pale to medium amber beer, with a huge, rocky, fully lasting white head. The aroma is moderately malty and lightly yeasty, with notes of banana, clove, bread and biscuits, perhaps a hint of pear. The flavour is moderately sweet, moderately sour, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, not a very long finish with light bitterness. A clean and dark example of the style, very nice powerful aroma, quite good mouthfeel. Very nice.

Pours a dark tan that gets lighter at the bottom of my weizen glass. A good 2.5 finger, frothy head with decent retention. This is a very thick, wheaty hefe. there are hints of sweet spice in aroma+flavor, but not as much of the heavy citrusy aspect common to alot of hefeweizens.
Slightly syrupy mouthfeel.

Pours deep amber into a weizen glass.  Off-white micro head turns congomerate as it slowly recedes.  Clove and sour apple aromas. Smooth and clean clove and nutmeg with a dry, slightly sour medium lasting malt finish.
By the bottle... Moderate appearance for unfiltered brew, very appealing aroma (banana & clove) and good head retention.  Crisp fruity taste, thin body, with a carbonated finish.

500ml bottle - pours an amber gold/light copper colour, with a massive white head on top. Aromas of yeast and banana, light fruit and bread. Flavour is watery for my tastes, and too thin which keeps this from earning big points. Otherwise, had a bready quality. Were the taste as big as the aroma, this would be a better beer. Not bad, but not nearly as good as the same brewerys Aventinus, and not as good as other Hefeweizens Ive had. Decent.

500ml bottle serving it chilled in weizen glass. Nose packed full of apple, spice, liquorice and brown sugar. Pours a clean deep amber with big off-white head. Flavour is quite satisfying and complex; brown sugar, apples, clove notes, vanilla, with a liquorice note towards the finish. Good combination of a fine weizen bier with attributes of a dark beer.

500ml bottle:  Beautiful, strong, complex aroma leads into a very drinkable brew...nothing too heavy, but you know youre drinking beer!  Concur with other reviewers who remark on the yeasty/bread flavors that dominate this beer, much more so than other weissbeers.  Definitely not as smooth as say, a Paulaner, but a quality, original drink...would recommend!
This is a big nice beer! Wonderful aromas and nice frothy head. Lots going on here. Refreshingly balanced flavors and finish. Well done.
Cloudy brown colored pour the nice sized head.  A light fruity, bread aroma to it.  A light yeast flavored finish.  Not too bad at all.

Cloudy dark copper body with a very small white head.  Aroma is wheat/bread, tropical fruits, cinnamon bun, cloves and a bunch of other spices.  Taste is less complex than the aroma.  It kept reminding me of Cheerios, the one with the spices (forget its exact name) with a touch of caramel.  Unfortunately the body is very thin, borderline watery.  It was very good at first but I got tired of it before the end of my pint.  Different.  Although I dont think thats what they meant by it I found this Schneider Weisse Original to be exactly that, original.
Bottle: Poured a brown tea like color with a tall white head. Aroma was fruit and pleasant nut smell. Taste was ballanced yeast flavor with a slight bitter finish. Solid beer all around.
standard beer. better than bud, but nothing special. light flavor, not too crisp...but satisfied, and isnt too expensive.
50 cl bottle. Muddy brown colour with a nice huge white head. Lovely aroma of banana, vanilla and yeast. Nice soft flavour of yeast, fruitness and clean. Very well made and good.
Aroma is of fruits and spice.Pours murky yellow with a big off white head.Get a light fruit taste.Alittle thin and watery.Finishes with a good bit of fruit.

Paulaner and Erdinger move aside. This stuff was great, and my new favourite. Im suprised I waited as long as I did to try this. Poured a light brown with a thick frothy head. Fruity, yeasty, and somewhat spicy aroma and taste. Strong, but pleasant  tastes of oranges and pears all the way through. Great Hefeweizen, I shall be having this again soon.
Good dark amber color with large white head.  Storong aroma of spice.  Good pronounced flavor of spice, berry and banana.  A good standar.

Bottle. Unlike most weissbier this is a darker amber color. Very nice look and creamy head. You will actually find yeast at the bottom of your glass as you drink. This was my introduction to hefeweizens and really turned me on to them. Unfortunately, I cannot find it where I live.

Michael Jacksons Ultimate Beer book features this as the prime example of the Southern German Hefeweizen so I had to try it. The body perplexed me- clear amber as opposed to your typical cloudy, unfiltered hefeweizen. The head was nice- big creamy and fizzy. The aroma was subtle- yeast, cloves, and spice. The smooth and again, subtle banana flavor was delivered with strong carbonation that sings on your tongue followed by a sharp cleansing finish. This is a good hefeweizen- worthy of being the prime example? No, I think Paulaner deserves that distinction.

Clear copper color with thin white head. Aroma of sweet malts and wheat with a hint of spice from the yeast. Taste starts off with sweet malt flavors and then becomes a bit grainy with some yeast spiciness. Then midway a sweet fruity flavor appears that seems to go from figs and apples to banana and then back to figs and apples. Nice.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a huge head. Fruit and yeast aroma nad flavour.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2006 I enjoyed this beer.  Dark in colour and fairly strong tasting.  Sweet and refreshing - Sehr gut!

This was one of the first beer styles I had that turned me on to beer.  I was in Germany during my early 20s, at a biergarten during a beautiful spring day.  It may have been Schneider Weisse, too, but I cant remember.  Poured with a sticky, huge, largely bubbled white head.  Aroma like citrus, clove, and bread.  Very lively carbonation.  Flavor reminds me of a Wit somewhat, except that this is vastly more crisp and refreshing.  Extremely smooth malt flavor, some clove and banana in there too.  Alcoholic strength looming in the background... reminds me that when I had this at the aforementioned biergarten, I went on a wild bike ride with a girl who was a bit more accustomed to drinking and cyling than I was... weeee!  Mineraly, mildly hoppy and dry finish.  Great beer.  Theres a lot there to taste and think about.

bottle from an indy beer seller, poured a cloudy orange with a fluffy white head that lasted quite well, strong aroma of banana on first smell and some sweetenss too. in the mouth are lots of banana with a yeast background but has a sweetish taste as well, finishes long which i like
Bottle. Dark amber beer with a huge beige head. Banana, clove, wheat aroma. Banana, wheat flavor. Nice balance. Lighter bodied and easy drinking.
Dark color and alchol content gives it a uniqueness within this beer type. Creamy and fruity character with a nice finish.  Persistent head and well-balanced throughout.  Great brew.
Bottle 50 cl. Fruity aroma, good head, dark colour, good carbonation, good flavour. Easy drinkable all year.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2007 This is a darker beer than I expected, a cloudy amber, rather than the usual straw/blonde. It has sweet aromas of banana and cloves, with hints of coriander, and a trace of nutmeg.A lovely refreshing beer, ideal in the heat of summer.

Pours a tawny color w/ full semi creamy froth. Strong aroma of banana spice. Light nectar w/ ample residual effers. Flavors of crispy malt and banana spice w/ moderate medicinal essence. On the watery side w/ no mid palate. Finish has a strong banana spice that lingers. Overall: darker in color than others in its genre. A decent example.

Absolutely not the expert on Hefeweizen so this rating is purely out of personal judgement.  The aroma reminded me of rotting fruits.  Cloudy, dark amber body with fast vanishing head of three fingers.  Heavy, wheaty copper tasting concoction with slightly fruity aftertaste.   Rich heavy consistency.  Not overly pleased with this one.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2006 Drank with stegosaurus.Bottle,  Dark amber pour with slight head that dissapears quick. Aroma is sweet and really smells good(possible caramel).Taste is citrus and roasted malts but not over sweetened. Pretty good brew.

Draught in kaiserslautern. Not much to say about this hefeweizen - does its job and does it damn well. The usual banana is accompanied by some lovely floral and fruity tones, all of which swirl together into a delectable combination. Something does taste very mass-produced about it to me for some reason, but oh well, it all seems to work.

Bottle.  Pours a murky, dishwater shade of amber with a huge frothy white head.  Big banana and malt wheat aromas.  There is a slight plastic smell.  Clean wheat flavor with some fruit notes.  Pleasantly spicy with a clean finish.

Fruity coriander aroma.  Copper bronze color with a very nice fluffy head.  The head is quick to dissapate. The taste provides a bit of a sour apple tingle with a fruity spice pop. The aroma and the taste work in perfect harmony.  Excellent palate with a lingering smotth sweet taste on the buds.  Very easy to drink and exceptional hefe.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2006 500 ml bottle - pours a dull copper colour, similar to unpasteurised honey, with diminishing white head.  Darker than most hefeweizens Ive seen.  Aroma of banana, yeast and some spice, with faint hints of green apple.  Taste is very nice, banana, pineapple, a little nutmeg and wheat.  Long, bready finish.  Full body makes this a beer to be enjoyed year-round - not just for summer like many hefeweizens.
Coriander, cloves and a hint of ginger and lemon completes the aroma of this beer.  Fruity, floral on a nice yeasty finish.  Nice looking body, nothing spectacular.

Darker brown than most hefe-weizen, pours with a modest but persistant head. Good lacing down the glass.  Flavor is combo of light grassy with followups of bananas and spice.  Nice clean finish.  Overall a very good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2007 500 ml Draught, Hotel Gasthof Sonne, Neuendettelsau. More deep estery fruits in the aroma than has the *Bottled* Schneider Weisse Original , of course nowhere near the richness of the Aventinus Doppel. Moderately rich malty taste and finish is clean, just a note rounder than the bottledl. Nice, everyday Dunkeles Weizen for Bavarians to toss back in quantity.
Dark amber/brown coloured white. Banana in the aroma, also some spices. Flavor is very nice, very enjoyable. Yeasty and nice sweetness.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2010 500ml botle. Pours toffee coloured, cloudy brown with a small-medium, off-white head. Weak aroma. Tastes of yeast, caramel, hints of honey...all a bit bland. Nice crisp palate though

Updated April 10 under Tap 7 Unser Original label. Apricot flavours too, well textured, buttery richness.

500 ml bottle, now available in Norway (Vinmonopolet, bestillingsutvalget). Cloudy / muddy brownish colour, large and lasting off-white head. Lovely hefeweizen aroma, full of ripe bananas and cloves, also notes of other spices, leather and tropical fruits. Flavour is zesty and mildly spicy, some citrus, and even decent hops for a h.w. Very nice!

Hazed, muddy and caramel gold in color with a pillowy white cotton head and perfect lacing.  Grinded cloves sweetly caress the nose with peppered bananas, zest of lemons and fluffy pastries borderlining baguettes.  That clove-spice smell is cunning and alluring.  Flavor fulfills on the spiced banana platform, drawing out pepper, nutmeg and cloves.  Of course its effervescent, but when it fades, it carries the trademark lemon sourness to lovely esteem.  Some rind parleys with buttery orange meringue-saturated graham crust.  Lemony sorghum imparts a bakers chewing sense at the back palate level, most prominently in the finish.  Very well balanced and a great benchmark beer for the style.  Pasties and natural lemon yogurt sweet cream comprise the final goodbye.
not that great for the orignal weisse beer. very pale tasting smells kinda bready a little like scallops but quite refreshing

Bottle from SAQ. Pours a dark amber colour with a thick frotty head that vanishes quickly.  Aroma is bread, yeast, cereals and banana. Taste is similar with a hint of cloves and a medium body. I always enjoy this one, suitable for every occasions.
White head on a dark golden body. Not very appealing, the strange taste actually made me half-sick.
Muddy brown with a white head. Not many beers look less appealing. Faint banana aroma. Watery, medicinal taste. Disappointing.

I still dont get the enthusiasm for hefeweizen; must just be me. Granted, this was superior to the Franziskaner product I tried first, but I just cant get excited about it. Aftertaste is nice and yeasty, but leaves me wanting somethig else.
Pours golden, light amber. Large white, rocky head. Fresh, lemonlike taste. Slightly spiced with koriander and cinnamon. a tiny bit to much carboation for my taste!

From bottle; poured a dark amber with a frothy head that was fairly long-lasting.  The nose was of bananas and pears...quite a collection of scents.  Flavour was sharp with fruit overtones and maltiness.  Definitely will have this again.

slightly hazy light brown color under a medium sized yellow head with good retention.  banana and spice aroma.  medium bodied.  flavored the same as the aroma.  slightly weak in the flavor catagory but definitely not a bad brew.
I love this beer. I want my home to smell of the rich dark wheat malt. I am so in love with German wheat beer, and this would appear to be a classic example.
Spicy, citrus, and wheat aroma.  Pours a cloudy red brown with a large fizzy head that fades.  Nose anticipates the flavors with a hint of bannana.

Pours amber with the traditional murky look.  A thick, off-white head which starts thick and frothy, diminishes a bit.  Aroma is spicy, yeasty and citris esk.  Flavor matches the aroma - citrus, yeasty, almost bready.  Very well blended,  and depth to the flavors of this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2010 Murky brown Bavarian sniffing faintly of toffee. Begins with a sourish hint of fruit, ends with a subtle smokiness. Smells better than it tastes. Smooth and fragrant, but not assertively fruity enough to rival my favourites of the style. (736314-3.3)
RERATE Got it a bit wrong. Bananas on toast aroma dappled with clove and honey. Hints of sourness, earthy yeast like a certain species of bottle-conditioned English bitter; banana and clove; toffee apple, linger including digestives. Bit of a departure. Better than I thought.

I tasted the 33 cl blue bottle. Amber colour, creamy head that doesnt persist much. Earthy aroma, with spices, clove and fruits, banana, pear. On the tongue, the earthy texture again, limey. Spicy and fruity, banana and pear. Very refreshing, excellent beer specially in summer.
Bottle. Nice big head with ok duration. Color is light brown. Aroma is powerfull and yeasty. Taste is fruit and some citrus.

Pours murky amber with a thick-lasting, off-white head.  Aroma is spicy, yeasty and fruity all at once.  Yum.  Flavour is just as good as the aroma - citrus, clove, banana and bready - the flavours of this beer blend well.  Finish is nice though was expecting more bitter, but Im just nitpicking.  An great Hefe-Weisse.

Bottle picked up at Morrissons, Aylesbury 8th August 2006, and drank this in a field at Cropredy, Fairport Conventions Cropredy Festival Saturday 12th August. Amber coloured beer with a large white frothy head, nice tropical fruit aroma, that led to very refreshing and tasty fruity, spicey, wheaty flavour mmhhh... I liked this one!!

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2008 Bottled. One of my favorite German Hefes. I had it on tap once which was remarkable. This is nice and crisp, good wheat flavor with some bannana and a touch of cantelope  aftertaste. This is a really really good Hefeweizen! 

Rerated 6/1/08: This is a quinteseential Hefe for me. Although Hefes are not m #1 go to style, if this beer is available, I love drinking it. Very enjoyable and refreshing beer.

Bottled. It had a very refreshing fruity taste. It had a strong but sweet citrus flavor to it. Clean finish. Wasnt like the other hefe-weizens that were old and tasted like soy sauce! A great beer to combat the warm summer!
draft at schneider haus.  one of the best hefes of the trip.  a bit dry, but otherwise balanced.  plenty of banana clove character.  quite thick.

(Bottle, Temple, Manchester, 28 July) Colour is dark amber/tawny, hazy, with a huge rocky white head. Nose is fruity with bananas, plums and a sweetish wheat character. Taste is fruity, distinct wheat character with bananas, plums, cloves. Fruity, spicy finish. Perfect balance. A great weizen.
On tap Wharf, Aalborg. Dark orange colour with a white head. Aroma is banana, wheat. Flavour is banana and wheat, citrus,spices.

On tap. Pours a slightly cloudy orange with a moderate short-lasting head. Light aroma of citrus and apples. Flavor was lemon and a bit of malt. Higher than usual carbonation. My favorite part of this beer was the awesome white porcelain glass it was served in. I tried to talk the restaurant into selling me one, but they wouldnt do it.

500ml Bottle: I saved this one for two weeks waiting for the right time to try it, and sadly, I might have pumped it up a bit high.  Hefeweizen is my second favourite style of beer and Ive managed to try a good number, and this doesnt rank at the top for me.  Typical aroma of cloves, coriander, citrus, and banana with a good pour that came darker than I expected.  The head left quicker than Im used to for the genre.  Exceptionally harsh mouthfeel out of the carbonation and pepper, definitely not something to down quickly.  Flavour, outside the surprising pepper, was traditional for the style.  Id have it again, but Id rather have a few others, including Schneiders own Aventinus.
Pours a yellow-orange with an off-white lasting head. Very carbonated and refreshing. Strong floral aroma with a slighly bitter  taste.
Cloudy brown - darker than expected.  Moderate creamy head - lasts.  Light and drinkable.  Cloves, and a nice balance of sweet and bitter.    Leaves a cool peppery aftertaste.  Great beer.

Pours yellow-brown with very quickly disappating off-white head.  Nose is pretty good-banana and clove, trace of malt.  Flavor shows initial clove and mild malt sweetness, but is thin and not particularly satisfying.  Rather bubbly, watery palate, and slightly musty wheat aftertaste.  Neh.

500ml bottle.  Cloudy burnt orange color with a frothy, bumpy and substantial white head.  Aroma was of sweet wheat malt, banana bread, juicyfruit gum and maybe pineapple.  Palate was light to medium with very small tingly carbonation.  Flavor of lemon and juicyfruit gum with some nuttiness. Sour lemon-herbal pastille finish.
(0.5L Bottle) Pours hazy orange with a nice head. Yeast and banana aromas and tastes that are typical to many of the sort. Refreshing and enjoyable.

One bottle from BOTW.  I was surprised by the amber color.  All my Weissbiers have been on the lighter side so far.  Still had a large white head.  I enjoyed mine with a lemon, so the lemon aroma and flavor was dominant.  Many streams of bubbles raising to the top, kept me mesmerized.  I enjoyed the refreshing brew immensely.

Bold amber colored pour with foamy thick head. Nose is dominated by clove and has that appealing hefe quality. Medium carbonation. Typical hefe flavors and character from here on out with obvious clove/banana interplay. Refreshing, unique in appearance and impact, this is a solid, stand-by hefe.

Pours a brilliant amber color, and has a wonderful foamy head.  Heavy carbonation.  Smells decent, although somewhat weak on the nose.  Taste is typical of most german hefes.  Some clove, banana, bubble gum. The color is somewhat misleading as the beer feels pretty light on the palate.   Taste nearly identical to Franziskaner, but twice the price.   Pretty decent.

Draught  Rocky, off-white head (faintly pink), lasts fully.  Muddy, amber to brown body.  Fully hoppy aroma of flowers, grass, grapefruit, orange and lemon with hints of malts (cookies).  Moderately bitter, lightly sweet initial flavour.  Lightly sweet, lightly bitter finish.  Very soft and well-balanced.  Light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation.  This is a very fine hefeweizen, well balanced and is smoothly drinkable with fine bitter notes.

Pours a cloudy woody brownwith a thin creamy white head. Lively looking body. Strong yeasty aroma of bananas, cloves and nutmeg. Bready notes. Lively thin taste with an unexpectedly thick end. Lively aftertaste.

very good hefeweizen.  Pours amber, with a big off white head.  Aroma is of banana, clove, the usual suspects.  Taste is also banana and spicy with some caramel and sweetness.  Well balanced, a good summer beer.

A gift from stretchmonster--TY.  More color and head than I expected.  Smells like baby food, banana malt-o-meal.  Warming dimished the flavor leaving somewhat of a bitey finish.  But fresh and cold a nice drink.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: Tasted at SIB. Slightly cloudy amber with big white head. Nice hef...big fan and would drink any time.
Light golden brown hue  nice white head  nose candy banana, yeast bubble gum  yeast, nutmeg, grass taste  medium body  aftertaste sour red fruit, overripe bananas

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2007 Pours a hazy darker brown/amber color.  Decent fluffy head that faded fairly quickly.  Flavors of malt, wheat, banana, citrus, nutmeg... a pretty complex dunkelweizen. It seemed to be slighly more carbonated than the usual, I found this to be a plus.  Crisp and refreshing, despite its heavy array of flavors.  Definitely a very smooth and easy-to-drink beer, and an above-average dunkel.
Hazy amber color with a small white head. Sweet malt and banana aroma. Banana flavor with wheat and light malt in the end.

A monstrous creamy head tops a cloudy amber pour, a bit darker than most hefes. The off white foam lasted until the bottom of the glass. The aroma has the usual suspects - banana, clove, etc. The huge head and impressive effervescence  makes one suspicious that this is over carbonated, but that is simply not the case. Very fine, small bubbles and a notable bready malt base make for a very pleasant mouthfeel. Theres an underlying light bitterness in the finish, but the sourness is more evident. A very nice hefeweizen in the classic Bavarian tradition.

Very dark beer, for a wheat. But it smells and tastes like a good wheat.
I love german made hefe weizen and this is one of this best
thanks to illini08 for sharing.  poured a golden yellow with a fizzy white head.  good hefe flavor of bubblegum and clove, but too much carbonation for me.

500 mL bottle.  I was surprised with how dark it poured for a hefe-weiss.  Cloves and bubblegum in the nose, with a nice spiciness coming through.  Flavors of bubblegum and cloves are dominate.  Nice hops in the finish; maybe a bit more so than in other hefes that ive had.  All around, a very good hefe-weizen.

Tap at Nord-Als Musikfestival. A muddy brownish amber colour with great creamy off white head. The aromas are dominated by banana and a bit of burnt malts. Not much initial taste but the aftertaste adds some bitterness and more banana.

had it at a rastaurant today at noon
big creamy-colored head
orange-golden hazy color
smells yeasty, much of clove-smell ,a bit of banana
smooth carbonation
tasts yeasty,much clove taste,almoust a little bit peppery, but  a bit of banana too, a little bit of citrus
aftertaste yeasty,clove,a bit of banana
good hefeweizen !!

Poured to a foamy head; cloudy and darker than most hefeweizens Ive had. Taste is light with a light, foamy mouthfeel. Beer was too cold at first, but got better as it warmed up a bit. A good weisse beer.

Poured the usual cloudy weizen appearance. The head and lacing were typical (big). The aroma was clovey and banana-like. Somewhat sweet and cloying, this one came through with cloves and bananas. The flavor was very similar with a dryness in the finish comparable to some of the dunkelweizens Ive had. Maybe a higher level of hops for the style, which is kinda nice, keeping it from coming across as too sweet. Mouthfeel was light to moderate. Nice to check-in with one last refreshing weizen amidst the heavier Fall and Winter seasons.

Surprisingly dark in looks, rather weak aroma, some sourness, clove, yeast. Flavor is very fresh, not as citrucy as I might have expected. Yeasty, with a slightly bitter finish. Nice hefe but I was expecting a little bit more. Verdict : good but overrated

Bottle, 50cl. Hazy, dark caramel orange colours, with a decent white fizzy head, just like a good hefe should be. Sour aromas, cinammon and banana. The beer has a rich and complex taste, wheaty, with definite hints of banana and nuts. The finish has bubblegum and slightly bitter qualities. One of my favourite hefeweizen.

The first and last word in the style -- the beer to challenge and confound the Hefe haters. I am struck by the freshness -- is this really from so far away? Lovely color -- sort of distressed suede, thick head that lasts. Cakey, balanced, fullyformed. A world-class beer, well deserving of its incredible reputation. Thank you, Germany.

The best wheat beer Ive ever had. Pours to an amber color, with thick off-white head, thousands of bubblres and very good lacing. Aroma of wheat, clove and cinnamon. Taste slightly spicy, and very good. Excellent finish. This is a beer I could enjoy often.

Opaque amber pour with an initial bubbling that settle down into a thin layer of love suds. Nose is of nuts and slightly sour, but pleasant, fruit. Chewy mouth feel that gives you a floraly-spicy kick with that sour fruit. An almost sparkling wine-like bubbly feel, but not overwheminly so. Pleasant finish decent grain finish.....very nice beer.

Hazy amber with a small white head. The aroma has something nutty and has hints of dry caramel.
It has a nice wheaty texture with a good dosis of flower-pollen aromas. The taste is dry, nutty and has a smooth mild mouthfeel. This beer has a clean and refreshing taste with hints of peache-pit, nuts, cereals and some dry honey accents.
Very refreshing and slightly fruity and sweet.  It has a nice amber colour. A great beer for hot weather.

On tap at Berlin-Tegel Flughafen. Cloudy orangey copper with a big creamy off-white head. Strong banana aroma. Sweet with fruity, mainly banana flavours, dryish finish with clove flavours taking over. Rather light-bodied, fizzy. A refreshing beer without too much complexity.
Boutelle de 50 cl. Belle couleur dorée, bon collet. Arome légé de blé un peu sûre. Petit goût de blé et fruit crèmeuse, arrière goût très liquide.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2006 500ml Bottle Pours cloudy amber with a light tan head that was rather thick. Tastes of cloves and some fruits (possibly apple). Quite refreshing with a slightly sour finish to it. I think I will have to try this with a bit of lemon next time to see what thats like.

Bottle.  48F Weizen.  Slightly sour and very light aroma. Light tan head that dissipates rapidly, Amber hazy color, with dark specs of floating material.  Doest look like yeats I am not sure what they are but, tastes fine.  Slightly sour taste refreshing with a fruity finish, followed by tastes of oak.  Holds a larger mouthfeel than I had expected, rather on the big side for a hefe.  Over all not bad a bit on the larger and darker side for most hefes, but still easily drinkable  especially in the warmer summer months.

Draft at Prost. Big white head of small bubbles, decent lacing. Nice loamy brown body--plenty of grain bill for a hef. Nose is fairly mild, a whiff of sour and maybe some floral, with some husky grain under. The flavor is strong and rich for a hef, with some sourness to balance a nicely considered profile of malts. Theres real spice and earthiness that opens as it warms, but by the bottom of the glass it gets really sour. Not something Id ever order more than a cool pint at a time, but sourness only goes so far with me. The chewiness is amazing for a hef, as is the subtle complexity of flavor. Refreshing and interesting at the same time--just a great beer.
Light brown color with a slight reddish hue. Lasting small head, fruity, almost had a nuttiness to it. Refreshing.
Has a hazy golden orange appearanace.  Taste has medium bitterness and a lightly sour aftertaste.   Seemed kind of tarty and fruity.  Has a little bit of a "bite"
500ml bottle at Zum Dortmunder in Stuttgart. Pours a light brown colour. Fresh aroma. Medium mouthfeel. Slightly carbonated. Sweet banana flavour with a nice bitter ending (22.04.2006).

Bottled.  Murky orange/brown pour, creamy beige head.  Strong aroma fruits, of bananas and bubblegum.  Crisp taste with some added spiciness.  Tart, acdic finish.  Apples.  Bit of an unfriendly finish toward the bottom of the glass.  Upper crust of the German Weizen, but not the best.
On draft at Issac Newtons with Stegosaurus. Pours dark, with a fat head and a unique flavor sort of like cinnamon, very sweet, unlike most hefeweizens ive tasted, this beer is very drinkable.
Tap/Ludwigs.  LEmony nutty good hefe quality. Lite on the banaana.  easy-going flavor.  Medium cloudy brown with white head.  An acceptable hefe.
Amber colour with a huge creamy white head. Aroma and taste of yeast and malt. Not too bad.

Pours a dark amber...nearly brown.  Unfiltered appearance.  Nose is fruity with notes of some floral hops too.  This beer is nice crisp and a little complex.  Its certainly better than the local Hefes ive tried since its actually got a little bit of balls.  Drink it nearly room temp, thats when its at its best!
Light amber colour, creamy white head. Typical aroma of wheat and orange citrus. Light bodied. Light spicy flavour. Average weize.

pours thick w/ a thudathuda.  very dark for a hefe, looks like a bock.  smells of banana bread.  tastes of banana (not very strong though, Ayinger is much stronger in this respect) & $1 french bread.  very watery for a hefe, make sure to swirl the bottom to make sure you get all the yeast.  decent, but not the best hefe ive had.

Extremely cloudy amber Hefeweizen.  With an apperance like this I knew this was going to be good. Strong fruit wheat nose.  Tart apple and banana with a fine yeast quality.  I know its just a 50th rating, but at least I picked out a good one for it.  Prost!

Quite dark golden unclear, with beautiful white head that lasts trough; Huge nose that explodes in your face: mostly overripe banana, but also fresh banana, clove and very nice sweet lilies; Huge carbonation in a body that is a little watery with some acidity;  The finish is quite short with some acidity and citrus like bitterness, again banana. Nose and body+finish doesnt fit all that well together.
Pours amber brown with a quickly disappearing head. Nice and sweet. Fruity and wheaty at the same time. A light tasty beer.
user_location: Waco (Buckle of the Bible Belt), Texas, USA

text: Dirty orange-brown, big head that collapses rapidly. Aromas of banana, bubblegum, vanilla. Big wheaty palate that is rich in banana and a little citrus and sweet spice with a nice tart finish. Fantastic!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 500 ml bottle. Poured a cloudy, deep amber(?!) into a footed pilsner glass with a 3-finger rapidly diminishing foamy white head. Nose is DMS and banana, quite sweet. A bit too much in the way of DMS. Flavor is immediate, offensive DMS. Blech. The next element to the flavor is a totally unwelcome sourness. Really terrible flavor. The finish is much better, though, with banana and spices. Watery/lively mouthfeel, would be pretty refreshing but for that awful sour note in the flavor. I really dislike this beer.

Hazy, amber body with thick, off-white head that quickly fades. The aroma is banana, clove and caramel. The flavor is wheat, banana bread and cloves. The mouthfeel is soft and smooth with a drying finish.

The first amber hefe Ive seen.  Pours clear amber with very little head.  Aroma is strongly bananas, with some spice.  The taste is one of the smoothest Ive had.  Sweet and light up front, then more of the wheat comes out in the end.  Crisp finish.  A really good beer.

Muddy brown.  Very malty aroma with a hint of fruit.  Minimal carbonation.  Spicy with the malt dominating mouthfeel.  A great showcase of wheat malt and smooth down the hatch.  Even a dash of hops to finish.

Bottle at the GBBF, Kensington Olympia 06/08/2003
Amber mid brown coloured and very hoppy. Some sour fruit flavour. Smooth on the palate.

From a 500ml. euro brown bottle with a blurb about the hefe weizen and a bottling date on the back label, 2005 (05). 103 day (APR 13). Made a very good appearance, poured a semi-hazy honey hued amber with a large frothy, foamy white head that slowly reduced to a thin, foamy, pancake-like lacing. Had a tasty aroma, banana bready, some clove spiciness and a sweet wheat malty character. Good carbonation and a smooth, semi-creamy medium bodied mouth feel, good drinkability. Delicious tasting, banana bready, clove and spice, a biting hoppiness on the tongue, a little bubblegum flavor and a dry wheat bready finish.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2007 On rerating this I find it is totally different and pretty good.  A little more full in flavor and malt than other Hefes but still quite good.  Aroma is banana and bubble.  Flavor is the same but like I said more malty.  Tasty, but not as refreshingly crisp as most.  Interesting side note:  This beer takes on a cherry flavor when you drink it while smoking a cigar.

Awesome pillowy white head that didnt last long, body is darker then most hefes ive had.  Typical delicious bread dough and clove aroma.  Flavorful with lots of spicy clove.  I think the mouthfeel in this one is lacking quite a bit, and feel if it were fuller, the flavors would be better appreciated.  Nonetheless, a tasty hefe but id pick others over it.

This had the trappings of being perhaps my favorite hefe every, with an incredilbly mild and unassuming nose (without the syrupy sweet blast that usually accompanies hefes in my mind), along with the deep brown color, this beer, before you taste it, looks like a winner.  The taste is fine, if a bit thin at the end, perhaps the bottle, but I was hoping for a bit more gravity given the initial impressions.  Still a very nice beer and would undoubtedly drink again.
Bottl-Poured an amber color with a large head,not that cloudy.Fruity smell and also wheaty and banana.The taste although was a little bland for myself,I dont know if it was just a bad bottle.
Bottle: Dark orange, cloudy with lots of sediment. Fruity, acidic aroma with notes of clove. Taste is fruity, wheaty and sour.  Bitter finish.

From the bottle. 
Pours a clear dark amber with a great big fluffy white head.
The aroma provides a big blast of sour yeast, cloves, and coriander, with some banana and cantelope. The flavor is tart, almost sour, with fruity yeast; its also well balanced in its finish, which turns pleasingly dry without a hint of the metallic flavors that curse other similar beers. The beer is smooth, crisply refreshing despite being almost buttery on the tongue in the finish.
All in all, a very nice Hefe! Id like to try this head-to-head against the Weihenstephaner.

Overa

A nice Hefe.  A tad dark in color, mine wasnt especially cloudy, a nice head.  Aroma was relatively mild, low on the deep yeasty pungence that comes with many Hefe.  That characeter carries into the flavour where the banana and clove are less than I would expect, and a little more general fruitiness, and less pungence.  The maltiness is a little thicker and more noticable than usual also, and the mouthfeel is nice and meaty.  Id call this an ever so slightly dark Hefe in flavour, nowhere near a Dunkelweisen, but slightly in that direction from the average Hefe.

Schneider Weisse pours to a very opaque deep blonde color with a huge rocky, white head, and a very lively carbonation. If possible, one should drink this beer out of the proper 1/2 liter weisse glass to enjoy the visual beauty, as well as the aromas of this beer. Hefeweizen is a wheat beer brewed with up to 50% malted wheat, and is sedimented with yeast. You want to roust the yeast by swirling it and then pouring it into the beer. Yeast is an essential flavor element in this beer style. The nose on this beer is fantastic. Tart wheat malt aromas marry with funky, clove, and banana aromas. The palate is a firm malt back bone, of pale and wheat malts, very tart and refreshing. Some nice fruity esters are present as well, hints of pear or perhaps melon. This beer finishes with more tart wheat character, and more of that banana and clove flavor. This is a fantastic Bavarian hefeweizen, a classic. Match this beer with weisse wurst sausages, egg noodles, and saurkraut

01.19.06  500ml bottle.  Dark and brassy amber, cloudy but not opaque, and with a short, quick white head.  Aromas are estery and clover honey.  Lighter bodied and more drinkable than the other Bavarian hefe standards, much milder in its sweetness and clove.  Its firm and fruity and refreshingly sour.  Good stuff.

This one poured a rich mahogany red-brown, slightly cloudy and flecked with yeast, with a thick, full off-white head that slowly collapsed in the middle, leaving nice fine lace up the side of the glass.  Aromas were clove and apple streudel, spice, ginger, and a bit of floral hops.  Taste was crisp fruit, spice, bubblegum, bananas, citrus, yeast and hops.  Sweet and refreshing but with a slight tang and a light bitter finish.  Full-bodied but balanced.  An excellent wheat.
Classic wheat beer.  Light fruit and spice.  That joyous bready flavour that I love so much.  Pleasant effervescence.  Sits nice and heavy.  A pleasure always.

"way different then any Hefeweizen i have had before. Pours a cloudy amber color. Doesnt have the normal bubbles a hefe has and a much darker color. Aroma was still citrus and banana. But flavor was a little stonger. Mouthfeel was about perfect. Overall good beer. Poured a nice cloudy amber with a decent starting head that didnt last throughout the beer. Overall its quite a good beer. Not sure if its the #1 weisse, but it does go down smooth and for the price is a good beer that one can afford to drink.

(12.27.05) One pint, 0.9 fl oz (500 mL) brown bottle purchased from DiCarlo Wine and Spirits (formerly Armanettis), Mundelein, IL.  Hazy brown ale having an average off-white head with good lacing.  No discernable carbonation. Nice spicy clove aroma.  Medium bodied that starts dry with light malt sweetness and spicy clove and smoke flavors. Finishes dry with light malt aftertaste.  A clean-tasting refreshing dunkel hefe-weisse beer.

Tasted this one from the distinguished white and gold labelled bottle and poured it into its own tall glass. Started off good with a cloudy, tawny amber-gold body with surging fine carbonation pushing up a lasting, pillowy off-white head that clung firmly to the glass. Thickly doughy and tangy, apple and banana nose; quite peppery and clove-like phenolic, which managed to tickle my nostrils upon each whiff. It all went pear shaped in the mouth; Im still aghast as to how an aroma can be so powerful with no influence on the taste. Considering that all the receptors lead straight to the brain, my brain must have obviously dozed off as this was bland as hell in the mouth!!! Lightly zesty with a pronounced kilned wheat flavour that dominated the otherwise watered down and thin palate. Lightly husky in the back with cardboard like flavours filling the void and lasting through after the swallow. Finish is quite short and without the lingering cardboard its reasonably crisp and non existent. Champagne-like carbonation obscures things for the first few mouthfuls but after that it is left to fend for itself, and unfortunately it fails. This had promise, but unlike the Aventinus Weizenbock, this was one as one dimensional as filing paper!!! Disappointing. (50cL, Morley Liquor Merchants, 22/01/06)

500 ml bottle.  Pours mahogany brown with vigorous foaming.  Head forms lovely peaks and valleys and stays intact for the duration.  Nose is of citrus primarily with a bit of flowery/herbal mixed in.  Very well balanced.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Bottle. 1 year past BB-date. It pours a sparkling, clear dark golden body with a small, off-white head. Banana, some citrus, cloves and wheat on the nose. Quite thin on the body, effervescent. The flavor has banana, cloves, a little citrus note, some wheat and a weak but pleasant bitterness. Sweetness too, but its mostly dry. Short bitterness in the finish, with banana and cloves lasting quite some time. Refreshing as a fine weisse can be, but a bit dull, due to age. Still, better than many fresh weisses. Rating: 6-3-6-3-13-3.1. (090409)Bottled. Dark orange with a white head. Disappointingly small head, but that was probably due to the glass. Aroma is banana and citrus. Flavor too, but it has some caramel in the flavor. Dry finish. (051210)
Bottled. Pours a hazy/orange brown color. Big bubbly head. Grainy metallic aroma. Some yeast going on. Slightly malty. Slightly roasted flavor.
Bottle. Hazy brown color with an average creamy white head that was mostly lasting. Good wheat aroma. Medium body. Moderate sweet wheat flavor with an average finish. Good brew.

Cloudy amber with a nice full head that dissappated about 3/4 of the way through.  The clove/apple smell was wonderful, and the crisp taste left me wanting another one.  The carbonation was a bit much at first, but after the first couple drinks was fine, even helped to keep the taste fresh.  Highly enjoyable beer, would love to try it on tap.

Actually the fizziness of this beer draged the score down a bit for me. The amber color, slightly cloudy, in conjuction with a fabulous though not overberring aroma really made up for anything left to be desired on the palate. Overall, would I overpay at a bar to drink this beer... yes I would!

Hazy amber-honeyish hue, with a foamy white head, yeasty, wheat malt, banana-like fruitiness and spicy clove aromas follows through on a medium-bodied  palate, with a yeasty, mellow wheat malt charecter, touch of caramel, sweet malt accent, spicy clove, maybe a note of cinnamon, leading towards a sweetish maltiness finish

this beer has all the bells and whistles youd expect from a german wheat. Banana, clove and a nice balance of hop and yeasty flavor. its a little darker in color than most weizens but finishes light. this beer remindes me of late summer, sitting in my yard having lunch while I smoke a pork butt in the barrel for dinner. AAHHHHHHHHHH .....pleasure!!

Banana and bread malt taste. Definately yummy. I added a lemon half way down and it was equally refreshing. definately not needed, but I wanted to try it both with, and without and only had one bottle. This is a great stock beer. had a lot of yeast to my surprise.

A Sim rate:
