Great beer to smell as you sip. Banana and sultana in the aroma. Bit yeasty smell. Almost like freshly-baked bread. Banana bread, perhaps? No lacing. Head disappears like lightning. Flavour is fierce at first and then quickly gone. Tastes again like banana. Very smooth and easy-drinking. Tastes like a cross between an ale and a weiss beer. Very dark for a weiss beer, but sweet in the flavour.
My favorite weisse. Not too spicey, just a basic wheat beer. I never add fruit to this baby!
From a bottle, ive been interested in trying quite a few white beers because theyre good. This one feels more like an ale than others ive tried, less fizzy bubbles. Good taste.

Ugly brown with some yeast floaters. Dense, creamy, white head. Yeast, wheat, clove, light fruitiness-aroma. Same flavor with a bit of spice and some subtle, crisp hops. Refreshing medium body with plenty of carbonation. Excellent hefeweizen.

This stuff was closer to the Belgian White beers that Ive had than the German Hefeweizens.  More of that Belgian-style spice, and fruit.  Lighter yeast.  Still pretty cloudy appearance though.  Not too shabby, but I like Franziskaner better.
Brownish-yellow color in glass.  Very fizzy.  Smelled fruit, banana.  It went down smooth and had more body to it than the other hefeweisens Ive had so far - I liked it.

500ml bottle poured into the official glass. A little bit darker orange body than usual. Cloudy as well with a huge head. Typical big banana aroma, but the flavor is much better than any other German Hefe to date. Big malt flavor with toffee. Finishes bittersweet. Very nice!

Bottled: This is simply a great example of a hefe. Typical amber colour, aroma is on the money - banana, cloves hints of citrus - nice sweet fruity flavours with a good mouthfeel and a lite bitter/sourish finish.
Good stuff.

Bottle (500ml).  Poured murky orange with a big lasting foamy slightly off-white head.  Aroma of sweet banana and citrus malt, very peppery.  Quite spicy and orangey tasting, fresh fruity malt and a bit of ashy hop bitterness too.  Mouthfeel is creamy and lively - very nice Hefe, not complex or challenging, but goes down easy.
nice spice and mild tang with a refreshing aftertaste, this is one of best witbier I know.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2007 This is really one of the flagship hefes that I picture mentally when I think of a good hefeweisen. Pours out a cloudy brown. A little bit of yeast in the nose, along with banana and wheat bread. The flavor is all hefe, complete with banana, light fruit, and clove. Really a great example fo the style. Cheers.

I used to detest wheat beers as there was always a seeming lack of balance and a far too prominent tang coming from a soup of esters. Then I discovered that Aussies generally cant do this style well. The Germans are masters here and the Schneider family do a great rendition of this style. Pleasant fruity aromas and a good smack of apple and bananas. A fine body and very thirst quenching as the warmer months approach.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: (Bottle)  Pours a lightly cloudy orangish-brown body with a large creamy off-white head.  Arom of wheat and banana.  Good flavored hefeweizen (wheat, banana, cloves).

Biased opinion as I love hefe weizens.  This one had some setiment in the bottom of the bottle (typical for a nice weizen), a very cloudy appearance, and less frothy head.  Nice flavor with excellent palate.

On draught (barrel-conditioned) at the Weisses Bräuhaus Munich: Cloudy, darker than the average pale wheat; rich nose: cloves, bananas, vanilla and some citrus in the nose; complex malty and fruity taste, leading to a drier, tart and fruity finish. The benchmark !

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2006 NIce one, it has been a long time since I did not have a Weisse beer like this, very long. he colour is a little new for me, but it was thick, the flavor was amazing and the aroma is pretty great.
Bottle. Distinct banana aroma. CLoudy brownish colour. Big stable head. Very bananaish flavour, some citrus.

A large robust nose of floral & wheat,  pours a resonant cloudy amberish to gold in color.  Nicely built head that enhances the nose.  Crisp, slightly sweet, tasting following what the nose and aroma offer, plus some some traces of fruits.  A good entry overall.
Not much different than the Paulaner Hefe-Weizen I just had, though a little darker in complexion with less head and less . . . fruity a flavor.  Again, not especially interesting.
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2005 On Tap. Pours a hazy amber with a dissappearing head. Fruity aromas with plum and banana and yeast. A bit too sour. Sour finish with banana flavor. OK CO2 level.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2006 Combined rating from US bottle and Munich brauhaus - Pours dark cloudy brownish amber with a fully receding off-white head. Aroma is phenolic with notes of dusty yeast, clove, caramel, alcohol, and spice.  Taste is lightly sweet and yeasty: notes of apples, cloves, dark bread.  Finish is tart and moderately acidic, lightly sweet. This beer is a slightly different take on the style, and it’s darker than a typical hefe.  Delicious when fresh and on tap, but still enjoyable in the bottle.

Fully hazy, foxy-chestnut with olive shine; small but tenacious creamy head. Banana, cloves and dark candi-sugar aromas. Citrussy acidity, obvious wheat. Roasted malts contribute making it much drier than the Helles. No excess sweetness here, except a litte restsweetness retronasal. Malty dry, full bodied. Dry and fusels in the aftertaste. Very good - the original N°1 in Weizenbierland is still great. Only - to me this ought to be called a Dunkel Weizen...

(500 ml bottle: $2.89 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) All these years drinking good beer, and Im finally getting around to sampling "The Original" German Hefe-Weizen.  Hmm, not at all what I was expecting.  First, the color is considerably darker than I imagined.  Its actually a dark, caramely amber, and only slightly hazy until I finally can swirl and pour in the remaining contents of the bottle.  At that point, the beer is cloudy, but chunks of sediment precipitate out.  It looks more like a Dunkelweizen to me.  And the head is all wrong.  Off-white, very fizzy, and the bubbles dissipate as rapidly as soda, leaving a pretty dead-looking beer.  Well, the flavor is more to my expectations, with definite banana-like esters, bubble gum, and yeast in the forefront, but the slightly caramely maltiness is again throwing me for a loop.  Theres a modest sourness in the finish, which helps to balance the beer.  In the nose, I get banana, clove, and uhm, apple?  This is one bizarre Hefeweizen.  Medium bodied, and well-carbonated despite the strange head action.  I think I need to try this again because this beer just seems all wrong.  Or maybe I just need to ditch my preconceived notions of what a German Hefeweizen is supposed to taste like?

Pours a beutiful amber-orange colour, with a great looking head, has a pleasing and surprising non offending smell, good solid but delicous yet subtle taste, this ones smooth and flavourfully enjoyable, at the end has floaties so watch out, but I recommend this even if your not a big hefe fan, this might help you change your mind!

Bottle poured caramel with a big thick white head.
Aroma is yeast and banana.
Flavor is yeast, banana and fruit with a big yeast and dark fruit finish.

The original hefeweizen is still the best and most unique. While many well-made weizens are nearly indistinguishable, Schneider Original has the drinkability of a standard hefeweizen crossed with the chocolate malt/caramel malt color and complexity of some dunkel weizens. Banana esters are much less prevalent in favor of a more spicy clove yeast character. A perfect beer for a hot summer day (or any other).
Bottle, North Bar, Leeds. Dark amber wheat beer with some apple and nutty flavours.  Also some spiciness in the palate and on the end.  Nutty finish. Nice.
Nice and light with mild banana, clove, citrus scents and flavors. Very enjoyable.

A weak, caramel-brown with large, plaster-chunks of sediment and virtually no head. Aromas were rather weak, with banana, lemon, honey and cola. A moderately sweet start with a mild, bitter middle and light acidity to end. Dry and spicy. There are better hefes.
<font size=-4>A perk of working for a <a href=http://www.workinlate.com/bier.html>mag that occasionally runs beer reviews :)<font size=-1>

Deep amber color to the body with a good head. Aroma of banana and clove.
Well balanced flavor of fermented fruit. Was clean on the palate. But the last swig it tasted like someone just put an alcohol wipe on my tounge. Decent beer.
Robe blonde voilée aux reflets cuivrés surmontée dune mousse blanche en dentelle. Arômes de bananes, dagrumes et de levures. Saveurs de bananes et de levures. Belle présence du corps.
(Bottle 50 cl) Cloudy, dark golden - must be one of the darkest German Hefes. Fresh and lightly acidic fruitiness with a - for a Hefe - surprisingly bitter finish. 160300

Citrus tones are the order of the day here, overtaking the standard clove and banana aromas/flavors typical to the style. Pours an unusually dark murky amber for a standard hefe; thin but tightly packed head sits atop this sinister-looking brew. Lace slides down the side of the glass fairly rapidly. Citrus dominates with some clove and apple notes back there a ways, then dry wheat shows up toward the end. Definitely on the chewier end of the hefe-weizen scale. One of the best of its breed, this is well-done.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2006 On a hot summers day I could imagine drinking litres of this beer on end. However today it is winter, and only just warm enough to avoid the jumper. Contrary to the description (which is quite different to whats written on my bottle) the head was initially prominent, but not persistent, and any lacing was sliding down the glass faster than a gecko on red bull. An initally burst of banana aroma was followed by some sour green apple. Tasting brought out a slight hint of the cloves, but the palate was a bit too light to be above average. The flavour was good, with a touch of bitterness leaving a very pleasant finish. A good weizen. Re-rate: Sort of like a baby Aventinus. This time around its summer, and it is appreciated a bit better. Noticed more of the sourness, although that probably has to do with a more experienced palate. Still far behind some of the brewers other products.
Poured a hazy amber color.  Aroma of banana and cloves.  Light body.  Flaovrs of citrus, banana, and cloves.  Light and refreshing.

Pours a nice hazy light  amber with a 1/2 foamy white head that fades to a slight cover.  Aroma of banana, nutmeg, green apple. 
Flavour is tart but not overly bitter. Slightly malty with a yeasty wheat body. and effervescent.  sour apple finish.

Poured a bronze-cast amber with a big head that dissappeared and didnt lace at all (contrary to what the description says). Aroma was rich, fruity, complex. I got notes of peach, honey, yeast, a touch of clove. The highlight of this beer for sure. Flavor was thin, too cidery, only a touch of wheat, with a suck-your-mouth-dry finish that didnt really go over too well. Where are the banana and clove notes everyone is talking about? I didnt even come close to those. This beer tasted (and looked) more like a kristalweizen to me.
Bottle. Not the biggest Hefe fan. Poured a hozy golden, small white head. Aroma of banan and cloves, and A touch of bitter ending. Nice.
Pours dark amber.Has aromas of wheat with the taste to follow.Has some chalkiness in the finish. Not bad
(draft) Not my favorite in this style, but not really anything wrong with it that I can point out. Just a little subdued in every aspect. Could use something more, but Im not sure what.

500ml bottle:  Suprise!  This pours an amber color, definitely darker than expected for a Hefeweizen.  Mine had a bit of a fizzy head, but it went to nothing rather quickly.  There was no lacing.  The main component of the aroma is definitely clove.  Not overpowering, but it is up-front of everything else.  Perhaps some wheat and spices in the backgroung.  It has a good wheat body, with definite notes of clove and banana to the taste.  Very drinkable.

Bottle, a medium dark ambery cloudy pour with nig head.  Clovey aroma, packed with spices.  Big banana and orange and esters and spices in the flavor - much more spiciness than I would expect in a German hefeweizen.

17oz - Aroma is yeast, malt, brown sugar, and a little lemon, kind of weak.  Color is a yellowish brown producing tons of bubbles, but little head and no lacing.  Flavor is brown sugar, yeast and malt with a touch of citrus.  Clean palate is refreshing on a hot day.  A different hefe, good but not great.

Draft. I reallý dont understand the rave about this one. My friends all love it as well, but this is what I thought: Aroma is extremely honey and rich. Definitely the best part of this beer is the nose. Flavor is something of a disappointment. Its too citrus and palate is downright disgusting. Way too sweet and sticky.

Had this one on draught in Chicago, Illinois.  An outstanding wheat beer, as most are!  Deep orange color with a thick head, nose of orange and cloves, taste light and wheaty with citrus and tropical fruit.  Finishes light.  A great summertime brew.

Imagine, being constrained by the use of four ingredients and two are water and yeast, and still being able to make this beer.  Probably the best Ive ever had.  The color is just rich and glowing.  The nose is full of banana and cloves that give way to rich baking spices and bananas foster.   Thank you to the brewery for refermenting in the bottle. Living beer is always a plus and aside from the remarkable freshness this beer also posseses a wonderful champagne-like carbonation that when poured into the PROPER glass at the PROPER temp. the head floats like a cloud all the way down the flute.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2005 Bottle.  Pours a dark amber color, not very cloudy.  Nice head, but did not last too long.  Seemed to have more carbonation than other hefes I have tried recently.  Had more of an apple taste to it with some spice.  I enjoyed this one, but a notch below some other hefes I have tried recently.  Good beer.

Bottle.  For a Hefe this is one of the tops in the catagory.  Just  pouring this into the glass is worth buying this one.  Head is incredible full tight and long lasting white.  Taste is decent a little more sour and fruity than a typical Hefe.  Excellent Choice.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2006 On Draft at Issac Newtons. Pours orang\brown with a beige head. Aroma of citrus, fruit (bananas), spices perhaps cinnamon. Flavor is sweet, wheat, bananas, citrus, carbonated. Good body, damn good Hefe.

A full blend of many different things making up the aroma: banana, clove, apple, spice and yeast . Is a murky amber brownish tea color with some yellow gleaming through the sides of the glass. Decent head formation but will be broken up quickly.  Notice of the spice, yeast and apple with a bubblegum undertone.  Love the carbonation and a leaves behind a bitter aftertaste, however, it would of been more enjoyable for me if only it wasnt as spicey in the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 Re-Rate for February 29/08- Pours a deep, earthy brown with hues of orange. The head is a frothy beige cap that lasts and laces well. Nice retention. Clove, yeasty esters,earthy, fruity malts and bubblegum all fill the nose. It is sweet, but slightly tart. Very fruity while hinting at clove and yeast with some candy as well. Creamy and effervescent. One of my all time favourites. Original score 3.4.
A good wheat beer. Sharp. Fruity. Crisp lively carbonation. Good appearance, and head properties.

pours deep amber, with lively co2, good head retention stuck around for the whole beer, maybe I just drank it fast? sweet aroma w/ hints of cloves and citrus, sublte banana flavor up front follwed by a nice clove spiceiness, finishes sweet with a bit of green apple, very enjoyable hef!
Nice beer.  Full of flavors, ranging from a light citrus to a tangy clove in the finish.  All the way through, however, the yeast is present.  Finishes nice and sour.  A good weisse.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: On train from Zurich to Austria.  Delicious to drink while watching the mountains go by in the restaurant car.  I forgot the other beer I drank, and I dont even care.
This beer smells like wine, minus the disgusting part. It has a strange appearance, but a nice flavor, with a pleasing after taste. Easily (one of) my favorite wheat beers.

pours out pretty dark for a hefe.  sweet smell, and equally sweet taste.  a good beer, not something i would chose given other choices of hefes, but certainly not bad to say the least.  glad i got to try this one.
pours a dark cloudy brown.  Has a small tan head.  Flavor is a bitter sweet flavor and aroma has some banana scent to it.

Draught at Ølbaren.
Hazy orange coloured with a creamy white head.
Aroma of citrus and bananas with some sweetness.
Sweet flavour of bananas and citrus.
Nice weissbier.

good weizzen. mahogany brown(very dark for a weizzen). aroma: banana, clove, nutmeg. taste: little sour, fruits(banana, apple), hints of Etoh. good body and maybe a bit too much co2. finish is short, banana-taste, bit sourish, bit bitter. refreshing summer drink.
Good Hefeweizen, has a bit more character than other Weizens. Beside the typical banana-clove recipe it gives room to citrusfruits, it is reasonably wellbodied and has a pleasant bitter aftertaste.

Really good wheat beer, the usual aroma and flavours but with a slight twist, as more juicey fruits and what id expect. This is shown though in the redish colour of the beer. 
Try it a  good session beer.

Pretty good, the only thing lacking in this beer was its flavor.  Of casre it was all malts, which was mainly that of sour citrus friuts.  Nice cloudy copper body thick white head.   Definiatlly a filling beer.

Pours a hazy copper with a huge, creamy, dense, ivory head. Darker than most hefes Ive tasted. Smells deeply of clove and banana with persistent hints of bubblegum.

Tastes of a nice blend of banana, bubblegum and clove. Lemony with other citrus flavors throughout (orange and light grapefruit). All nicely supported by sweet wheat malt. The mouth is a bit thin but overall a surprisingly good Hefeweizen. Flavorful, refreshing warm weather beer.

Pours much darker than I expected from my experience with other German weisse beers.  Little head, no lacing.  Aroma is banana and a bit of spice.  The flavor is similar but with a nice tart edge and a hint of raisin flavor in the background.  Wheaty flavor that I expected was only present as an aftertaste.  Not like other hefe-weizens Ive had, and Id have to say that I like this one the best of the ones Ive tried.  Highly recommended.

Hazy chestnut-brown with a big, rich head. Sweet and spicey aroma, with some banana bread notes. Flavours of yeast, citrus, banana & malt. Crisp & well-balanced bitterness in the finish. Fantastic stuff that I really should drink more often. Thanks for Andicus for this bottle.

Bottled. Hazy nut brown colour, hugefoamy head. Sweet wheaty aroma with hints of malt. Wheat and malt in flavour with some hoppy notes. Wasnt as sweet as I thought. Good hoppy level. A bit different from other weissbiers I have tasted.
Cloudy amber appearance, small creamy head. Vague aroma of cloves, wheat and salami. Citrus and banana in flavour, rather spicy and dry finish, hints of ham.
spicy aroma, banana. Pours a nice cloudy yellow-orange, thin head. A satisfying, refreshing hefe. Mild acids but still a crisp finish. Sweetness in the middle.

Great, intriguing flavor, unique to Schneider Original. Beatiful reddish color. Very good mouthfeel - just has that taste of more.
The best weissbier Ive ever tasted!

Light malt and spice aroma in this one, following a golden brown pour with a lively head.  Tastes of toasty malts, fruit, spice, and slight hops--pretty normal hefe stuff.  Not my favorite style by a long shot, but a clean and refreshing change for a nice warm day.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2005 Pint bottle served cold. Aroma is strong with hops and alcohol and some roasted malt. Is a golden brown color but lacks cloudiness. Nice frothy head. Tastes is somewhat like English ale in that its taste is almost chocolate like; that is no doubt from the well toasted malts in this one. Nice hop character that adds a mixture of bitterness and spiciness. Decent alcohol presence as well. On the down side it is a little too thin and could stand to be a little sweeter but overall a very good beer. Weak bitter aftertaste.

Pours amner wth a healthy head into a hefe-weizen glass.  Smell is of banana and coriander.  Taste is citrussy with the wheat elements brought to the nose in each gulp.  This is a favorite of mine in the warmer weather months.

aromas of sweet fruits, apricot, a little banana, but not a heavy smell has a citric sharpness, also cloves and a light spicyness. lively and clean mouthfeel with a sharp finish, a really nice hefeweizen and a definite summer favourite.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2006 I have heard of this beer for some time, and being a wheat beer fan I have been looking forward to trying it. Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a chestnut color with a large pinkish head. The aroma was sour malt. The flavor is light sour malt with a hint of citrus and a light wheaty finish. It is an ok hefeweizen but nowhere near the best in the class.

Bottle. Pours with a massive white head like a proper weizen, however the colour is a few shades darker than your average hefe. Big banana and clove on the nose with a bit of malt in the background. Sweetness is reasonably low for the style and phenolic clove tones are very noticable on the finish. Aftertaste does not stay around as long as my reference hefe (Weihenstephan). Mouth feel is soft and light, not overly carbonated. A solid hefe and very drinkable.

Draft at San Diego Brewing Co.  Cloudy, dark amber with a very nice, lasting head.   A lot of fruity aroma that carries over into the flavor.  Some spice in the aroma as well.  A nice even bitter aftertaste.
huge head, brown colored. nice fruity aroma, the flavor is banana and the body is medium.

Poured a murkey brown color with a medium white head.  Aroma was wheat malt with a spiciness.  Flavor was fruity with banana and cloves and a bit of sweet malt with a spicy finish.  Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation.
This beer has an unfavorable spice and aftertaste. Lightly cloudy, not a true beer - taste no hops and very little malt

Small off-white head, cloudy/murky body.  Nice aroma, sweet and spicy.  Medium body with a thin texture.  Lively carbonation. The taste starts sweet and ends with a acidic/spicy flavor.  Pretty refreshing, but not a favorite.

Definately on the darker coloured side, a nice medium chocolate brown.  Slightly cloudy. Expressive nose, cloves, and some faint larger notes.  Does remind of a Belgian strong ale. Much fainter and lighter in the palate, disappointing so.  Feels nice in a Asahi Super Dry way, but where did the flavour go?  Has to be a dodgy bottle.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2005 Rerate 23/7/05: Skinny over-carbonated weisse. Cloudy copper colour, poor head retention. Delicious aroma of banoffee pie - bananas, toffee and cream. Classic weisse. Thin, ridiculously fizzy palate. Like drinking Creamola Foam. Drab caramel flavour and little else going on. 
Original rating: 7/4/8/4/16

This beer brings the words "crisp and clean" to a new level.  It is also a beautiful beer with a head that is slightly golden in color.  It enters the mouth with a slight tartness but leaves a sweet aftertaste which is unlike the commercial description.  A fantastic beer!
Probably the best mainstream wheat beer in Germany. You can get it (almost) everywhere in bottles. Tasty, fruity,  refreshing & palatable.
Pour ia a amber, little lace-dislike. Comes with a clove taste although light, very mild fruit. Refreshing, clean mild finish, another.
Supurb spicy yeasty flavor.  Just enough hops bite to balance.  Great beer.

Excellent all around, cloudy orange/amber with a very tall sturdy white head. Tons of clove in the aroma, banana notes are much more mild, wheat and apple. Taste is very alive and refreshing, carbonation brings out the spiciness of this brew. Wheat and light malts up front, fading to apple clove finish.

Spicy aroma, lots of clove with banana and bubblegum in the background.  Cloudy dark amber color, on par with some dunkelweizens, thick off-white head.  Cleaner tasting than other weisse beers, mostly clove, moderate tartness from the wheat, restrained apple fruitiness.  Medium body, lots of spritzy carbonation.  A little different from the classic hefeweizen - more emphasis on clove and tartness, less banana and bubblegum.

This, while less complex and outright amazing than Aventinus, has a less overpowering sweetness, and is probably more balanced.  So far the best german wheat Ive had aside from Aventinus, which is really in a class of its own, even among that all too rare dunkel doppelweisse category.  Not a lot of hops, but it cant be all things to all people.

bottle-pours a dark amber hue with a nice fluffy white head.  Pours much darker than most hefes, almost like a weizenbock.   phenolic aroma of bananas, lemon zest, and lots of spice.  the dark malts make a presence also.  flavors are fairly malty with the normal hefe banana notes with a lemon note on the finish.  tasty!  a nice spritzy body brings the flavors in quite well.
Aroma with banana, malt, wheat. A quite dark weisse for a non Dunkelweizen. Orange-brown color, frothy fluffy head.  Malty, spicy, tart acid note. Apple and clove notes. Astringent finish.

Adherent and persistent foam. Unusual color, amber and clear brown. Lightly veiled with a remarkable infeef fizzy. Much bubbly. Intense scent with fruit and lemon aroma. Present also notes of scotch. Taste fresh and decided with one good persistence. Medium bitter. Truly valid.

Muddy orange pour with a bubbly off white head which quickly disipates.  Nice Hefe aroma  dominated by banana and pear peels with hints of spice.  This beer has a great mouthfeel and a crisp, dry finish.  The body is thin and balanced throughout - great drinkability.
Fizy cloudy light golden colour. thick head that fades to minimal lingering. stale yeast nose. Dry fruity yeast taste.
Pretty dark for a hefe, hazy, lots of carbonation.  The head was pretty fine, not too rocky.  Had about half of it, and then some chicken wings, I think it would have gone better with some sausage.

Good colour, typically hazy, good fluffy head, and what a nose, spice, malt, citrus fruits, the works..sets the tastebuds tingling but it must be said that while there are lots of flavours, Im a bit let down after the complex aroma, a "classic", but have had better.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2009 Dec 31, 2004: Pleasant, but very yeasty. I happen to like yeast, so this gets a good rating :) Wheat, yeast and fruit makes for a well-balanced weizen. Very dark appearance.

Re-rate May 22, 2009: Upped this a bit. Its very good :)

Brown Coloring with Sandy Head. Coriander/Yeast Aroma.  Carbonated.  Coriander Light Wheat.   Mainly Carbs and CorianderBut Solidly The Best Beer Ive Had This Night.  For a Hefe, This is Very Decent, But Not What I Would Want in a Balanced Hefe.

Murky brown with a foamy, white head that recedes to a patchy blanket.  Fresh aroma of lemon, spicy cloves, and faint banana.  Where the aroma is not strong in banana esters, the flavour would be quite tasty for a monkey.  The banana taste is followed by cloves, but is not really spicy and there is a refreshing citrusy note throughout.  No bitterness.  Medium to full body with substantial effervescence and a small alcohol warming effect.  A+.
a principio parecia ser muito boa...mas depois q dei a primeira golada vi q a kaiser do brasil eh melhor q isso

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2005 Bottle: Pouring dark amber with a small scummy head that dissapeared in about ten seconds things didnt start well for me with this. However, my fears were diminished with a draught of the fresh aroma - classic phenolics and spices that were sweet and wheaty with lots of synthetic banana. The flavour was darker, like the beer itself, and confused me at first. Spicy wheat with some earthy and grassy hop flavours towards the end. In fact I think the finish is probably where this beer shines with a lingering tartness and wheaty hop flavour. I found the palate somewhat dry and the carbonation a little coarse. All up this felt like an unfinished beer conceptually, but still very nice. 7/3/7/3/12 = 3.2Re-rate: More together this time around with some smokeyness filling out the middle. 7/3/7/3/14 = 3.3
The head looks like soap water, but it sure tastes like a weissbier. Very dark though compared to the wheat beers Ive had earlier.
bottle. murky dark tea color. thin quickly fading head. semi sour caramel nose. taste is sweet malt with a pear taste. finish is a touch of bitter, caramel, and fruit.

On tap at the Bermuda Brau, Wien. Dark Amber, hazed, lasting whiye head. Particularly restrained weisse, more subtle in the spiciness though a corriander flavour shows through. Refreshing though a little flabby sweetness. Good though.

In the Bottle bought from The Alex in Derby.

A light brown wheat beer. Naturally cloudy. Quite a strong (but nice) smell & taste.

A really nice bottled Wheat beer
Deep cloudy amber color and large off white head.Banana and clove aroma.Bubbly mouthfeel and slightly bitter finish.Very drinkable.
Bottled. A decent example of the Hefeweizen style. Spicy clove, banana aromas. Typical of the style. Nice yeastiness. Overall a nice refreshing beer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2005   Good beer but the Schneider Aventinus is much better.  The taste is weak in comparison.  The aroma is good but it lacks the spicyness of the Aventinus.  I still recommend this though, because it is a solid Hefeweisen.

Pours a murky dark amber with a large white head that left a lacing on the glass.  One of the darkest hefes Ive seen.  Smelled of hefe spiciness.  Taste was a little less striking as other hefes, with less banana flavor and more general spiciness.  Good moutfeel.  Overall very refreshing and drinkable.

Orgasmic start, smooth flavor with nice crisp overtones of bright fruit flavors (banana, orange, apple), refreshing with a light finish of wheat flavoring.  This is an excellent and clean implementation of the hefeweizen.  This combines invigorating flavors with wheat overtones.  Loving this right now, perfect example of German craftsmanship.
A very nice weisse.  I put this one up there with Victory Sunrise Weiss as one of the best.
Bronze color.  Perhaps darker than Ayinger Ur-Weisse.  Nice white head.  Nose of banana, cloves/spices.  Refreshing mouthfeel.  Yeast flavors throughout.  One of the better weisse beers.
Pours a nice mahogany colour with a full creamy head. Aroma has notes of yeast and esters. Taste is very yeasty, and full bodied.
Cloudy amber, big off-white head. Yeasty, spicy aroma; coriander rather than cloves. Flavor much like the aroma. Very slight grassy bitterness. Fairly light body.
Hazy golden color, light yeasty banana citrus aroma and fresh taste, medium body, sparkeling finish.

Bottle. Large rocky off-white lasting head with good lacing. Sparkling cloudy amber/orange. Aroma yeast/biscuit/banana/pear/peach/bubblegum/clove/va Medium creamy mouthfeel with long finish, a little chalky, but not too much. Apple and blackcurrant notes in mouth which I didnt notice in the aroma. Tasted alongside Erdinger Hefeweizen. This wins.
Orange, corriander, some yeast, citrus nose.  Lively citrus, wheat, yeastiness, apple (vanilla?)  Nice smooth mouthfeel

Bottle. A decent hefe, but not enough. I prefer franziskaner hefe, even if its a little too carbonated. Anyway, medium dark brown, darker than most hefes. Smells light and refreshing. But the flavor falls a little flat. Not on my list to try again unless nothing else decent is available.

Cloudy amber color,small head that faded quickly leaving little behind.The aroma was spice and bannanna with maybe a bit of a semi-sweet side.The flavor was fairly decent,sort of sweet at times with a decent bannanna side a nice not overly done spice with a mild alcohol but very mild.Over all a fairly decent brew that makes for a nice summer session but for the cooler temps coming it doesnt fit right now.Well worth trying again in the summer.

Amber colored with some cloudiness, little yellow head which disappeared totally. Yeasty and fruity aroma, pretty standard for hefeweizen. Strong carbonation comes up in start. Flavor starts watery and sweet, ends with lasting banana and some yeast, which make aftertaste pretty nice. Too much carbonation for my taste, still crispy and refreshing brew, although not anything special.

in bottle at Lucky 13 in SF.  nice dark tea and golden cloudy color, rocky white head that dissapears quickly.  clove, apple, and banana aroma.  fruity and blended malty flavor, light wheat zing but balanced.  fair sweet finish.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2007 Draft at The Wharf, Aalborg, Denmark. Hazy, pale copper-brown colour. Creamy white head, which sinks. Yeast in the aroma. The flavour is hoppy with yeast. Fresh. Fruity. Not so powerful, but very well balanced. Soft. Not a lot of aftertaste.

Bottle. - 7 / 3 / 6 / 3 / 10. Pours a hazy light copper brown with a diminishing white head. Sweetish aroma; yeast. Nice. Flavour is sweetish and yeasty. Feels a bit thin. Thin finish. Slightly bitter and dryish with faint metallic notes. 09-03-07.

Nice light bouquet of cloves and banana with a slight hint of fermentating vinegar alcohol.
Wasnt impressed with the quick dissipating  head not even a lace on the glass. Large bubble size would sum that up. Cloudy rust in color. What I like to do is before the bottle is empty I leave just a little of the elixir and swirl the contents to get the wheat that settled off the bottom. Taste was a little to light for me.
And even though Hefeweizen is my fav. This one has a nice wet mouthy feel but a little to wet for my likes. Not a real true hefe in my opinion. Could be more considered a light hefe. Im just taking taste, but it does pack the punch of hefe. Putting all things aside I like it but it would be last resort if I can get better.
Dark amber color eith a thin white head. Aroma of bananas and spices. Flavor of bananas and spices with a sweet finish. Very full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Very good weizen.
(bottle) cloudy amber with a nice thick fluffy head. i love the banana notes and wheaty flavors. despite my lingering cold, the taste still shines through.
Cloudy bown colour. Nice, big thick head. Heavy cloves aroma. Taste is banana, yeasty, cloves. A bit lightbodied, which is the reason I rate this lower than my favourite weizens.
Looks like a Dunkel-Weisse beer and is smoother than most hefeweizen.  Still, it has a lot of flavor of bananna and cloves packed in it.
Bottled.  Poured a cloudy dark amber color with a rapidly diminishing off-white head.  Flavor was very crisp and mildly fruity - banana and other tropical fruits came through.  A great hefe.

A relatively standard but authentic hefeweizen that also happens to taste very good.  One of the best of its kind; an excellent choice as an opening beer when you plan to drink several types in one sitting.  Best on tap when its cloudy and gray (the beer, or the weather for that matter).

Off white weak head. Cloudy amber color. Aromais fruity with pear , banana , dark fruits and spicy notes.  Flavor is fruity too with pear and apricots tones,ending in a sweet fruity finish. Light bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2009 Bottle - strong banana, orange, clove and wheat malt aroma.  Cloudy brown-yellow color with nice head.  Strong ripe banana, clove and wheat malt flavor.  Strong carbonation/acidity.  Very spicy  - definitely a top level weizen as long as you get it fresh.  Just doesnt age well.
Golden brown color beneath a massive foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, and light spices. Refreshing wheat with the slightest tartness. Crisp finish with subtle hints of clove. Not bad.

Deep amber/brown in color with a frothy head, this has a clean, light citric aroma with a hint of grassiness.  Plenty of body regardless of bottle size and the time it takes you to drink it.  Full, floral mouth-feel with a slightly sweet finish.  A truly refreshing drink.  Keep some in your refridgerator for when good friends stop by.

Ah yes!  The white label...  unlike denisons, this is a bit darker almost orange in colour.  Its so clean with honey and floral tones... I am a big fan of the Schneider family of brews.  This one is just as excellent!

The color here is not what the average beer drinker expects a hefe to have, but this is the Bavarian style. A muddy dark orangish, nearly brown near the crown, lighter at the foot. The head on it is full,lush,voluminous, white. Aroma is light, sweet, soft, delicious, delightful, focusing on flavors of citrus (lemon), honey, flowers, and mild spices. Texture and mouthfeel is extraordinarily smooth, with a graininess up front that fades fast.
Clean, brisk, uncomplicated, easily drunk, and yet brimming with taste. Substantial body, perfect malt, and a swift, but recurring, bright and lively finish. Citrusy hops return again and again to delight the tastebuds.
A very flavorful weizen, and a perfect brew for mealtime, hot Julytime, feellikehavinganotherbeertime.

interlaken, switzerland: this is a great german classic. nice orange brown haze with a huge fluffy pillow head that makes you want to sleep.  nose of bread, nutmeg, clove, slight banana.  smooth in the mouth and silky bubblegum banana clove mixures dance with delight of you new found love....to open arms by journey.   this is a nice solid hefe. a gold standard.
UPDATED: OCT 24, 2005 A very nice hefe.  Im a fan of all the Schneider & Sohn brews, and this is no exception.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Orange coloured with thin, but long lasting white head. Spicy aroma. Spice, banana/bubble gum and wheat flavours. Excellent slightly carbonated but smooth mouthfeel. Great wheatbeer
hazy orange with a nice thick dissipating head.  aroma was wheaty and alcoholy.  flavor was strong with alcohol and sweet.

My tastebuds are broken. I have yet to taste any Hefe-Weisse that tastes anything like a banana. This one didnt either, but everyone else, as usual, thought it did.

Smelled clean with faint traces of earthy hay and alcohol. Poured wonderfully. Much darker than the usual hefe. This one was a watery brown color.

Familiar yeasty hay flavors. Very light and watery finish.

Mouthfeel is thin and bubbly with abundant carbonation.

Not overwhelmed, but Id drink it again if someone else was paying.
Poured cloudy amber...smells of cloves, malt, banana...very malty right off the bat, then spicy and smooth...not very wheaty...but the finish is dry and yeasty...definately not your generic wheat...

16 oz bottle.  After drinking hundreds of these in Berlin in the early 90s (3 per week for 100 weeks) I finally get around to providing a rating.  Starts of with lots of banana, then finishes with clove and a hint of licorice.  Benchmark hefeweizen.
Sample taken from 500ml brown bottle. Pours cloudy. Amber coloured with dense white head. Aroma of bananasand spice. Spicy flavour, slightly tart finish.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2012 From bottle, dark cloudy amber tones with a nice white head. Spicy aroma with clove, orange peel, vanilla and banana but mellow palate that smoothly moves through thanks to a well-balanced carbonation. Medium sweetness with no bitterness that stays in mouth for a long time. Refreshing at the end with a long bready finish. This is for me the reference for a Hefe-Weizen, consistenly excellent, either from bottle or from tap, it delivers. Revised rating up to 4.5 from original 4.1.

Pours awefully clear amber color with a big white head. Aroma is a nice banana spice malt mixture. Flavor is very similar to aroma with a wheaty fruity finish. The start has a big difference from the dry wheaty finish......Im not describing this one well. I like it, but it is different from the other hefe I have had. Perhaps less yeasty and the carbonation is a bit less lively which seems odd.  Very nice and a refreshing.

Dark amber color with an initially large head, but it melted away quickly.  Aroma has some ester involved.  A very mild dusting of wheat in the taste with some hops, but not as much malt as you might expect.  It has a spiciness that is reminiscent of some Belgian beers.  An okay tasting brew, but I wouldnt hold it up as the standard Hefeweizen of any origin, let alone German.
Has a spicy aroma with some skunkiness and some fruit. Amber in color with not much for a head. Seemed to have some sourness. Has a yeasty taste with cloves.
Amber body, full head, spicy and some fruitiness-citrus and banana, lots of carbonation Vary good overall.
Ahhhh - wonderful.  Thick rocky head lasted a long time, and the aroma/flavor combination was perfect.  The brown color is offputting, but  no matter - a very fine hefe.
Large head disappearing fast. Cloudy amber. Aroma: yeast and banana. Same in the taste and with some bitterness in the rather long finish. Really good Hefe-weizen.
Pretty good wiess.  Medium amber color with a nice off-white head and plenty of body.  Bananas, lemons, and yeast all fill the nose.  Malted wheat and citrusy hop flavors.  Neiss weiss.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2004 Pours a amber body with a tall, voluptuous white head. Aroma is perfect for a hefeweizen. Spice, yeast, fresh fruit and wheat. The taste reflects the aroma in many ways. Hints of banana and yeast with spice blended throughout. Nice wheaty taste as well. The palate is smooth, even if a bit over carbonated, and very drinkable. Finish is more spice and yeast. Very refreshing beer! I love hefes during the summer. They seem to click more with this season than most other beers. Great hefeweizen!

All around an excellent Hefe. Dark golden pour, light white head which dissipates quickly. Fresh clove and spearmint aroma. Crisp hefe flavor - bubblegum and bananas. Very refreshing. Thick, clingy mouthfeel - yet refreshing. A good summer refresher.
Good head, good color, stronger flavor than I have experienced in comperable Weizens.  A good thirst quencher with a lingering taste on the palate. Great on a hot day.

Light chestnut color with a large foamy,
white head. A mild banana and citrus
aroma. Stronger flavored than most hefe-weizens. Nice malted wheat flavor. Highly carbonated and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2007 Wow! Just slightly lighter in color than Aventinus. This is dark for a hefeweizen...poured a slightly clouded copper-orange color with those lovely big natural bubbles streaking up the glass sides.... capped by a big frothy meringue head that stacks out of the glass and stays for the ride lacing up the sides of the weizen glass. Wonderful aromas of apple-banana with caramelized malts and a nice dab of clove-like spice. Starts tart and peppery from the effervescence and citrus tastes up front... then the flavors expands in the mid palate and on the tongue, to a big wheat-malt departure with the apple-banana-clove yeast signature and a nice understated musty toffee taste from the malts. The finish is fairly dry with a nicely balanced sweet-tart aftertaste.
This is a sturdy, old style wheat beer with bottle conditioned qualities that send its unique complexity over the top. I love this one.

Light lemony aroma, citrus, bread. Cloudy light amber, visible carbonation with foamy white lacing head. Medium body, light-medium carbonation. Starts wheaty, citrus, a little sweet. Nice rounded acidity, no bitter. Bubblegum clove finish, with sweet banana.  Mild after, very refreshing. Solid weizen.
Light brown body and a great big white head.  A nice light typical wheat nose.  Lots of streamers and well-carbonated.  A great hefe.
Fantastic beer.  taste great.  fruity aroma, golden brown colour.  large head that lasts.  One of my favourites.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2004 Pours an amazing cloudy terra-cotta body topped with a thick off-white bubbly head. Yeasty aroma with various hints of spices, malt, fruits (citrus, banana) and herbs. Mouthfeel has a good balance of carbonation, maltyness, yeastiness and fruityness. Long and wonderful final. Along with Maisels Weisse and Hacker-Pschorr, this is one of my top-3 bavarian Hefeweizen.
My favorite of all the Bavarian Hefe-Weizens. A little bigger and bolder than the every-day Weisse, it never fails to quench a thirst and please through a great complexity of flavors.

Bottled pint. Orangish gold hue; cloudy. Bits of swirling stuff. Head disappears quickly. Bready aroma. Nice yeasty tickle to back of throat. Crispy bite to it; peppy carbonation. This is decent but nothing to write Mom about.

Bottle.  Poured much darker than expected.  Light head that lingered.  Some spicy scents in aroma, but very subdued.  Refreshing crisp taste, good carbonation, and surprising malt character.  A long lasting finish.  Pretty good.

(on bottle)Not having traveld germany, my knowledge of local Weisbier isen´t that big. But this is, along with Maisels, the top of my line so far.
A dark, hazy brew, with little or non of the anoying banana flavours as from belgian witts. Some vanilla though. Smooooth to drink, love that feelling, along with the smal bitter sirp in the end. A perfect thirstkiller for me.

Bottled (BB 09/2004)
Murky hazy brown-orange color, a bit like dunkelweizen. Big foamy white head. Citron-banana aroma. Banana, wheat, spicey flavors. Crisp, well-balanced mouthfeel, tickling carbonation. Nice sourish aftertaste.

Nice amber/copper color. Very spicy and clove-like in the aroma and in the flavor. There is a fruitiness in there along with a dry wheat flavor. Not much yeast sediment (the beer was only moderately cloudy), but still a good representation of the style.
Cloudy dark orange with a big white head.  Aromas are bananas and yeast with spices.  Flavours are also bananas and spice with dry hops.  Some sourness in there as well.  Not bad at all.

This may be the classic weisse, but it doesnt look like all the others.  This beer pours a dark amber color, and is much clearer and darker than its brethren.  There is a more distinct malt backbone that dominates over many others that seem to waver towards banana or bubblegum.  This is a clean refreshing pour, with the extra thickness that makes it linger.

Indiana Ale Fest at Fort Wayne. Bottle. Poured no head, softly carbonated, semi-transparent with an orange hue. The aroma was malty, somewhat sweet, banana and clove. The taste was hoppy and clove with a smooth mouthfeel. Not impressed with this one and there are definitely better German Hefes out there IMO.

Bottle. Orangey Amber in color. Nice full head.  Really good. Banana and clove aromas. Nice and fruity. Good beer.
Full Bodied beer.
Very nice head.  Body is full and a very wheaty taste.  Smelled like most hefeweizens do.  Very good brew!

This bottled brew poured a very large sized head of foamy white colored bubbles that left behind a good lace.  The body was softly carbonated and light orange brown in color.  The aroma was malty musty and fruity like old bananas.  The mouth feel was smooth and flat with a wheat malt flavor.
An amber hefe. Huge head, weaty taste.  A nice refreshing beer with a nice bite.  I prefer other hefes more though.

Bottled. A hazy amber body, lively carbonation, terrific whiff of sharp yeast, nice & spicy taste, really dances on the tounge, very lively, real acidic smack in the lingering vanilla aftertaste. Enjoyable.
good for a wheat beer, but then, i really really dont like wheat beers.  however, this is probably the best one ive ever had.

Bottle.  A hazy, caramel-coloured hefeweizen that sits under a large, foamy, whitish head.  Spicy aroma with green banana and citrus notes.  Medium body with moderately brisk carbonation.  Flavour is fruity (banana and citrus) and  spicy (cloves), with a bread-like maltiness and a juicy acidity that carries through the finish.  Nice, unique, and a good match with food such as roast pork.
Murky brown with nice head. Wheaty, banana, high level of acidty, quite dry, light bodied - very refreshing.
Draft at High Q, Copenhagen. Surprisingly dark colour. Decent fruitiness with hints of black currants. Highly carbonated. Smooth and mild finish (but maybe it dies too quickly).
My favorite Hefeweizen (made after intense comparison studies in Munich).  A bit sweeter than most of this style.
Wheat n toilet to the aroma... Pretty standard wheat beer, with a very discount taste to it... Not to good in the finish
Was great in the middle of winter and can imagine it in summer with meat. Much better than any wheat beer I have tried. A light sweetness on the tongue, a banana smoothie.
Rich malty flavour although still light on the palete, slightly sweet with a bit of spicyness and banana. Good example of this style of beer.

Nice choice for my 100th.  Cloudy, dark brown with a nice head that recedes to a thin bubbly coating.  The aroma is amazing, citrus notes mixed with a mild spiciness - remarkably enticing.  Tastes good too - nice spice and mild tang with a refreshing aftertaste that is a bit thinner than expected.  Good solid brew.

nice white head that disappears quickly... after swirling and mixing the yeast up, it became a  brown diarrhea-looking beer with lots of yeast chunks floating around.      medium palate.  not as fruity as many hefeweizens ive had.  spicy, a hint of banana with ardent hops at the finish.   not bad...

Bottle:  Aroma was lemon, banana, and cloves.  Poured a dark brownish orange with a white head that lasted less than a minute.  No lacing.  Very lemony in taste.  A little sour.  Cloves in taste too as well as wheat.  Highly carbonated.  Short lived aftertaste that is mildly sour with a slight bitterness.
Bottled. Murky... big head. Wheaty/spicy aroma. Tastes of mild wheat, which is good as most wheat beers seem a little heavy on it for me. Good wheatbeer
A beautiful, dark amber colored beer with a long lasting creamy head. Though it is a refreshing weissbier, it is a bit too watery for my taste
Just wasn't impressed.  Head ran away quickly.  Dark orange, clove and yeast aroma.  No lacing.  Clove taste, highly carbonated.  I guess I would pass on this one.

Good, unremarkable from what I know about wheat beers, which isn't much.  The usual clove and faint sour tastes are present.  The taste gets stronger as the beer builds up, and I had to pour out the last inch or so of sediment.
Dark amber body with a white head.  Banana nose.  Some trace of smoke.  Bitter.  Nothing that I'd care to have again.
Pours bronze orange with lage head.  Banana, citrusy nose.  clearer than expected for a hefe-weizen.  Fruity, malty body.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2004 This one was a disappointment.  It started off well with a great white head, and a dark orange color with lots of yeast.  The aroma was very light with citrus.  For flavor there was not enough wheat taste.  Thick and heavy, which is how I like my hefeweizen, but this lacked the aroma and flavor to be really good.  If you want to pour a beer and look at it this would be a good choice.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Bottled.  Good aroma of lemon and wheat.  The beer pours a hazy muddy light brown.  The taste is typical hefeweize except its too thin.  The light fruity notes are there - lemon, banana etc.  but it is a bit uninspiring.Score 2.9Subsequent ratings scored 3.0, 3.3 and 3.0. Average becomes 3.0

In the 500 ml bottle. A big ol' rock of yeast in the bottle. I knew there would be trouble. Once properly mixed, the cloudy concoction was a murky pond water brown- sans euglena. Poor head retention, and that may be a result of the bottle's age. Tangy and fizzy with the distinctive german lager yeast impart to the buds. Interesting rod-shaped debris left in the bottom of the glass. Some of the yeast was just dang insoluble. I'll try to score a fresher one when I am in germany in the Fall.
A very representative hefeweizen, nice citrusy zest and banana, very fruity.  Pours dark and aromatic.  Great!
Fairly dark and clear for a hefe. A little less metallic taste than many Euro hefe's. Has some peach and a little bread in the taste. Some cookie dough and chocolate in the aroma.
Not a typical hefeweizen color: light brown. big white head. Smells fruity and yeasty. A little tart (lemony) taste.
Surprice was in the colour which is darker than one would expect. Aroma is fruity and flavor is spicy and fruity.

Light brown...the darkest non-dunkel weissbier around.  Because it's so dark you don't notice that it's not all that cloudy either.  Always a big frothy head.  Aroma of apple, banana, wheat, malts (including some light toffee).  Very full body for the style...it's heavy.  Sweet-tart components are complemented by a delicate spiciness and aforementioned apple and banana.  Tartness dominates a rather quick, wheaty finish.  Whether it is the classic hefeweizen is debatable, but it's certainly one of the most distinctive.

Smells like cloves and bananas. Looks great regarding color tall and dark and hazy... shame the head died so quick.

Flavor is a bit of a hit and run thing. You get a quick glimpse of the flavors present in the aroma then the strong carbonation cleans up and allows for the bitterness to prepare you for the next mouthful. As there is no real malt in the mouthfeel it makes the palate a little harsh for my preferences. This is, however, a brilliant "lazing around ont he balcony in the heat" beer.

Dark reddish brown color.  Thin head dissipates quickly. Fairly high carbonation carbonation. Aroma is sweet and crisp. Flavor is dry and acidic and starts getting to me about halfway though.  I've had better.

Light brown with a big but quickly diminishing head. Aromas of clove and yeast. Great taste, clove, yeastiness, good carbonation and a dry quick finish. Man but these would be great on a hot summer day.
This Dark traditional wheat beer pours a solid head and has a robust taste. Not as refreshing as others.

Bottle was well within BB date but I think it had suffered a bit from the trip, which is unusual because I find Schneider is usually the freshest tasting (and best) Weizen in these parts.
Poured a slightly more brown and less orange colour than I recall it having (which was the first thing that made me think it was a bit dodgy) and head retention was pretty ordinary.
Aroma was still great but slightly more dull. Cloves nicely integrated with fruity apricots and a touch of vanilla.
Nice, refreshing Weizen malt character but missing that really nice soft maltiness that Schneider usually has. At its best this would be a top ten beer for me.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2004 Bottle pours a hazy light brown with a fizzy  white head.   Well carbonated, virtually no lacing.   Head has now dissipated completely.  Visible sediment floats in the glass.     Aroma is of typical German wheats, banana, yeasty & leathery.   Initial taste is of allspice, cloves, and a yeasty/bready flavor.   Mouthfeel is fizzy.    Finish fades rather quickly.   Still enjoyable...
Has a clouded brownish color with little head and heavy carbonation.  Smell is spicy/fruity/yeasty.  Taste is spicey/fruity/yeasty and finishes pretty dry.  Overall a pretty good wheat.

Orangey brown cloudy pour with minimal floaters. Nice Dark Weisse. It is pretty. Fluffy head with berries and wheat in the nose. Citrus honey. Mild ripe stwed apricot, pears, peaches. Nice fruit sugars. It was good but it didn't blow me away.

Wowwweeee, I was very surprised by this brew!

NICE golden amber, with a soft fluffy head and lots and lots of carbonation.

A bit cidery in the nose... sweet and pleasant.

VERY smooth and easy to drink, a bit lacking of a defined flavor though. Finished with a bitter tinge.

Nice and crisp in the mouth.

A GREAT, easy session beer if I ever had one. Goes down smooth and fast... the import version of Yuengling Traditional Lager, in my opinion.
extra chunky, hazy dark straw body.  big, foamy loose head.  lots of esters, a hint of phenols, some spicyness.  a bit of dry wheat.  aggressively carbonated.

Bottle.
Poured a light amber or dark straw color with a large white head.  The head dissolved very quickly to a thin layer on the top of the beer, leaving no lace.

Nose was mildly malty but predominantly yeasty with a very slight hint of citrus or wheat wang to it.

The taste was off--there was the traditional wheat edge to the flavor, good mouthfeel and a fresh yeasty taste, with hints of citrus and light spice, but there was also a plastic/bandaid phenolic taste as well.  Also, in a bottle that has any age to it, you miss out on the fresh yeast you'd get if you had the beer fresh or on tap.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2007 Darker than I expected. The head was fine. Very fruity up-front, but this taste dissepates quickly, leaving a sour tang. An average weisse... but Ive had better.

01/11/07 - After almost 3 years later, I figured it was time for a re-rate. Light amber in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas of clove, lemon, vanilla, and a bit of MacIntosh apple. More vanilla and light citrus in the mouth, along with some prickly bitterness and a latent malt kick on the finish. Classy.
Amber color with a thin head. Flavor is citrus & spice. It leaves you with a slight bitter taste.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2004 Murky dark orange color with a quickly diminishing, thick and big-bubbled head. Quite sour, fruity and yeasty, slightly spicy aroma. Not very strong, and not nearly as much banana aroma as in most hefeweizens. Sourish and dry (for a weizen), bitter, malty and fruity flavor. Quite full-bodied and smooth, dry and sour, but stingingly carbonated palate. A very nice and refreshing weizen, with just the right sourness (for me) to be enjoyable.
Large white head and zesty lemon aroma. Dark and cloudy. A good citrus taste which lingers on the palate. Overall, very enjoyable.

It's darker than the norm, and pours a good fluffy head. Yeast and citrus in the nose. Full taste, rather dry, medium body. The finish seemed a bit weak and slightly tarty. A good and balanced weizen that still didn't quite live up to my (very high) expectations.

Bottled.
Hazy, dark golde, huge head.
A bitter, yeasty aroma.
Rather dry with yeast and spices in the flavour.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2009  Draught, Delirium Café, Göteborg. 
Hazy dark amber. Aroma is just perfect, with clove, vanilla and a clean maltiness. Rounded flavour of ginger, clove and vanilla. Light spicy that is. Dry finish. Incredibly juicy and tasty. Fantastic hefe.

Really liked the cloudy amber appearance with frothy head. Couldn't quite figure out the nose but definitely there was citrus in both aroma and flavour. Very enjoyable and worth keeping a couple of these on hand.

german version of hoegaarden white. smells of citrus, wheat and floral hoppiness. amber with good head that died quickly and thin body. tart, wheat, spice and citrus, dry and refreshing. good but i prefer the more rounded hoegaarden.
Very frothy head that filled the glass.  The amber color was slightly clouded. This was my forth gift beer of Christmas. I was not impressed.

Good stuff.  I love the amber color of this wheat beer.  Schneider is my favorite maker of Bavarian wheat beers.  This is not my favorite of theirs, but it is a classic full flavored example of the style.  I like the spicy/fruity yeastiness of this brewery.  Excellent beer.
Yellow-orange, much smaller white head than I expected, lots of yeast flakes. Aroma is banana and cloves. Thin mouthfeel.
Slightly fruity nose. Yeloow orange color, with a white head. Full palate, with a fruity citrus note balanced with banana. Overall well made and drinkable.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Smells floral and wheaty.  Appears a cloudy amber.  Gave a good head.  A great tasting florally, fruity, wheaty concoction.  Hint of apples, lemons and pears.  Full-flavored.  Yeasty.  Not too spicy.  Nice, long finish.
This is excellent.  Good wheat flavour.  Reminds me of hoegaarden white, but without some of the extra flavours, and better.

This is just excellent.  It's the darkest hefe I've sampled, and is the best of the style.  Big, frothy head, complex, full taste, coupled with the mouth puckering refreshment, which a hefe should deliver.  One of my all time favourites.
Smooth and easy to drink.  Large head.  Its decent overall, but I would pick its neighbor bottle the Aventinus everytime if I had the chance.  That is just too amazing for words.

My marks are based on the beer I enjoyed in my many years in Munich and the beer that I was able to buy in the States over the last year or so. HOWEVER. I recently bought a couple (fresh, I work in a store that sells them) after a few months of not having any, and was shocked to pour a clear amber - almost devoid of yeast - liquid with a quickly- dissipating head. I fear that Schneider has gone the way of all good Bavarian exports: brew a separate beer for "International" tastes. What a shame.

Dark golden and mostly clear with a thin, big-bubbled head. Rather carbonated and a little too crisp up front. Light, grainy malts with some sweetness. Light, but really nice, aromas of sugary bananas and clove. Finishes dry, delicate and clean. Only a very mild bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. Very light-tasting and light-feeling, but well made and nicely balanced.

Bought in the 500ml Euro-style brown bottle "The Original German Hefe-Weizen"
This beer has a darker appearance than most hefe I have had the great pleasure of tasteing''almost an amber colour beneath the haze..a great frothy ever so slightly off white head which dissapates to a small but persistent head.
The smell is very nice fresh wheat bread mingles with bubble gum and some tropical fruits...nicely done.
Ah great taste again i taste the wheat bread and the bananas,,the bubble gum is less present..nice malty finish..after a while a small amount of hoppiness appears but not much.
Feels creamy smooth in the mouth but does tingle the taste buds..excellent.
Very very drinkable I could get drunk on this beer very easily.
All in all an excellent Hefe-Weissen among the best I have no doubt.

From a 500mL bottle. Murky amber, highly carbonated with an enormous frothy white head, fully diminishing, but a good cm stays long. Aroma is rather intense, estery with obvious bananas and bread. Mouthfeel is creamy, rather low-bodied, but tongue cleaning. The taste could be more complex, wheaty bananas are overwhelming, but it remains very refreshing with its lightly dry tart character. I guess that besides its color, it fits precisely the style, but just doesn't have the depth of character to be in the ballpark of its big brother aventinus. This and most wheat beers rarely manage to touch my sensible cords. Still, this is highly drinkable.
One of the best Weisse I´ve ever tried. Darker than most of the others, a firm white head and not too sour, with a clear bitter ending
Wonderful. Darker orange-brown color. Pleasant aroma. Lively, clean finish. Great weissbier.
And I said I didn´t like Weissbier...Well you can always change your mind. This was a delicious drink for a hot summerday, both sweet and bitter and sour, very fresh.
pours a cloudy orangeish brown with a nice white head. nice yeasty aroma with banana notes. very drinkable with definite banana flavors and some clove spiciness as well.  a well done hefe.

Yeasty, estery, big banana aroma. Fluffy, thick, dense white head that recedes slowly coating the glass with lacing. Hazy, cloudy, coppery-brown colour. Nice spicy bite at the sides of the mouth banana and clove with some alcohol apparent in flavour. Flavour is a bit short but finish is long and very fruity. Low hops and medium body. Bottle.

One of my favorite wheat beers. Pours a deep orange with a snowy head. The fruit taste is there in the first sip, but its quite inoffensive and semi-sweet. Its a great citrus-tinged wheat taste, perhaps a bit floral (cloves?) Solid and refreshing.

POurs a nice nutty brown color with an aroma of the same and a huge creamy white head.  A very fruity taste ensues with bananas and clove joining the smorghasbord of taste.  A very satisfying hefe, right down to the finish.
Pours a hazy brown with generous white head. Yeast and malts in the aroma with some fruits. Similar flavors. Nice hef.
Color is hazy brownish with a nice white head. The taste is yeasty and fruity. A little to yeasty for my taste.
Brownish coloured, very cloudy. Wonderful aroma, malty yeasty and fruity. Flavour is not as complex as the aroma. Smooth finish. Good beer, but there are a few better Hefeweizens out there.

My first reaction: wow this is dark!  Classic banana aroma and huge head with this one.  The flavor is all the way German HW ... banana sweet, fruity and strong.  Most classically standard HW in the US ...
My favorite Hefeweizen.  It's got a lot of that great wheat beer flavor.  It's also very light and refreshing.

On-Tap: Color is a brownish gold cloud of opaqueness with a bit of orangish peach skin highlights coming through more so near the bottom of the glass with a solid small tight but puffy white head that stuck around awhile and didn't have any lacing during the consumption. Aroma is solid lemon citrus, dullish but bright, mixed with some orange, grapefruit and banana with a ton of clove filling up the nose favorably with each wonderful wiff. A solid spicy and citrusy smellin' hefe. Taste is alot more of the same notions carrying over from the smell with lots of citrusy dulled lemon and clove, smooth and full of energy with notes in other citrusy fruits of orange and grapefruit, and some banana and jolly rancher-like candy notes coming in towards the finish. The feel is a short but fun ride of creamy fullness at first then playing back and forth with a lively texture and carbonated spritzyness thats very easy, smooth and lightly crisp. Heavenly drinkable and a solid hefe.
Has a fine malty background, topped with the traditional coriander-aroma. Real good.

A very full head with extremely big bubbles gradually subsides to a thin white layer. The liquid is dark amber, with some brown accents. Smelling this beer tells you exactly what to expect  both the nose and flavours show huge spice and citrus notes. Some additional floral/honey flavours show through as well. In aromatherapy, citrus and certain spices are used for their rejuvenating effect. The same can be said for Schneider Weisse  one drink and you feel alive. With all the carbonation, however, more than ones going to make you feel bloated.
I thought this beer rocked. Big fluffy white head but didn't last. Slight banana, slight spiciness and moderately yeasty. Very good stuff.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2006 Nice wheat beer with small head. I would have like a bigger head that would have stayed longer... Light brown colour. Very refreshing beer for the summer without being too distinct or exceptionnal.

This beer was fairly clean for a German wheat beer.  There was a slight bit of acidity to it, a hint of banana flavor as well as a bit of clove.  Lightly fruity as well, which left one with a quite refreshing beer in hand.  A good drinking summer beer.
dirty orange. small white head. smells great. banana and spicy refreshing smooth

Tap. Dark golden orange and brown, murky, medium white head. Yeast/banana aroma. Medium to full body, banana, wheat, cloves, smooth and soft. Has a sweet finish. Provided total refreshment for a hot summer day. A very nice hefeweiss.

(bottle conditioned) Appropriate thick, creamy head but it fell into the beer too quickly for my liking.  Very pretty orange straw color with very little yeast despite approriate pour.  Orange citrusy fruit aroma with tart cider apple hint.  Medium-bodied with a thin feeling and lowish carbonation.  Not much of the wheaty body I expected.  Nice subtle carmelly apple finish but the taste quickly "petered out" leaving my wanting.  Acceptable, but not strongly recommended.

Thick, champagne head that diminished rapidly. Burnt straw color and hazy with lots of fizzy carbonation in the body. Aroma of apples, bananas, and bread. Flavor of shredded wheat, yeast, fruity esters, and hints of honey and caramel. Initially fizzy palate becomes flat as it sits. This is a full-flavored wheat beer (in contrast to the flavorless Sierra Nevada Wheat that I had yesterday). A good style for summer. However, this beer is over-priced in my region, and I prefer the Weihenstephaner and Franziskaner anyway.

Interesting murky orange/yellow/brown color with a gray/tan head. The aroma was full of fruit, banana, clove, and wheat. The flavor was nice and sweet...banana bread. Okay mouthfeel...at times it seemed watery. Nice Hefe-Weisse.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2007 Wow what a colour, mud or maybe sewer water? doesnt look that appealing but any how here goes! good head, no lacing but taste of malt, no tartness slight banana and also cloves good beer!

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2003 I was hesitent to try it as a friend didnt like it but I think its terrific. What a great german brew. No skunk at all just fine flavor. Long live wheat beer! A little more dark then most standard wheats but great if that is what you are in the mood for.

Ok, so I got an error when I typed "beer...it kicks ass!" saying my comment needed to be over 75 characters.  What's up with that?  Is this not a free country?  I know about beer...I've done my share of serious reviews on this web site.  I don't need to know what goes into a review of a beer.  If I want to write a 4 word review of a beer, I should have that rite.  Are we a country that allows freedom of speech, or one one that says ?you have to see this to proceed??
The dull gold color gives way to spicy and refreshing aroma and flavor. It's good but not impressive.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2009 2009-12-03. Hazy golden dark amber, good sized off white head. 3+ Mild aroma, light alcohol and yeast. Flavour is similar, yeast, some mild esters. Light bitterness in the finish, but sweet overall. Average plus palate is smooth, fairly carbonated. Pleasant, but milder than I remember it being. 7/4/7/3/14 Bottle from LCBO, TorontoRe-rate Oct 2004 - Pours hazy golden body with a massive white head that slowly diminishes. Lots of yeast in the aroma, with a touch of spicy clove. Flavour has a bit more of the cloves notes than I personally like, but is still very pleasant. Touch of sweet banana in the finish, touch of alcohol in the background is more apparent than ideal, and also more prominent than I remember from other samples. Full bodied, pleasant palate. 6/4/6/4/15
Sept 2000 - Clove taste is not as strong as in some, and is balanced well with the subtle malt. Not an everyday beer, but a must try. 7/4/6/4/9

Big head that faded slowly.  Cloudy, dark amber appearance.  Yeasty, wheaty nose with some spice.  Very mellow taste, dominated by the fruits and spices typical to this style.  Nicely carbonated, which adds to its thirst quenching attributes.  Peppery aftertaste with a clean, lingering finish.  Love it.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2006 Large, frothy-fizzy white head on a hazy brown body.  Aroma of toasted cereal, grass, dough, and smoke.  Flavor starts moderately sweet and tails off towards the finish.  Medium acidity throughout.  Light/medium body, watery, and fizzy.  Suprisingly dark brew, which hides an otherwise beautiful cloudiness.  Good wheat taste but less bananas than Ayingers Brau Weisse.  Carbonation makes this beer feel bigger than it is.  Flavor and aroma are restrained.  A very good thirst quenching beer and a very good hefe-weizen.
This beer comes from the oldest Weissbier brewery in the Munich area. It's a comparative dark Weissbier with a bit stronger flavor. Most bavarians love it and I also can recommend it to everybody.
probably the best weißbier out there. the funny thing is that it´s actually quite dark.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2007 2007-12-05, draught in Düsseldorf airport, served too cold, 7-3-6-2-13=31Muddy brown color. The aroma is nice, because its balanced and fruity (banana). The flavor is less interesting, supported by a quite weak body, with a mix of spices, caramel and some banana; it ends quite dry. Not bad, but not convincing.2003-06-28, bottle, 7-4-7-3-13=34Cloudy amber color. Pleasant aroma: spicy; but also maltier than other Weizenbier. Good body, quite malty but also with a sharp banana touch; pretty dry. The final is probably too sweet, and lacking of character.

The aroma is very lightly sweet and wheaty with notes of sourness. The color is an unclear mixture of brown and yellow and it has a fine head. The flavor is a very refreshing wheat flavor, very soft, and very complex for a wheat beer. One of my favorite wheat beers.
Good hefe-weizen. cloudy and fruity. this beer needs no additives like a lemon. sweet. medium body, good feel.
on tap - rich amber, cloudy. smooth, lots of wheat character. some tropical fruit in the nose and mouth, mildy sweet.
Fairly deep color for a wheat. Frothy off-white head. Strong banana prescence. Nice mouthfeel, medium to full body. Very drinkable and enjoyable.

Bottled, at the Wenlock Arms, Its at this point things start to go slightly awry. Marcus, the mad beer lovin German from The Masque Haunt walks in. Its only his 2nd time here. He insists that I have a Weiss beer with him. I try to resist, sighting my plan and the fact you can drink from a bottle any old day, but seeing the passion in this guys heart for Weiss beer had to comply. Served in its own class Marcus turned the serving of the beer into a show. Swirling the last tenth of a beer around in the bottle and acrobatically serving it like a cocktail.  Murky brown with a big fluffy head. It was a bit like drinking lemon-scented-gravel. Complex and complete, for the weiss beer lovers this must be heaven but I was looking forward to the IPA. 4 of 7.

Bottle:  (maybe old?) Deep golden color.  Small white head with next to no retention.  Little fruity nose.  Nice flavor - fairly pronounced banana.  Good beer, but based on my purchased single I prefer the Franziskaner.
On draft. Very complex wheat. Not pale and retiring at all. Amber alish in color. Slight taste of the residue from a bubblegum wrapper (not that that makes sense). A great beer.

Light brown color. Large head. Aroma is malty, sweet and fruity. A medium to full bodied hefe. Malts are wheaty, slightly roasted and sweet. Hops are somewhat spicy. Touch of banana and clove as well as spices. A very nice beer. Much darker than I was expecting, Very fine carbonation, nearly champagne like. Very drinkable. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Nice Greman wheat beer.  Brew pours up light brown with significant head.  Head almost completly dissipates and there is little or no lacing.  Very nice malty, yeasty, clove aroma.  There is a ton of floaters in this beer, almost to the point I was ready to break out a strainer.  Nice flavor, sweet apples.  Does have a dry, champagne type of finish.  Quite good.

Hazy almost amber color with huge head and some lacing, bigger body than most weizens. Nice aroma of banana, sour apple, bread dough, and a hint of clove. Wonderful tartness and a fizzy mouthfeel, very refreshing, very underrated hefe, my second favorite just a nudge under Ayinger.
Hazy copper, big light head, banana aroma with citrus fruits and cloves.  Wheat acidity, sugar-free banana bread, a hint of bubblegum, just a bit tart, really refreshing.
Head drops off quickly, aroma of biscuits and grass.  Wonderful light, refreshing with a nice bite.  Not as fruity as I would like, but a nice beer.

Deep reddish-brown pour with a short, white head.  Aroma is bready and malty with a tart nose at the end.  The taste is quite light but hoppy... perhaps a bit of rye here?  The finish is full... that surprises me after the initial light taste.  Great tangy bite at the back of the mouth.  Overall, I like Wheats a little fuller than this, but the long finish and whiskey-like color make it interesting.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2004 ReRate: What the hell was wrong with me? I had this Beer rated as a 3.5, I must have been a mongoloid?  Anyway, this is a Great Beer, The best Heff I have had! Large notes of bananas, clove, and citrus oils: particularly tangerine. The palate is immensely creamy and inviting. Terrific Stuff!   
I have been drinking all of these German wheat beers lately and all of the flavors and aromas are beginning to run together in my mind. I have a fantastic authentic German deli 100 feet from my office. The owner drinks beer and runs the register all day as his wife prepares the food. The Schneider Weisse Original is a completely genuine German wheat beer. This beer has an amber-golden color, gigantic foamy head, an aroma of wheat and malt, and smooth finish. You aren’t living until you have the Original.

Crazy brown colour for a wheat beer. Soft white head which dies down very quickly. Tons of floaties, but that could be a result of where I bought it from. Classic wheat smell reminiscent of fruit and yeast. A very full bodied taste with a large flavour with not too much 'wheatie' characteristics. A wierd beer which is pretty drinkable, but definately not my favourite style. A bitter aftertaste but not too pungent or tasty. Worth trying, but don't be too upset when its not what you are expecting.

Big head which does not last long.  Great big huge carbonation throughout.  Looked like someone turned on the bubble machine and left it on.  Hazy amber color.  Aroma of yeast and wheat.  Flavor is pretty smooth with hints of unripened bananas mixed in with the traditional wheat.  Finish is very, very dry.  Almost to the point where your tongue feels sticky.  A decent wheat beer that hits all of the landmarks for a traditional wheat beer.
Cloudy amber beer with generous head.  Very astringent aroma with hints of yeast.  flavor mild and fruity but somewhat green grass tasting.  Not a pleasant experience.  Guess It's not my style.

Cloudy golden wheat beer with huge white head that fades to small lacing.  I must pour faster than uglyradio, and I think I am supposed to pour for a big head on a wheat beer!  Taste of cloves, banana, and yeast, with a long sour bitter finish.  Good warm weather beer.  In a side by side comparison with the Weihenstephaner Hefe the long bitter finish and the mouth filling clovey spiciness of the Schneider comes through as a bigger, more balanced, crisper beer.

It has a nice, clear (that is, until I dumped the yeast in) amber color with a small, off-white head that lingers. The aroma is estery with hints of yeast and banana. The flavor is mildly yeasty and fruity, with some earth notes and a bit of banana flavored bubblegum. A good German Hefe-Weizen.

Poured an amber hue with a medium sized rocky head. A flowery aroma with the typical banana notes and some oak character. A smooth and carbonated palate which is a litttle thinner than what I had anticipated. A fruity flavor with a citrus bitterness, oak and a earthiness. Some brets emerged as it warmed. Overall good German Wheat.
What can you say.... Another GREAT beer, from an awesome brewer.  It is hard to beat a German Wheat beer.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2003 I've had the opportunity over the past 10 plus years, through both traveling to Germany and living in a community that has many German residents, to sample some 25 different German wheat beers.
