And I have to say that this one is my absolute favorite. Not to light, not too dark and possessing a delicious wheat and yeast flavor with very little bitterness. It's one I keep going back too again and again. This is what a wheat beer should taste like. I guess that's why it's been around for a thousand years.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Has a nice fruity taste.  The head stayed very nicely throughout the drink. Was extremely smooth to drink
Bottled. Orange-brown and very cludy with brief head. Estery banana aroma. Fruity, but with clean, hard mouthfeel. Smooth finish with balanced esters and some black currant.

Bottle.  A very dark golden amber color with lots of rising bubbles and a white foamy head.  Dusty, citrus, coriander, banana, vanilla, and spices in the nose.  The dark color is from the nice malt presence which complements the hefe flavors (zesty fruits, spices, banana).  A quality beer in this style where most brewers fail.

Smellls like a big old bottle of peanut butter-and-banana sandwich. Seriously, the aroma was dry and peanutty, with some little banana wisps. Distinguished Old Germany label. Nice dry nutty flavor, this beer would be great with a pastrami or corned beef on rye. Pithy palate for a weiss, banana and pepper moderate finish.  A sturdy and enjoyable beer.
A very drinkable beer .A touch of fruit and mild yeast and carbonation .Good aftertaste ,will drink again .
user_location: Petit De Grat, Nova Scotia, CANADA

text: Huge head - needs to be poured very slowly; great flavor with a pleasant long-lasting finish
Has all the things that this style is known for, but done just a little better. Will definetly try again in the summer months.

Couldy, dark orange colour w/ substantial foaming head. Nose is fruity & yeasty w/ clove & some vanilla. Fluffy, creamy, light feel. Lots of carbonation. Flavour is soft and slightly grainy. Lightly tart and fruity w/ some cloves & nuttiness. Lovely, refreshing beer.
Nice clear honey colored beer with a big creamy off white head that dissipates quickly.  Very slight bananna aroma, mainly spices in aroma.  Taste is also mainly spicey.  A nice wheat.

Slightly hazy copper colour with a frothy white head.  Head did not last very long though. Nose is malty with hints of banana.  Taste is semi-sweet with an acidic and dry finish.  I prefer the Hoe, but this is still a very nice well balanced beer.
Poursa medium head. A darker colour than I expected for a weisse. Somewhat hazy. Very nice spicy aroma. Medium body with moderate carbonation. A delicious weisse.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Cloudy amber with a short head. Bright fresh banana and faint tropical fruit eater in the aroma with phenolics that come across as rubber and pepper. Its acidic, effervescent and lively, but unpleasantly sour, stark, and bitter.  Theres a faint acetone taint, something I find in a lot of Schneider bottle on this visit.  Its not as awful as some of the others we tried but its completely characterless and basic.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2003 A bit hazy, dark golden-amber hue.  Big white head.  Bananas in the nose.  Very pleasant, citric, bananas, cloves, coriander.  Very drinkable, medium bodied, very quenching.  One of my personal favorite wheats.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2003

The color of this hefe was a bit darker than most others, it was more on the copper side and not all that cloudy or hazy, very huge bubbly white head, had a very tangy nose with lots of bananas & coriander, those same traits were in the flavors as well, rich & tangy aftertaste, very decent wheat beer
Dark for a hefeweizen.  Quickly dissapaiting head.  Apple and clove.  Nice lingering aftertaste.  Aroma isn't that strong.  Malty with champagne-like carbonation.
For a person that enjoys a wheat beer, this one screams ENJOY ME!  Excellent flavor with a slight hint of citrus and a beautiful cloudy appearance.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2003 (Bottle) First comment: Great colour - I love it. Pours a foamy and dissipating almonde head. The body is a beautiful and cloudy auburn body; like a lovely tanned body! Little scent. Real taste of sweet white wine with slight bananas and spice. Delicious... recommended for breakfast, lunch and supper!
Faint wheat aroma. Great, off-white head with excellent lace. Rootbeer float color. Very good flavor; smooth, not overbearingly wheaty. Very pleasant.

I want to say that it looks good but it reminds me of dirty ponds, it is a murky brown and the white head diminishes immediately.  the aroma is very phenolic as is the flavor.  lots of tangy action going on in this one, but nothing of the tang like belians.  finishes incredibly clean, this is an easy drinking beer.

On tap at Eli Cannons in Middletown, CT.  Opaque spanish brown color, with a thich white head.  Awesome appearance, very strange color!  Heavier body than I was expecting, with a strong flavor.  Hints of banana, clove, and maybe a little garlic?  I was eating cheesefries with this, and maybe that had something to do with it.  Head dissipates to nothing, so it looks like a strange treehugger wheatgrass healthfood tonic or something.  :)
Its been a while but I still remember this one as one of the best Weizenbeers in germany. nice wheaty taste. Try!
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2005 A pretty mainstream german wheat beer. Lightly hopped with a wheaty finish. Nice flavor of banana/clove and a medium body. Nice wheat beer.
Bottled 500ml. Fairly decent beer, monster head, darker color than i expected, spicey/fruity nose, some banana, pretty good overall.
Bottled(500ml). -not so specially good German wheat, fruty, quick dissappearing head

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2004 big fluffy white head, pours a dark hazy copper colour. aroma of sweet yeast, hints of banana, sour apples, cloves.  nice mouthfeel. spicy, well balanced. an excellent German wheat.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2007 Classic. all the qualities you might ever hope to find in a true Bavarian weiss. Visit Kelheim and the brauhaus for a real treat.
definatley one of the best wheat beers around
Full of body. very wheaty. tickles the tounge just right. A great beer with a meal or on its own

This is a full bodied wheat beer with a nice balance of hops, malt and yeast.  Make sure to swirl up enough yeast for the pour.  Very mild bitterness, but a pleasant clove spice in the finish.  Doesnt quite match up to the mouthfeel of the Weihenstephaner Hefe-Weissbier, but puts most American wheats to shame.

Wheat beer is my favorite style of beer. Ive tried many different types of wheat beer from countries around the world. This one has to be my #1 (very close) over all the rest. The taste and carbination of this is exactly what I look for in the best wheat beer. Ayinger brau weisse or Maisels weisse are others that is very similar to this one which I enjoy a lot but not quite as much as schneider weisse. This one is harder for me to find and costs more so I usually buy hacker pschorr,paulaner,ludwig which I love but not like schneider or the others I mentioned. This is just my opinion on how I love to taste wheat beer like this does. This beers evil twin is also the best dark wheat beer Ive had also.
really stands out from the crowd of hefeweizens. rich yet soft
<font color=#00ff99>This is a fine beer. I dunno how those Krauts do it, but there is something sublime about this. I didnt gets much banana, more custard tart or something.</font>

Orange color with fluffy white head and a spicey nose.  Stronger malts than other German weisse beers, but still has that same clove/banana flavors.  Maybe a little thin in body, and the flavors seem to weaken as it warms.  Decent weisse, but Id pick the Hacker-Pschorr or Paulaner over this.

Aroma has a bit of plum and maybe a little alcohol toward the end.  Flavor is what you would expect in a very good German wheat like Hacker-Pschorr or Franziskaner, but I find the malts here a bit darker and that some substantial effervescence plays a significant role in framing the malt.  Excellent.
Bread-like nose, cloves, big. Dirty brown, cloudy color. Big fizzy head but with no retention. Wheat, banana tastes, but a bad aftertaste. OK balance. Pretty good HW.

RE-RATE: Cloudy light brown.  Malty, rich wheatiness, orange peel.  Nice clean finish, a good beer to start the night on.  ORIGINAL RATING 6/21/2002 6-4-7-4-13 Slightly wheaty, grainy.  Very smooth, decent taste, drinkable.
Smoky bacon banana - maple syrup, spice, orange. Brown/orange cloudy appearance, unfiltered, real.

Yeah, it is becoming clear for me..I love German Wheat - I realise it. This one is great. Banana, yeast and vanilla aroma. Light dirty brown color with hints of orange. I tasted chocolate, yeast and banana and it also had a little bitter finish. Fullmouth but a bit fin.

Lovely colour, yeasty/spicey aroma, starts slightly sour.  A little too much carbonation.  Banana/clove aroma through the middle.  Hops on the finish, leaving a pleasant sour/bitter impression.  I always get a hint of smoke in here, am I wrong?

Beautiful flavour.  Lovely colour.  The palate was perhaps a bit bland.  Bubbly and smooth.  A good beer but lacking something too move it up a notch.  The head did not match the picture so it might have been a bit old.

Very strong esthers in the nose, more banana than bubblegum.  Has a nice, pale, long-lasting head over the surprisingly dark body.  The flavor is great, with even more banana and bubblegum flavor than the aroma promised.  The palate is crisp, as befits the style.  Overall, this is probably the best Hefe Ive had.

Very faint hazy deep amber with smallish short lasting light beige head. Faint fruity nectar and caramel aroma. Medium thin low carbonated watery body. Soft mild bitter flavoured palate with some added faint fruity honey sweet flavours. Mild  somewhat tasteless finish. A bit disappointing.
This is my favorite Hefe-Weizen.  Amber in color, giant white head.  Flavor is so smooth and the aftertaste is wonderful.  Buy this beer and learn to enjoy one of the best beers Germany has to offer.

The beer that revived the style.  This one is a cleaner tasting Weizen.  Beautiful amber colored with thick white foamy head, turbid but not overly so, Schneider Weiss has a cleaner flavour profile than most Weizen - for example Hacker - and the aroma and flavours are predominated by a more clove-like, and maybe apple-like character as opposed to bananas. It has a hearty body, is lightly hopped and a clean finish for a weizen.

This beer has a long and complex history. The Schneider family holding the faith for weizenbier during a time when nearly every other brewery was switching over to lager. A true classic. Top fermented like an ale, but fresh tasting like a lager, this is an ideal summer drink - refreshing, but also interestingly complex. The flavours are mildly spicy with just a hint of a medicinal quality - there are cloves and corriander present, and then some light fruits which range from mildly sharp such as apple,  to smoothly sweet such as banana.

Great flowery aroma, complex. Great head, small bubbles. Brown orangey look, cloudy.
Good flavours but not as complex as aroma is promising .A bit watery, maybe I was expecting so much. Still great drink. Recommended.

Darker than most weissbiers.  Huge pillowy off-white head looks very appetizing.  Notes of citrus, banana and cloves make this one very enjoyable to smell. Taste is not quite as good as its appearance and aroma would suggest.  Its rather weak and a bit on thin side.  But still overall pretty decent weissbier.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2003 Huge bubblegum aroma.  Greatwheaty flavor with substantial mouthfeel.  Good clovey esteryness.  Fabulous hefe.
wheat beer tasting 02:  a classic wheat.  darker than most.  malty banana aroma, great balance of acidity and spiciness.
Like a slightly weaker version of Paulaner Hefeweizen.  Still quite good but Im preferential to Paulaners wheat.

After this beer, I think it is accurate to say you can count on Schneider for most all your wheat beer needs. Maroon in color and  having a lovely profusion of malt-tinged wheat aroma in the flavor, this was another great product from this brewery. The strong german wheat concentration and small appearance of grain and malt make this a perfect autumn brew--though great for any season.

This is not a bad wheat. Reminded me a little bit of root beer at the time... light, citrussy, buttery maltiness and slight hoppiness. great wheat... after having a sam adams summer ale, this wheat was a breath of fresh air
What can I say, for Germany this beer must be one of the best. ;)

Dark brown, bock-like appearance with a huge stable head.  I found the nose kinda weak, with caramel-banana the most prominent feature.  Maybe a touch of smoke/roasted grain also?  Seems odd for a weiss.  Flavor:  ahh, much more like it.  Hugely malty, but in a medium-light weiss kind of way, with a buttery/lemony undertone and a long smooth finish.  Super-drinkable on a hot day (hot fudgeing month I should say, I moved to VT for this?).  Not the best Ive had, Paulaner still rules, but this is excellent and could grow on me.
Smooth and light tasting with hints of cloves. Very enjoyable, would go down awesomely on a hot summer day.
Not as good as some, but quite enjoyable, perfect with grilled brats on a summer eve in the back yard
Murky brown. Honey maltiness and clove aroma. Medium body and well balanced sweetnes vs spicyness. One of the best classical weissbier.
Not really what I hoped for. For the price I was expecting something superior to Schöfferhofer or Franziskaner. It is in fact in my opinion a lesser weizen in taste.

A little rough around the edges. Lots of wheat in aroma, not much yeast. Same with the flavor. Darker appearance than most weisse Im used to. A different sort of weisse, with more emphasis on the grains and less on the fruity yeast, but there is quite a bit of citrus in there.
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 A celestial gift of juicy bananas and orange-scented herbsWonderfully cushiony wheat with lemony acidity and drynessCovered with soft cloves
Decent second tier brew. A notch below the best. Still, great banana aroma, and dark cloudy appearance make it appealing. Taste is good, if a bit tame. Could use more intensity.
Another enjoyable weizen. Dark colour and stronger alchol content gives it a uniqueness within this beer type. Creamy and fruity character with a nice finish.
Had one of these followed by a Paulaner Hefe, and this one was certainly lacking.  Quite bland and watery, and the only thing you taste is sweetness.
Very plain hefe, not a whole lot of flavor...give me a Paulaner
Looks like mud, a little too sweet for my taste but very intersting and flavorful palate reminiscent of champagne.
A very smooth beer, with a nice head, and a beautiful muddy brown color.  Very subtle spices with a very nice finish.

Nice head, almost muddy-brown in colour. Much more dry and citrisy than other hefe-weizens and wheat beers in general that i have sampled. Slight banana aroma but little to nothing in the way of banana flavour (this is something i look for in a german wheat). Very crisp aftertaste (which again is un-common in weizens to my experience). All in all a good beer which is distinctively a German Wheat but yet very unique as well.
Mine wasnt exactly clear in the glass; a bit of haze.  Nice dark color, lots of carbonation.  I was really hit by the spiciness and clove, along with the wheat essence.  Overall nice.
richer in malt flavor than the usual german wheat
Nice wheat no overpowering flavor mildly complex with th clove/spice nature a pleasure to drink
Nice clean tasing wheat,great head, bannana aroma.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2010 Original: July 2002: Slightly more sweet and less dry than the Edel-Weisse earlier; other than that my German Wheat-challenged palate cant tell much of a diff. Good, good, good; again, hefty, dark body, cloudy, mysterious, and an overall yummy beer.

Wow, my original impressions are not that far off!  Darker than many hefes, a very solid body (too solid, in fact, could use a little bit more liveliness). Excellent wheatiness, tangy, clove. Smell is unusually natural, dirty, grainy. Very good, but not up to Andechs standard!
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Darker than Im used to. Others have mentioned it, so pours just like the picture. Not much body but has  decent flavor. Good for a 92 degree california summer day.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2003 On tap: Probably the best german wheat beer I've tasted yet. Very fine aroma and flavor.
Fizzy, twangy, and a head to die for. Seemed darker than a typical wheat. In the end a very enjoyable brew. Oh, did i mention the head is just like the picture?
Strong bananaaroma. Banana, yeast and grape sugar in the taste. Hint of coffee. Just a bit tart. A bit too thin and sharp.

If this beer has a downfall it is definately the slightly watery palate. Otherwise, this beer is  a winner in all aspects from its voluminous marshmallow foam, to the crisp initial bite on the tongue, through the mellow banana middle, back to crisp and clean for the finish. Leaving you with a distincive beer moustache. Very satisfying.

This beer rocks.
Its darker than most wheat beers, but I like that. Its better than most german wheats.
The color might be a bit on the darker side but otherwise this is a typical German Wheat.
This is surprisingly dark.  A moderate wheat flavor and a large head much like the photo.  Nice, enjoyable brew thats above average.
This one wasn’t for me, reminded me of pep-duh-biz-mal and ass.
user_location: Phila (Home of Geno's Steaks), Pennsylvania, USA

text: perhaps i should rate this one extra high to help offset the apparent weenie factor of those plebian throngs in our midst that wouldnt know a splendid wheat if it bit them on the arse. right from the bottle this beer is a halle berry of bodacious libations, like a ripened peach with a malibu tan. a huge billowy cushion of foam--if the foam was an aspen snowfall,  skiers would be ecstatic. gets cloudier as we gradually decant.  a spiced apple aroma, toffee and a dash of almond. cider character persists in the flavor, its robust with moderate sweetness and just ample hops. grand and entertaining--id say refreshing but it leaves you wanting another. i believe its my favorite hefe (so far) because the citrus-clove yeast effect typical of the genre is more apple-like and mello.

Beautiful hazy bronze color with a mammoth white head filling half the glass and lasting until the last sip.  Very pleasant nose with cloves, coriander, lemon-flavored candy and yeast.  A bit on the sweet side with a touch of malt and yeast in the background.  Finish is dry and slighty astringent.  Biggest problem is its watery and thin mouthfeel.  A good hefe, but gimme a Maisels instead.

Frosty bronze, numerous floaties.   Nice aroma, equal parts clove, vanilla, banana.  Just a touch of yeast.  Light malt, tart and sweet.  Exceptionally watery  texture, which is a big detractor.  Will have to resample.
copper/amber color  - not usual.  TART and FRUITY.  not a favorite wheat, and i dont like em much to start with.
My first wheat, I like it.  Not too sweet not too bitter, good nose.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2003 Darker than most German Wheats, looks closer to a dunkel than a standard heffe. Banana and malt in the aroma. Slightly sweet but nicely malty and nice saltiness. Pretty nice, but nothing to write home about, not the best German Weisse.

Wonderful example of a hefeweiss -- sweet banana/wheat aroma.  Both of these are present in the taste, as is a bit of cloves.  A little meatier than most hefes, not to mention a little darker.  Incidentally, if you ever get a chance to get to Kelheim to sample the beer firsthand, do so.  Not just a good pub to quaff, also a picturesque part of the country.
I love this beer.  Everything that a wheat beer should be.  Large head, wonderful vigorous bubbles.  Lots of clove, yeast, some fruity notes.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2007 Excellent beer. One of my favourites.Lovely firm , lasting , lacey head. beautiful mouthfull. flavour explodes in mouth ....excellent with food. So complex.definite cloves/fruitiness/spicy..every mouthfull brings a new experience.

Clear copper in color,frothy white head, and decent lace. Nose is malt, front is lightly sweet, the top is light, the finish is acidic, dry, nicely hopped, clean and quite fresh. A very drinkable beer,for a hot desert afternoon.
Not the best wheat beer out there.
I tried the strong version of this with about 8% alcohol. The colour is darker than other wheat beers, but the taste is almost the same. I dont like it very much.

Darky beer than I expected, but the color and head are nice.  Noteworthy is the subtle sweet creaminess with the banana, clove taste from the yeast in the background.  It could use a bit more wheat flavor.
I dont know if I got an infected bottle or not, bu8t mine tasted slightly cidery.  Dark orange colour.  Fairly carbonated on the palate.  Fruity flavour.  Not one of my favourite weisses.

Re rate: I have had this a few more times and the more I drink this beer, the more I like it! Dark and cloudy? Yes, whats wrong with that? Hell, thats one of the reasons I like it! Somewhat reminds me of my Grandfathers tin of pipe tobacco. Rich, I lived in Japan for over 16 years and Ive been to my share of fish markets. This in no way smells like a fish market. A middle eastern bazaar perhaps with the spices and the hookah smoke. A very good beer, this and Aventinus have become two of my favorite.
Very dark and murky looking wheat beer with a slight fish market scent.  I hope to try better beers of this style in the future.

A darker tahn typical hefeweizen and not as cloudy, thick white foam. Nose shows sweetness with some caramel, banana, and spice. Fuller color results in fuller flavor. Some light caramel and toastiness mellows down and gets pretty complex with clove, banana and a little spice. Lingers soft and sweet in the finish. Something of a surprise although that may be my lack of experience, full flavored and refreshing.

Appearance - Nice creamy head that hangs around for a long while. Nice orangy color, darker than a lot of the other wheat beers Ive had. The mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy. I was actually impressed by it. The flavor has lemon notes even without a lemon squeezed in. This is actually the first beer where Ive actually tasted bubble gum, but I did. Until last night I thought everyone was making up the bubble gum flavor in beer. It was also fairly sweet. It may be a little too sweet and bubblegummy, but it was still good.
A reasonable wheat beer, bit of a strange aftertaste though...reminds me of something, though not quite sure what
Heavy scent of wheat. Cloudy bronze colour. Wheat, malt and spices. Tingles the tongue, almost thick enough to chew, like soft bread. A true marriage of complexity.
Huge fluffy head, medium amber, cloudy. Lacks the creamy banana finish of the Paulaner, but quite good.
The thing a surprised me the most was the murky orange colour.  Looked almost like an iced tea.  Had a nice creamy head that lasted right until the end.  I will buy this beer again.
One of the best German wheat beers Ive had, which is a style I tend to stay away from.

Orange brew with tones of banana and solvent (thinner-like) in the nose. Banana and yeast and some alcohol in the flavor.
Not a top-weissen.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2005 Great big foamy head and amber brown color. Slightly hazy.  Citrus & Christmas aroma. MIce smooth mouthfeel with a clean crisp finish .

Spicy, hint of bubble gum, clove, vanilla, good esters but not the usual banana (isoamyl acetate). Light amber in color.  Thin bodied with some tartness & a dry finish.  A nice beer, I have always liked the diversity of hefe-weizens.
frothiest head ive seen on a beer....darker than most hefes ive tried. wonderful banana/bubblegum aroma and the same in the flavor. one of the best hefes ive had
Typical German Wheat beer. They all taste the same. A good beer though

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2007 Head is initially huge, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy medium amber, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (cookie, caramel, toasted bread), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana, orange, and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Rather inconsistent in the States, it seems...sometimes theres very little head upon pouring, and the aroma is often light and unflattering, and theres frequently hard little chunks at the bottom (like grains of dirt, rather than yeast). Ive just tried it at the brewpub in Munich, and its about a 3.6 there as well.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2004 A true ur-weisse!  Light aroma with a the flavor of cloves balanced with great nutty malt.  Not for the novices.
One of my favourite German wheat beers. It is full of flavour and a great creamy body and texture. The quality comes from I think in making it in the old trditional method. This beer is a treat.
I was just expecting a little more than what it had. But still good.

Instant flavour and then bugger all. Yes some Yeast. Not much. But some
Anyone who compares this to a Dunkel is a novice. Ignore them.
If you must have a clear weisse, this is quite good. However, for the same price, Ill go with Aventius everytime.
Very yeasty although that is not a bad thing.  Very good nose.  Nice finish.

Im not a fan of American weissbiers, so this was a bit of a hard sell. Glad I tried it, though -- this traditional German wheat is exceptional. A bit darker than other german wheats, with a smooth, moderately full flavor and a clean aftertaste. Its ease of drinking makes it an excellent beer for earlier in the day or outside in the sun.
Good German Wheat. Much darker than other wheats Ive tried. A little more yeasty than others as well.
Slightly darker than a normal weissbier but it doesnt mask the banana aroma or spicy taste. Nearly as good as the Weihenstephan
slightly bitter-sour flavor.  This is not one of my favorite weiss beers.
UPDATED: MAY 4, 2003 Cloudy orange brown colour. Lots of white fizzy head. Fruit and pepper aroma. Slight lemon flavour, but mostly pepper and spice. Light, but satisfying and refreshing.
wheaty, kind of bitteness, I prefer other German Wheat beers
An example for all wheatbeer brewers.

My very favorate beer.  I still remember drinking Schneider Weisse when stationed in Germany in the mid 1980s.  It has a very smooth taste and nicely filling.  The lower alcohol content made it much easier to enjoy the taste without the side effects

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2004 every time I have this I like it more. there aren't any other weizens even close to the character of this. It smells beautifully perfumey, tastes rich and salty and then turns tart and juicy in the finish. great stuff. rer8: i dunno, the head fizzles, the colour is a sort of muddy brown, the taste has plenty of bubblegum and clove but no banana, and too much dark malt, and the mouthfeel is fizzy, hard and too salty. lots of flavour but it's just not that drinkable with the combination of fizziness and maltiness. like the edelweisse better.

Excellent weisse. Beautiful color and full bodied. I enjoyed this beer very much.
I had to re-rate this beer and give it slightly higher marks after comparing it to some other wheats.

Cloudy, dark straw. Aroma had  light clove,yeast and wheat characteristics with other spices. Medium body, nice creamy mouthfeel,smooth wheat flavor with some light citrus twangs. A good wheat. Better then the edel-weiss.

Sweet and creamy. Great weizen.
Considered the original. Dark because the recipe was never changed to appeal to the new lighter colored hefes in the early 1900s.

darker than most weiss beers - amber copper colour. sustained foamy head.   great tasting - lots of natural cirus zest (no lemons neeeded here).  wAlso has a nice clovlike flavor.
a rich and smooth weiss.
Unique wheat beer, for me anyway. Good cream with long finish and balanced fruit. Nice body and beautiful color.
A little watery but still worth trying. Liked the Edel better. Needs a shot of lemon in there somewhere.
It has a beautiful transparent amber colour with a nice creamy head. Flowers and forest in the aroma. Full-bodied, liquorice. The aftertaste is quite long with a touch of bitterness.
Excellent classic. My second favorite German wheat beer next to Schneider Aventinus.
A proper white one, very tastfull.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 This is a good beer. I love german made hefe weizen and this is one of this best. Clean, crisp and overall great tasting without showing and signs of weakness. I reall enjoyed this one. I really love how these come in the pint size. Not wheaty enough though, and it would be nice to have a few more fruity flavors hint through.

Very dark beer, for a wheat. But it smells and tastes like a good wheat. Though its not as good as a Hoegaarden for exammple. I still think the Belgian wheats are better than the Germans, but they are not far behind. I guess this beer is also known as Schneider Edel-Weisse, which is also present in the database.
Darker than most but does not taste chocolatey or dark at all. Nice clove flavors with some vanilla thrown in as well. Very good malt backbone and a subtle citric tartness as well. Excellent classic.

At first glance I was confused by how dark it was, I believe the exchange was something like: Its not a dunkel is it? I didnt think so!? Very dark, easily pours to a fine to a fine foamy head. Flowery/perfumy scent. Slight maltyness, and a bit spicy, gives it a musty, earthy taste and smell. Not bad, but not great.

Im not quite sure this doesnt qualify as a dunkel.  Deep, dark, translucent brown, thin white head, with a spicy, flowery aroma.  Banana and walnut are the dominant flavors.  Not quite smooth at first, this beer smoothed as time passed.  Full bodied with a touch of bitterness, this is an average weissbier.

Surprisingly dark for a wheat beer, and fairly bland overall. I liked it better than the Paulaner version of this style, mostly because the malt seemed to be balanced out better and because it seemed smoother, but I could use some stronger hops and more flavor.
Decent hefeweiss bordering on light dunkel if you ask me,  oxymoron though that might be.
Far from my favorite Weissbier. As has been mentioned, its really carbonated--the head was out of control. Further, it had a thin consistency, and was a bit on the bitter side.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2003 Brown hazy appearance.  Nose is citrusy with notes of other fruit.  Also some banana was present.  The body is oily with a slight spritzyness.  Notes of citrus and banana abound, but nothing really making this beer a standout.
Just not that impressed.  It got so built up to me as being phenomenal and didnt quite deliver.
Darker then others of the style.  malty aroma with a malty banana taste.  highly carbonated
transparent amber colour, few head, wheat and banana aroma, slight starting acidity, full-bodied, well-balanced
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2003 Tasty German hefe-weizen.  All your favorite things about hefes are in this beer.  However, if you like this one, try the Edel-Weisse!

An awesome hefe-weizen.  The original beer of the genre, and if not the best, then right up there.  Dark for the style, and extremely flavorful; the banana-clove is on full display with this puppy.  A classic beer.
Cloudy, amber in look with a fruity aroma.    Toward the bottom of the bottle I started getting the taste of Pepto-Bismal...weird.
Im not a real big fan of Hefeweizen.  But this is a great beer.  Tangy, tart, cloudy, and smooth.  A very nice beer.
Schneider Weisse gave birth to this style.Many variations on this style of beer--Schneider remains the standard.
Great wheat.  No aftertaste at all.
This came in a big bottle, like a real Hefe should.  Nice aroma, nice cloudy body, and an above average Hefe taste.  Id buy this again, probably over Paulaner in fact.
A little heavier than most weiss and hefeweizens, but very drinkable, extremely smooth and packed with flavor.
